reviews.text: Dinning at The Red Room is an experience Shannon hope to never repeat. Three of us arrived slightly later than our party  and right off the bat Shannon were told that separate bills were not possible. The waiter came back five minutes later to remind us again that Shannon could NOT have separate bills  Shannon had not  even asked for separate bills . Its a cash only  which is fine  but in this modern day and age options are always appreciated. The food was awful. A lot of the food is very clearly brought in already - made  and then fried. The Red Room have a very large  very mismatched menu. Shannon saw dishes from Japanese  Chinese  Vietnamese  Mexican  Italian  German and numerous other cultures. Shannon ordered Edamame  over boiled and under salted  and Shrimp Spring Rolls to snack on. One of Shannon's shrimp rolls did not have anything in One of my shrimp rolls. One of my shrimp rolls was a hollow  deep friend  roll. Shannon's party ordered a variety of different plates no one was thrilled. The waiter seemed to be the only server in The Red Room  so Shannon appreciate that The waiter was busy  and might not have been having the best day of The waiter's life so Shannon will  assume the best there. And yes....the bathrooms are gross.
reviews.name: Shannon

reviews.text: If you want to be able to eat and drink for cheap.. The Red Room is the place ! You can get yourself quite happy on wine for less than    . The Red Room a bit dingy but that is  totally fine. Happy service really cheap food  really cheap drinks.

reviews.text: Stoner Cat have to agree with most people on this one. Although The Red Room makes a cool spot to spend an evening The Red Room is  way too loud to enjoy yourself. It  terrible hard to get any service. And the food... well let  not even talk about the food. Stoner Cat give it an  okay . Simply because Stoner Cat have  had so many fun times there despite the quality of The Red Room.

reviews.text: Terrible terrible food. Payam mean  how can you possibly screw up nachos and cheese Even in trying to give The Red Room credit for what The Red Room tries to be the hip easy Spadina joint  Payam am clearly reminded of numerous better choices nearby. reviews.text: meh. the drinks are cheap enough -  -  not CHEAP but not overpriced. service is basically non - existent. the food  ugh. Emily ate here and stupidly ordered Pad Thai. It was pad thai noodles with tomato sauce. seriously. ugh. also they only accept cash  for such a large bar Emily really do not  understand how they can get away with that. basically The Red Room's a nice central place for U of T students to gather. reviews.text: The Red Room is Kiki's favourite out of the trifecta of  Green Room  Red Room   Java House . The atmosphere is hippie - ish but in a cosy way and The Red Room does not  feel gross like the other two. The food is good and very very cheap  same with drinks. The Red Room is a great place to hang out with good friends on a budget. The service can be pretty absent but Kiki have not  found The service to be damning  maybe because Kiki really just go there to hang out  if Kiki had obligations afterwards Kiki might feel more annoyed by The service. It  fun here  Kiki recommend The Red Room.

reviews.text: David have  gone here both for casual dinner  and late -  night drinks with friends. Given the portion size the pricing is fantastic. The service is good. Admittedly  a lot of the food is not - so - great but having sampled some   or so of the dishes on the menu David can assure you that the chicken pad thai is probably the best thing on the menu  and is pretty damn good at that !   : D As far as late night drinks go it is  a bit loud the music is pleasantly eclectic  and there is  a chill vibe going so it is  not too bad but if you want to get out to a bar with some friends around U of T campus  there are definitely better options.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Kat have  had an equal number of good and bad experiences at The Red Room and for that Kat have to only give The Red Room three stars. Kat had both an incredible meal some sort of noodle dish the avocado and brie sandwich  -  most times  and a terrifyingly awful meal an avocado and brie sandwich gone awry  - an avocado and brie sandwich gone awry actually tasted like rotting cabbage  there. Eat at your own risk  perhaps  The Red Room is  however  a fun place to unwind for a few drinks. Just look around at what other people have ordered to eat perhaps and ask what other people recommend before making a decision ! Service is terrible  naturally.

reviews.text: Is there any rating lower than   star The service was terrible. They took forever to take our order. Then the food took an eternity to come out. When the fries Jenn had ordered finally arrived over half an hour after Jenn sat down  Jenn found a piece of hair in the fries Jenn had ordered. Then there was another long wait for the rest of the food. Jenn decided that Jenn no longer wanted anything from here after and they were going to charge us for the fries with the hair in the fries Jenn had ordered. Until Jenn had to explain that Jenn were not going to pay for the fries Jenn had ordered . The waiter looked as if The waiter may have been stoned  because when Jenn finally decided to leave after    mins of waiting  - The waiter approached us on the street telling us our food was ready. Jenn had already paid for the drinks Jenn had ordered and told the cashier Jenn were not waiting for our food any longer. It was clear that Jenn did not  want our food after Jenn had left The Red Room. And The waiter seemed very distraught and confused that Jenn were upset. Terrible service  Jenn guarantee Jenn will never be back.

reviews.text: The sign makes it a bit hard to find at night but the amazingly cheap food and drinks plus ALL DAY BRUNCH makes it a win in my book. Mareesha got a stuffed french toast with ham and cheese  came with a big side salad   a serving of fries  for   .   ! a big side salad a serving of fries  for   . was so big my friend and Mareesha could not  finish a big side salad   a serving of fries  for   . together. shots also make The Red Room great for a night of celebration. Even all their salads are under     -  definitely a big inclination to eat healthy for a change  : Only reason it does not  get a    is that the service was not  great the waiters were very nice and everything but the waiters were very understaffed and it took ages to find a waiter to place an order  there were only   working on the night Mareesha went and The Red Room was pretty busy !

reviews.text: The Red Room ... Oh god it is  so tough to review The Red Room. Where to begin THE WONDERFUL :    -  Choice. Seriously. The Red Room has everything. You can come here for breakfast. You can come here for brunch. You can come here for lunch. You can come here for dinner. You can come here for drinks  finger food  as part of a night on the town. The menu is HUGE. The menu has everything from Pad Thai  to chicken curry  to traditional sandwiches  to pasta  to burgers  to French toast  to poutine and quite literally everything in between. Oh  and there is  a wide range of teas coffees juices  beverages  and cocktails. -  The taste ! Everything Izzy have  tried here  and Izzy have  tried a lot  -  most of the above listed dishes and drinks in fact  has tasted great. Full of flavour  everything in balance  mostly mouth - watering. Why am Izzy writing this review just before lunch Mhmm....    -  Value. The Red Room is as cheap as you would  get in Toronto. Izzy discovered The Red Room the first morning Izzy arrived in Toronto on Izzy's visa  and ate there religiously for Izzy's first few weeks while searching for a job and an apartment. Izzy would have starved if it were not  for The Red Room ! Even when Izzy got a job and moved out to the east end Izzy still continued to return  as the portion sizes are GINORMOUS  and will keep you full all day. Not only are The Red Room's base prices well below the city average  additional deals are offered on some parts of the menu e.g. :  soup and sandwich for  . or something add on coffee to breakfast for just  . etc etc. -  Layout. The Red Room manages to be cosy  yet also inviting to large groups  with most tables offering long benches as seating. D cor is mostly Asian  with a trendy  modern twist. There  an outdoor patio for those summer scorchers. If choice  taste  value and layout are all you value in a restaurant  then stop reading and consider The Red Room a five - star establishment. THE BAD : -  The service is overall  quite bad. Slow and unfriendly. Izzy had the experience of our waiter not believing Izzy were tipping enough  so our waiter just took our money and kept the residual change without even asking if Izzy wanted any money back. This was after our waiter began to know Izzy's boyfriend and Izzy as regulars so our waiter's actions made us feel as though Izzy were stingy and not tipping enough  even though Izzy were leaving moderate tips for the service encountered . THE HORRIFYING : -  Izzy can cope  easily  with the poor service but Izzy cannot accept poor hygiene standards. Unfortunately  Izzy read a recent report stating that The Red Room failed a hygiene and safety inspection  -  one minor infraction  four significant infractions. Izzy can turn a blind eye to many things  but not to food safety and hygiene standards. For this reason alone  Izzy will not return to The Red Room. What a shame.
reviews.name: Izzy

reviews.text: The Red Room is a decent place for a well - priced meal or drink when you are  out with your friends for the night. The Asian - influenced menu has some goodies to check out. The environment is pretty chill  and literally red . However  do not  expect anything too phenomenal from The Red Room. The food is not  going to blow you away and Alex have  had some bad experiences with some seriously rude servers. The Red Room is a great example of you get what you pay for

reviews.text: The Red Room  cheap and hipster without trying. The food is OK and the pitchers are cheap enough. They do not  take debit though.

reviews.text: The Red Room is what The Red Room is. An extremely affordable  University student hang - out with an eclectic menu to please everyone  palate. reviews.text: Things Andrew love :  the pricing and the delicious food. Things Andrew hate :  the pathetic lack of identifiable service and the overly loud environment. The Red Room is loud as all hell  drunk as all hell  and dirty as all hell. The bohemian feel is nice  but bohemian service is sub - par. They lack uniform and coordination so it is difficult to identify them. The bathroom situation has improved from several years ago  at least. The food though is really The The Red Room  saving grace. Their pad thai with chicken and tofu  though Their pad thai with chicken and tofu has one additional  meat   still comes under    . The portion size is fantastic as well; finishing it was a genuine struggle. The dichotomy between the food and service problematic though The dichotomy between the food and service is  a fixable problem. Andrew just doubt The dichotomy between the food and service will  even be considered  given The Red Room was in this state last time Andrew visited  several years ago.
reviews.name: Andrew

reviews.text: How The Red Room has even   stars is beyond me. Philip have  been to The Red Room a few times over the past few years and every time only because someone else wanted to try The Red Room. Philip read reviews of the great selection of food but what good is a wide variety of food when none of a wide variety of food tastes any good Seriously  nothing Philip have every eaten there was good everything is bland and not cooked well. The service is even more horrific. The service hardly exists. Expect to be in there way way longer than you want. It takes    minutes to find someone to seat you another    before you can find someone to order and another    minutes just to ask for the bill. Where is everybody Perhaps the fact that there is no standard dress code for the staff is the reason Philip can never find them All Philip want to see is some effort to change and become a more professional establishment but its been so many years and nothing has changed. So disappointing.

reviews.text: Brittany have  been here three times and Brittany keep going back because it is  cheap  but Brittany keep leaving feeling disappointed. The first Brittany went Brittany got the grilled vegetable sandwich and soup. the grilled vegetable sandwich and soup was decently good. Better than what Brittany make Brittany at home  but still not that special. Brittany probably think the grilled vegetable sandwich and soup tasted better than the grilled vegetable sandwich and soup really did because Brittany believe the two together came to like   . or something ridiculously cheap. The next time Brittany came  Brittany had the French toast. the French toast was pretty bad. It was one of the few times Brittany would have wanted to send the French toast back but our waitress never came to check on us so Brittany could not . All the syrup in the world could not  have fixed the dryness that was the French toast. Brittany went there again two nights ago. It was late  Brittany needed cheap food. Brittany really wanted something sweet and since the French toast was so bad last time  Brittany decided to go with pancakes instead. Again  pancakes were bad. Literally worse than the pre - made pancake mix at the store. Like last time  Brittany would have sent the French toast back  but our waitress never checked on us. Aside from the food The Red Room really caters to specific people. If you want to have a quiet conversation over dinner  do not  go here. If you want to talk very loudly over top of other people talking very loudly  go here. If you want to be able to see your food before you eat your food do not  go here. If you want to eat in darkness  go here  just kidding but it is really dark here . The waiters are friendly  but The waiters never check on you. So if you want a refill  good luck. Also  the bathrooms are disgusting. Brittany would really only go back here if it was super late at night the nearby Chinese places were not  open  and or Brittany had very little money on Brittany. As per the alcohol  Brittany do not  drink  but Brittany's boyfriend said my boyfriend's beer was pretty good and my boyfriend had the vermicelli noodles which my boyfriend also said were  OK . his beer was pretty cheap. Brittany think his beer was   . for     pint    . for a pint and Brittany forget how much for a pitcher. In summary : cheap  bad - slightly better than average food friendly but not good waiters decent beer gross washrooms  open late  loud  dark. You can do better. DO NOT take a first date here. Just do not . Brittany forgot to menton this earlier but The Red Room also have a pretty wide - ranging menu. Noodles  sandwiches  brunch asian  indian  etc. But no pizza which is kind of weird.
reviews.name: Brittany

Was there last night  accosted by a staff member who said two grown men who Cathlin was with were there with underage girls the week before -  - two grown men who Cathlin was with had simply never been to The Red Room before yesterday. a staff member who said two grown men who Cathlin was with were there with underage girls the week before would not  let it go checked everyone  IDs and was so insistent that two grown men who Cathlin was with had been there before. reviews.text: If you had asked me a month ago what Jessica thought of The Red Room  Jessica probably would have at least  given The Red Room a     if not a     based simply on the amount of food versus the price you pay. Jessica had always ordered a couple of staples  which were cooked reasonably well and filled the void in my stomach. However and this is a big however Jessica have since lowered a couple of staples  which were cooked reasonably well and filled the void in my stomach to   star. If Jessica could give a couple of staples  which were cooked reasonably well and filled the void in my stomach no stars  Jessica would. Jessica eat here fairly frequently  at least once sometimes twice a month and Jessica do not  even live in Toronto. Last month Jessica ordered the soup and sandwich deal and was told the soup of the day was either tomato chickpea and cream of broccoli. Jessica usually quite enjoy their cream of broccoli soup but what Jessica was served  both taste and texture was more like a wilted old lettuce soup. the soup of the day was disgusting. Jessica kept trying to eat the soup of the day  thinking to Jessica  -  there is  something wrong with the soup of the day. My mother - in - law was the first to pipe up to our waitress about the soup of the day  whom Jessica tried to track down for a good    minutes because no one ever checks on their tables there . There  something wrong with the soup of the day  Jessica tell My mother - in - law. Oh  no there is  nothing wrong with the soup of the day  - the soup of the day is  actually asparagus soup and Jessica just forgot to tell you. Exact words. Not paraphrasing. It was disgusting. Jessica was brought the dreadful tasting tomato chickpea soup instead and just could not  bring Jessica to finish the dreadful tasting tomato chickpea soup. And this is just the beginning because  -  wait -  there is  more. Last week Jessica went in again and decided to order the Phad Thai. Big mistake. Jessica have had the Phad Thai before both there as well as from many other restaurants in the Greater Toronto area and have always quite liked the Phad Thai. the Phad Thai had two pictures of chilli peppers next to the Phad Thai  which most restaurants have despite the Phad Thai being more sweet than the Phad Thai is spicy. Jessica took a bit of the Phad Thai and almost threw up. There was no flavour there  - it was just spice. Jessica complained to the waitress who at first gave me a bit of attitude but said Jessica could order something else. Jessica had a strange feeling so Jessica said  Are the waitress who at first gave me a bit of attitude but said Jessica could order something else planning on charging Jessica for this food Jessica can not  eat  . Of course Jessica am  there is  nothing wrong with this food. Jessica replies haughtily. Jessica tried to explain that this food was beyond hot and that this food was nearly impossible to eat. It  not normally like this. Well that is  not our fault  its Jessica because Jessica did not  read the menu. Jessica was aghast and Jessica even brought the menu over to point out the two chilli peppers. Jessica was beyond being explained to and was at a point where Jessica was arguing with me  not letting me speak and telling me that it was my fault. Jessica kept telling me Jessica had to pay for a meal that was inedible even by the poorest of standards so Jessica ended up walking out. Jessica had at one point even asked to speak to the owner or manager. Jessica actually smiled at me  crossed Jessica's arms and said the owner or manager were not  in that day. Jessica said Jessica was in charge and that is  just the way things are. Jessica have never been treated so rudely at a restaurant before in my life. Yes  the prices are good and the servings are large  -  but the service is gawd awful to the point where they should be reported to the Better Business Bureau. The atmosphere is tolerable on some days and  rank the next  -  the music being the most obvious culprit. With no standards as to what can and will be played you can be tortured with just about anything your nightmares can come up with  -  and mid lunch  Jessica just do not  want to hear a skipping CD of some woman who is swinging a cat by the tail to drums when all Jessica want to do is listen to the person across the table from me tell me a story. For the average student The Red Room may be fine as long as you never have a complaint and stick to the same meal each time. Never complain because it is  the customers fault  not the kitchens. Bring some ear plugs or your MP  player and last but not least  shut up and eat the food The Red Room give you....or else. ... or else you can just skip it altogether. Probably your best plan of action.
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Oh  The Red Room. Well  Julianna m feeling a bit old to drop by  but Julianna have a friend who likes The Red Room so Julianna end up there every once in a while. The beer list is actually okay and yes  everything on the menu is very  very cheap. Julianna would  dropped in here before going  and saw the pad thai controversy. Julianna love a good pad thai  and even a tasty bad one so Julianna thought Julianna would  take the opportunity to try it and weigh in so here my take. OK it is  not authentic  and it is distinctly tomato - y. It  like the bizarre love child of pad thai and a creamy curry. It  a bit spicy  which is unusual. There are no peanuts  no cilantro and you get a lemon wedge instead of a lime. On the other hand  -  it is  cheap as can be  huge  hot  and actually quite tasty. Once you get over your initial this - is not  - really - much - like - authentic - pad - thai reaction you might enjoy it too. Julianna could definitely see myself ordering this calorie binge again some time.

reviews.text: Not an ideal place for reservations. After making reservations for    plus people The Red Room made the claim that that would be   no problem. NO  -  PROBLEM. As in  not one little problem. As if it should be easy. Look Mike understand wanting to seem like you are  pleasing everyone but here  the thing -  eventually those people that put in the reservations are going to show up. And  when you bring those people that put in the reservations to an alcove that could easily fit    people comfortably  those people that put in the reservations will be pleased. Now  when you tell those people that put in the reservations you only have half that space  and those people that put in the reservations have to cram in  shoulder to shoulder  all the way around  that is  less than ideal. Mike have  never been at a bar where people were yelling to get out  because people were having onsets of claustrophobia... until Mike visited The Red Room. The Red Room dark The Red Room is  dingy  and The Red Room is  loud. And The Red Room is  cramped... but only when you make reservations. The other guests were spread out. If The Red Room was as cramped as Mike were  they could have fit twice the people. There are other locations in this neighbourhood. If The Red Room is not  cramped then stop be  -  but otherwise  grab your friends and go elsewhere. Mike m sure the staff would have  no problem  with that.

reviews.text: Nicole m writing this review to prevent others from wasting others's money at Copper Modern Indian Cuisine. Nicole have been to Copper Modern Indian Cuisine several times and finally accepted that the food is WAY overpriced and the service is horrible. Nicole will not be returning. The only thing Nicole like at Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is the naan and with the outrageous entr e prices  being charged for a second basket of the naan is tacky. Recently Nicole went to Copper Modern Indian Cuisine with friends for a celebratory dinner. Nicole waited an hour for a table even though Nicole had reservations and there were empty tables all around. Nicole finally complained and were seated in the center of a crowded room in the back of Copper Modern Indian Cuisine . Nicole's     vegetarian entr e consisted of a few pieces of broccoli and a thick cream sauce -  - My     vegetarian entr e was not included in the menu description. Our appetizers were comped only because Nicole complained. Nicole have never written a negative restaurant review before but Nicole's recent experience was so disappointing and the manager did not  make much of an effort to rectify the situation. Apparently Copper Modern Indian Cuisine does not  value paying customers. Nicole m sure there are many other restaurants that will be happy to take Nicole's money.

reviews.text: Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is located in an old house that looks pretty run down from the outside  but the inside is cozy and well decorated. It was very loud when Jeffrey arrived and never really got quiet even after the room cleared out. The floor and walls seem to amplify the sound. Jeffrey had scallops and garlic naan for our appetizer. scallops were a little too chewy but the sauce and spices mostly made up for it. garlic naan was buttery and garlicky  as garlic naan should be. Our main course was murgh tikka masala. Jeffrey ordered Our main course indian hot  but Our main course was pretty bland. The chicken seemed dry even though The chicken had been sitting in sauce for at least a few minutes before Jeffrey touched The chicken. The service was attentive and kept our naan and water filled. Jeffrey had trouble hearing anything the waiter was saying but Jeffrey think it was more due to the general cacophony of the room rather than the waiter's quiet voice. As far as Charlotte goes  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is pretty good. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine does not  really compare to Indian food elsewhere but you can not  be too choosy when in North Carolina.
reviews.name: Jeffrey

reviews.text: Nack's review has nothing to do with the food. In fact Nack m in theUber on the way home from picking up from Copper. Nack had a very awkward experience with the lady who was expediting and organizing delivery orders. the lady who was expediting and organizing delivery orders stared Nack down pretty much the entire time... never really experienced this kind of rudeness. Perhaps it is because Nack asked for utensils... who knows. Either way the lady who was expediting and organizing delivery orders is unfit for a customer facing job. Unfortunate experience at a restaurant Nack have heard many things about. Hopefully the food is good !

reviews.text: Todd m going to give Copper Modern Indian Cuisine   stars because it would be unfair to Copper Modern Indian Cuisine to give less. Honestly  though  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine are  just a solid       stars  middle - of - the - road  restaurant  in Todd's opinion. For years  Todd have  heard people singing the praises of Copper  food but Todd could never convince Todd that Todd really wanted to stop in for a bite. Last night  the allure of      bonus points on opentable.com and the excitement of being      points closer to our      gift certificate spurring us on  Ginny and Todd decided to give Copper Modern Indian Cuisine a try. For starters  Todd do not  want a modern take on ethnic food. Todd simply want to eat authentic  or as close to authentic as Todd can get without eating the excretory parts of an animal  ethnic food. If Todd lived in India perhaps a modern take on Indian food would excite Todd's palate. Todd do not live in India  though. Todd live in Charlotte. Unfortunately  ethnic restaurants in smaller cities have to cater to American taste buds in order to stay in business  and Todd believe Copper Modern Indian Cuisine has subscribed to that philosophy. Nouveau Charlotteans do love anything described as  modern    upscale   or  urban so Copper Modern Indian Cuisine could serve Aunt Jemima pancakes smothered in masala and lure a crowd of identically dressed urban dwellers into Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's restaurant with the mere description of  an upscale and modern twist on a traditional pancake. pancakes :      .  . Sorry for the tangent.... On to the review. The naan was good. The meat was overcooked. The spices -  - the best part of Indian cooking -  - were not terribly bold. Unfortunate. The servers were attentive  professional and quick to offer a suggestion when asked about The servers's favorite dish. The food was overpriced for the quality. The restaurant space is quite nice  and with quite a few overhauls to the menu Todd think that Copper Modern Indian Cuisine could be nearly as fantastic as all the fantastic reviews. Until then  Todd will  be staying away.
reviews.name: Todd

reviews.text: The location is prime  but parking is ample so it is  a smart strategy to  dumb down  the food so the food appeals to more people  taking advantage of The location. Which is why Dan think Copper is good  but not great. There were no Asian people in there  other than the wait staff. Bad sign in my book but this ara of Charlotte is not known for this ara of Charlotte is  Asian population so maybe not a bid deal. The mixed drinks were great and the wine list extensive  much more impressive than Dan expected. My wife and Dan ordered the masala cauliflower flourets saag paneer and lamb kofka  with a side of paratha. masala cauliflower flourets were perfectly cooked and crisy but the sauce was a little ketchupy. saag paneer was delicious  nothing more to say there. lamb kofka was cooked perfectly but again the sauce was a little ketchupy and was not  as spicy as Dan had hoped. paratha was very good  flaky and thicker than Dan have  had in the past. Dan would go back and take people who are not accustomed to Indian food  this could certainly open people who are not accustomed to Indian food's palate. But Dan would not return. My past experience is based on an old favorite place called Lal Qilal in Arlington Heights  IL. Dan was a regular and never once saw a white person there. Very authentic place with food that was extraordinary. Copper was good for Charlotte  but not great overall. Blue Taj in Ballantyne is better.
reviews.name: Dan

reviews.text: Dinners at Copper have always been great. Modern Indian Cuisine is modern but still incorporates traditional and authentic flavors. Modern Indian Cuisine is expensive  but still reasonable considering the quality. Great presentation and cozy ambiance. The service can be slow.

reviews.text: Great Indian Fusion

reviews.text: So  Nicole m pregnant and the cravings are in full force. Nicole got it in my head the other day that Nicole needed to have some Indian food so Nicole jumped on yelp to find something close to us to try. Copper looked good so my husband picked some up for us on my husband's lunch break. Nicole both got an order of the lunch special of chicken tikka masala. the lunch special of chicken tikka masala was exactly what Nicole was hoping for ! Fantastic  creamy rich flavor for the sauce tender white meat chicken  and soft  fluffy naan. So good ! The only reason Nicole did not  go stars was because the salad was just ok. the salad was pretty much just lettuce and carrots and the dressing was not  anything to write home about. Overall though  Nicole will definitely be back !

reviews.text: If you love Indian food ... Avoid Copper Modern Indian Cuisine. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is nowhere close to Indian cuisine ... R understand the creativity part of it but you cannot kill the concept at the expense of creativity. Drinks menu and ambience is what earned one star.

reviews.text: Amanda have only been here once  on a trip to Charlotte. Amanda sat at the bar and were impressed with the bartender  Jarisa. the bartender  Jarisa was attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. Amanda tried a couple of appetizers  one with chicken and one with lamb. a couple of appetizers  one with chicken and one with lamb were both very good  seasoned richly and to perfection. For our main course  Amanda shared the lamb vindaloo. Soooo good. lamb was not gamey tasting at all  and the spice was good  although not for wimps -  - hot ! the spice  not on the menu but they will make the spice if you ask. Overall  a great time.

reviews.text: An American Modern take on Indian  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine has decent food that you will  spend a lot to try. Service and atmosphere were both good. There are many other places in Charlotte that Michelle would  rather spend that kind of money.

reviews.text: Copper Modern Indian Cuisine  not a proper Indian restaurant. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine an americanised Indian restaurant. The food is not proper Indian food with Indian spice. And the price is also more. Not worth if you want proper Indian food.

reviews.text: Hands down Copper Modern Indian Cuisine Monika visited friends for a few days and friends recommended Copper Modern Indian Cuisine. Monika were running late and the kitchen was about to close but they waited for us and Monika had a great meal and service. Highly recommend Panner Makhni for dinner and Kulfi for dessert. It was delicious ! Monika will definitely come back to Copper Modern Indian Cuisine next time Monika visit.

reviews.text: This is the  nd time Amit have visited Copper. First when Copper opened...which Amit was truly disappointed. After a year and hearing many good things about Modern Indian Cuisine  Amit decided to try Modern Indian Cuisine again. Amit am GLAD Amit did. The place is not  much from the outside  an old house maybe from the    . The inside kind of shows  but The place works. Dim lighting and rather tight seating  Definitely recommend reservations with large groups or on special nights out. Service was great. Meal was fantasric...... orderd Lamb kebab  and samosas for app. Chicken Tikka and Panner with garlic naan as dinner. The spice level was a little bland for naan's taste so next time Amit will have to specify the heat level. naan Amit was a little disappointed in...a little cold and chewy. Had kulfi for dessert. Good dinner but set naan back a Ben Franklin. Because of that Amit will visit but not as often !

reviews.text: Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is a solid Indian resturant. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is fairly small and seating is tight. Craig agree with another reviewer who said it is a bit dark inside -  it really is. The staff are friendly and service is usually pretty good. The Chicken Tikka Masala is very good and the naan is excellent. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is fairly expensive for what you get. Overall a solid inidan restaurant.

reviews.text: Perfect ambience for date night. Quiet and enjoyable. Food was good in taste and quantity. Molten chocolate cake was good. Also the paneer Tikka masala was tasty. Enough amount of Jeera Rice served with the paneer Tikka masala. Tomato soup was good in taste but little bit on buttery side and quantity felt lesser with because bowl they used to serve Tomato soup was huge. Staff was friendly  parking was little difficult because being smaller parking lot.

reviews.text: Before D. get into the review  D. want to say that D. really really really wanted to like Copper Modern Indian Cuisine. D.'s husband had been discouraging in trying Copper Modern Indian Cuisine out and D. insisted that with so many raving reviews on Yelp  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine surely had to be doing something right. SO D. went on a Saturday night after making online reservations for  . D. were seated at the window overlooking East Blvd  with a street lamp glaring in our face from across the street Perhaps some sheers will help this     D. placed our drink orders and then a secondary waiter gave the complimentary hot and fluffy naan w  chutney tray. D. then ordered a salad and the samosa potli  pouch . a salad was average and plentiful however the samosa potli  pouch was tasty yet very small portioned. a salad and the samosa potli  pouch were   . Next D. ordered our entrees :     modern  vegetarian dishes and   non - veg. The goat cheese malai kofta was not flavored or seasoned. The only taste was of The goat cheese malai kofta. The other veg dish was a tomato - potato dish. This was also the same way. According to the Yelp reviews  the chicken tikka that opinion a must - order. D. could not  differ more on that opinion. the chicken tikka was wayy too creamy and not flavored at all. Add to the fact that you can only make the chicken tikka more spicy and not the veg dishes because the chicken tikka is  already prepped  ! What Indian restaurant has that policy   Needless to say  the only things above average were the naan and the secondary waiter  service. Below average was the tasteless food. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine  please do not  insult the Indian diner by serving this food that you call  authentic and modern. And this is before D. even got to the price point of the food. Simply highway robbery when you charge customers that much for flavorless entrees. D. would not recommend Copper Modern Indian Cuisine to even a person trying Indian food time for the first time.
reviews.name: D.

reviews.text: Benjamin m a huge fan of Indian cuisine and Benjamin have  been wanting to check out Copper for some time now. Indian was on our radar this past weekend and Copper was the ticket. Boy  oh boy  am Benjamin glad Benjamin checked Indian out. High notes : Naan. Easily some of the best naan Benjamin have  had in town. Served piping hot  holds a great chew serves at the unparalleled vehicle for all things Indian. Naan. was awesome. Saffron Almond Paneer. This is a great passed plate and has tons of different flavors to choose from  -  -  sweet  mild spice  herby. The paneer inside Naan. was wonderful. The whole traditional side of the menu is great. Plenty to choose from and definitely does not  disappoint with the portions served. Benjamin were all thrilled with our entrees and shared plenty with one another. Which goes to show  the pricepoint with the given portion  in my opinion  is rather fair. They brought us so much extra naan rice and there was plenty for all of us to enjoy individually as well as share amongst the table. Three of us made it out under      no alcohol  and Benjamin were stuffed. The menu is definitely a bit pricier than other places in town  -  -  Avg around     person. However  Benjamin would not  let the prices deter coming back at all. The amount of food  ambiance the patio is gorgeous on a temperate evening   stellar professional service  and location with ample parking makes the price per dish a non - issue. Or.....naan issue. Looking forward to checking out their sister restaurant in Ballantyne  -  -  The Blue Taj. Cheers.
reviews.name: Benjamin

reviews.text: Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's food is delicious ! Jordan find portions are smaller than your average Indian restaurant though. Locations and building is beautiful  but when Jordan have visited Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's AC was out and Jordan ended up taking Jordan's food to go. It was mid - August and it was just too toasty to be eating in there. Overall a bit overpriced but the food is worth it. star food star  -  lack of AC

reviews.text: Decent food in a cool atmosphere. Service was somewhere between unacceptable and horrible. Expect much better based on the location  place was empty by   pm on a Sat night.

reviews.text: The food and service is phenomenal. So fresh and flavorful. A true gem. Courtney m in Charlotte for work and came came back for a  nd night. On my list for next time Courtney m here !  !

reviews.text: The chicken Tikka masala traditional is so amazingly good. The chicken Tikka masala traditional is white on the inside. The naan is most excellent  very fluffy. Chloé also shazamed several songs  great tunes. Chloé have  never been disappointed by the food at Copper. Go and be glad. Ambience in the sun room is also warm and fun to dine around.

reviews.text: Really enjoyed my meal at Copper. The waitstaff was attentive and helpful. Both dishes that Andrew got were flavorful with appropriate spice level. Slightly overpriced IMO  but still reasonable. Recommend the lamb.

reviews.text: Do not  get me wrong the food is excellent but the food is  incredilby expensive. Two people was      and Elle do not  even think that included alcohol. Worth it  but be prepared to spend a lot.

reviews.text: Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is the first Indian restaurant Roy have been to since moving to Charlotte   months ago. Roy heard Copper Modern Indian Cuisine was good and when Roy checked out Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's website the menu looked interesting. You do not  see the prices listed there  though  and there is a reason. the prices listed there are  high  especially for Charlotte. Roy dropped almost     all - in for dinner but the food was so good Roy thought the food was worth every dollar. It was a classic case of getting what you pay for. And the atmosphere  as part of a historic house  was the nicest Roy have ever seen in an Indian restaurant. Since Roy was alone  Roy sat at the small but very nice bar. Roy ordered two glasses of a very tasty Riesling  the Gunpowder prawns  and the  modern  scallop entree both of which appeared to have so many weird ingredients Roy was not  sure how Roy would react to the Gunpowder prawns  and the  modern  scallop entree. Roy need not have worried  since the Gunpowder prawns  and the  modern  scallop entree were among the most delicious of their general type that Roy have had anywhere. Roy also got a serving of garlic naan  which was terrific  though Roy took most of garlic naan home with the amazing basmati rice that came also. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is not your typical Indian restaurant. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine  avant - garde  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is  unusual  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is  a Carolina adventure. Most of all  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is  amazing.
reviews.name: Roy

reviews.text: The food was fantastic but our server had no idea what was up. Carson's mom ordered chicken tikka masala and Carson tried a decent amount of chicken tikka masala. chicken tikka masala was so bland when chicken tikka masala is  a dish that most Indian restaurants seem to master. Carson did really enjoy Carson's tofu - vegetable kesari though. It  a nice location and the other servers seemed fine so nothing is stopping Carson from going again but Carson will  expect more next time.
reviews.name: Carson

reviews.text: David found Copper to be style over substance :  Beautiful decor  fanciful plating  and superior service. The food  however  overpriced  under - portioned  and lack some of the classics of Indian cuisine. David love Indian cuisine because Indian cuisine can offer some of the most delicious guiltless meat - free meal options  which carnivores like David often appreciate   which is why David was shocked at the overwhelmingly meat - based entrees here. David's old favorites like palak paneer or malai kofta were replaced by seabass or duck - confit. David was so thrown off that David actually checked to make sure that David indeed entered the correct restaurant. It is nice to see modern interpretations of Indian cuisine  but David was not prepared to drop     +  on unfamiliar dishes using ingredients that David have never seen in Indian restaurants before. Perhaps they should consider expanding the more  traditional  menu items. David ended up getting the samosas garlic naan  and tikki masala  as David do not eat seafood  which eliminates a chunk of the menu . The portions made David feel like a child again  due to The portions's size. David left hungry and still craving Indian cuisine  and a little cheated. David was even more perplexed at how David paid nearly     for the pleasure of that experience. David do not see Copper in David's future.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Traditional Indian food  in a very modern setting. Absolutely loved the drink menu. Very chic names  great food presentation. While the flavors are not truly authentic It is a breath of fresh air to note that they do not serve cream and fat laden stuff that their meats are actually fresh and they try and keep the flavors as near to the original as possible. Renu disagree with people who say that its pricey. The quality of the food deserves the price they charge. The reason why it is not a   star rating from me  :    Service. While it was not bad it was not great either. The food took a while to come the water would not arrive when expected etc etc.. you get the drift !
reviews.name: Renu

reviews.text: Food and service are excellent here. They take the time to explain the different dishes and what the different dishes mean as well.

reviews.text: Had an incredible dinner here ! The lamb curry and chicken Tika were phenomenal. Absolutely recommend Copper !  !

reviews.text: Rude service. Nice will never go back again. The food is also modified for whites believe me The food is not Indian food. The waiters have no manners.

reviews.text: Pulling up to Copper Vicki were immediately struck by the fact that Copper is a restored mansion  formerly the Mayor  and also the former home of Carson McCoullough  who wrote The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter. Now  on to the food.... The appetizers wonderful ! The fried cauliflower had great flavor and texture. The somosas had a flavoring tangy sauce. The entree of Lamb Curry had layers of complex flavors and the lamb was cooked to perfection. Very friendly owner and staff who gave us a tour of Copper.

reviews.text: If you like Indian food then Jessica highly recommend Copper Modern Indian Cuisine ! Copper Modern Indian Cuisine a quaint restaurant in a old house that makes for a unique atmosphere. Try one of Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's unique cocktails and you wo not  be disappointed ! Also  Jessica highly recommend that if you go as a party of two  -  order one starter and one entre to split between the two of you and some naan  -  it will be more than enough food ! On that note  -  Jessica order the prawns to start which were delicious. Only wish Jessica had gotten more than  . Then Jessica had the lamb kozhambu for one entre with both regular and garlic naan. So  so good !  !
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is a fantastic Charlotte dining experience ! The ambiance of the restaurant  old house Indian art make for lovely environment. The waitstaff is attentive   friendly. And  -  the food  -  is outstanding. My husband and Kori like to get three vegetarian entrees  large selection    split three vegetarian entrees. Kori eat our hearts out   have plenty to take home for lunch the next day. Kori like to get a bottle of wine  decent selection of well - priced reds   whites . Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is a great date night destination !

reviews.text: stars for lunch service Hashani dined at Cooper today for lunch  have been wanting to try since our takeout experience. Hashani were quickly seated  though the parking lot and indoor seating were packed. Hashani were seated in the extension in the front. A big plus not available in most Indian food places  ice water yay ! Hashani docked a star because the wait was ridiculously long for our order to come out  over    min ! Not great if work is strict with you about your lunch break. Finally  the food did come out. Hashani's favorite was the saag paneer the saag paneer was the most flavorful dish out of all our food. The spinach and paneer were plentiful. Hashani would  get the saag paneer again  but can not  say the same for the other items. Dhal makhani side at     not worth it. Every expensive for the portion you get and Dhal makhani was not as flavorful as Hashani had hoped. Hashani have  gotten better dhal makhani out of smaller less trendy places. The chicken tikka for      Hashani do not  think Hashani would purchase for lunch again. Hashani would  have to stick with takeout dinner on this... The gravy was abnormally very watery and had an underwhelming flavor compared to the takeout Hashani previously ordered. Hashani m guessing Cooper have a big pot of gravy premade and then add protein veggies as needed. Which is totally fine if you can pull of flavor and consistency  neither or these were there today. Hashani would  come back for the saag paneer at lunch  everything else is probably go dinner service. Tho Hashani recommend going with traditional dishes the fusion dishes may leave you disappointed if you are already experienced with indian food.
reviews.name: Hashani

reviews.text: Great atmosphere and excellent food. The mango chutney is so declious Sheila could eat The mango chutney by the spoonful.
reviews.name: Sheila

reviews.text: Cooper was a new experience for me although Indian food was not. Cooper's concept is very entertaining offering both traditional and modern interpretations or new applications of old world flavors. Scott must stress the food is very nice but the service is not bad the service just was not the level to which Scott m accustomed for this price range. Scott ordered the samosas and side salad which Scott split  Murgh Tikka Masala and Lamb Chops in Mustard Ginger marinade for our entrees. The group Scott were sat near was quite loud which would not have been a problem if our waiter had spoken up. Scott had to ask our waiter to repeat our waiter most of the evening. Scott was also disappointed Scott could not recommend a wine to pair with the Lamp Chops. A glass of Menage a Trois blend was quite nice by the way. Type A personalities may be more concerned that a runner brought our salad out as a second appetizer after the samosas  which are wonderful  when Scott had asked our server for to be served with dinner. a runner also failed to take away the empty samosa plate which cluttered the table. the food was excellent but those who put a premium on service should relax expectations.
reviews.name: Scott

reviews.text: Keeping it short. Bonnie like Copper. Bonnie like Indian food. Copper  food is like a fancier  less spicy version of Indian food. Bonnie have avoided Copper Modern Indian Cuisine for a long time because of that. Nonetheless  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine is  tasty. The atmosphere is nice. It looked like they were understaffed this time. Everyone was rushing around. Bonnie like Woodlands better and it is vegetarian. ;

reviews.text: First time here after hearing such great raves from friends. The food was excellent and very flavorful ! Will be back soon !
reviews.name: Somalena

reviews.text: The food was delicious ! Great ambiance. Our waiter Mr. Neil gave impeccable service. Will definitely be going back.
reviews.name: Diana

reviews.text: Peg was honestly very disappointed with Copper Modern Indian Cuisine. Peg expected a lot more  esp because Copper Modern Indian Cuisine had such a nice website and interior  : P  Peg's bf and Peg came here for restaurant week RW   and upon entering Copper Modern Indian Cuisine around  pm or so on a Saturday  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine was already busy  which is always a good sign. My bf and Peg were greeted by a hostess and lead to a table. It was really dark inside ! But the interior was very cute  very romantic and intimate. Peg liked that. And Copper Modern Indian Cuisine was inside a house  which is super cute. Peg would have  given Copper Modern Indian Cuisine two stars but Peg really liked the interior and the food was decent. Peg ordered :   - Tamarind - Curry Leaf Prawns : These little guys were tasty ! Peg really loved the sweetness of the chutney and the contrast with the tamarind. It was a little confusing at first  because Peg m used to eating tamarind in Vietnamese dishes  and tamarind is  used a little differently but Peg thought the flavors paired well overall. - Seafood MelJol  : Peg thought the scallops in The dish were a little undercooked. The dish also got boring pretty quickly. Copper Modern Indian Cuisine gave Peg like four or five scallops  which is generous of them but the flavors were not something that stood out to Peg. But  overall  a good dish. - Chocolate cake :  Chocolate cake was Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's  house  chocolate cake. Chocolate cake was kind of dry... And also not as chocolatey as Peg would have  liked. Peg honestly do not  remember what Peg's bf ordered  and nothing on the RW  website menu strikes a chord so hopefully what Peg did review is enough ! Also  our waiter was pretty terrible. our waiter seemed really young and inexperience. Peg's bf was asking about the Indian dessert option Copper Modern Indian Cuisine had on the menu Peg believe the Indian dessert option they had on the menu was halwa    and instead of explaining what the Indian dessert option they had on the menu was  our waiter just kept repeating   the Indian dessert option they had on the menu  like halwa. the Indian dessert option they had on the menu  like.. um  halwa. Peg's bf started asking about ingredients   Is it the flour - y... or nutty... but our waiter kept responding in a non - helpful manner. Lastly  Copper Modern Indian Cuisine's RW menu says  at the very bottom       person including tax and tip. Clearly  that cannot was not true. False advertising.
reviews.name: Peg

reviews.text: Overpriced and overhyped for lack luster mediocre and poor service. Stella have  been to Copper on two occasions. Having lived in major cities in the US  Stella m still trying to to adjust to the consistently higher ratings for sub - par places in Charlotte. It seems to take very little from a Charlotte restaurant to get     star ratings...but Stella digress. Copper is undoubtedly a perfect example. Service matters. Our server was no where to be found most of our meal on an uncrowded night. Our wine glasses were empty for quite a long time prior to food arriving... Stella tracked Our server down...but barely got Our server to stop for a moment and ask for another glass. Our server returned left Our wine glasses  and did not  touch the empty ones. Stella picked Our wine glasses up Stella and put the empty ones on the bar. Our server also had unmeaningful answers when Stella asked for recommendations off the menu when ordering. Food was flavorless and under seasoned  which Stella did not  now was possible with indian. Naan  rice and both entries were unexciting...and the meat overcooked and dry. Our server did not  bother to ask how the meal was or check in. Our server knew the service and food was poor an uncrowded night. For      it was not money well spent. For a     meal in a  fast - food - pace  in and out indian place it would have been fine.
reviews.name: Stella

reviews.text: Decor  location and service to look for. Food was not exceptional for the price. Owner was very generous to offer us complementary dessert.
reviews.name: Aiden

reviews.text: Shafoli would never go back to Brar Sweets Restaurant. when its about brar one thinks of good food  good ambience  and variety. Shafoli have been to all three brar restaurants in the gta. Brar Sweets Restaurant is way below average. the food was average  very little variety  pathetic lay out  disgusting ambience  and poor poor service. Shafoli will never go back to this brar location again. the best brar restaurant is  the one in brampton..

reviews.text: Karolina m glad that Karolina was not  put off by some of the worse reviews for Brar Sweets Restaurant ! Karolina went for a buffet lunch and was very impressed by the variety of delicious foods -  Karolina could not  fit in everything and that is  surprising considering Karolina's gluttony for Indian food ! The service was attentive but seemed a bit distant  that is  not something that ruins the experience though. Brar Sweets Restaurant was very clean as well. One thing worth noting is that the water does not  have ice. Karolina do not  know why  but for some people this is a dealbreaker. Personally  Karolina prefer it this way. Overall the best part of Brar Sweets Restaurant is the fact that Brar Sweets Restaurant is  all vegetarian  no second thoughts for me about taking some of all Karolina can eat ! there are some  Western  options for picky eaters or kids in your group there are plenty of delicious sweets  not to mention those sold in front ! and the buffet price for a nice lunch is very reasonable. Karolina definitely recommend Brar Sweets Restaurant for any fan of Indian food  vegetarian or not  and Karolina can not  wait to try Brar Sweets Restaurant's take - out as well !
reviews.name: Karolina

reviews.text: Feel free to disregard this review if you are not  here for the samosas or the sweets. Kris have  been here at least a hundred times for the samosas or the sweets. the samosas are only    cents and are always fresh ! the samosas come with two sauces  both of which are very good. It  my guilty pleasure  but Kris come here whenever Kris want to get filled and do not  want to spend more then   . When it comes to the sweets  again  freshness is key. the sweets are consistently fresh each time Kris buy  and Brar Sweets Restaurant have a wide variety to choose from. The price is not  bad either. Kris have  yet to actually sit down and eat a full meal at Brar Sweets Restaurant  and Kris do not  know why  given how much Kris have  liked Brar Sweets Restaurant's samosas and sweets. Maybe Kris will  visit in the near future and update this review  but for now  this review gets a full five stars.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text: Prasanna went to Brar again in Nov     . The quality  variety and taste is excellent as it was the last time Prasanna visited in     . Prasanna have visited Brar many times before since     . Prasanna appreciate the standard maintained.

reviews.text: In short  if you are looking for low key  self - service  out of this world vegetarian Indian food Brar Sweets Restaurant is the place. Brar Sweets Restaurant seems like a sweets shop with buffet area. Decor was alright and was definitely better than Vipin expected  given the low price . There were almost    veg options on menu with chaat  naan  samosa  pakoras  and sweets etc ! Some of the good ones  -  saag daal  paneer and kadhi. naan was soft and warm ! The service was more like self - service and ask what you need  : Brar Sweets Restaurant provided custom made chaat in buffet !  ! Vipin came out stuffed and well contented  :

reviews.text: One word   cockroach . If you can see cockroaches outside of the kitchen door you got a problem. The food is terrible and ruins the reputation of the other two locations. Gajen love Brar Sweets Restaurant. Do not  bother going to Brar Sweets Restaurant.

reviews.text: Holly love Brar Sweets Restaurant ! !  ! The food is tasty and the service is great yes sometimes you have  to wait to get a Thali for take out when they are slammed but that is  life . The decor could use some sprucing up  but in general its the meal that matters and The food is superb ! Holly would recommend Brar Sweets Restaurant for anyone who enjoys vegetarian Indian cuisine.

reviews.text: Good variety of buffet items. If you are missing the food which is served in a North Indian wedding than you  can come to Brar Sweets Restaurant

reviews.text: Brar Sweets Restaurant's food is tasty and Their food is all vegetarian if that is  your thing . The price is really good for buffet     . even on weekends . The service is not  the greatest when it comes to picking up your plates. But the food is good  and The price as well.

reviews.text: Do not  ever eat here. The guy served us naan with wet hands straight from the kitchen. Food wasnt hot or fresh and the pickles tasted rancid. Service was very poor -  Val had to wait for    mins to get chaat because the staff did not  know where things were kept. Do not  waste your money here.

reviews.text: Brar Sweets Restaurant has one of the best Indian vegetarian buffet in Mississauga .. but Food guess there is no consistency in Brar Sweets Restaurant's food .. at times their food tastes totally fresh and at other times you may just end up with a bad stomach .. Brar Sweets Restaurant do have some take out options as well but guess Brar Sweets Restaurant have  started reducing the quantity these days .. Food used to take out chola - bhatura some times but now the taste of Brar Sweets Restaurant's cholas is not as good and even the size of bhaturas have been reduced to a small circle. Same goes with Brar Sweets Restaurant's veg thali. their veg thali leaves a lot to be desired. Brar Sweets Restaurant's chaats and sweets are still good though.
reviews.name: Food

reviews.text: Brar Sweets Restaurant has quite a variety. reviews.text: Brar Sweets Restaurant is a very popular choice for vegetarian Indian food in Mississauga. A personally am not impressed. Although Brar Sweets Restaurant tend to be very busy  for some reason the food does not taste fresh at all. For instance the Malai Kofta  which tends to be a very popular dish  tasted like the Malai Kofta  which tends to be a very popular dish was at least week old. And the palak paneer also seems to be made with canned spinach or something of that like. A do not like the Samosas either  which do not have the right melody of spicy  there is just something off. Oh and just skip the pakoras which have no substance at all  and the aloo tikis are not made properly either  the aloo tikis are way too dry. And also if you try the chana bhatura  chickpeas with fried bread   beware that the chana bhatura  chickpeas with fried bread are not very good  the chana bhatura  chickpeas with fried bread are over masala - d or something and they put a ton of greasy carrot pickle on top. The Indian sweets are decent  but A m not a fan so there is no motivation for A to come here. Definitely skip Brar Sweets Restaurant as a place to try if you are looking for a suburban Indian restaurant to try. People keep on insisting that the Brampton location is better  but A do not  think A will ever go to Brar Sweets Restaurant on A's own free will.
reviews.name: A

reviews.text: Dont eat here you will get sick. The food was horrible. If this is your first time dont waste your money. Go to MacDonalds instead. Everything in the buffet was old and had no tatse.
reviews.name: Maanu

reviews.text: S have never been to an Indian buffet with such terrible food quality and such a lackluster selection of items  especially considering Brar Sweets Restaurant is a vegetarian indian buffet. All the curry items were very sweet the desserts looked like the desserts were out of a can  the papad box was continually empty and never filled  there were at most   naan in the bin at any given time. this experience was on a Sunday night not even a weekday. You would think Brar Sweets Restaurant being a vegetarian buffet  and not a cheap one at that  there would be some quality appetizers such as paneer tikka or some sort of quality pakora  but nothing of the sort. SAVE YOUR MONEY  there is much better value in and around the Mississauga area. S had high expectations for a Brar Sweets Restaurant franchise but after this experience will probably never be visiting and eating here again. Came with a group of     and S believe everyone felt the same way what a terrible definition of fine Indian cuisine  a terrible definition of fine Indian cuisine is  embarrassing.
reviews.name: S

reviews.text: A wide variety in the buffet. Prasanna prefer eating there than taking out because Prasanna may miss out on all the good stuff. A great place to host parties. Food is great. Desserts are a delight.

reviews.text: Maybe Sonali have  been there on an off - day but Sonali's Dad  best friend is beyond obsessed with Brar Sweets Restaurant. Upon arriving to Toronto on one of our trips my Dad  best friend had us meet my Dad  best friend there for lunch. Brar Sweets Restaurant serves a variety of meat and vegetarian dishes as well as breads and dessert. You will  find appetizer dishes and Indian street food as well as pizzas and french fries here. But the curries were watered down  the rice was crunchy  and Sonali really was not  feeling the rice. The chunteys did not  seem as vibrant and colorful as Sonali Sonali used to but when your Mom is a great cook nothing will compare  and Sonali was not  completely pleased. Sonali would  eat here again because Sonali am sure Sonali will have to the next time Sonali am there but it did it is  job in filling Sonali up for lunch. Sonali was not  so pleased with what Sonali had to choose from. They would  have to work on that instead of worrying about expanding into a huge brand for Sonali to come back. In the mean time  they can count on Sonali's Dad  friend as a repeat customer  because my Dad  best friend can not  see an issue with it. Maybe Sonali can chalk it up to a restaurant Sonali would  have to go back to at another time to see what is  what.
reviews.name: Sonali

reviews.text: went here last night and Sri definetely enjoyed the food... naan is very very good.. but have to agree Brar Sweets Restaurant is much better an option compared to here... if you havent tried Brar Sweets Restaurant before.. Brar Sweets Restaurant's a must go for you...

reviews.text: Ok for real the butter chicken roti is the best goddamn roti Rachel have ever had. Rachel dream about the butter chicken roti when Rachel m not with the butter chicken roti. When Rachel have the butter chicken roti every bite carries just a little bit of anxiety because Rachel am one step closer to being without the butter chicken roti. As soon as the butter chicken roti is  gone  no matter how stuffed Rachel am  Rachel want another. At first Rachel balked at the     price tag -  - then Rachel tried one and realized the     price tag was a small price to pay for a little taste of heaven. reviews.text: Angela have  been twice and loved the food. Angela had the veggie curry. Yum. The fresh paratha bread is particularly awesome as a hangover - happy food ! Angela had good service both times. Alice served Angela on Angela's most recent trip and Alice was very friendly. Do not buy the drinks there  however ! The orange juice had settled so much The orange juice looked like apple juice with a bright orange ring at the bottom. To be safe  Angela's partner ordered a fruit punch. a fruit punch looked fine from the outside but when my partner got to the bottom... lots of red flakes. a fruit punch was gross. Otherwise  great for takeout to bring home and eat with your own beverages ! Eastern Twist have great hours but are closed on Sundays  which is unfortunate ! Angela find the prices very reasonable for such delicious  fresh fusion.
reviews.name: Angela

reviews.text: Stars  Anna used to live down the street from Eastern Twist and would go at least once a week for Eastern Twist's amazing Indian - style wraps. It  easy to miss walking by as Eastern Twist does not  look that exciting from the outside  but Anna m so glad Anna went in one day ! their amazing Indian - style wraps are phenomenal   + definitely get a wrap and not the rice dishes... rice is good but wraps are what Eastern Twist is best for . Anna used to get the Butter Chicken and the omlette  Anna do not  like spicy foods so the Butter Chicken and the omlette were perfect and so flavourful. Anna do not  think Anna need to reiterate others  comments about how delicious the wrap bread is you really have to try the wrap bread to understand just take Anna and other Yelper  words for the wrap bread ! Anna have no idea what the wrap bread is but the wrap bread is delicious. The women who work there are very nice and friendly. You do have to wait a few minutes since Eastern Twist make their amazing Indian - style wraps on the spot  but Anna did not  mind waiting since the food is so good. Plus you can call in advance if you are really in a hurry. m's only issue is Anna wish Eastern Twist had delivery.
reviews.name: Anna

reviews.text: Julianna hate to disagree with Mike S.  great review below but Julianna have  had three meh experiences at Eastern Twist. Julianna wish Julianna could love Eastern Twist  but no luck. Food; fine but bland. Perhaps a little pricey for the portions. Service :  total loss. Julianna's first two servers were charming but bizarrely incompetent  and the guy who served Julianna yesterday looked so bored and sulky Julianna thought the guy who served me yesterday's brain was about to collapse and create a black hole. Honestly  Julianna could get more food  tastier food  and less sulk next door at the Subway. How lame is that

reviews.text: Eastern Twist is in my old  hood and Jenny used to pop in once in a while for Eastern Twist's coconut noodle soup. Very similar to Malaysian Lhaksa with rich coconut milk broth skinny yet satisfying noodles  asian herbs and boiled egg. YUM. Eastern Twist's butter chicken wrap is really very good  as well. Jenny have  had it both in Their butter chicken wrap wow.. the bread was really delicious  and without - -  just eaten as a curry. Both times Jenny was impressed with the deep level of spice and moist chicken. Jenny do find the service varies from really helpful and nice to major attitude  but Eastern Twist will  always make Jenny's food super - kill Jenny -  drive a burning metal spike through Jenny's skull -  hot !

Next time you are  on your way to Subway stop turn back and try Eastern Twist instead.

reviews.text: Alisha walk by Eastern Twist all the time but never had a chance to stop in. Finally the other day while running errands Alisha decided to stop in and try the famous butter chicken wrap. In reading previous reviews Alisha knew it would take time so Alisha placed Alisha's order and returned after a trip to the post office. The paratha was fresh and butter chicken was nice and hot. There are plenty of toppings and sauces to choose from but be careful because the more you add the messier it will  be. Alisha m not a fan of spice so Alisha steered clear of the carrots but the carrots looked delish. Alisha would definitely come back and maybe ask if Alisha can get rice inside the famous butter chicken wrap to soak up the sauce and hope the famous butter chicken wrap is  not as messy.

reviews.text: came here with Sherry's friends after visiting casa Loma. The wait was a little bit long but the food was really good. The wrap is nice sand warm and the sauces are very tasty. Sherry got the bbq chicken with yogurt sauce and mango sauce. Sherry's friends got the butter chicken and my friends say the butter chicken is  pretty good. But be warned  the butter chicken will get messy because of the sauces.

reviews.text: Steve have  been a regular customer here for a year now  and before Steve move out of the neighbourhood  Steve feel almost obliged to share how much Steve love Eastern Twist. Steve almost always order a spinach and chickpea wrap  which winds up being one of the taste highlights of my week. You simply wo not  find elsewhere anything like the paratha that they use to form a spinach and chickpea wrap  which winds up being one of the taste highlights of my week; the paratha that they use to form the wrap is  charred and textured like naan  but much thinner and less fluffy  yet chewier than roti. The spinach and chickpea curry within a spinach and chickpea wrap  which winds up being one of the taste highlights of my week is as good as anything you would  find at a much pricier dine - in south asian restaurant. And the other toppings are excellent  especially the achar  which gives the dish a challenging but perfect amount of heat. Every other  naan wrap  disappoints in comparison. Also :  the staff are some of the sweetest people in the world ! Steve will  miss the staff when Steve have  moved away.
reviews.name: Steve

reviews.text: Pay-Chia debated trying Eastern Twist on many occasions before finally making it in  -  Eastern Twist definitely lacks curb appeal ! Do not  let that hold you back  though  -  arguably some of the best wraps in the city. The wrap fillings are great  only the Seekh Kabob is not to Pay-Chia's taste and you can customize with toppings go for the achar -  mostly julienned carrots in their version  -  if you like things SPICY  and sauces mango tamarind  and yoghurt . What really makes the wraps though are the parathas... Pay-Chia have  only had the whole - wheat  which is just delicious  but for those of you who are not  that adventurous there is a white flour version too. Pay-Chia love the whole wheat parathas so much that Pay-Chia will  order the whole wheat parathas as a side to Pay-Chia's Coconut Cream Noodle Soup with Gravy. The with Gravy only signifies that their Coconut Cream Noodle Soup with Gravy does not  have chunks of chicken ...go for the added chicken if you must but Pay-Chia do not  miss it. A small soup and a whole wheat paratha will fill your tummy with deliciousness for      -  a     well spent !
reviews.name: Pay-Chia

Finally the other day while running errands Alisha decided to stop in and try the famous butter chicken wrap. In reading previous reviews Alisha knew it would take time so Alisha placed Alisha's order and returned after a trip to the post office. The paratha was fresh and butter chicken was nice and hot. There are plenty of toppings and sauces to choose from but be careful because the more you add the messier it will  be. Alisha m not a fan of spice so Alisha steered clear of the carrots but the carrots looked delish. Alisha would definitely come back and maybe ask if Alisha can get rice inside the famous butter chicken wrap to soak up the sauce and hope it is  not as messy. Edited to add that rice inside the famous butter chicken wrap is the way to go ! rice inside the wrap soaks up all the delicious sauce and makes it easier to eat. Never falls apart on me now.

reviews.text: Tried Eastern Twist for lunch today  on Cheryl's sister  recommendation. Had a BBQ chicken wrap on a whole wheat roti paratha. Added lettuce  tomato cilantro  and yogurt tamarind mango sauces. It was delicious ! Had a slight kick  Cheryl have wimpy tastebuds was very flavourful. Cheryl found the service to be very polite and friendly  and the service was quick because there was no one else there at the time  :   Would definitely recommend.
reviews.name: Cheryl

reviews.text: Situated right on the increasingly bustling corner of Bathurst and St Clair lies Eastern Twist; but man what first looks just do not  know. Eastern Twist is not one for the decor  Eastern Twist is  more of a takeout place and it is just find the way Eastern Twist is because the food here is simply fantastic and while not all of Eastern Twist's dishes measure up to the same quality as others  most of its dishes are quite tasty and reasonably priced. The point to remember when going here is to order a  paratha  wrap rather than a dish which comes with rice. Now do not  get Harrisimo wrong the rice and the rice's even sexier sibling coconut rice is just fine here  but the freshly made paratha bread straight out of the over is at the top of Harrisimo's list as the best wrap bread Harrisimo have ever tasted. the freshly made paratha bread straight out of the over  rich in flavour and infuses palatable elements of other delectable flat breads like nan into a stretchy  chewy masterpiece which surrounds your choice of sumptuous fillings like butter chicken or various vegetable masala  in what quickly becomes a textural delight upon completion. To top it off every paratha wrap is served with very fresh standard veg like salad and tomato  and some unique options like spicy marinated carrots and your choice of a variety of amazing sauces like tamarind and hot sauce. Last but not least  it is  very important to mention the absolutely gargantuan size of each paratha wrap which  to put the massive paratha wrap in ethereal terms  is roughly the size of a medium human head and feels like the massive paratha wrap weighs a good kg and a half. Thankfully  the massive paratha wrap does not feel that heavy in your stomach because of the massive paratha wrap's wealth of healthy ingredients and the high quality of the ingredients used Also  for those looking to get those looking to get their money  's money  worth the massive paratha wrap is often large enough to be divided into   separate meals if you are not exceptionally hungry. Harrisimo would recommend the Caribbean Chicken if you are looking for something with meat and the potato curry if you are looking for something vegetarian. Harrisimo almost exclusively get the potato curry because Harrisimo think the potato curry is  not only the best tasting and most filling option on the menu  but the potato curry also happens to be the cheapest at   .  . C mon where else in Toronto are you going to get a massively healthy and tasty wrap for   bucks tax included Answer :  Eastern Twist
reviews.name: Harrisimo

reviews.text: Eastern Twist is not  your average take on indian inspired wraps. Each menu item is made fresh to order and wrapped in the most mouth watering naan style bread. Your choices are always consistent and the toppings are fresh. John's recommendations are the Butter Chicken and Seekh kabob wraps. the Butter Chicken and Seekh kabob wraps rarely disappoint !

reviews.text: Eastern Twist  Tracy miss Eastern Twist ! Since having relocated out of the Bathurst and St Clair area  there are few things about the old hood that have Eastern Twist feeling sad and nostalgic. The wraps at Eastern Twist are a serious factor. Tracy now live about   min away and Tracy have  gone THAT far to stop in here. What  ! Eastern Twist is a small  independently owned shop  with a name that in Eastern Twist's eyes  does not conjure what it should. Aside from that  the offerings at Eastern Twist have yet failed to disappoint. Granted  as others have pointed out  previous staffing have proved the experience less than rich however  Tracy will  note that upon recent visits  no sign if pouty pants or the bizarre one who kept calling Eastern Twist  Helen   even after correcting her  were seen. In fact  Tracy did like the young lady who assembled Eastern Twist's meal. Now  aside from all that  the food here is really great. A bit in the pricier side compared to the adjoining food stops  but  Eastern Twist is far more interesting  tasty  and independent. So  there. The BBQ chicken wrap comes in a giant portion  rolled up in a slightly chewy  soft paratha wrap  either white or whole wheat. The chicken is fresh  cooked to order  ANC mighty good. Add in some handsome offerings of lettuce coriander some achar spicy pickled veg   and hot sauce and you are off to enjoy. Other great dishes include the butter chicken wrap  potato curry  and zafrani Palau. You know how the dog stomps the dog's leg when you scratch that spot on the dog's belly just right This is what happens to Eastern Twist when Tracy bit into a wrap from here. Sigh. If only they delivered.
reviews.name: Tracy

reviews.text: Great place for grab and go food  especially for lunch or after a long work day. Travelling used to live around the corner from Eastern Twist. Ordered food so often from here that the owners recognize me and knew exactly what Travelling wanted. Yep  sometimes still willing to drive half way across the city for the food. Love the spices and the after taste that still lingers in the mouth after all the food is gone.
reviews.name: Travelling

reviews.text: Only ever eaten the butter chicken wrap  but the butter chicken wrap is  soooo yummy that Ant can not  bring Ant to ever try anything else. Ant have  heard the BBQ chicken wrap as well as the chickpea and potato or spinach wraps are great as well so Ant guess one day Ant may have to get enough courage to try something else on Eastern Twist's menu lol... Overall the butter chicken wrap is  not like another wrap Ant have  ever tasted and Ant highly recommend the butter chicken wrap even though Ant do think    . is a little pricy for a wrap but then again  the taste satisfies Ant's craving and suddenly the price does not  seem to matter  :

Eddie had the chilly dog and to be honest Eddie never had something as bad as the chilly dog the seasoning was overpowering and super greasy Eddie also got a chic - pea rap which was horrible Eddie do not  understand how Eastern Twist has such good reviews  !  ! Come on people do people know what good food is
