reviews.text: Sandwiched in with a Harvey  and Subway  Eastern Twist deserves more attention from people looking for a quick snack.. or even dinner. Jeremiah usually drop in for the coconut milk soup with chicken to go. A large is enough for three people to share  and for about     after tax that is  not too bad   although Jeremiah usually also serve the coconut milk soup with chicken to go over fresh white rice at home  despite the coconut milk soup with chicken to go being a noodle soup. the coconut milk soup with chicken to go  tasty and fresh  coming after usually about a ten minute wait. Eastern Twist's wraps  which Jeremiah have  had a few times  are okay  but not quite as special as the coconut milk soup with chicken to go. The staff at Eastern Twist are very pleasant and welcoming. Even kitchen staff will greet you when you arrive and when you leave. Dining space at Eastern Twist is pretty limited and Eastern Twist is  obviously intended to be a take - out place for most. Jeremiah definitely recommend the coconut milk soup with chicken to go to anyone in the neigbhourhood. Eastern Twist have a chicken - less version as well for those looking to avoid meat. Skip the rest of the typical fast food franchise places and go here.
reviews.name: Jeremiah

reviews.text: Eastern Twist is surrounded by big - name chains so it appears to get lost in the crowd. Emily went in before work one day and placed Emily's order of BBQ chicken poutine. Was told about   minutes after Emily placed Emily's order that it would be another    minutes. There is not  really anywhere to sit so it became an awkward situation between Emily and the hostess while Emily waited. There was no one else in Eastern Twist while Emily was there. The food itself was really good and was a fairly good size. So if you are  looking for something different in fast - food Eastern Twist is the place to go.
reviews.name: Emily

The people who work here are extremely sweet  and The people who work here even know AJ as a regular now  lol !  . Small place to eat  so tend to always take out instead of dine in.
reviews.name: AJ

reviews.text: Nice staff  good flavours. Anamika tried the chicken curry wraps  butter chicken and the veggie one too on different occassions. Good amount of food for the price.
reviews.name: Anamika

reviews.text: The butter chicken wrap is really good  followed closely by chickpea and other veggie wraps
reviews.name: I

reviews.text: Eastern Twist is a great addition to the Bathurst St Clair area. It  nice to have a fast - food option that is not  Pizza Pizza or Subway  or  now Harvey  . Eastern Twist offers a diverse options  with a variety of flavourful curries and seasoned meats. When Jon go to Eastern Twist it is  usually for a paratha wrap. Jon's favourite tends to be the spicy beef wrap though the BBQ chicken tikka wrap and the butter chicken wrap are both delicious too  -  -  the butter chicken is the best bet for someone who does not like things spicy. The paratha  bread  itself is absolutely scrumptious. Once the bread and filling are ready  you can choose which toppings you would  like to add. These include lettuce  tomatoes  onions cilantro  and  very  spicy carrots. There are yogurt and tamarind sauces as well. Beware very  spicy carrots ! very  spicy carrots are delicious  but will be too spicy for some people  tastes. The vegetarian samosas are cheap and delectable as well. Everything is made to order  so you may have to wait for    or so minutes for it to be ready. You can call in an order to pick up  but Jon have had mixed results describing what Jon want and getting an order right. On the whole  Jon love having the option of grabbing a bite here rather than the standard fast - food options nearby.
reviews.name: Jon

reviews.text: BBQ Chicken wrap is good specially Eastern Twist's spicy carrot topping !  !  ! Nelson always get BBQ Chicken wrap for lunch on the weekend...... yaaas
reviews.name: Nelson

reviews.text: While the concept of butter chicken poutine is mouth watering butter chicken poutine's execution is less than satisfactory. The butter chicken is amazing but the fries The butter chicken is  put on are thick cut and quickly become soggy.
reviews.name: Lola

photos.caption: Mango mousse from wednesday lunch buffet
photos.label: food

reviews.text: The soup  on ! The lentil soup at Jaipur Grille is killer. The soup has this tang to The soup that Leeor love. Leeor once tried to cajole the server into telling Leeor what they put in The soup  and the server said the server would ask the chef  but the server flaked on Leeor. Anyway  Leeor eventually de - constructed it. All the food Leeor have  tried here is high quality. Tandoori was nice as well as the curry dishes. Staff is generally quite cordial and friendly and its never hard to get a table.
reviews.name: Leeor

reviews.text: Jaipur Grille is a great Indian restaurant with higher than average prices. Jaipur Grille's grouper konkani is a reason in Their grouper konkani to pay a visit. Their grouper konkani  soft and tender  with delicious sauce. Trimurti on Queen  for instance  offers the same quality of food at a lower price point. However  if you feel like Indian food you can not  go wrong with Jaipur Grille.
reviews.name: Andrei

reviews.text: Very nice Indian food. Disclosure : Mae have  never been in India but ate there with people who had been . Everything seemed freshly made and the spices were varied among the dishes  also not too hot for Mae's taste. Elegantly simple decor makes the dining room very pleasant. Service was attentive but not excessively so.
reviews.name: Mae

reviews.text: Atmosphere was good but not great. Service was great and food was very good if a little bland. Even though Zahir usually order mild or medium spicy at most Indian restaurants  at the Jaipur Zahir tasted no spice in the vegetable paneer or the Madras chicken. And Zahir did not especially ask to have the dishes made blander. Overall  a good experience which caters to the white bread palate.
reviews.name: Zahir

reviews.text: GREAT INDIAN FOOD Maddy had a greay deal about Jaipur Grille and have been wanting to check Jaipur Grille out for a while  -  and Maddy finally did. The food was delicious the ambience is nice and the staff was friendly as well. Food : a  Appetizers : -  Maddy had the dahi vaada and chaat for starters -  was good but a little disapointing -  Maddy was hoping for more chaat style  -  the combination of the dahi vaada and chaat in one was a little weird. the dahi vaada and chaat would have  tasted better as separate dishes  -  kebab platter   -  the chicken tikkas were so tender and delicious ! The fish was fantastic as well. Would have  been satisfied with anothe round of the platter   b Entrees -  daal panchtaran  -  a mix of   yellow and orange daals -  ti was good but not my favourite entree that Maddy tried. -  Chicken Tikka masala was very flavourful ! -  Diawli Special  -  the lamb dish was AMAZING !  ! THE best Indian lamb dishes Maddy have EVER had. Maddy wish this was on Jaipur Grille's regular dinner menu c  Dessert  - Kulfi -  tasted great and the presentation was fantastic !  ! Highly recommend Jaipur Grille for good indian food !
reviews.name: Maddy

reviews.text: Emily was actually looking forward to writing a good review for Jaipur Grille. The food was quite good and a step up from lot of other Indian places Emily have  been to. Emily went out with a group of friends      vegan     meat eaters . Emily were very clear about this when ordering. After were Emily done Emily asked for our left overs to be packed up. Emily just went to eat our left overs only to find a HUGE piece of meat  -  beef  lamb  its brown..and some other meat rice dish mixed into Emily's veg left overs. Jaipur Grille is really unfortunate. Emily called to the apology and the apology seemed very insincere. First Emily had to explain to a server the problem and a server just totally did not  understand then Emily was passed off to the manager. As a vegetarian it really is upsetting to have meat mixed into your food. Emily do not  think Jaipur Grille understands this. the manager was just giving Emily some excuse that when its a large table Jaipur Grille always put all the left overs together. Our main server was very attentive and nice  but the server that packed up our food was obviously clueless. Not sure if Emily will return.
reviews.name: Emily

reviews.text: Jaipur Grille has some exquisite chicken curries. Korma and vindaloo curries are one of the best you can get. Also  in terms of freshly baked Indian breads Jaipur Grille is a number one restaurant. Jaipur Grille have the best garlic naan Marcin have ever eaten. That being said  Marcin am very disappointed with Jaipur Grille's vegetarian dishes. Cauliflower and potato curry has no sauce whatsoever  was excessively salty and the vegetables felt as if the vegetables were made of gum. Marcin guess Jaipur Grille did not use fresh vegetables. So Jaipur Grille is definitely not a good place for vegetarians to go  and sadly so  as Marcin think vegetarianism is a very important element of the Indian cuisine. One of the waiters is very intimidating. One of the waiters never smiles and it feels like One of the waiters is angry with you. The atmosphere is not very relaxed. Marcin would not go there alone. However Jaipur Grille might be perfect for formal occasions.
reviews.name: Marcin

reviews.text: After ordering Jaipur Grille several times and enjoying Jaipur Grille  David decided to finally check out Jaipur Grille in - person during Summerlicious. Jaipur Grille was almost empty when David arrived on a Friday night  and David were quickly shown to a nice table by the window. Shortly after placing our order  however  a party of three and a baby were seated at the table right next to ours  -  -  despite the fact that there were many  many other empty tables in Jaipur Grille. Now  here  what David have  struggled with. Do David make this review all about our experience next to the table right next to ours  Or do David focus on the food alone David have  decided to go with the former  since the staff felt it was okay to place a small infant at a table right next to another one  despite ample space in Jaipur Grille. David's appetizer the Chicken Ginger Tikka  Chicken breast marinated in lemon juice  crushed ginger garlic  cooked over charcoal was actually pretty good and David did enjoy it quite a bit. It was only after David would  finished eating it that a baby really started to express a baby's displeasure at being out of the house. a baby wailed for a solid half hour  and probably kept going long after David would  left . Nobody at the table right next to ours made any effort to shut a baby up  and in fact  Nobody at the table just started talking louder. the staff not only did not  do anything about this  but basically ignored our table for the rest of our meal. David would have  ordered another alcoholic beverage but nobody asked if David wanted another alcoholic beverage. Worse still  our water stayed empty right up until it was time to pay the bill. David's main was the Shrimp Masala  Tiger shrimp saut ed with peppers   garlic in tomato   onion masala  and David's dessert was the Gulab Jamun  Dumplings cooked in light syrup with saffron   pistachios but because of the absolutely intolerable ambiance  David was forced to wolf the Gulab Jamun  Dumplings cooked in light syrup with saffron   pistachios down in an attempt to get the hell out of there. David should note  however  that the shrimps were not peeled. The laziness of the chef meant that David was forced to spend a few minutes the endeavor to peel each of the shrimps  with the endeavor made all - the - more difficult by the sauce that the shrimps were soaked in. All in all  this was one of the worst  most annoying meals David have  had in a very  very long time. Neither of us enjoyed our meals  since David raced through the entree and dessert portions. The fact that David paid about      for such an experience is something David wo not  forget for a long  long time.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Raj's family hosted a party here for about    guests in the back room. Raj looked at about eight places all over the GTA before choosing Jaipur Grille. Jaipur Grille was more expensive for a group meal than most of the other places Raj saw  but the space and layout was perfect for us so Raj went with Jaipur Grille. Turned out the price was totally worth it  -  -  most of our guests  who were South Asian  were blown away by how good the food was ! Most impressively  Jaipur Grille manages to make yummy Indian food without the usual  secret ingredient  : copious amounts of oil and grease. For anyone else doing a large group event Raj were very happy with the well - coordinated service and nice ambiance  and no surprise charges at the end of the night  -  -  whew !  . Raj have  gone back here since a party and the food has been consistently good  and pretty affordable too . Raj's faves :  the samosa chaat an appetizer  and the mango mousse.
reviews.name: Raj

reviews.text: Been going to Jaipur Grille for    years and the food is always great. visit was no exception. However the service has changed.... dramatically. Gone are the familiar servers only to be replace by some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals. some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals felt awkward.... albeit pleasant. The biggest surprise of the night came when some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals changed into some   younger and clearly less experienced individuals's street clothes before William had finished the meal and proceeded to clear the table. Overall  the experience of eating at Jaipur Grille felt inferior this evening.... however the food quality remains high.
reviews.name: William

reviews.text: Bund will  keep it simple. Bund enjoy coming here for lunch or dinner. The service is friendly and efficient. The food is delicious. Jaipur Grille The prices are very reasonable as well. The kebab platter is always appetizing. The combination of spices used really wake up the palate. The chefs really know what The chefs are  doing. Great location and ambiance. Nothing pretentious about it. Simple  clean decor. The food speaks for The food.
reviews.name: Bund

reviews.text: Jaipur Grille has such a romantic and classy atmosphere which was perfect for Masha's weekday evening date with Masha's hubby. Masha were seated right away inside the clean  simple  dim lighted dining area. Several large candles were flickering along the big windows as the reflection of the flames danced around Jaipur Grille  creating the most cozy and sexy aura. Our server was extremely friendly  chatty and efficient. Our server was very helpful in helping Masha choose what Masha would like Our server noticed Masha was picky . Masha had : Appetizer :  Dahi vada chaat      -  thin crispy lentil dumplings drowned in thick yogurt  mint and tamarind sauce. This dish was semi - sweet  a bit tart and delish ! Mains : Lamb korma       -  Spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce. Lamb korma       -  Spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce was cooked to perfection and just melted in Masha's mouth ! Lamb korma       -  Spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce could have  been spicier but Lamb korma       -  Spiced lamb in an almond and cinnamon curry sauce defiantly was awesome. There were strong notes of cardamom which was not  a big deal but they could have  toned down a bit. Paneer makhani       -  Small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter. Masha thought Paneer makhani       -  Small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter would be too greasy but Paneer makhani       -  Small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter was not . Paneer makhani       -  Small tender pieces of cubed cottage cheese drowned in a fenugreek tomato curry sauce and thick butter was Masha's favorite dish and the flavors were bursting ! Naan    . -  The naan bread here was fluffly  a bit stretchy  and super fresh. The naan bread here really went well with our mains. Dessert Drinks :  Masha tried the mango mousse     or    which had a thick creamy whipped cream texture bursting with fresh mango flavor without being too sweet. the mango mousse     or    which had a thick creamy whipped cream texture bursting with fresh mango flavor without being too sweet was pretty tiny; the mango mousse     or    which had a thick creamy whipped cream texture bursting with fresh mango flavor without being too sweet could have  been bigger especially for the price. Jaipur Grille had a nice bar menu but Masha opted for the lassi      and masala chai     . the lassi was semi - sweet  chilled and creamy with yogurt  and masala chai was super fresh and hot ! Masha was afraid Jaipur Grille would  give Masha microwaved stuff like other Indian restaurants. Microwaved tea =  poison tea ! Masha highly recommend Jaipur Grille ! The service is amazing  the ambiance is perfect  and the food is cooked well and tasty. Jaipur Grille's portions are good and the prices are a bit high compared to other places but Jaipur Grille do Jaipur Grille's stuff well here. Also  Masha look forward to coming back for lunch; Jaipur Grille have a nice lunch menu that Masha think may be worth checking out.
reviews.name: Masha

reviews.text: Selene generally really do not  like most indian food. Selene find most indian food super greasy way too heavy on the sauce the pakoras are normally done wrong and all the veg dishes have paneer or ghee  making it super hard as a vegan. The food at Jaipur Grille  however  was really good. The pappadums were spicy  as The pappadums should be . Jaipur Grille had a good number of vegan dishes  though Selene get the feeling that Jaipur Grille did not  know what vegan was so Selene m not      positive there was not  some ghee in there... Three of us split an order of pakora  not the best Selene have  had  but quite nice   an eggplant medallion dish in sweet tomato sauce  mixed veggies and cashews in a green sauce  and a spicy yellow lentil dish with rice. The food was great  tons of flavour  not greasy. Our other friend got an okra dish  which was really good  though a bit on the salty side. Service was amazing. Jaipur Grille were very attentive and friendly. Decor was beautiful and the lighting was perfect. Some things that could be better... Selene do really hate that Jaipur Grille only have white rice. Come on  get with white rice ! If you do not  want to do brown rice  offer wild rice or something ! For some reason Jaipur Grille gave us all our leftovers wrapped in one bag. Very weird  like Selene obv do not  all live together. Selene think that Jaipur Grille could have asked if Jaipur Grille were unsure. And worst  as Emily M. said  Jaipur Grille mixed all our leftovers together  meaning Emily M. got meat in Emily M.'s veg dish ! Not cool ! Selene m still not super into indian food but the next time Selene am in the mood for some  Selene will  check out Jaipur Grille again.
reviews.name: Selene

reviews.text: Chantalle used to get take - out from Jaipur Grille on a regular basis ages ago  but after a change in management  over a year ago  Maybe longer... Chantalle just did not  feel the JG love. Chantalle tried other places but mostly just went without Indian food. Chantalle tried The Yellow Chilli a few weeks back  thinking Jaipur Grille would fill the void. Not even close ! So tonight  Chantalle ordered takeout from Jaipur Grille and Chantalle could not  be happier !  ! It is delicious and fresh and yay ! Chantalle will definitely go back. Of course  the butter chicken is a must  -  excellent ! The naan was fresh and light and the pullau rice was good. Papadums were good and overall  Chantalle are very pleased with JG and thank you for a delicious meal !
reviews.name: Chantalle

reviews.text: Constantine have  been to Jaipur Grille a few times  and Constantine m not impressed. The food is overpriced  is not  that great  and the portions tend to be quite small for the meat dishes. For example the chicken korma is      and is about the size of an appetizer. Constantine had the paneer makhani  which is a vegetarian dish  and the portion was more generous than the meat dishes. However  although the paneer makhani  which is a vegetarian dish was good  the sauce tasted sort of like canned tomato soup with some Indian spices. The only good Constantine can really say about Jaipur Grille is that the naan is tasty  and that Jaipur Grille is physically very nice. The staff is also nice  although service can sometimes be slow.
reviews.name: Constantine

reviews.text: Stopped by Jaipur Grille for Summerlicious      -  Jaipur Grille's menu was inexpensive for a   - course Indian lunch. Kris's selections were as follows : App :  Onion Bhajias Entree : Lamb Rogan Josh Dessert : Gulab Jamun Each course was very well made. Onion Bhajias were very crispy and were accompanied by a mild sauce. Lamb Rogan Josh came with garlic naan  freshly baked. Gulab Jamun was also delicious  and Kris's friend described Gulab Jamun as a fried cinnamon timbit covered in syrup. Mmm. Service was unobjectionable  and the restaurant ambience was decent. stars given solely for doing nothing wrong. Well done.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text: WOW what a mouthwatering experience. Sonia went for summerlicius and Sonia ordered the chaat tandoori wings  chicken  lamb  glaub jamun. Every dish was cooked to perfection the service is friendly and Jaipur Grille is clean. Looking forward to coming back !  !
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text: The interior of Jaipur Grille  is tastefully decorated with really simple yet elegant motifs. The tranquil atmosphere and aroma of spices escaping the kitchen made Ehsan happy just to sit by the window and sip on Ehsan's mango lassi. The appetizers; dahi bhalla chaat  samosa and tandoori wings were all fresh tasting. tandoori wings and mint sauce pairing was especially good. Ehsan found dahi bhalla pretty unusual and Ehsan can not  really say Ehsan enjoyed dahi bhalla. Main course dishes lacked variety. Main course dishes were     identical  which took away from the fun of sharing. All dishes came with a side of rice  saag paneer and raita. The warm and fluffy naan came in generous portions. The saag paneer side was Ehsan's favourite part of all the dishes Ehsan tasted. The saag paneer side had actual pieces of cheese and The saag paneer side was much more flavourful than the typical runny stuff you get elsewhere. The rogan josh lamb was tasty but a bit too heavily salted for Ehsan. The fresh mango lassis and golab jamun soft spongy dumpling infused with warm syrup and saffron  really hit the spot after the big meal. The food  on the whole  was less than spectacular but the friendly and attentive servers along with the great atmosphere turned it into a good experience.
reviews.name: Ehsan

reviews.text: Jaipur Grille has great value and really well done Indian food. Jaipur Grille really care about what Jaipur Grille are making. Julie also really like that for dinner Jaipur Grille have the option to do dinner for      or more people which means you choose an app  a vegetarian main option and   meats for a flat rate and that also includes naan   rice and deserts. Perfect !
reviews.name: Julie

reviews.text: Food : Zero Stars    tiny pieces of chicken and even smaller potato that could fit into palm of hand ! ! !  !   Service : Zero Stars Paid     for lunch special : vindaloo chicken  chicken should be more than   pieces of cut up chicken  each smaller than a timbit  and   potato size of   thumbnails  inside small soup container with mostly liquid watery gravy  -  flavour was not  even absorbed   biryani  big rectangular container maybe  . small bowls  and naan  partially dried   tiny salad  tiny container for sauces . The chicken container lid melted off  so sylvia lost gravy - liquid BUT there were only   pieces of chicken and   piece of potato that could fit into the tiny salad container for  sauces  meaning  sauce size . If sylvia can figure out how to attach a pic sylvia will of the containers but sylvia was so hungry sylvia did not  think of taking pics of the food ! The server was utterly rude with crossed arms asked why sylvia did not  call first and sylvia told The server that sylvia tried but nobody answered and then The server called out to a guy to investigate the phone issue with sylvia instead of just tactfully handling sylvia's food order. sylvia told The server that if it was trouble sylvia did not  need to order lunch sylvia was the only customer . When the food was ready The server shouted to sylvia to get the food The server did not  even bother to walk the food over to sylvia from around the wall dining area and sylvia was sitting on a chair by the entrance sylvia asked for the nice guy that sylvia asked to look into the phone earlier  and The server pretended The server did not  know which guy sylvia was talking about when the entire time there was  a guy and there was nobody else and no other customers the entire time. sylvia decided to tell The server why The server was a jerk and The server apologized only because sylvia think The server thought The server would  get into trouble  but sadly sylvia did not  know how bad the meal was going to be or sylvia would have demanded a refund and marched right out. sylvia will not return. If it is  called carbs  rice and naan  than sure  be honest and rename it carbs and price it accordingly and do not call it chicken when there is  barely chicken let a lone not even vindaloo. sylvia always go to Banjara on Eglinton for spectacular vindaloo chicken. They can alter the salt and spice level and you do see actual chicken pieces. They do not  even expect you to call although they have tons of takeout orders and sylvia have never been greeted with cross arms.
reviews.name: sylvia

reviews.text: stars for service   stars for food Henry would  heard good things about Jaipur Grille so Henry made reservations for Winterlicious and dragged family and friends to try Jaipur Grille out. The interior :  Thankfully does not  reek like Banjara et al. The interior  polished but forgetfully bland. Soothing ambiance. Henry were the first ones there that afternoon and it did not  get busy for Saturday lunch. The service : Very attentive  just saw one waiter   friendly and accommodating. Henry walked in at  pm  and were there till   pm ! The food :  Was a tad disappointing. Mint chutney lacked mintiness. The dahi bhalla chaat  rice crisps in yogurt with sweet and tangy sauces  lacked sweet chutney. The tandoori wings  really looked forward to The tandoori wings  smelled like fowl. Not good. The rogan josh was ok. Not terrible but nothing too praiseworthy either since The rogan josh lacked fennel. The saag paneer lacked garlic and punch. The saag paneer was ok. The fish curry that Henry had was delicious :  lightly sweet because of the onion puree and coconut and not because of artificial sweetener. The vegetable biryani won high praises from The vegetable biryani's consumer. The naan was really fresh. The mango mousse was quite good  not too sweet but still mangoey. The gulab jamuns also won praise from The gulab jamuns's consumer  but their consumer has    sweet teeth so The gulab jamuns is  no tall order ! Henry's taste buds were not  too impressed. It  a one time deal for now.
reviews.name: Henry

reviews.text: Terry have been here several times for lunch. It is great if you work in the area and need a nice but not expensive place to bring a co - worker or client. For that matter  Terry sometimes will go alone for a lunch treat  as it is  never full and Terry am always in - and - out of there in    minutes or so. Jaipur Grille have an outdoor patio  on the street  which is nice on warm days. The lunch items range from    to      plus tax and tip  and are served with your choice of rice or naan bread. Terry usually get the Saag Lamb  which is lamb masala cooked with baby spinach  and the naan. the Saag Lamb  which is lamb masala cooked with baby spinach  and the naan is very tasty  with just enough spiciness for Terry  for those with  spicier appetites Terry have  heard the vindaloo is great  and naan bread is soft and delicious. Jaipur Grille obviously have a dinner menu but Terry have not  tried a dinner menu. Jaipur Grille also have a weekend brunch weekends    : AM  -    :    PM with a somewhat odd mix of Indian dishes and items like  grilled chicken and cheese sandwich all under     .
reviews.name: Terry

reviews.text: Nisha have found the best Naan in town people ! Nisha love the best Naan in town people and made my peace with the fact that Nisha could never find the best Naan in town people here  until... Nisha found Jaipur Grille ! the best Naan in town people is so good and Nisha have  tried the best Naan in town people along with the Butter Chicken which is good  the Palak Paneer which is amazing and a Lamb dish whose name Nisha m forgetting. But trust me  Jaipur Grille is one of the better Indian Restaurants and Nisha find Nisha hardly disappointed with the choices. Jaipur Grille also have the best Mango Lassi in town ; The service is great and the staff goes out of the staff's way even if you order take out. Would definitely recommend Jaipur Grille !
reviews.name: Nisha

reviews.text: Ordered the chicken biryani and dahi vada and chaat. Aliyah was surprised that Aliyah got biryani instead of the chicken tikka masala Aliyah thought Aliyah had ordered  -  not sure if it was an error on the Just Eat website or if Aliyah clicked on it myself. Anyway  Aliyah love biryani and was excited to eat biryani. the chicken biryani was not very good at all. Aliyah took out a plate of food and then had to go back to the kitchen because there was not  any chicken in a plate of food... Aliyah actually had to stir the food around to hunt for meat. There were a few chunks of chicken in there but definitely not enough compared to the amount of rice. The rice rice was spicy but otherwise lacked flavour  same with the chicken which was a little dry. The dahi vada chaat new to me was interesting slightly sweet and cake - like in a thick creamy sauce. Aliyah liked chaat better than the chicken biryani but chaat was nothing special and Aliyah would not  order chaat again.
reviews.name: Aliyah

reviews.text: Norman was really delighted how tasty the food is. the chole dal is done just right. the curry chicken could be spicier but still well rounded flavor. the rice is really decently cooked. good solid indian food  which says a lot for the toronto indian establishments that Norman have  tried  but the toronto indian establishments that Norman have  tried could beef up the taste a notch for what the toronto indian establishments that Norman have  tried are charging.
reviews.name: Norman

reviews.text: Chandni got the food delivered for dinner and it turned out to be the horrible experience. The worst veg. biryani and paneer makhani Chandni have ever had in Chandni's life. the vegetables in biryani tasted so bad and the rice was also not perfect. Never ever ever in Chandni's life.
reviews.name: Chandni

reviews.text: Sandra had a surprisingly poor meal here just after Christmas      . Sandra ordered vegetable curry as Sandra's main course. The vegetables were soggy   pedestrian    seemed to have come out of a package  frozen. The sauce was generic  as though supermarket curry powder had simply been stirred into tomato sauce. The samosas were OK  but not very flavourful. Sandra wondered if the ownership   or chef had changed since the last time Sandra had eaten here  several years ago  when the food had been first - rate.
reviews.name: Sandra

reviews.text: That  some tasty Indian right there. Chicken tikka masala  like butter chicken but with some heat and sweet peppers mutter paneer  cheese chunks with peas in tomato onion sauce  and daal panchratan  soft yellow lentils spiced with tumeric ..... all good baby. The naan here is also exceptional... The naan here is  got just the right amount of chew. You could say The naan here is ... second to naan ... K thanks bye  :
reviews.name: Lauren

reviews.text: Colleen have never felt the need to give a place a zero. This is hands down a ZERO but Colleen do not  have the option but to be generous on a One star here to write this review. In most cases Colleen m generous with the reviews. But  Colleen would normally base the reviews on food and service. Let  give you some background Colleen booked a reservation here online to dine at pm  Colleen even call them before Colleen get there to let them know Colleen will be there at    pm since Colleen did not  receive a confirmation call and Colleen also wanted to enquire if take out was an option since Colleen was going to use one of those entertainment coupons. Off the bat  Colleen should have understood what imbeciles Colleen would be dealing with. After Colleen very politely ask the man who answers on the phone about one of those entertainment coupons the man who answers says no take out using one of those entertainment coupons only dine - in and before Colleen could even reply the man who answers got agitated and said Colleen should have read the whole book even though the whole book does not  say anything on one of those entertainment coupons. Fine. Colleen have a reservation already so no big deal  Colleen tell the man who answers that is  ok Colleen have a table booked at   pm and Colleen will see them in a few minutes. Colleen get to Jaipur Grille and the man who answers walks up and says Colleen are  closed kitchen is closed. Colleen explain Colleen just called and the man who answers makes it appear that Colleen m lying. Colleen spoke to the man who answers    minutes before getting there !  !  !  ! Then Colleen explain Colleen had an online reservation and the man who answers  like   Colleen do not  know why they have it like that online they know Colleen close at    pm. Excuse me dumb much  ! If they close at    pm why do you post an available table at    pm the man who answers then suggests Colleen get in touch with ppl online to correct it. No the man who answers  why the hell do not  the man who answers do tht since the man who answers are  the business Now normally  in any given restaurant  -  there is  an apology at this point. None. Instead the man who answers starts aggressively showing us the door while there are patrons in there dining watching this initially telling us there was no online rsvtn and then saying the man who answers saw no online rsvtn but does not  know why no online rsvtn happened. Well if you noticed no online rsvtn  should not  the man who answers have called us and told us about the error and saved us a trip from Mississauga  ! the man who answers was so rude -  Colleen decided to walk out of there than stooping to the man who answers's level and decided to never go back there. With an attitude Like that Colleen feel so very sorry for the staff that work for Colleen  Colleen mean if you can treat customers so poorly  Colleen dread to think of what employees there go through everyday dealing with the man who answers.
reviews.name: Colleen

reviews.text: Paul eat Indian food not infrequently. For Paul it is essential that Jaipur Grille listen when you place an order  especially when it is regarding the degree of heat  spice in the food. When Paul placed our order over the phone Paul specifically said Please make our order very very very mild . Paul picked up the food and took the food home for a birthday celebration. the food was a large amount of food. the food was so hot Paul could barely eat the food. While Paul could appreciate that the flavours were very good what is  the point if the heat prevents you from enjoying the food
reviews.name: Paul

reviews.text: The kebabs taste great. Jaipur Grille have a buffet lunch on Wednesdays with a decent selection of foods all of which was hot and just as good as Jaipur Grille's normal lunch fare with lots of meat. The buffet  mango mousse is ice cream frozen into a bowl. Despite the clean appearance of the customer area of Jaipur Grille  apparently Jaipur Grille do not  have very good results from Toronto health inspections which makes Eric wary of returning. WiFi password is           . Parking is easy to find on nearby Duplex Ave  or paid street parking on Yonge St.
reviews.name: Eric

reviews.text: Fantastic quality  great service and reasonably priced. Rod am a regular there and would recommend Jaipur Grille to anyone. Rod have only ever ordered take - out  however  so Rod can not  attest to Jaipur Grille's table service.
reviews.name: Rod

reviews.text: Has to be Jaipur Grille. After moving to New York from India   years back  Hari have been craving for authentic Indian food ever since. Hari stumbled upon Jaipur Grille on Hari's last visit to Toronto. And Jaipur Grille was just perfect. Great food  great atmosphere and excellent service. Do not miss Jaipur Grille's Chicken Tikka Masala  for meat eaters   Subzi Malai Methi vegetarian  and Mango Mousse.
reviews.name: Hari

reviews.text: Great dinner last night. Friendly  efficient service. Simple decor and delicious food.... as others have said  not greasy which can often be the downfall of Indian food. The Bhindi Rajasthani  fried okra  is not to be missed !
reviews.name: Diane

reviews.text: An overall disappointing experience started when Michele walked in the door and waited several minutes before anyone acknowledged Michele's presence. When a server did appear  a server just suggested to Michele and another person waiting that Michele just take a seat  -  but did not ask any questions to determine what Michele were waiting for. After getting seated  Michele had to call a server over to take our order after several minutes. Then Michele had to wait quite a while to get the first drink Michele's friend ordered. After about    minutes  Michele was informed that Jaipur Grille were out of Kingfisher beer  and suggested Michele order something else. When the food arrived  the experienced sadly did not improve. Everything was oversalted and tasted much the same. Michele ordered chicken saag  goan shrimp  aloo gobi  rice and naan. The shrimp was stringy. The meal was supposed to include raita but Michele were informed raita had run out. Michele barely touched The meal as The meal just was not  very good. Needless to say  Michele will not be back.
reviews.name: Michele

reviews.text: One of the nicer Indian restaurants in the area. Been there a couple of times now. The inside of Jaipur Grille. is neat clean and well spaced so tables chairs and people do not seem cramped. Serene were seated  immediately and food was served soon after Serene ordered. DIdnt have to wait long. Things Serene liked about the food were that the presentation was neat  food was served hot and the taste was quilte pleasant if a little on the mild side. The seesh kebab was spicy and very well made Serene ordered the daal  yellow lentils  and Serene felt on that one curry dish that Serene had the quantity could have been better. Serene enjoyed the evening here. If you are looking for a nice quiet place to have a tasty dinner in a very pleasant setting  then Jaipur Grille. is a nice quiet place to have a tasty dinner in a very pleasant setting !
reviews.name: Serene

reviews.text: Came back here a few times after the initial visit and the bar was set lower  which is disappointing. My hubby and Masha came here on weekday evenings and noticed the service suffered a bit even though My hubby and Masha were the only people there. Also  the food portions decreased and prices have gone up. Prices on some of the desserts have decreased by    or so  but still expensive for the amount. the food portions need to be a bit more for the price  and the dishes can use more spiciness. Masha noticed that the dishes are usually overdone on one particular spice which overwhelms the overall taste. Love the amazing cassata ice cream. the amazing cassata ice cream really good ! Not too sure about Jaipur Grille anymore but Masha may return just to give Jaipur Grille another chance.
reviews.name: Masha

reviews.text: Adam came to Jaipur Grille today on a whom since Adam seen Jaipur Grille across the street from St. Louis. There were many well dressed individuals here and Jaipur Grille was quite upscale. The service was excellent and the owner himself even came out and introduced the owner himself ! Adam m not that familiar with Indian food but they recommended Adam a couple dishes that turned out excellent. Adam can recommend a couple dishes that turned out excellent. The portions looked big but when Adam was done Adam was craving more so Adam opted for desert as well. The experience was very authentic and Adam can not  wait to come back. the owner himself told Adam they have  been around for    years and have a second location somewhere around waterfront Adam can not  remember.. Anyways  check Jaipur Grille out.. Jaipur Grille looks like a great place for after work.
reviews.name: Adam

reviews.text: Ordered delivery tonight  -  -  was craving some spices and quite enjoyed everything Jennie ordered. The food for   can feed   for     plus taxes and tip so Jennie would  start with plus taxes and tip when ordering delivery or take - out. Jennie had the lentil soup  -  -  very bright flavors  with a lemony tang and poppy seeds   !   ! ; aloo gobi  - -  very mushy cauliflower was not a hit with Jennie's cauliflower loving kid  unfortunately; butter chicken  -  -  great curry flavor that was a bit sweet lamb saag  -  -  fairly tender lamb meat but Jennie still got out a knife to cut fairly tender lamb meat; raita and of course  the basmati was fine and the naan bread was fresh. Everything came hot and piping within    minutes of ordering and Jennie appreciated that tremendously. Overall if Jennie need another Indian food fix Jennie would  order again from here. Whenever Jennie eat Indian food from Queen Street Jennie feel like Jennie's pores are saturated with all the greasiness or richness of all the flavors. Jaipur Grille is definitely no Queen Street.
reviews.name: Jennie

reviews.text: Jay got the dinner for   platter with an additional entree for a party of  . There was more than enough food to share between a party of. Jay enjoyed the flavours of the dinner much more than the standard Indian buffet style. Service was quick and attentive. The seekh kabob and veg pakoras appetizers were made to order and fresh. seekh kabob were full of flavour and the veg pakoras were crispy with a delightful spicy mint sauce to complement veg pakoras. Jay enjoyed the lamb korma and chicken makhani entrees. the lamb korma and chicken makhani entrees had lots of flavour and the right amount of spices but was creamy and sweet. The beef vindaloo had quite the spicy kick to The beef vindaloo and The beef vindaloo was soft and tender. The grouper needed a bit more seasoning but The grouper was still good.
reviews.name: Jay

reviews.text: When the temperature is  -    outside  David figure it is  a good time to order some spicy Indian food. David have  lived in the area for a while now but David would  never tried Jaipur Grille. David m a huge fan of Indian food so expectations were high. First of all  David should mention that the food arrived extremely fast; so fast  in fact  that the food was still hot ! That  a win in David's book. Our mains were Saag Paneer and Chicken Tikka Masala. Saag Paneer was solid  to be sure  but David will admit that Saag Paneer was not  quite as flavorful as other versions of this dish David have  had. Saag Paneer seemed just a little too salty  somehow. Chicken Tikka Masala  on the other hand  was exquisite. Chicken Tikka Masala was flavorful  spicy  and just all around delicious. David could have  eaten another eight containers of Chicken Tikka Masala. David also ordered a couple of samosas and a cashew salad. a couple of samosas was surprisingly tasty and full of delicious vegetables  while a cashew salad was good but not spectacular. All in all  Jaipur Grille was just what the doctor ordered on an almost insanely cold night.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: As someone who grew up in Mumbai and has been constantly disappointed at various Indian restaurants across North America it was such a pleasant surprise to find Indian food here that was as nearly      as good as the food back home. Our favourite things here are the Samosas the Lamb chops  the okra and the eggplant. Arti generally do not  eat meat  but the Lamb chops here are just irresistible. The service is excellent. The service is a little pricey  but The service is  worth it.
reviews.name: Arti

reviews.text: Jason routinely get Jaipur Grille for takeout. Jaipur Grille is Classic Indian food done well. There is not  anything super creative on the menu but all the classics are very well executed and when your in the mood for that Jaipur Grille cannot be beat  Jason will eventually make our way over and try the lunch buffet. The naan bread is out of this world.
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text: Came here a few weeks ago with some friends for lunch. some friends were running  Jaipurlicous so Laura had that. Laura had the tandoori chicken wings as Laura's app  -  did not  enjoy the tandoori chicken wings as my app all too much  -  the tandoori chicken wings as my app was not the traditional red  BBQ charred colour or taste Laura expected. Instead the tandoori chicken wings as my app was yellowish and looked to be semi broiled. Was not  a fan. Laura's main dish of shrimp masala was good  -  really enjoyed the gravy  -  perfect level of spice and the gravy was really aromatic. The naan was nice and fluffy. For dessert Laura had the gulab jamun. The meal came with one  Laura could have easily had another    -  these were rich  sweet and warm  Laura like them served warm not cold like some restaurants do . Price was great and service was good as well. Will come again and try other dishes  and Laura know not to order their tandoori wings.
reviews.name: Laura

reviews.text: Came here for lunch -  do not  be fooled if there are not  many people there -  the food is very good  and reasonably priced. Had the chicken tikka masala  and saag paneer -  both very tasty. The business lunch is very filling  good if you are  hungry or for leftovers.
reviews.name: Mdaw

reviews.text: After reading all the reviews  Nav decided to go with Nav's team for lunch here and Nav was very impressed. The food was more authentic than many other places around here  read Chef of India   and a great value for lunch. For     per head  including gratuity and taxes  Nav ate a good complete meal. Nav had the chicken tikka masala which Nav requested extra spicy  and Nav thoroughly enjoyed the chicken tikka masala which Nav requested extra spicy. Far better than going for a run of the mill buffet. Nav went again with Nav's brother and husband on a Saturday for lunch  and the food and prices were great again. The chaat for starters was also very enjoyable. The only reason that Nav am giving this   stars and not   is because when Nav went with Nav's family  my family did not ask my family for chai dessert  which Nav did actually want  and got my family the bill straight. So Nav decided not to order those things and my family lost out on some more money. Despite this  highly recommended for lunch  not sure about the dinner value  !
reviews.name: Nav

reviews.text: The foods are delicious but what Gogoland like even more is the friendliness of the staff. Gogoland have come in here with friends for lunch and have also ordered delivery and the staff are always accommodating and full of smiles. Sometimes  in a busy city like Toronto  some people forget how to be nice to other humans so it is  always refreshing when this is the case. At Jaipur Grille  you get good food  great atmosphere and friendly staff. What  not to love
reviews.name: Gogoland

reviews.text: Great service and owner ! Got an upset tummy after Jaipur Grille so wouldnt go back there. Be assured of great service while you are there.
reviews.name: Satya

reviews.text: Jaipur Grille is run by an extremely dishonest and untrustworthy person. Having heard good reviews of the food  Arpita ordered chicken and shrimp biryani for    people. an extremely dishonest and untrustworthy person had given Arpita an estimate of      including tax for this including delivery. Come D - day  when Arpita asked for a confirmation of an estimate of      including tax for this including delivery  an extremely dishonest and untrustworthy person tried to fool Arpita by adding additional tax and delivery charges. The WORST part is that chicken and shrimp biryani was just colored rice  and the chicken and shrimp biryani barely had any of colored rice. The entire party was disappointed with the food and Arpita am skeptical of ever going back. If this is what they do  Arpita wonder what other unethical things they do with food. Recycle half eaten dishes
reviews.name: Arpita

reviews.text: Jaipur Grille is an office favourite. The food and service are always great. Sumantra can not  think of anything on the menu that Sumantra did not  like. Jaipur Grille
reviews.name: Sumantra

reviews.text: Heather have  been to Tandoori House many times over the years and have always enjoyed the food. However  since changing Tandoori House's name to  Tandoori House   Tandoori House have reduced the size of Tandoori House's lunch buffet significantly  and food is not replenished once emptied. Very slim pickings really  and no mango ice cream ! Tandoori House have  also done away with the warm gold  red  green interior. Instead Tandoori House have painted the walls a prison color beige and replaced the dark carpet with standard issue beige tile. Did Heather go to the prison cafeteria or an Indian restaurant The staff was very nice but The staff did not offer any kind of drink other than water. Sadly  the underwhelming food and stark ugly decor equate to a deal breaker. There are many other Indian restaurants around Madison that bring their A game in all categories. All those wonderful pictures you see of the buffet tables and the warm colors on the wall are long gone from here.
reviews.name: Heather

reviews.text: Use to be my favorite buffet. New name  +  new Managment  +  ! less good food  + not good service = let  consider somewhere else for lunch !
reviews.name: Amit

reviews.text: Went here after realizing that Kangchen is closed on Mondays  and was curious to try the  new  Indian restaurant for the  new  Indian restaurant's lunch buffet. Bottom line is that there is  nothing new here that you wo not  find at any other buffet in town  and although it is  a self - perpetuating problem the lack of customers meant that the food was mostly sitting out rather than being refreshed and looked old and was not terribly warm. So... is it bad No. Would choose to go here for lunch buffet again No.
reviews.name: K

reviews.text: The food here is amazing !  ! The best Indian food around. Christine had the goat curry  mixed tandoori  mango shrimp and chicken Makhani. chicken Makhani was so good Christine had to get an extra order to go. Tandoori House make great drinks from scratch -  mango margarita was so good !  ! Christine was very impressed with the service as well. Christine travel often and eat out a lot at high end restaurants and the service was top notch. Very friendly and helpful.
reviews.name: Christine

reviews.text: Local demographics who are not very aquiented of this type of ethenic food consider awesome  but who grew up eating curry and kabobs Tandoori House is just a mediocre restaurant. -   buffet is just little too much for cold food. Dish trays were not attended and some were empty. No one was looking after buffet trays. Middle of lunch hour resturant was empty  meaning good seating without any wait. Kamran guess Kamran was expecting better food with newer management. Tandoori House charged     -  with better taste.
reviews.name: Kamran

reviews.text: Great buffet  excellent service. The staff are very polite and professional  even when kids are being raucous. The lunch buffet has lots of choices and is a great value. Nuriddin would  go here once a week if Nuriddin lived closer.
reviews.name: Nuriddin

reviews.text: So Brandon was a bit shocked to see Maharaja was replaced  and Brandon went in to Tandoori House's lunch buffet to compare  with a skeptical pallet . Brandon do not  understand why some people said their lunch buffet was worse than before  Brandon thought their lunch buffet was fantastic ! Pretty much the exact same menu and selections as before  except their lunch buffet seems to be even a little bit better but Brandon just can not  put Brandon's finger on why. Brandon m a big eater; Brandon always get Brandon's money  worth. Brandon tried almost everything at their lunch buffet it was all as good as if not better than Maharaja used to be. Brandon would  definitely say it is  a step up not a step down. Do not  fear change change is  not a bad thing in this case !
reviews.name: Brandon

reviews.text: The chicken tikka masala meal is pretty good but the entire paper bag from the restaurant  especially the naan  smelled heavily of cigarette smoke. especially the naan was completely inedible due to the cigarette smell taste  -  especially the naan was really disgusting especially in terms of taste... Even though the taste of one dish from the restaurant is good  the cigarette smoke smell taste that has transferred to the food is just unforgivable.
reviews.name: Katy

reviews.text: Unbelievably good Indian food for an upper Midwest town like Madison. Ali travel a lot and always eat at Tandoori House when Ali m in Madison. The food is prepared beautifully and The food  well seasoned without being too spicy. Ali have  dived in and ordered delivery and the quality is always high. Ali also appreciate a good halal option  which can be difficult when Ali m not in a big city. The staff are friendly and Tandoori House has a family vibe. Ca not  recommend Tandoori House enough.
reviews.name: Ali

reviews.text: It was my first time coming to Tandoori House. My wife and Manuchehr really liked the service. Manuchehr were seated promptly and the buffet had a good variety of dishes. Overall  Manuchehr were very satisfied with the service and the food. Manuchehr will come again !
reviews.name: Manuchehr

reviews.text: Goodson m not sure what the complaints are about. Goodson really liked the food but most of Goodson's meal consisted of   -   dishes only. Goodson wish Tandoori House had palak paneer but instead there was a lamb dish with paneer. a lamb dish with paneer was good. Goodson m a goat fan so the goat curry was also good. Give it a try and see for yourself. Disregard our Yelp reviews.
reviews.name: Goodson

reviews.text: Nice atmosphere  friendly attentive service  good food. Free papadoms. Everything Katrina tasted was good :  chicken pakora  papal paneer  garlic naan  mango lassi.
reviews.name: Katrina

reviews.text: The food here was absolutely outstanding. Zeshan came into town for a business trip and thought there was no good food in the area. After a quick yelp search  Zeshan saw Tandoori House and thought Zeshan would  check Tandoori House out. To my surprise  Tandoori House was a Pakistani Indian fusion restaurant. These are very rare to find ! Zeshan had the Peshawari Kabab with saag paneer. It turned out to be a rest experience . Both owners were present. Both owners  which showed me exactly why both choices of my dishes were so good ! Naan was on point and fresh as well. Zeshan would recommend Tandoori House to anyone. Just wish they had more places like Tandoori House in my hometown. Thank you for the great food and service Tandoori House  !
reviews.name: Zeshan

reviews.text: Tandoori House is now were Maharaja used to be. The new owners must have new chefs as well. The food was terrible. Very bland tikka masala and chicken curry; every thing needed more salt or something. The tikka masala had way to much cream in The tikka masala Ali could barely eat The tikka masala. Even the nann was cold and tastless. Ali's favorite thing to eat at most Indian restaurants is the mint chutney  dipping for nann  pakora and samosas. Most places the taste is very similar  sometimes different color or texture but still tasty. Tandoori House  was beyond awful. It was again bland  super spicy from tons of raw jalape os that it almost tasted chemical - like. The samosas were also empty from the time Ali got there until Ali left. Maybe it will get better with time but Ali m not willing to take that chance. Ali will not be coming back here  Swagat off of Old Sauk will be our go to Indian buffet from now on. Also weird how the other   reviewers have only started yelping this month and have only reviewed Tandoori House  Just sayin.....
reviews.name: Ali

reviews.text: From what Nikita have  read  Tandoori House used to be another restaurant that switched cooks and changed Tandoori House's name. When Nikita initially looked at the reviews most said that Tandoori House was better and that Tandoori House lacks ambience. Tbqh that may be true to some degree. Tandoori House was very large  empty and had no music. The waitstaff seated Nikita promptly and had good service. when Nikita go to ethnic restaurants Nikita usually go for good food and Nikita thought the lunch buffet had pretty good quality with lots of variety. The curry was very flavorful and some were actually spicy  which Nikita really like. The only dish Nikita did not  like was the goat curry. The meat was very chewy and hard to eat  but Nikita did like the flavor and consistency of The curry.
reviews.name: Nikita

reviews.text: Sara have absolutely no complaints ! Sara really appreciated the menu; there were many choices and Sara's Indian favorites were on the menu. Sara ordered Palak Paneer and Chicken Makhani to - go and it tasted as it should ! The staff was friendly and the prices are fair.
reviews.name: Sara

reviews.text: The interior decor went downhill since the change from Maharajah  tore out the carpet and painted the concrete floor Really Why  . The food on the lunch buffet was lukewarm had no sneeze guards over the chafers Bernard thought no sneeze guards over the chafers were required by law    and there was not a good selection of items. Bernard wo not  return.
reviews.name: Bernard

reviews.text: Stopped in to get lunch buffet Tandoori House have discontinued lunch buffet. Have a different lunch menu. At least   people came in and walked out because people asked for buffet and there was none. Anyhow  ordered the veg thali and the meat thali. Food is subpar. Did not  look like the traditional thali you would expect at most Indian restaurants. Chicken and daal and rice and salad. Over cooked tough chicken. Very disappointed. Not worth the time or money.
reviews.name: Charanjeet

reviews.text: Seth went to the lunch buffet with a friend and the food was so good Seth returned with Seth's wife for dinner soon after. Seth's friend had lived and travelled in India and also felt the food was unusually good. There were lots of vegetarian entrees  two types of naan  a very good lentil soup and tasty desserts. The pickles  condiments  tasted fresh and flavorful. Coming back for dinner Seth shared the vegetarian dinner for two  which featured three excellent entrees papadam  pakoras  naan and dessert. The portions were generous and the use of spices skillful. There were good choices for Indian beer. This is now our favorite Indian restaurant by a wide margin.
reviews.name: Seth

reviews.text: My friends and Chris had been frequenters of the former Maharaja for years. Found out the former Maharaja changed hands and became Tandoori House so Chris went over Friday afternoon to give the lunch buffet a try. Arrived around the lunch buffet was pretty empty. Think there was only   other table seated the entire time Chris were there. And once Chris tried the food the food itself  Chris knew why. The selection was pretty standard to what you would  expect at one of these buffets. Chris of course got some tikka masala Chris's go to  and tried the lamb curry  and a few other things Chris cannot recall the name of. Chris took Chris's first bite of some tikka masala  my go to  and spit some tikka masala my go to out. It was like taking a shot of salt. Everyone else did the same. some tikka masala my go to was inedible. At least   of the other dishes were just the same  the only flavor was salt. Overpowering loads of salt. And on top of that they had the heater on the lunch buffet set really low or even off  if the food itself had been any cooler Chris would not  have even tried the food itself  for sanitary reasons. One of the managers stopped by to ask  how the food itself was at one point  and Chris was honest with One of the managers. One of the managers did offer to have a batch of  low sodium tikka misala made up  which came out piping hot. And while it certainly was not  the salt bomb that the stuff on the lunch buffet was it was completely bland. It seems a strange turn around from the  was not  salty enough  comment here from   months ago. And Chris know the business is still new but you would  think the business would  have the recipes in tip top shape after   -   months.
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Good authentic Indian food.. Visited for the first time.. Had not  heard much about Tandoori House.. Buffet was pretty good and had lots of variety.. Specially liked sik kabab and dal makhani..
reviews.name: Dhiraj

reviews.text: James will  start by saying the food is definitely good. Eating at the lunch buffet James got to try a good variety of things and all of it was pretty darn tasty. James was let down by the chai tea there was not very much flavor in The chai at all. Sadly The chai was more brown water than anything else. Did not  get any other drinks so James can not  speak for them the rest may be good. The atmosphere of Tandoori House is not  enjoyable currently  though this is mainly due to remodeling they are  doing James think. There  not really any decorations on the walls  so apart from the tables the rooms feel empty. But again  they are  currently remodeling so The atmosphere of the restaurant will likely improve over time. The waiter felt very awkward and almost confused. And James do not  think James would  put it to The waiter being new to waiting tables. The waiter had the motions down so to speak but The waiter did not  seem to know what was going on. James asked if James paid at the table now or on the way out  and The waiter did not  seem to know. After a long pause The waiter said it was paid at the table but The waiter sounded very unsure. And throughout our interactions with The waiter  there was never a spark of personality. So comparing Tandoori House to Maharaja  which Tandoori House took the place of. Is the food better Maybe some of the food yeah. the food  the same if not better. The chai is worse  though the rest of the drinks may still be good. The atmosphere currently is a far cry from Maharaja  which it took the place of. Empty walls and lack of any decorations make Tandoori House feel unenjoyable and less fun. Tandoori House lacks the charm that Maharaja  which it took the place of had. And James can only speak for The waiter  but comparing The waiter to the waiters of Maharaja  which it took the place of  there is  no contest. The waiters of Maharaja  which it took the place of had fun personalities and were nice and very attentive  even at the lunch buffet where the waiters of Maharaja are  needed much less. The waiter James had seemed like The waiter would  rather be anywhere else. The three stars are because the atmosphere  and staff will likely improve over time. And the food is already good. Tandoori House has the makings of a great restaurant that will stand on Tandoori House's own and not need to be compared to Tandoori House's predecessor. When that happens  Tandoori House will  be a   or  . But right now the food is  just average as it is  food is held back by the rest of Tandoori House.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: My husband and Sandy were hungry for new flavors and so Sandy tried Tandoori House and were not disappointed. My husband and Sandy were served delicious  fresh  handcrafted drinks and enjoyed the intense flavors and fresh  hot dishes of chicken curry and beef tandoori. The naan was crisp and hot out of the oven and the staff was attentive to My husband and Sandy's needs throughout the entire meal. Sandy will definitely be back.
reviews.name: Sandy

reviews.text: My friends and Emily came in on a Sunday  for my birthday dinner. Emily were seated promptly and very friendly. Our server told us about the drink specials. Emily had a margarita and a cocktail Emily chose for me. Sweet  spicy  and delicious with oranges  limes tequila  and tamarind. Our food was hot  with great flavor and large portions. The menu was accommodating to my vegan vegetarian  and gluten free friends. Emily were given a complimentary birthday dessert that fed all of us. Emily were very impressed with the staff and quality of food. Emily would  highly recommend Tandoori House for a fun get together with friends ! Thanks for my birthday dinner !
reviews.name: Emily

reviews.text: Contrary to a previous recent review  today when Elizabeth arrived the  lunch buffet  neon sign was on and Tandoori House did indeed have a lunch buffet available. Salad  fruit  dal  and an average number of hot dishes     -     including chicken tikka masala  were available on a lunch buffet as well as two dessert options  mango ice cream and kheer . A basket of hot naan was also brought out to our table. The dishes were okay but Elizabeth would have preferred more  or more pungent  spices in The dishes. Elizabeth liked the goat curry  dal  pakora  and samosa. There are certainly better options for Indian food in town  but on a Monday in this vicinity it was an alright option. The fennel seeds on the way out were great though
reviews.name: Elizabeth

reviews.text: Totally recommend Tandoori House. Plenty of  Indian  food options around Madison  most of which offer a very similar menu and flavor. These guys pulled in some different recipes and flavors from Pakistan which makes it worth a visit. Solid service as well.
reviews.name: FJ

reviews.text: The food is very delicious. being a stay at home mom who has to cook   meals daily. there are times when Ayesha dont want to cook at all but have to as there was no resturant which delivered halal and delicious desi food. Thanks to Tandoori House now Ayesha can take a break from cooking and spend more time to play with Ayesha's kids. So far Ayesha have tried chicken tikka  chicken achari  peshawari kadhai samosa chat daal makhni  and chapli kabob. everything was very delicious with pakistani taste. and yes how can Ayesha forget ghulab jaman... veryyy yummyy. now Ayesha dont need to wait to go to chicago for pakistani food. Ayesha can get pakistani food here from Tandoori House. Ayesha wish Tandoori House add pakistani style biryani to Tandoori House's menu.
reviews.name: Ayesha

reviews.text: Went here for dinner as Tandoori House has been around for quite sometime known as Maharaja. It  gone completely downhill unfortunately. Leah was with family    other adults  and Leah's one month old daughter. Leah were seated quickly. Leah's order was wrong but Leah did not  say anything to the waiter because Leah's daughter was starting to fuss. Leah ordered chicken tikka masala and some other kind of chicken was served instead. The food presentation was not  up to par and the quality of food was not  great either. the waiter was rude about Leah's daughter fussing even though Leah were on our way out. Not a good place for children  rude and inaccurate service along with poor quality food. Spend your money somewhere else.
reviews.name: Leah

reviews.text: This was the biggest disappointment since Toronto.... food was cold for starters and Gina arrived at    : so it should have  been stellar fresh. There was crust on the saag paneer and the tandoori grill fish was cold like the tandoori grill fish had just been brought out from the refrigerator. The naan was average at best and even the water had a peculiar taste to even the water with oily film on top. The only good thing Gina can say was Tandoori House offered a box of  Kleenex  next to the chai tea as you left the buffet area so you did not need to blow your nose in the white cloth napkins. The price was    . person but Gina were charged    . for two with no extras. Never again... trust me do not  go here. Sorry Tandoori House but you need to change  things and fast.
reviews.name: Gina

reviews.text: Amazing Tandoori Paneer best Matthew have  ever had. Super flavorful spice rub combined with the tandoori char to produce something out of this world. The vegetable curry was also excellent. Service was a little slow  but friendly and accomadating. Matthew would highly recommend Tandoori House -  - food is worth the wait.
reviews.name: Matthew

reviews.text: The owner was so nice ! Cherise ordered Cherise's food Togo and The owner recommended the chicken tikka masala. Cherise caved and got the chicken tikka masala because who can resist. The meal itself comes with a good portion of rice tikka massala  and dessert. As much as Cherise liked the portions  Cherise was not  able fully get the explosion of flavor Cherise was looking for. The rice was plain...which Cherise was looking for something more fragrant and the actual tikka was creamy but missing that pop. The meal itself was not  bad  but The meal itself was not  great either. However  you should definitely try the mango smoothie if you go. Cherise will  be back for convenience  but is not  Cherise's first choice.
reviews.name: Cherise

reviews.text: Different name but still great food. Ordered off the menu for dinner and were very pleased with what Ira got. The chicken makhani was rich and delicious; the tandoori beef had a nice bite to the tandoori beef and a smokey flavor; and the garlic naan had plenty of garlic. Loved the chai tea  too. Ira treated very well; given extra bread and refills of chai. Ira will  be back next time Ira are  in Madison.
reviews.name: Ira

reviews.text: Done with Tandoori House. My husband and Trisha have been coming here for a long time and order the same thing every time and the order can not seem to be consistent. Tonight felt like Trisha threw away My husband and Trisha's money again. For    . for dinner for   you would  think Trisha could at least get My husband and Trisha's take out in containers that were not  cracked open and spilling all over. When My husband and Trisha's order is correct everything is there  and containers that were not  cracked open and spilling all over are not  busted open Trisha like Tandoori House but Trisha can not  seem to get that consistently. Also the pakora and shahi paneer recipes must have changed recently and Trisha do not  care for the pakora and shahi paneer recipes anymore. shahi paneer was very hard and the new spice flavor was not  as good as the new spice flavor was. The pakora are now chewy  bland and taste overcooked. Trisha had issues in the past and the staff addressed issues promptly but again Trisha had My husband and Trisha's extra rice missing  bad pakora and shahi paneer spilled all over. Madison selection of Indian Restaurants is growing constantly and Trisha wo not  be coming back here. Friendly staff and very good food sometimes.
reviews.name: Trisha

reviews.text: David stopped in on a Monday night and ordered the chaat samosa appetizer  potatoes and spinach aloo something  and malai kofta. The hot food was hot  especially the bread  and beautifully spiced. You can order hotness from   to  . David's companion is not a spicy girl and found   too hot. But David's kofta tasted milder to My companion  perhaps because of the paneer in malai kofta. When David were ready to go the waiter offered rice for the spinach leftovers  no charge. There are several vegan and vegetarian options on the menu.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Excellent food  quick delivery. The  mild  was more accurately hot Jeremy do not  say that as one of the weak tongued  but still full of great flavor !
reviews.name: Jeremy

reviews.text: Went on a Saturday night with friends. Excellent drinks made special for us by Jimmy. The food was wonderful. John loved the Roghan Josh and the Goat Malabar. John will  definitely be back.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: So it is  a little confusing. Google Maps says Maharaja Restaurant is permanently closed  but Tandoori House is at the same location and shares the same website. Aside from that Tandoori House is a great place to go for Indian. The Lamb Curry was delicious and perfectly spicy at medium temp. The Chicken Shahikorma had nice chunks of bell peppers and was also perfectly spicy at medium. The one issue Matthew had was The Chicken Shahikorma was lacking in sauce. Honestly though  the service was great and Matthew look forward to going back to Tandoori House.
reviews.name: Matthew

reviews.text: TERRIBLE DELIVERY SERVICE TAKES FOREVER. The order took more than an HOUR AND A HALF to arrive ! They would  told us    min for delivery. In addition  TERRIBLE DELIVERY SERVICE was really expensive considering what Kelly got. Over     for literally one entree  shahi korma     orders of naan  and   tiny samosa. They only provided one small packet of rice. Kelly were calling for half an hour to check on the status of the food but no one ever answered the phone. Kelly would  ordered the food mild as our toddler does not  like very spicy food  but the food was extremely hot  -  perfect for Kelly  but not at all what Kelly ordered  and our kid could not  eat the food. When delivery finally arrived  the delivery guy was not  even apologetic. Kelly was standing at our open door waiting  and Kelly was walking so slowly  like Kelly did not  even care. Unfortunately Kelly would  already left the tip  and they charged us a delivery fee on top of the tip  without disclosing a delivery fee. This is a business that is obviously NOT equipped to provide delivery service. shahi korma was good  but nothing else was.
reviews.name: Kelly

reviews.text: Tandoori House went totally downhill after the change of ownership. Every time Erica have  ordered delivery they have  either not been able to find Erica's address  and then just went back or they totally screwed up Erica's order. But the absolute worst was finding some sort of metal string in Erica's curry. It  really a shame because Tandoori House used to be one of Erica's favorite places.
reviews.name: Erica

reviews.text: The too long did not  read version of this review is  Gemma miss Maharajah . miss not the reason for   stars but miss is  still true. Gemma went for the lunch buffet because Gemma are  just wild about Indian food. the lunch buffet did not  really have a large amount of people  and Gemma got there shortly after open     : am . You would  assume the food would be fresh  but you would  be wrong. Everything Gemma got off the lunch buffet was lukewarm at best. The fried things were soggy and greasy. The flavor was ok  but you can get better pretty much anywhere in Madison. the lunch buffet is also very small. the lunch buffet also do not serve naan to the table naan is  in a hopper so naan is  sad and limp not crispy and awesome. Gemma think outside of the food the thing that bugged me the most was that Gemma did not feel welcome at all. The two guys who were serving us talked only to my husband and one actually walked away as Gemma started talking to him. He asked how things were  listened to my husband and walked away while Gemma was talking. When Gemma went up to pay it was basically the same thing. Looked and talked to my husband even though Gemma was paying. Gemma do not  need to return here.
reviews.name: Gemma

reviews.text: Mary had been here previously when Tandoori House was a different restaurant. Mary were pleasantly surprised with the new menu. Many dishes Mary were not  familiar with. The flavors of the Shahi Korma and Jalfrezi were unique and delicious. The Naan was soft and flavorful. The staff was very friendly. The only drawback is the decor which feels a little stark. Concrete floors and bright lights. Mary will be back !
reviews.name: Mary

reviews.text: Gave Tandoori House a shot before Joshua leave Madison. Joshua found the food very bland or lacking flavor. the food was not  bad..but not very interesting either. Palak Paneer is usually an easy  yum but Palak Paneer was flavorless. Maybe the food is healthier or more authentic than other locations Joshua m not sure. It was consistent throughout the food. Probably the best part was the naan bread when it came to the meal. Service and prices were fine and the selection was fair for the price.
reviews.name: Joshua

reviews.text: Having eaten Indian around the country and overseas  C never expected such quality in a strip mall. C had   different dishes and each was exceptional. The ingredient mix was spot on and some combinations unique  salmon masala . C m also sensitive to over salted food and over powering spices but had no post meal overeating regrets ! A bit more work on style and Tandoori House could be even more welcoming as the staff were carefully attentive. Highly recommended !
reviews.name: C

reviews.text: Hannah came to Tandoori House when Maharajah was still Maharajah and after visit  Hannah find myself wishing Hannah was back at Maharajah. Do not  get me wrong it is  still cheap eats for lunch for all - you - can - eat ! It not that the food is inedible but the food is  just not super yummy anymore. On the day Hannah came  lunch time ran until  pm. Hannah got there around  pm and most of the chafing dishes were either half empty or practically already empty. It did not  seem like they were going to refill anything because they were getting ready to close at  pm. Of all the things Hannah ate  here are a few that hit the spot : The chicken tiki masala had a really good sauce but The chicken tiki masala was super dry. Hannah really liked what looked like a blood sausage; a blood sausage was full of spices not temperature wise  and good. The garlic naan that they brought out was hot out of the oven and fragrant with the smell of garlic. Very good ! The best thing Hannah think Hannah ate there was the spicy chicken  the spicy chicken is  red and reminds me of Chinese sweet and sour chicken . The staff that Hannah encountered with were very happy polite  and attentive. That is something Hannah can vouch for ! Tandoori House is also very clean  but the food has left to be desired.
reviews.name: Hannah

reviews.text: Under new management  Nick did not  realize they were there until Nick were invited to dinner with friends. Great lamb tandoori and nan  enjoyed with authentic Indian beer. All   at the table enjoyed All   at the table's meals immensely  and Nick were able to specify the exact level of spiciness Nick wanted. Quite enjoyable. Nick will  be recommending it to our friends.
reviews.name: Nick

reviews.text: Pretty much the only Indian resto in this neck of the off the beaten path NDG. The store front says   Yagel Bagel but go right in you are  at the right place.
