Express Indien is small  only a few tables  and Lu have  only ever been here for lunch  and so far so good. Reasonably priced well prepared Indian food  perhaps not gourmet  but good nonetheless. Lu never had to wait forever to get served and the food was always piping hot  and prepared as Lu prefered. medium spiced There are   menus a la carte and a special lunch menu  featuring the veggie or meat thali  or briyani  with daal soup naan extra. daal soup    could have used an extra flavouring  of something or other the naan was good served toasty warm  the  chicken thali better than at some other places Lu have  tried. The only other dishes Lu have  ever had were :  chicken Kashmiri  chicken Korma and the ever popular butter chicken... all good. Overall Lu have  always left Express Indien feeling pretty good  satiated and happy to have been referred here by a colleague.
reviews.name: Lu

reviews.text: The. Real. Deal. Finally  after months of beating the bushes and getting greasy fast food Indian everywhere Daniel followed a trail to Express Indien and Daniel m putting it down as the best Daniel have  found of the dozen or more Montreal places. The small dining room is not  fancy but The small dining room is  not gross either. It  a little hole in the wall place and the chef came out to talk to us -  - that kinda place. Perfect pakoras  flakey and not at all greasy. Wife got the chicken Tikka Masala  Daniel got butter paneer both were excellent. Lassi was great  naan was great  rice was solid. Everything you could ask for in real Indian that is  neither served from a bucket nor pretending to be fancy. Go give these people your business.
reviews.name: Daniel

reviews.text: On a personal note Express Indien is a great neighborhood restaurant. From the owners to the employees all respectful and admirable. Food is without a doubt all awesomeness  always on the money same taste and flavor at all times. Always a pleasure buying from Express Indien. Multiple thumbs up. Keep up the good job in keeping us and our tummy happy
reviews.name: Clifnote

reviews.text: Romesh have  ordered from Express Indien since Express Indien have  opened a few years ago  and have always enjoyed Express Indien. But after three recent misses despite multiple previous hits it is clear Express Indien have changed either Express Indien's chef  Express Indien's recipe  or Express Indien's attention to detail. Recent order was too oily  too bland  and too mediocre. When Express Indien are  on  Express Indien are  really on  but though Romesh have  actually called Express Indien to give feedback and Express Indien have  provided not only viable explanations but also renewed attention to detail  this time was one too many disappointments. Sadly  Romesh will no longer be customers  and will seek better quality from elsewhere. It pains me to write this  as Romesh have enjoyed Express Indien's food TREMENDOUSLY up until the last few months. Sorry  Express Indien Express Indien have  lost our business.
reviews.name: Romesh

reviews.text: Our friend Aron recommended this little place that is just a few blocks from our home so Leesa-Catherine gave visit a shot. Walked in at    :    am on a Saturday. Express Indien was empty except for one man in Express Indien who was busy on the phone. Leesa-Catherine stood awkwardly for about two minutes in front of one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone until one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone finally said Yes   one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone did not  even bother to take the phone away from one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone's ear. Leesa-Catherine said Leesa-Catherine would  like to order Repas Royal for    dal soup tandoori chicken poulet tikka seekh kebab   tandoori shrimp  lamb curry  vegetables  naan bread rice  and Gulab Jamon for dessert  and an order of onion bhaji all for takeout. one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone said it would take at least    minutes. Leesa-Catherine asked about delivery  one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone said delivery would cost   . and would take longer to arrive at our home because one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone had to call the guy. Ugh ok. Leesa-Catherine decided to order  go somewhere for a coffee and come back to pick it up. one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone never put down the phone the entire time Leesa-Catherine were there. Fast forward    minutes..... Express Indien is still completely empty. No sign of one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone. Leesa-Catherine wait. one man in the restaurant who was busy on the phone finally shows up with the food in bags.       . for lunch which Leesa-Catherine take home. The food.....VERY small portions. Soup was just ok. Everything tasted the exact same  which Leesa-Catherine found so strange. Leesa-Catherine never received seekh kebab but Leesa-Catherine did not  want to go back so Leesa-Catherine just took it as a loss. Vegetables were a mix of fresh and frozen cooked together. Shrimp was frozen so was the meat -  they defrost the meat in warm sauce once an order comes in. Onion bhaji was greasy and mostly batter. The one high spot was the naan bread  -  the naan bread was very good. Leesa-Catherine are  huge fans of Indian food and being in NDG Leesa-Catherine are spoiled for choice. Leesa-Catherine wo not  choose Express Indien again. Leesa-Catherine will  stick with Maison India or Ganges on Sherbrooke.
reviews.name: Leesa-Catherine

reviews.text: Mattie have  had the best thali of Mattie's life at Express Indien. Under     you can have almost half a pound of delicious food  ! What Mattie liked the most was the choice of dishes available to include in our thali and the possibility to have our thali more spicy. Also  the service is really quick and the people are so kind  ! And Express Indien deliver !  !  !   :
reviews.name: Mattie

reviews.text: Michelle would highly recommend Express Indien first time my family and Michelle Went There Michelle absolutely fell in love with Express Indien the cream butter curry chicken dish is amazing the vegetarian dish are to die Express Indien give you the choice of level of spice you want in your food the service is fast Express Indien are very clean and have a warm hospitality and Michelle can not  complain about the price the price is  very good
reviews.name: Michelle

reviews.text: Express Indien is by far one of the best Indian restaurants John have ever been to. that is  saying a lot in a city with so many of the best Indian restaurants John have ever been to. The prices are unbeatable and if there is anything not on the menu Express Indien will make anything not on the menu for you.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: The taste is there les plats sont prepar s avec soin saveurs delicats  bonne presentation la deco un peu simpliste mais seems clean.. dans un quartier m connu.
reviews.name: Pat

reviews.text: Alright food; unremarkable place. Alexandra had vegetarian samosas butter chicken  and shahi paneer. samosas were just filled with potatoes; well - seasoned and nice pastry  but kinda boring. shahi paneer had a nice bit of heat and the cheese was good but the overall flavor was forgettable. butter chicken was very tasty though ! Express Indien looks pretty dated and if Alexandra had not  read positive reviews beforehand Alexandra think Alexandra would have skipped. Alexandra were not  given any condiments until Alexandra were almost done with appetizers; skimped on the papadums; owner  family walking around quite a bit... Overall not a bad meal and Alexandra would not  mind going there again but Alexandra will explore alternatives...
reviews.name: Alexandra

reviews.text: Richard was really impressed with the quality of the food and the tastiness of the sauces. Richard had the daily meal  Tahli  with chicken. You have a choice of lamb or vegetarian. Richard will definitely go back.
reviews.name: Richard

reviews.text: As an Indian living in NDG Frank's choices were limited to the ones on sherbrooke street. Express Indien was a bit of a surprise. When Frank first went there Frank had the Biryani which was aweful. Frank did not  go back for a year. Then a friend dragged Frank there and Frank had the Thali lunch  mixed meal  which was priced at and wow  ! the saag was good as was the butter chicken. The Naan was one of the best Frank have had in town. The chef worked in some known restos in India so The chef knows what The chef  doing. The chef uses a real tandoor oven so you get that light texture and smoky taste. For ten bucks  ! a really good meal that beats the Mc fast meals any day and much healthier The chef does not  over do the grease . Not too spicy either. Decor is simple and clean. Just a  good meal at a good price. Nothing to write home about but Just a  good meal at a good price works for Frank.
reviews.name: Frank

reviews.text: Well prepared food in an unpretentious setting. Mari could see myself eating butter chicken here for lunch on a regular basis.
reviews.name: Mari

reviews.text: Back on top ! ! Romesh have  fallen in love with this place again  Romesh's previous experience must have  been an anomaly and Ram the owner has assured Romesh this place's attention to detail is still there. And it shows :  the food is terrific. Romesh are back with a vengeance and are so thankful to be so !
reviews.name: Romesh

reviews.text: Express Indien  great prices. Meat was really dry unfortunately but the rest was pretty good ! Give it a go
reviews.name: Pema

reviews.text: Outstanding. After decades of dining at Indian restaurants all over Montreal  J find this absolute gem right in NDG. The best Indian cooking J have  enjoyed since the Bombay Palace on Ste Catherine St closed the Bombay Palace on Ste Catherine St's doors.
reviews.name: J

restaurants.name: Raja Foods
restaurants.category: Restaurants, Nightlife, Pakistani, Mediterranean, Hookah Bars, Indian, Bars

reviews.text: Farah ordered from here through skip the dishes. The food came quick but the portions and quality were very disappointing. Not worth ordering from.. would not recommend Raja Foods.
reviews.name: Farah

reviews.text: Raja Foods had the best butter chicken and the best papri chaat in the whole world. That is what Bathool claimed for the past three years. The staff attempted to give good customer service Raja Foods still lacked but Bathool's love for Raja Foods's butter chicken and papri chaat still dragged Bathool back often. Bathool brought friends who had stopped going because of the shady shisha bar environment not fit for a family. Recently  Raja Foods expanded to have a family side away from the smoke filled Shisha side. That is why last week Bathool called and made reservations for   people. They confirmed said everything was set for   on April th. Today  Bathool showed up with Bathool's party  only to find hand written sign in the door way saying  Bathool are closing at   pm Today  sorry for any inconvenience. It was a very embarrassing experience in front of your guests that the restaurant Bathool raved about and were a loyal customer to ignored your reservation without even a phone call. Bathool give it   stars out of   on customer service. Bathool will not be returning.
reviews.name: Bathool

reviews.text: Great food and shisha place with ambience. Been goin here the past two years and have found the Food to be great tasting and consistent... service  as with any desi place is inconsistent but Alpha find service is better during dinner time when the younger crowd does a great job looking after everyone with much enthusiasm. Shisha is also available with many flavours to choose from. Raja Foods serve Halwa puri breakfast on the weekends and Halwa puri breakfast is  certainly worth the wait and can see why many say Halwa puri breakfast is the best in town. Dinnner dishes Alpha tried have all been delicious and worth trying over and over again. Prawn curry  malai chicken and biryani is the usual with tikka and kababs from time to time as well. Ask for what board games you can play...usual have cards or ludo on hand to play with your table.
reviews.name: Alpha

reviews.text: Yummy food ! Harjot love the Biryani here  and the customer service is always on point. Friendly place and great energy. Please Note : This is just not a restaurant. You can also go to smoke hookah if that is your thing. Harjot do not  smoke  but Harjot noticed when Harjot go in there the smoke from the hookahs does not  disturb Harjot  and make want to run away from the smoke from the hookahs like cigarettes and all to the opposite side. or make Harjot cough when Harjot wait for the food. Harjot was told because there is no tobacco in it as it a fruit blend.
reviews.name: Harjot

reviews.text: Cat would love to be able to rate Raja Foods properly but Cat am too frustrated trying to find a menu to be able to order. There is an online order form but no menu. You have lost my business before my business began.
reviews.name: Cat

reviews.text: Amazing food amazing service. Try the butter chicken or kebab donair  -  the butter chicken or kebab donair will blow your mind. Sheesha is high quality with lots of choice and not rickety hookahs
reviews.name: Amyn

reviews.text: Raja Foods is my go to place for shisha and food. Raja Foods have amazing na an and great shisha. My friends and Cherie have gotten great customer service here; Great atmosphere   music. Cherie would recommend Raja Foods.
reviews.name: Cherie

reviews.text: Has superb service and food. First time going here was a pleasure and Tarik enjoyed the atmosphere there very much. The only reason why   stars are given in this review is due to smaller portions of food for a more than  above average  price. Other than smaller portions of food for a more than  above average  price Raja Foods is dope ! Recommended for everything else ! !  !
reviews.name: Tarik

reviews.text: Mona were old customers happy with original owners. New guy named Fahad was very disrespectful  arrogant. No washrooms were working  Mona's order was not available  Mona changed our order but did not  get our order even after waiting for   hour and    minutes. Ask New guy named Fahad about Mona's order  New guy named Fahad told Mona to leave. Never going back. If a business can not  respect customer does not  deserve to get customers. Terrible and horrifying experience.
reviews.name: Mona

reviews.text: The food is AMAZING. A little overpriced but who cares  Its hard to find quality desi eastablishments in Calgary. Not much can stand in the way of good butter chicken and papri chaat. The atmosphere is so nice. As a female  Misha hate going to desi joints only to get gawked at by the male crowd. Makes me feel like Misha have  been transported back to Pakistan...and not in a good way  : Well this did not  happen here ! In fact  my mom and Misha ended up having a long convo with the surprisingly young owner. the surprisingly young owner was incredibly friendly  professional and chilled out. Raja Foods is a great hidden spot  perfect for youger crowds. Raja Foods do not  just focus on making good food  but also have a great selection of music. The customer service is fantastic and the overall ambience vibe is excellent. Raja Foods reminds me so much of those cool hangout spots in Lahore  like Zouk Cafe. Misha miss that  it is SO rare to find halal restaurants like Raja Foods in Canada. Misha love that the employees are not all desi  and are able to speak fluent English. Raja Foods is definitely a Caucasian friendly place. Raja Foods also have a separate dining area for people who do not  want to be surrounded by shisha smoke. Misha was also told that the shisha is tobacco free. Misha did not  try the shisha so not sure if the shisha still tastes good  but the smells were definitely delicious  : D  Raja Foods are really well known for Raja Foods's halwa puri on weekends. Expect long line ups. But so worth the wait.
reviews.name: Misha

reviews.text: Excellent traditional foods ! Mark have  eaten here many times and love bringing friends who enjoy East Indian foods. A must visit for anyone in the city !
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text: Hameeda went with great expectation but seems like the halwa is not the same or not to our liking. Other than that Hameeda really enjoyed the hot puris and channa Yes the mango lassi not worth it The service is always the worst here. Bear that in mind. If you want to wait for someone joining you do that outside. Also do not  expect to be allowed to sit after your meal is over.
reviews.name: Hameeda

reviews.text: sadly Rianna have to write a bad review Rianna got food poisoning from here Rianna called to speak to the manager just to inform  but when Rianna asked for the manager one of the employees told Rianna to call back later so Rianna did then Rianna kept trying to call back and Rianna never got an answer. Other than that when Rianna ordered the food the front service was very polite and nice.
reviews.name: Rianna

reviews.text: The food is full of flavor. Great portion size. Super clean restaurant. Just wish the dishes were better and plastic wear.

reviews.text: Annie had a Groupon and enjoyed my curry of the day ! The rice was good and my curry of the day was pretty good too. Annie would go back again to try more of the dishes !

reviews.text: The Tasty Touch offers decent value for your money. Greg have eaten here once  Greg had the chicken tikka masala. the chicken tikka masala was spicy and good. Greg ordered the naan bread  which was your typical naan bread. Again  the prices are good  quality Indian food in the neighborhood.
reviews.name: Greg

reviews.text: cold bland food. Cannot call cold bland food. indian food by any standards. These people want to make use of a prime location and want to sell stale food overpriced. Ordered biryani  chaat and chole batura. Everything is in bad taste. The garbanzo beans in biryani  chaat are straight out of can cold  and biryani  chaat has huge lumps of potato. These people did not  even bother to heat garbanzo beans or properly cut cook potatoes. Satya cannot call the Biryani a biryani because the Biryani is fried rice  or just colored rice  made quick and is not a biryani. Oil used for chole batura is stale. This is a very basic dish and they can not  even get this near perfect. Do not  recommend. waste of time and money ! !  !
reviews.name: Satya

reviews.text: Finding a restaurant where Ali can eat absolutely anything on the menu  and really want to  is so exciting for Ali ! The food here was delicious. Ali got the platter that came with three curries so Ali could try a little bit of everything it was only Ali believe for a LOT of food. Roti  pickled veggies  rice  curries  a little dessert. Only complaint was the rice came out kind of cold but it was the end of the day so Ali get the rice. Also Ali did not  like a little dessert but Ali think that was just Ali. The food was great  flavorful with just a kick of spice ! Ali's BF got a cheese filled bread with a side of spicy yogurt dipping sauce and My BF enjoyed a cheese filled bread with a side of spicy yogurt dipping sauce so did Ali. Ali also got mango lassi which Ali liked. Good prices  good service  great food. Ali would  like to try more but Ali m pretty sure Ali will  end up ordering the platter that came with three curries every time Ali come !
reviews.name: Ali

reviews.text: Great taste  great value and friendly service. Eric were driving nearby and were hungry. Made a stop and will do it again...
reviews.name: Eric

reviews.text: Great food and exceptional customer service ! Kelly have  been to Namaste a few times now and Namaste never disappoint. The Tasty Touch offers traditional Indian foods with a take away order at the counter set up. While no  The Tasty Touch is  not your typical  sit down fancy Indian restaurant Kelly think it is  a refreshing change to have more varieties of  fast food  in the valley. The Tasty Touch offer a wide selection of vegetarian vegan and gluten free options. The staff is extremely friendly and gave detailed descriptions of the meals and offered some great suggestions. The Tasty Touch have a lovely patio to dine on or you can eat inside. Kelly have  never been disappointed with any meal Kelly have  had there. The portions are plentiful and Kelly always leave with leftovers. The Tasty Touch also offer a lovely selection of sweet and savories you can enjoy after your meal or bring home for later. Kelly would highly recommend checking The Tasty Touch out ! Even if you think you do not  like Indian food -  give The Tasty Touch a try. Kelly's picky teen even found a few things My picky teen really enjoyed.
reviews.name: Kelly

reviews.text: Mike were excited to have a new vegetarian restaurant opening in our area and love Indian food. Mike ordered a variety of foods and really enjoyed a variety of foods ! The house specialty was very tasty. Mike's only complaint would be that the portion sizes are a bit small. The Paneer Curry was very flavorful as was the rice dish Mike shared. The spicy paneer stuffed into bread was great as well but can not  remember the name of The spicy paneer stuffed into bread. The menu on the outside window has photos of the food making it much easier to order. The staff was very friendly and The Tasty Touch have a pet friendly patio as well. Mike will be back.
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text: Awesome food after new management took over. The Tasty Touch's Dabeli  Dahi Poori  Channa Batura are awesome. Have also tried The Tasty Touch's undhiya and Aam Ras  which is not on The Tasty Touch's regular menu but have their undhiya and Aam Ras  which is not on their regular menu but have it on their catering menu on The Tasty Touch's catering menu  such is also very good. Perfect location also.

reviews.text: David had the chicken biryani rice to go and had the chicken biryani rice at home. the chicken biryani rice was by far the best David have  had for a long time ! Well done TTT !  !  !

reviews.text: Love The Tasty Touch ! The Tasty Touch are  so kind   will recommend dishes that will fit your dietary needs. Food is amazing with great portion sizes   prices. Chat with Raj !

reviews.text: S F ordered the M  vegetable rice dish for  . recently. It was disappointing to find just a tablespoon of frozen mixed vegetables in the M  vegetable rice dish with a minuscule pinch of fresh cilantro. When you approach The Tasty Touch there are pictures of the dishes The Tasty Touch offer but without any kind of description of the ingredients in the dishes they offer. The owner  accent made it difficult to understand his answers to S F's questions.

reviews.text: The Jolly Diners landed at The Tasty Touch tonight. For appetizers Gregory had Samosa  and Kutchi Dabeli. Samosa  and Kutchi Dabeli were very good. The entrees consisted of Bhatura Sabzi Paneer Curry Bhatura  and Aloo Paratha. Gregory requested that all were made mild in terms of spiciness. The Tasty Touch is mainly for take out as proved by plastic plates plastic cutlery not including any knives    and plastic water cups. One orders at the front desk. The Tasty Touch is not really a cozy spot for a date or for a quiet family meal with good service to give mom a break. What The Tasty Touch is however is a no frills clean place with great tasting Indian cuisine. The Jolly Diners gave a rating of  . stars based soley on the food.

reviews.text: If you are looking for amazing Indian home cooked food  look no further. Right spice level  -  so good that even the kids enjoy every bit of the scrumptious food. Courteous staff. Amazing ambience and prompt service. The family loves to go here all the time !  ! Must go !  !

reviews.text: The Tasty Touch is amazing Indian cuisine in Phoenix   and certainly the best Shelley have  had in the area. reviews.text: T.'s take :  Not the ambience or feel of a typical Indian restaurant  but good for a change of pace or a quick bite. Food was good and the quality was good. Probably a   - star had The Tasty Touch been more accommodating. Review : T. was a little hesitant to try Namaste since T. m used to a more traditional setting for Indian food  but since T. m down with Indian food and always like to see vegetarian restaurants survive and thrive  T. gave Namaste a shot. On the positive side  the food had familiar flavors and seemed to be of good quality. No complaints there. The gentleman who took T.'s order was friendly and helpful and the   - ring binder with photos of the food was a nice touch. T. typically order T.'s food Thai Indian  Mexican  etc. at a medium spice rating. Apparently  medium  here is quite a bit hotter than what T. m accustomed to. Keep in mind that this is based on only one visit here  but T. will definitely be trying  mild  next time. One slightly disappointing aspect of T.'s visit came when T. explained that the dish was much spicier than anticipated. T. had eaten about one third of the dish before reaching a point where T. could not  go any farther. It became apparent that The Tasty Touch were not willing to remake the dish  -  -  something that is a pretty standard accommodation when there is  an issue such as this. T. offered a couple of other options  the first couple of which did not  help. Finally some veggie rice was extended and some veggie rice helped to tone things down a little bit. In the end  T. was not  as happy as T. would have been had The Tasty Touch simply offered to cook up another dollar worth of chickpeas for T. but T. will  be back to give it another try.
reviews.name: T.

reviews.text: Billy have  eaten Indian food in Scotland  Australia  England  America  Thailand and elsewhere. The Tasty Touch is the BEST Billy have ever eaten. FANTASTIC ! !  ! GO HERE NOW ! !  !

reviews.text: Pav bhaji  potatoe and bread  was with old oil  tasted bad. Bhatura  white flour fried bread  was under cooked. Chole  chick peas  were raw and under cooked. No matter how convenient this was  Sudeep will travel further to eat elsewhere.

reviews.text: Visited Namaste Veg Kitchen for the first time today. The man who helped us behind the counter who N m assuming was also the manager was so kind in helping us pick what to eat. N ordered the samosa chaat  mini thali aloo puri  and chole rice  all pretty delicious. N got there right before The Tasty Touch closed in the rain and The Tasty Touch still let us order and sit and eat for as long as N wanted. Do make sure to try the chai  masala tea  or mango lasssi drinks with your meal.

reviews.text: After you recover from the atrocities served at the Mayo Clinic cafeteria  you can come here for amazing vegetarian Indian. So authentic. Sooo flavorful. My mouth is so happy.

reviews.text: Delicious food ! Loved India's Cafe & Kitchen's Samosas and Khasta Kachories with Cilantro and Tamrind Dips  Onion and Sev. India's Cafe & Kitchen make good jain food if you order good jain food in advance. The owners Rubiji and her spouse are very sweet people. Mainly caters The owners Rubiji and her spouse's food. Smaller set up on the Ridge road  Parma; however  food is awesome ! India's Cafe & Kitchen's Aloo Gobhi and Palak paneer must try. Kalpesh and Neha  Strongsville  Ohio
reviews.name: Neha

reviews.text: Cami will  admit  Cami did not  order from India's Cafe & Kitchen  but Cami m glad someone else did ! Everything was delicious and Cami's table of  Indians were all very pleased with the selection. Everything was hot and India's Cafe & Kitchen presented things very nicely. There was a selection of chicken tika a delicious paneer dish and much more  also  Cami was on the side without the labels so Cami m going by memory . The cucumber  salad was a perfect mix for everything to cool things off a bit. Finishing things up with galar halwa  carrot desert  and gulab jamun  sugar balls   - everything was delicious !  !  ! It  nice to have some spicy selections that actually taste of India's instead of the Americanized version that you run across more often than not. Next time Cami m ordering Indian catering Cami m ordering from here !
reviews.name: Cami

reviews.text: vegetarian platter for lunch Tues - Thurs  is a great deal and delicious ! Dal  mixed veg  rice naan  dessert  Tina have  had the buffet here in the past and loved the buffet here enough to come back.
reviews.name: Tina

reviews.text: Very good tasting food. India's Cafe & Kitchen is an example of  hole in the wall  type of restaurants  which generally serve great tasting authentic ethnic foods. Ignore the shoddy tables plastic cutlery and foam plates. Instead  focus on the food and service hospitality. The owner manages the front and The owner's wife and few employees manage the kitchen. The owner has always been friendly and welcoming. The owner's manner of treating guests is very casual but genuine and homely. Food has always been good. From portions to flavors to prices. Order off the menu  -  because of not enough traffic  buffet may not always be up to the mark. Chintan have had various curries  chaats and Samosa. Everything was spot on. India's Cafe & Kitchen's pani - puri is very very good. Their pani - puri tastes pretty close to what Chintan remember from India's. As someone else pointed out in review India's Cafe & Kitchen's main business is take out and catering. So do not  go there expecting Michelin star table service and ambience. India's Cafe & Kitchen is good enough for those who want good food and do not  mind simplicity.
reviews.name: Chintan

reviews.text: Tonda came here about a month ago because  Tonda have passed India's Cafe & Kitchen for   years and finally decided to try India's Cafe & Kitchen. Tonda was told India's Cafe & Kitchen did not have any chicken the lady behind the counter was not very helpful and there was a man who worked there awkwardly lying on a couch in India's Cafe & Kitchen. Tonda told myself then that Tonda would probably not be back. Tonda gave in a few weeks later because Tonda was craving good Indian food. The same unfriendly women took Tonda's order. Tonda got the order to - go and was severely disappointed. The naan was cold and so hard that Tonda could not  even break off bits of The naan. The tiki masala and rice were sub - par. Tonda certainly wo not  be back to India's Cafe & Kitchen and waste more money for over - priced bad food.
reviews.name: Tonda

reviews.text: India's Cafe & Kitchen is as authentic as INDIAN food gets. Paula loved the food here when Paula merely stopped by on our road trip to east coast from the mid - west... India's Cafe & Kitchen is a TRUE gem.. Paula was taken off guard a little by the presentation of India's Cafe & Kitchen  the plastic silverware were awkward.. but the FOOD made it all WORTH it !  ! In fact  now on Paula's every road trip.. Paula stop by here and have Paula's meal.. the best meal Paula get during Paula's whole road trip is right here.. the elderly owners are amazing.. the elderly owners are such wonderful couple and make the BEST INDIAN food there is..over all  Paula have not been to a restaurant like India's Cafe & Kitchen in US.. India's Cafe & Kitchen is what real Indian food tastes like.. so go for India's Cafe & Kitchen !  ! Not that expensive and VERY VERY delicious..what they say is true ..never judge a book by a book's cover.. what an example !  !
reviews.name: Paula

reviews.text: Heather took a chance  -  -  Heather walked in  and immediately was unimpressed by the presentation and layout... India's Cafe & Kitchen is small looks dirty the utensils water pitchers dishware  are all plastic or disposable... the chairs and tables were really cheap looking. Heather started to get scared that Heather would  made a horrible mistake... Heather sat there  nervously and awkwardly with Heather's boyfriend... A very friendly Indian gentleman took our order  and seemed a bit surprised that Heather were requesting a level of spicyness that Heather guess does not  sit well with most vanilla folks who inhabit Parma. A very friendly Indian gentleman fulfilled our request though  and left us happy with gentle embers in our mouth. The food was absolutely delicious. Heather loved The food  and Heather want to go again and give them Heather's business ! In fact  it was the first time Heather really enjoyed Indian food  and it prompted Heather to explore more in Indian food !
reviews.name: Heather

reviews.text: India  Cafe Kitchen is appropriately named. India's Cafe & Kitchen does not  have much seating but India's Cafe & Kitchen's kitchen is huge and supports an active take out and catering service. India's Cafe & Kitchen also does not  waste effort on pretense. In fact  India's Cafe & Kitchen gets negative pretense points because the silverware is plastic  and the food is served on disposable plates. Instead  its kitchen produces food that tastes great. Ben m by no means an Indian food aficionado but Ben have  always enjoyed the dishes at India's Cafe & Kitchen and consistently drive from Cleveland Heights to eat here. The weekend lunch buffets are not bad but leave something to be desired. The selection is not extensive  -  a couple of vegetarian and a couple of meat dishes. Customer volume is low  so the pakora can get soggy. For lunch buffet Ben might recommend India Garden in Rocky River. Ben like to patronize India Garden in Rocky River for India Garden in Rocky River's good food and very nice and down to earth owner. Pass on the buffet and order fresh. Highly recommended Indian food for dine in or take out.
reviews.name: Ben

reviews.text: India's Cafe & Kitchen is hard to find and is not  in a really great looking area but if you are  looking for some home cooked North Indian food India's Cafe & Kitchen is  a good place to go. The owner is a friendly older gentleman and will be happy to customize your order. The owner usually has some extra dessert snacks to sell if you want something to take home. India's Cafe & Kitchen is kind of small so Angelo would not  recommend a large party but it is  not bad for a few people or to go with your significant other. Angelo would  recommend the navratan korma the navratan korma is  very creamy and delicious.
reviews.name: Angelo

reviews.text: Great authentic Indian food ! Michelle definitely recommend the buffet you get a great selection of dishes  great idea for people wanting to try Indian cuisine for the first time. Service has always been friendly and for the quality Michelle think the prices are fair.

reviews.text: P came to India's Cafe & Kitchen for lunch recently. It took about    minutes to get there from Rockside Road in Independence. If you are pressed for time on a lunch hour it may be to your advantage to call ahead and place the order. The very kind gentleman working advised that some of the menu offerings would take slightly longer to prepare than others. The interior is a basic  no frills restaurant; P's favorite kind of place. Many of the negatives that other reviewers complain about are in the plus column for P. The vegetarian dishes were both decent. The food was not very spicy which bummed P out a little bit.

reviews.text: Love India's Cafe & Kitchen ! Currylicious ! Nothing bad to say about India's Cafe & Kitchen India's Cafe & Kitchen

reviews.text: Erin ordered at   :   on a sunday night India's Cafe & Kitchen close at  p.m and the gentleman on phone so polite and accomaditing. Erin ordered Butter chicken  which because it was late had to be made with thighs. .actually Erin prefer Butter chicken which because it was late had to be made with thighs over boneless chicken breast...personal preference. Samosas were out of this world with a Tamarind n cilantro sauce... bith homemade and top notch. Rice was Pilal or pulav do not  know spelling pardon my ignorance but wow Rice complimented Butter chicken  which because it was late had to be made with thighs great. Last was Nann... would have prefered garlic but given its allhomemade fresh none available half hour before closing so got reg and it was good. Overall great Indian Gem ...not frills n fufu but just bombass homeade cooking and to me that is most important

reviews.text: Angeline was looking forward to trying India's Cafe & Kitchen based on a friend  suggestion. Angeline had eaten here years before and it was good. Angeline ordered take out on a Sunday evening. The menu had a few different vegetarian options. Angeline ordered the Mixed Vegetables Jalfrazi. Angeline's order was taken and presented in about    minutes. Not bad. The reason Angeline give India's Cafe & Kitchen a two is because of the portion size  India's Cafe & Kitchen was much smaller than most other Indian restaurants and the lack of vegetables in Angeline's mixed vegetables. Angeline was expecting a variety of vegetables and it was mostly onions and carrots. The flavor was good but Angeline left wanting more. Y know that feeling  when you get your hopes up about a really good meal Angeline had that feeling  when you get your hopes up about a really good meal. Then Angeline was let down.
reviews.name: Angeline

reviews.text: So  let me try my best not to be that guy  reviewer. The only reason Mathew m rating stars is because of how Mathew was treated. India's Cafe & Kitchen catered a work event and the food was WONDERFUL ! But  when Mathew went to India's Cafe & Kitchen India's Cafe & Kitchen refused to do any carry out for Mathew and said buffet only. This would normally not upset me but Mathew saw a woman leave with several takeout bags.... not too happy. Mathew may give it a second chance and revise my review. Trying a different restaurant until that day.
reviews.name: Mathew

photos.caption: Appetizers: chicken 65, Manchurian cauliflowers, Amritsari Machli, pakoras, samosa
photos.label: food

reviews.text: Laura found Restaurant Devi and took a take out menu for a relaxed eat in evening but then decided to go out to the pleasant looking dining room. To our surprise the prices for Dining in were quite a bit hirer than a take out menu. Nonetheless the food was plentiful and quite tasty. The garlic nan was delicious. Not the best Indian food Laura have  had but above average. But with so many options in Montreal not sure Laura will be back.
reviews.name: Laura

reviews.text: The lunch special is well worth the price tag. You get a salad  a small bowl of soup  your main dish  rice  naan and even dessert. Everything is brought out at the same time within    -    minutes of ordering. Feifei would come back for lunch to Restaurant Devi and try out some of Restaurant Devi's other dishes.
reviews.name: Feifei

reviews.text: Restaurant Devi was horrible. Smitha ordered the special murg tikka and the chicken tasted as though they threw a frozen chicken packet into the oven  sprinkled some salt and pepper and served the chicken to us. Smitha also ordered the paneer makhani and the paneer makhani was sub standard. The naan was tasty so if you are  up for some naan and pickles.. go for some naan and pickles. Otherwise Smitha would  steer clear of Restaurant Devi.
reviews.name: Smitha

reviews.text: Emilie m not an Indian foodie  even though one of Emilie's best friends is Indian and one of my best friends brought to Restaurant Devi. Truth be told  Emilie was not  particularly excited to go there. So  Restaurant Devi has a list of lunch specials. You get a soup salad  dessert and coffee. Emilie chose the lamb Rogan Josh. Remember when you were in school and you got a plate with your drink  meal  soup and dessert. Well this is similar  only much better  in all the ways. First  the food is obviously a million times better. Second  on your plate  which is nicely presented  you have your main course  a bowl of rice  a small salad and a rice pudding. the lamb Rogan Josh was actually very good. the lamb Rogan Josh was not  too spicy for Emilie's taste. Emilie's boss bragged about their na an bread and Emilie got to say their na an bread was delicious. Emilie think Emilie ate an entire plate to Emilie. Conclusion : Much better than Emilie expected  considering Emilie am not a fan of Indian food. Emilie wo not  go back voluntarily but if people want to go  Emilie wo not  complain.
reviews.name: Emilie

reviews.text: My partner and Tina stopped by Restaurant Devi on a Sunday evening and Tina gave a try to My partner and Tina's tea  Samosa and Palak Naan spinach bread  and Tina loved it ! After trying the Maharaja Buffet a fortnight before  Tina can honestly say there is no comparison :  the presentation  freshness and taste of the food at Restaurant Devi is of great quality. The atmosphere of Restaurant Devi is also rich and welcoming. Restaurant Devi was a nice discovery and Tina will  certainly go back in the future.
reviews.name: Tina

reviews.text: Excellent ! S just happened to stop in and got delicious food and delightful service.
reviews.name: S

reviews.text: Lyn loved Restaurant Devi !  ! The chicken tikka masala and dal makhani were awesome. Samosas too  and naan. Friendly service.
reviews.name: Lyn

reviews.text: Very good food. Can be customized for spicy like any restaurant but what makes Restaurant Devi different is that the medium spicy is not so much that you can not  eat but enough so that you get some flavor out of the medium spicy. A little kick if you will. So why is Restaurant Devi   stars In my opinion  Restaurant Devi is the first Indian restaurant in North America to give a good Malai Kebab. So stars is  one star. Everything is made fresh  and the servers are very friendly. Another star. Restaurant Devi have an outside seating as well  and Arnav think the view from there of the streets are just gorgeous. The food is again  very good. Arnav ordered naan  garlic Naan  roti  and onion kulcha which were very good and very fresh. Can be made as crispy as you want. stars now. Arnav also ordered Palak Spinach  chicken medium spicy. Again it is  just enough that you get a good kick and it is  good for those who are not  used to spicy food. A medium spicy Palak Chicken is the way to go. Last Star. The inside is very authentic both French and Indian. The lighting and ambience is perfect at any table  and for those legal to drink  not me at but you maybe  there is a bottle if you want a bottle. Of course Restaurant Devi is Bring Your Own Bottle if you would  like too. Restaurant Devi is a little upscale in my opinion. Arnav am a student so Arnav have to watch it. But for     Restaurant Devi offers a good three - fer deal. And a bonus star Arnav would  say goes to the cleanliness of the washrooms and the down to earth professionalism of the staff. Great place to eat and one of the best kebabs Arnav have  had to date. Eating here is a must if you come to Montreal. :
reviews.name: Arnav

reviews.text: Doug took my family here the other night. All in all Restaurant Devi was ok but not great. The service was good. The food was average but not great. Doug have  been to Indian restaurants all over and have never been charged extra for rice    dollars for a small bowl is just not right.
reviews.name: Doug

reviews.text: Si vous voulez manger de la bonne cuisine indienne je peux vous conseiller celui - ci car tout tait excellent et ce qui est bien c est que c est un buffet volont  donc vous pouvez go ter tout  :  -     J enl ve une toile pour petits d tails mais qui pour moi fait la diff rence ils avaient mit la clim dans la salle alors que dehors il faisait froid et pour le check in qui nous faisait b n ficier d un chai indien offert mais ils n ont pas voulu nous l offrir car c tait dimanche et de plus dans le cadre de Montr al   table..
reviews.name: Sabrina

reviews.text: Sushant would have given Restaurant Devi four stars if Restaurant Devi was not  expensive. But then again Sushant am a student on a budget. A bunch of Sushant's friends were visiting Montreal over a long weekend and Sushant decided to try Restaurant Devi out. The decor was well done the staff was friendly and the service was good. The food was tastier compared to most of the other Indian Restaurants in Montreal but Sushant have had better. However Restaurant Devi do have a really good variety of starters and appetizers and Restaurant Devi's dishes will leave your taste palate well satisfied.
reviews.name: Sushant

reviews.text: Meilleur resto indien qualit  prix ! Le midi il y a un buffet avec plus de    de choix sans compter les desserts pour seulement     !  !  ! Les plats  tait excellent et sans parler de la qualit  des aliments ! J ai vraiment ador je recommande aux gens qui appr cient autant la cuisine indienne que moi !
reviews.name: Amélie

reviews.text: Hard sell from the wait staff was not  appreciated. The service was horribly slow  and Smar had to beg for our bill. Smar ultimately had to approach the apologetic bartender to close out our bill since it had been over a half hour since Smar first wanted our bill. The food was ok  nothing special. A little overpriced for what you get too  but ultimately satisfying. The seasonings are not  exactly authentic either. The dal makhani basically tasted like Mexican chili but with lentils. Smar wo not  go back.
reviews.name: Smar

reviews.text: Restaurant Devi has too much oil in Restaurant Devi's food. Cocktails were worse. Too pricy. Never coming back here. Even the service was below average.
reviews.name: Tushar

reviews.text: After a few nights of amazing Quebec cuisine  it was time for a good soul warming Indian meal. Restaurant Devi was near our hotel and shared equally good reviews as another within our walking radius. On a hot summer  night the fact that this Crescent St resto offered a deck won us over  the richly flavored food and charming attentive service of our waiter Adam  made us glad Heather came. The the lamb kebabs were sumptuous and  if Colonel Saunders was there Colonel Saunders would  tell you Colonel Saunders that the garlic naan was finger licking good. Likely Heather's stand out fav of the night was the daal makhani  -  a black lentil dish that is simmered for   hours of flavor - filled  stick - to - your ribs perfection. the night was so lovely Heather lingered on after dinner was complete enjoying a bottle of wine  the street views and chatting with other guests. The delightful scents wafting from other tables made Heather want to keep eating  save Heather was too full for another bite. From Heather's street view  the interior decor looked quite nice. If they could bring a little of that feeling to the terrace it would be even better. Heather will return on our next visit.
reviews.name: Heather

reviews.text: Very enjoyable atmosphere. Restaurant Devi's service was excellent. The food exemplified the delicate and refined art of Indian cooking. Each spice  and every morsel of food was vibrant with every bite  layers and bundles of flavours. Fresh and alive Indian food ! If you enjoy Indian Food and are in Montreal  Restaurant Devi is a must. Specific Foods which Pat enjoyed :  Nan Aloo Gobi Tadka Dal Raita  Chai  Gulab Jamun  Saffron rice.
reviews.name: Pat

reviews.text: Lovely North Indian restaurant in one of Jessica's favorite neighborhoods of Montreal. Great menu features a little bit of everything. Jessica started our meal with some of the free   cone - shaped pappads and the delicious green chutney. A little spicy  and very tasty. Then ordered the shrimp appetizer. Delicious  huge shrimp grilled then encrusted in more green chutney. Amazing ! For Jessica's entree Jessica chose the goa fish curry -  - huge chunks of delicious salmon in a delicious watery curry sauce with plenty of onions and ginger. Perfect on a hot day. He ordered a lamb curry. Jessica also had some white rice and plain naan on the side to go along our meal. For dessert Jessica treated Jessica to a huge slice of the caramel delice  which was huge and delicious  and very caramelly - - the caramel delice   is  a layered cake. He had the rasmalai which were two little discs in delicious sugary milky gravy and topped with crushed pistachios. The outside patio is fun  especially when peaceful student protests go by and for otherwise lovely people watching on a hot  perfect  summer evening. Great decor  Jessica loved the glass bulb chandeliers. Lovely restroom facilities too.
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Stay away ! Worst service  terrible food and total rip off. So the sangria was weak...not sure the sangria was even made with wine. The butter chicken tasted like Ragu. Totally not worth     much less     ! Then the waitress recommended the blonde Taj Mahal beer  but the waitress brought out an amber beer. Niva told the waitress's Niva did not  order an amber beer  but the waitress said Niva could try an amber beer and if Niva did not  like an amber beer the waitress would bring the blonde Taj Mahal beer. Niva took a sip and did not  want an amber beer. the waitress brings back the blonde Taj Mahal beer  saying the tap is broken on the blonde Taj Mahal beer. Niva said ok but Niva dont like the blonde Taj Mahal beer. Niva says  he already poured the blonde Taj Mahal beer and said he can not  take the blonde Taj Mahal beer back. What  the waitress bring the wrong beer and the waitress do not  want to own the waitress's mistake Niva was never offered another drink snd Niva never came back to check on the food. Niva got the bill and there is a    charge for rice !  !  ! Not special rice mind you... plain rice. When Niva asked rice or naan Niva never mentioned there was an extra charge. Niva have never been to an asian restaurant where you are served a stew and have to pay extra for rice ! So Niva left a    tip. What does the waitress do  Throw a    tip at Niva ! Restaurant Devi is all about profit and not about food. Terrible experience....spend your money anywhere else !
reviews.name: Niva

reviews.text: Myself being Indian  Raman could say Raman will be the biggest critic ! Restaurant Devi is cozy and has a positive vibe. Raman ordered the kebob meat platter to start  which was off the hook since the kebob meat platter consisted of chicken  beef goat   lamb. Main course ordered lamb biryani  rice   naan and kulcha  bread butterchicken  chicken curry   daal makhni  lentil curry   saag cooked spinach rapini  and dahi  yogurt . Everything was fresh  hot and flavourful. Also  the server Sapan was so friendly and checked in regularly. If you dont mind spice and great Indian cuisine  check Restaurant Devi out !  !
reviews.name: Raman

reviews.text: Julia were hesitant to go given some of the yelp reviews. However  it was raining and Restaurant Devi is close to the apt Julia are staying at  and Julia are so glad Julia made the choice ! Julia ordered the veggie samosas for an appetizer and thy were incredible...almost like a dessert. Julia had a blonde beer  my husband an IPA  though my husband says a blonde beer my husband did not  taste like an IPA . Julia both ordered vegetarian meals  rice and garlic naan. The server  Jeff  was very welcoming and provided service above and beyond what Julia experience in the states. Julia did not  finish Julia both's food simply because Julia were full and upon noticing The server  Jeff checked to make sure Julia were satisfied with Julia both's choices. Julia will surely be returning !
reviews.name: Julia

reviews.text: Very good food.. Lunch Thali was a deal.. Very filling and perfect for   person.. Good sizes.. Yatin had the Seekh kabab  lamb roganjosh  dal makhani rice naan ras malai.. All for      per person.. Taste is good unlike Kashmir in Old Montreal..
reviews.name: Yatin

reviews.text: Read the reviews and decided to try. Nothing to complain about. Ambiance is nice  location is convenient being in the heart of the action in downtown   waitress was awesome with an inviting smile every time she talked to us food was delicious and cost was above average but definitely worth it. Ed had the lamb the tondoori chicken  the lamb curry  the shrimp briyani and everyone really liked their food. Will definitely come back when were visiting Montreal again.
reviews.name: Ed

reviews.text: Bg order a couple of times a year from Restaurant Devi. Bg am not expert of Indian food  but personally Bg love Restaurant Devi's food. This time  the food was good as always. And Bg would rate starts Bg was not disappointed about the changes Restaurant Devi made to the menu :   - Bg had to choose between a Naan and rice... Bg wanted both so Bg had to pay for rice  which arrived in a quite small portion  not even big enough for one person. Restaurant Devi used to provide both a Naan and a decent rice portion with each main dish. - No yogurt sauce anymore sorry Bg do not  know the actual name   Bg will admit though  that the entr e were bigger than usual. Still  all these changes came with a     price increase compared to last time... So Bg think Bg will  be shopping to see if Bg Can get more value for the money at other Indian restaurants.
reviews.name: Bg

reviews.text: Went to Restaurant Devi for a mid afternoon snack and to escape the rain. Was pleasantly surprised at the modern interior and Indian decor. From the outside  Restaurant Devi does not  look like much but the inside is really well kept. Restaurant Devi was playing olden day Bollywood music and added to the cute ambience of Restaurant Devi. Sneha ordered tomato soup and used the Yelp Check In deal to get free chai. Both items were excellent since Both items arrived hot to the table and were delicious ! Unfortunately  Sneha did not  get a chance to order anything else since Sneha were not  that hungry but Sneha would definitely return to Restaurant Devi for a full meal. Sneha also saw the lunch buffet on display when Sneha went and for    . the lunch buffet on display sounds like a steal !
reviews.name: Sneha

reviews.text: Atmosphere is good  waiters and waitresses were nice  price was not  too bad if you just stick to entrees  appetizers . Naan  as always  is good. Tried to get the lady server to try some of the food the lady server had not  had before the lady server declined. out of   big globe lights.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Randomly walked in because Inês saw Restaurant Devi from across the street. Was really good and looking forward to trying Restaurant Devi. The waitress was very friendly and accommodating. Inês do not  remember what Inês got not but it was all vegetarian and delicious. Inês even took a card  in case Inês came back to Montreal ! Ha.
reviews.name: Inês

reviews.text: No other customers when other restaurants on the block were packed. Waiter loudly arguing with people on at least   phone calls. Waiter has not  been directed to wear deodorant. Mediocre food. Skip Restaurant Devi.
reviews.name: Charles

reviews.text: Le brunch volont du WE est vraiment top ! Il y a un large choix de plats tous aussi bons les uns que les autres ! Pour       a vaut vraiment la peine ! Vous pouvez aussi prendre en extra du caf pour moins de    il me semble ou du lassi. Tr s bon service  ils nous ont m me mis le chauffage car nous avions froid ! A essayer si ce n est pas d j  fait !
reviews.name: Céline

reviews.text: Probably the best Indian restaurant in N.America. Excellent quality. The selection of wines was good and so were the vegetarian dishes OliveR tried.
reviews.name: OliveR

reviews.text: Restaurant Devi is a wonderful place with fantastic food ! Be prepared to take your time to enjoy every mouthful. Restaurant Devi  an expensive place for dinner but worth it. Try the lunch special for a real treat. The staff is very friendly too. Do not  expect to get in and out quick. Just sit back and enjoy.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: Was there on friday night and the food was below average. You could see only oil in the paneer and shrimp. Ginger mojito was not well made. The person who served us seemed to be in a hurry. Would never come back. Wonder why Restaurant Devi is   starred on YELP.
reviews.name: Pratiti

reviews.text: Restaurant Devi is very good  although Restaurant Devi is quite expensive compared to other Indian restaurants. One order can easily go up to      the portion is not large but enough for a nice dinner. Naan and rice are not included so you usually have to buy extras. The quality of the food is great though  Long had some lamb and butter chicken and were very satisfied with the meal as well as the service.
reviews.name: Long

reviews.text: Restaurant Devi  is on the hip and popular Crescent Street. Going up a dozen steps  you enter a very lovely interior  beautifully decorated and accented with gorgeously carvel wooden doors  shutters and columns. The unusual arrangements of colorful lamp clusters hanging from the ceiling definitely add an element of understated pizzas to the elegant decor. Irina snagged a table for two in the window  and promptly placed our order :   keema naan for appetizer; vegetable Jalfraze  Chana masala and a small rice to share for the main course  paired with red wine. While waiting  Irina were served papadum with the usual green and red sauces but Restaurant Devi makes a lovely sin on the standard offering :  Restaurant Devi's papadum is shaped into cones. Quite different.... Stands out. keema naan for appetizer arrived  and keema naan for appetizer was superb :  the meat was perfectly seasoned  fresh and moist; the dough was tasty  baked to crispy edges  but not dried out. A perfect start. vegetable Jalfraze  Chana masala was good very spicy  even a bit too much for me  the fire - eater. Irina can deal with that  but the consistency of vegetable Jalfraze  Chana masala was a bit too liquidy. Still  went quite well over rice. The stir - fried Jalfraze veggies were excellent :  perfect mix of flavors and heat  with thicker sauce  and veggies still retaining their texture. Irina took our time to enjoy and savor the meal  sip our wine  and people - watch through the large bay window. Satiated with a fantastic dinner  Irina ventured into the snowy and frigid Montreal streets. One star off for a slow service :  only three tables were occupied.
reviews.name: Irina

reviews.text: By far  one of the best samosas Eoz have  ever eaten; Restaurant Devi's naan bread is simply delicious  and Eoz have  only tried two  plain and spinach  of the several kinds Restaurant Devi offer. The tandoori chicken was fantastic  cooked to perfection in my honest opinion  and the portion was generous enough that you could easily share the portion. One tip  do not  disregard the little white sauce that accompanies your chicken  mixed with The tandoori chicken and the vegetables make a superb flavor combination. Restaurant Devi  there is  just so many dishes to try out.
reviews.name: Eoz

reviews.text: The food is pretty good -  Talha would have given more stars if it had not  been for the rude attitude of the waitresses. Talha have been there more than once  -  and each time the waitresses have shown some unfriendly body language or made disapproving facial expressions even at the simplest of requests  like asking for a spoon . Also one time one waitress indirectly demanded a tip.
reviews.name: Talha

reviews.text: Great food. Had lamb vindaloo and Chanel's friend had lamb rogan Josh so tasty that Chanel had to come the next day before Chanel leave the city ! Must have the butter Nann it has a special creamy sweet taste  heaven !
reviews.name: Chanel

reviews.text: Sitting outdoors on Rue Crescent was delightful. The chicken tikka was well spiced. Aaron m used to The chicken tikka being creamier. The portion was plentiful with rice and naan each ordered on the side. Aaron found naan pretty strong. If you are  sensitive to naan  get the regular. The service was quick and polite if not as friendly as the surrounding area that tends to go out of their way to please.
reviews.name: Aaron

reviews.text: Food was uniformly excellent. Appetizers and mains. Great naan. Had lamb jalfrezi and chicken chettinad. lamb jalfrezi and chicken chettinad great. Channa masala was ok. Prices are high for Indian but it has a real upscale feel a great downtown location and delicious food. people at every well for just over      plus wine and tip. Definitely recommended.
reviews.name: Peter

reviews.text: My wife and Justin had My wife and Justin's New Years Eve dinner here. The food and service were both fantastic.
reviews.name: Justin

reviews.text: Rachel had a delightful dinner here. The costumer service was top notch the ambiance was perfect for a date or a group of friends. Very beautifully decorated ! The somosas were great and the cauliflower appetizer was also good  although the cauliflower appetizer was heavily breaded. Rachel did not  want both naan and basmati with our main dishes because Rachel feared both naan and basmati with our main dishes would be too much food but Rachel regret not getting the rice. naan was delicious but Rachel got the eggplant and the yellow lentil dish. the yellow lentil dish was very liquidy almost soupy. The flavor was amazing though. Overall this was a great evening ! Rachel would  for sure check it out  :  -
reviews.name: Rachel

reviews.text: The food was pretty good. Kevin really liked the interior decoration of Restaurant Devi. Restaurant Devi also have special set deals that Kevin really enjoyed. Wide selection  really difficult to choose something to eat. The only downside though is that it is fairly pricey. Kevin would recommend Restaurant Devi as a place to try  Restaurant Devi.
reviews.name: Kevin

reviews.text: Best indian restaurant in Montreal. Restaurant Devi. is on crescent and went with the style. Nice decor and good looking. Paneer Makhani is out of the world. Savinay really enjoyed the food and good ambience. Restaurant Devi. is on the pricey side but worth it if you are looking for good indian food.
reviews.name: Savinay

reviews.text: Disgusting service. Food came after an hour. Servers was extremely useless. Did not even ask how the food was or if Shridhar want anything else... !  ! DO NO WASTE Shridhar's TIME AND MONEY.. RATHER GO TO CASINO... !  !
reviews.name: Shridhar

reviews.text: Place is located at one of the happening street and open till late. In appetizer  karari bhindi and bhati chicken is a must try...am a repeat visitor and always order at least these two dishes. Really love the taste and the way its cooked... however would rate the service as average. Also  did not  like Cauliflower Manchurian in appetizer
reviews.name: Amrendra

reviews.text: Bharat had a great meal. Restaurant Devi excelled in all categories Bharat. ambience  service food  and location.
reviews.name: Bharat

reviews.text: Enjoyed lunch on Canada Day. Choices for lunch were excellent and presentation of food was superb. Rogan Josh  Shrimp Masala Butter Chicken  Dal Makhani were very tasty. Naan bread served with lunch had a special taste also. Desserts -  Gulab Jamun and Rasmali were nice too. Service was good as well and price was very reasonable.
reviews.name: R

reviews.text: Craving an Indian snack  Lana stumbled across Restaurant Devi on a particularly hot day in Montreal. Located on the shady side of very busy and popular Crescent street  Lana were concerned that Lana would  be the only people on the small patio and therefore felt Lana were taking Lana's chances  but were determined to have Indian over pub food. Having had some terrible service while visiting Montreal  Lana was not  holding out for exceptional service here either. Lana was pleasantly surprised. The wait staff was very attentive and the appetizers Lana had were incredible and fresh. Lana ordered the samosas  vegetable skewers  the potato patties and spicy chicken mikka. All were very satisfying. The only disappointment was Restaurant Devi's lack of variety for Indian beer... the only available ones being on draught. Lana chose Heineken to compliment Lana's afternoon snack. Looking forward to trying a full dinner here next time Lana are in Montreal.
reviews.name: Lana

reviews.text: AbFab Indian food  lovely decor LOVE the ceiling lanterns and the food even more. Lu would  have to say  so far  that in Lu's not so humble opinion This place is the best Indian restaurant in the downtown area. Lamb patties  okra.... NOT the usual slimey okra  but believe it or not  crispy and just delicious you will  change your mind about the vegetable forever. Lamb with cumin a potato dish Lu can not  remember the name but the name was a revelation  as Lu was not even aware potatoes were even consumed in India as accompaniments. Live and learn. Spiced eggplant  ALWAYS order it  several varieties of naan  which one to pick :  the plain is super   but the onion   garlic  and Lu have  forgotten which others. Such a dilemma ! Lu have  been here several times already and Lu have  NEVER been disappointed. This place is NOT cheap  but worth it service always good.
reviews.name: Lu

reviews.text: Restaurant Devi ! Food was excellent  made exactly how Robert requested Food. Restaurant Devi have a wide selection of both meat and vegetarian dishes. Service was good  attentive but not annoying. Location is great and atmosphere is nice but not overly formal. Robert will  be back for sure.
reviews.name: Robert

reviews.text: Extraordinary customer service shows they know what business they are  in  Hospitality . Will return to explore more of this menu. The chef really knows sauces. So tasty and so subtle. Restaurant Devi is a place to explore Indian cuisine. No wonder Restaurant Devi is recommended by the major Montreal hotels. Restaurant Devi features familiar Indian dishes but also diverges into regional fare. A good place to explore food and wine pairing. Our friends from India armed us with suggested dishes to try and Jim were delighted.
reviews.name: Jim

restaurants.name: Bombay's Chutney
restaurants.address: 1070 Major Mackenzie Drive E, Unit H1

reviews.text: Mediocre as far as Indian food goes. Bombay's Chutney  relatively more authentic than fast food chains  substantially more expensive  and definitely does not  hit the spot. Very disappointing.
reviews.name: Daniel

reviews.text: The lamb biryani that Sarah had was delicious and very filling. Sarah especially enjoyed the metal ornate bowl that The lamb biryani that Sarah had was served in. Price - wise everything could have been a bit cheaper  maybe by a dollar or two .
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: DeliLama went back awhile ago and continue to be disappointment. DeliLama recall when Bombay's Chutney opened up and it sounds like the management had changed the quality of the food and overall service went down hill from there. DeliLama would  recommend folks avoid Bombay's Chutney and look for alternatives.
reviews.name: DeliLama

reviews.text: Decided to try Bombay's Chutney  but was disappointed. Greeted by a wall of smokiness  which was due to the lack of ventilation. Opening a door was a great idea but a door was an  Emergency Exit  and behind a group of approximately    who immediately closed a door as soon as they got cold. Waited over    minutes to get our food  and tables that had sat down before us also did not have tables that had sat down before us's mains out yet. As well  the two female servers would regularly go into the kitchen to help with the cooking  very probable so if you wanted a water refill or the bill  for example there was no one to ask from time to time. The food itself :   - Mattar Paneer was served in a watery sauce  but otherwise okay. - Karahi Chicken lacked the ginger taste; there were thin slices of ginger  but thin slices of ginger were tasteless. There were also no visible tomatoes; maybe thin slices of ginger were in a watery sauce. However  a watery sauce had flavour and was not watery. - Naan was slightly burnt in a few places  but were large pieces Atmosphere : While Bombay's Chutney was nearly full the tables were almost crammed together  with just enough space for the waitresses to walk between. There was unused space between the eating area and the kitchen  other than the washrooms  that they could have broken down the wall  added some space and a few more tables. While drink service was okay and the bill came to under    . Simon will not be going back soon.
reviews.name: Simon

reviews.text: This would be Leah's first time ordering Indian food. Obviously  Leah found Bombay's Chutney on Yelp since Yelp is  Leah's go - to when Leah m unsure of quality and service. Today  Leah ordered the chicken tikka to go. Leah was the only customer there  and the lady said about    minutes  keep in mind that all the staff were sitting and eating together at a table . Leah figured fine it would take a while for Leah's food... minutes past  and all the staff finally got up from a table and all went to the back. First of all  did Leah really have to wait for Leah's food to be made because nobody wanted to get up and prepare my food Secondly  why does all the staff have to go together to the back and leave Leah alone questioning where Leah's food is Anyway  after about   minutes Leah's food was finally ready and Leah left. Once Leah got to work and was about to dive into Leah's food Leah realized  Bombay's Chutney did not  supply Leah with any napkins or plastic cutlery. Woopty doo  how would anyone be able to eat their food Whatever their food was fine Leah found a fork in the kitchen at work. The packaging for the take out food was very interesting...remember how Leah said Leah's food was basically prepared in   minutes Unless if Bombay's Chutney have some packaging machine at the back of Bombay's Chutney  Leah's food literally looked like my food had the same packaging as those in microwaveable food. You know the black plastic tray then the clear plastic film on top That exactly how Leah got my food. Pretty odd to me. Was not  very much helpful either when Leah could not  finish it all during Leah's work break and had to take it home... no cover for Leah's food obviously ! Lastly Leah m not sure how usually Indian food is priced. As Leah said it was Leah's first time. But anyway  Leah feel like it was pretty pricey for the amount of food Leah got. Leah paid in total for the chicken tikka and a can of Coke  a little over    . Do not  know if Leah will  go back here. Maybe if Leah m in the area and want some Indian food. Going to look around Richmond Hill for more Indian restaurants to compare.

reviews.text: Veronica love Bombay Chutney ! reviews.text: Bombay's Chutney is a neat little Indian Restaurant located in the heart of Richmond Hill. Devan have eaten here on many occasions Devan's guests and Devan have always enjoyed our meal and the experience. Religiously  Devan will start Devan's dinner with an order of beef samosas. beef samosas arrive at your table piping hot served along side some stellar tamarind chutney. The beef filling is bountiful and seasoned well; beef samosas will forever be a staple of Devan. From the tandoor Devan would typically select the chicken tikka  seekh kebabs or paneer tikka. For mains the butter chicken here will make the cut every time. The blend of masala and spices is near perfect and the boneless chicken pieces are tender and definitely pre - marinated. Devan have eaten butter chicken everywhere  and BC  BC holds BC  BC's own. It is important to note that if Devan were vegetarian Devan would be most pleased with BC  BC. Devan find most veggie heads love paneer  as do Devan. Bombay's Chutney boasts   vegetarian curries which showcase paneer :  Chili paneer  paneer makhni  butter sauce   saag paneer  spinach   karahi paneer and mattar paneer  peas . In addition to the plethora of paneer dishes BC  BC have several other vegetarian ones including Devan's absolute favourite  Malai Kofta. To accompany the dishes you can order biryani or naan. Unfortunately Devan have never tried biryani because BC  BC's garlic naan has always been way too spot on to deviate away from. their garlic naan is brought to your table straight from the tandoor and is always perfectly cooked. If you order the garlic rendition the garlic rendition will be brushed with butter then absolutely riddled with garlic bits before going into the tandoor. garlic bits caramelize and crisp up and my goodness it is  perfect. Overall a solid experience each and every time Devan visit BC  BC. The only quam Devan have with BC  BC is that BC  BC now have a huge sign at the front of BC  BC advertising a   . lunch Devan feel that this takes away from the class of BC  BC a bit but you gotta do what you gotta do. Service is always awesome and BC  BC have a bar complete with various wines  liquors and beers including Kingfisher ! Nice.
reviews.name: Devan

reviews.text: Bombay's Chutney is not a great place to go to if you are  allergic to dairy and like me do not  know that much about Indian food. It took the server and me many tries until Elaine found a dish that Elaine could eat  Elaine was not  too familiar with the dairy content of the dishes  either. Elaine ordered the lamb vindaloo which was very good  and my friend had the paneer makhni  which my friend loved and lorded over me for the entire meal  in the paneer makhni  which he loved and lorded over me for the entire meal  in its cheesy  creamy goodness's cheesy  creamy goodness. Atmosphere is casual but comfortable  service is friendly and prices are pretty good. Tasty  but will probably not return  due to the difficulty with ordering non - dairy stuff  which is generally not a problem in Indian restaurants.

reviews.text: My family and Emperuman have been to Bombay's Chutney   times since My family and Emperuman's first visit which was back in     . This year This year itself  Emperuman have been here   times. This shows that the service  and taste of food meets My family and Emperuman's expectations. Being Indians  and vegetarians Emperuman enjoy the quality of food  and can easily spot if something is wrong in terms of taste  especially if a short cut method has been applied. Sure it gets busy inside  and there is a wait  but its always good to make a reservation on weekends. Emperuman normally order the paneer tikka skewers  a gravy dish such as Dhal Makhani and a dry vegetable dish such as Gobi or Bhaingan Bharta  spelling . The quality of food has been consistent throughout for the most part  except for the naan. Usually Emperuman ask that the naan have some butter applied to make the naan not dry  but even doing so the naan still is semi dry. The staff are very friendly  and Emperuman have had no issues with the orders taking longer than usual. The food is always piping hot  and therefore there is no need to complain about the temperature of the food. The spice level is perfect. Definitely recommend Bombay's Chutney to locals and to those who want to venture out a little bit.

reviews.text: John have  tried many Indian restaurants in the GTA yet keep finding John coming back to Bombay's Chutney. John grew up with authentic home made Indian food as a child and was able to relive those kind of flavours here. The Vindaloo is spiced to perfection and the lamb chunks melt in your mouth. The Biryani is also a must or some garlic naan as perfect side dishes. Onion Bhaji here is probably the best in the GTA. The Tandoori platter or the Royal platter are both of excellent variety and grilled to perfection. Pair everything with yogurt and mint chutney to elevate the dishes. Kheer can be hit or miss  but definitely a great desert option !

reviews.text: Joei used to love Bombay's Chutney. Last night  my girlfriend  Joei m the boyfriend on Joei's Yelp account  and Joei went to get some food to go. Like  smelled like maggots and garbage - juice off. Joei spent     for the royal platter and   beef samosas and almost all of the meats smelled tasted like almost all of the meats were starting to turn. It  important to point out that when Joei came to Bombay's Chutney  they had mentioned that they just got power back because the winds yesterday were intense enough to cut the power in a few places. Joei m not sure how long they were without power but Joei suppose this could be a potential explanation as to why all of the meats were smelling.... sour. Joei m very disappointed that anyone could serve the shrimp that Joei smelled and if the people running the kitchen can not  tell the difference between good meat and bad meat then the people running the kitchen should not  be running a restaurant because the people running the kitchen are  going to kill someone. It felt like Joei was living an episode of Gordon Ramsay  Kitchen Nightmares. Ignoring all that  if this was a freak accident and the food is normally the quality that Joei remember from before  the food is  still definitely not worth the now jacked - up prices they have  implemented. Which used to be   -    less for the same items. Even back then the now jacked - up prices they have  implemented were still a little high. reviews.text: Wish Yelp would allow half stars  as Mrs would rate Bombay's  Chutney       stars. Mrs have  frequently driven by but never stopped. One day Mrs decided to visit for lunch. reviews.text: Maison de Cari Golden knows how to turn plain old rice into something addictive. Karina m talking about Maison de Cari Golden's palao rice  which is an exquisite melange of subtly fragrant spices and roasted onions. their palao rice  which is an exquisite melange of subtly fragrant spices and roasted onions is the perfect complement to Maison de Cari Golden's tasty and flavourful curries. Aaahhh... the wonderful butter chicken that melted in Karina's mouth without a fight ! Karina's dinner companion had the lamb tandoori  which was more than sufficiently spicy and definitely delicious. reviews.text: My boyfriend and Julia order from Maison de Cari Golden all the time. Julia usually order the exact same thing; butter chicken  lamb curry and eggplant. Sometimes the food is good  but lately  the quality is hit or miss. Julia ordered those three dishes last night and were extremely disappointed it was the last time Julia will be ordering from Maison de Cari Golden.
reviews.name: Julia

reviews.text: The place atmosphere is dark and depressing. Caty waited    mins for our food only   other table were occupied not busy at all ! Service was bad  poor manners ! And the food was the worse food Caty ever had in a restaurant. Very greasy  over cooked and not clean !
reviews.name: Caty

reviews.text: Best Indian resto in the Plateau  Mile End ! Brent went there fir years when Brent lived in Montreal and always go back when Brent return to Montreal. Also  one night when Brent forgot Brent's computer bag at    : pm and never realized it until    : pm minutes after they closed   the gentleman was nice enough to open up again after Brent knocked on the door ! the gentleman kept my computer bag stored in a safe place because the gentleman was not  sure when Brent was coming back ! Brent gave the gentleman the biggest hug ever !  !  !  !  !

reviews.text: Malika have never eaten inside. This is only for take out. Malika LOVE Maison de Cari Golden. Very good shrimp  spices and butter chicken ! Is relatively expensive  but the food lasts Malika and Malika's boyfriend about two to three days. The curry is good and the owner is very nice.

reviews.text: Terrible terrible terrible delivery service. h   for two dishes a soup and a couple of sides. Food was cold and not the first time it happened but is the last. Its too bad because the culinary ability is decent. Much better places overall in Parc Ex
