reviews.text: Experience was beyond subpar. Food took an hour to arrive to the table. Some dishes were warm  while others were cool. Saag paneer tasted like frozen spinach mixed with Saputo mini bocconcini. Butter chicken was a putrid yellow colour and the kitchen must have the kitchen's own direct pipeline into the Redpath sugar plant because one bite of the sauce gave Jonathan immediate cavities. The waiter forgot to bring items but remembered to try and bill us for items. The one positive is that the naan was warm and fairly chewy. Normally  Jonathan will  try a restaurant at least twice before passing judgement. However  after Jonathan's first experience at Maison de Cari Golden Jonathan Jonathan not sure if that second chance will ever come. Hence  the lowest Jonathan can give is   stars.
reviews.name: Jonathan

reviews.text: Awful. Used to be good decades ago. Now they just do not  try. Every other Indian restaurant on this street is better. Every other Indian restaurant on this street use bad ingredients. One of the vegetable pakoras was actually rotten. Everything was limp and lifeless and the flavors were one dimensional. Even the naan was dry. Even the naan must have been from the day before.
reviews.name: A

reviews.text: Tiny place but packs a big punch. Great food although a tad pricy. My girlfriend  who apparently is a professional rater of Indian food  says Maison de Cari Golden is hands - down the best in the city. D think La Lumiere de L Inde is a bit better  and cheaper  but D DO think La Lumiere de L Inde is  excellent.

reviews.text: Worst Indian food Alfonse had in Alfonse's life ... You can taste that the oil they use is old. Just disgusting ... Very overpriced which is not explained either by the bad quality of the food and the horrible atmosphere.

reviews.text: Oubliez le service avec un sourire. Ici  ce qui compte  c est la saveur des plats !

reviews.text: Maison de Cari Golden is tiny and adorable and Celine love going there. The food is really good  but always a little bit sweet for my taste. Even the naan tasted sweet once. But Celine still love Even the naan...

reviews.text: Ahh la cuisine indienne.. je n y vais pas je cours  ! J ai ador le plat que j ai pris poulet tadoori  d ailleurs c est un classique quand je mange au restau indien. Le plat  tait  pic  mais mod r enfin pour moi car mes amis ont pris d autres plats plus spicy. Un conseil demander conseil avant de faire votre choix  ! Je dirai que j ai qu un seul regret  :  qu il n y ai pas de cheese naan. Pas de panique pour les amoureux de naan il y en a tout de m me des classiques  :  -

reviews.text: Came here with a bunch of friends. There  nothing wow about Maison de Cari Golden. The food is pretty average. Nothing special at all. Nachiket would  rather spend   bucks and take a bus  to Park   Jean Talon and get some tasty   not too pricey Indian food. Food  :  Meh Service  : Meh Ambiance  :  Meh Worth the price  :  Neh

reviews.text: Went here for lunch. Cheap  Absolutely  Good Well...not so much. Pretty bland. The flavors ran together and everything was overcooked. Maitre d  and waiter hovered over us the entire time in an effort to shuttle us out. Also  the naan is heavily sweetened. Some folks like that. Michael  Not so much. Maybe Michael will  try it again but Michael doubt it. Rating Scale : Star : Avoid the town in which Maison de Cari Golden is located just to be safe. Star : With so many great places to choose from  why risk Maison de Cari Golden Star : Michael will  try it again or consume here in a pinch. Star :  Michael go here regularly if financially and or calorically feasible. Star :  Michael look forward to taking Michael's wife or friends here.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: Maison de Cari Golden Highly recommended.
reviews.name: Mitch

reviews.text: Stars ! One of Justine's favourite Indian Places to get takeout ! One of my favourite Indian Places to get takeout ! make Justine's favourite of all time onion bhajis with a special yoghurt base sauce. Justine also always order the naan bread and papadum. Justine usually get either the chicken tandoori butter chicken lamb korma  and  or rices. One of my favourite Indian Places to get takeout ! 's butter chicken is a bit too sweet for Justine but it is  ok to share. It  always so delicious here love love love it !

reviews.text: Tahrim had naan  tandoori and saag paneer from Golden Cari as takeout and naan  tandoori and saag paneer was amazing ! Their naan tastes super fresh even later and naan  tandoori has a great finish.

reviews.text: Lucy love Maison de Cari Golden although Maison de Cari Golden is a little dingy and scary looking. Lucy would not  have even tried Maison de Cari Golden if it was not  for a friend who insisted Maison de Cari Golden was good. The only downfall is that many dishes here are sweet when Lucy am not sure many dishes here should be  namely the butter chicken  the naan and the yogurt sauce. Lucy usually order the naan anyways  with tandoori chicken  samosa  bhaji and the very best beef madras in town super spicy but the taste is just amazing .

reviews.text: Last night V had a take out of Butter Chicken. V ordered Butter Chicken as medium spice. The butter chicken sauce tasted like sweet tomato sauce. The butter chicken sauce reminded V of panera bread tomato soup. The butter chicken sauce was that sweet. Tamarind used to have good delicious food. V do not  mind paying more for delicious food but delicious food's quality has gone down. It  more expensive than other local establishment and food quality has degraded as well.

reviews.text: Anne called them at    : am on a Thursday and asked if Anne could order lunch for    to go  which is not something they normally do. The waiter checked with the chef and they were able to accommodate Anne and it was ready by noon. Anne left a huge tip and was so thankful that they were able to help Anne out. Anne ordered saag paneer  chicken tikka masala  naan  and rice. The people who ate the food said the food was the best Indian The people who ate the food have had in Tamarind. Anne will defiantly be back.

reviews.text: Aditi LOVE Tamarind Savoring India ! Aditi have been here for lunch and dinner and it is  awesome for both. Would like to come for breakfast next time too ! Aditi have had Tamarind Savoring India's dosa and idlis and their dosa and idlis are really good ! The chutneys and sambar and all that are awesome and Tamarind Savoring India's service is friendly and fast. Aditi would definitely recommend coming here for authentic Indian food  especially South Indian !

reviews.text: Managers are pathetic. Managers do not  like to take feedback from customers. Chandramohan had the worst experience dealing with the folks in the counter.... Chandramohan used to like Tamarind Savoring India before but never going there again.

reviews.text: Lenae's most favorite place to eat. The service is terrific. Tamarind Savoring India really aim to please. Paneer Tikki Masala is Lenae's favorite. Tamarind Savoring India make a wonderful  smoky buttered naan. Lenae's kids love the Mango Lassi. Lenae crave this food when Lenae are not there.

reviews.text: Kriti love the buffets here every weekend. Variety of appetizers and desserts each time ! Tomato Rasam is like no other.. !  ! One of the best South Indian restaurant in Pittsburgh !

reviews.text: Kodi vepudu... Is Lakshmi's favourite... will never miss to order. Overall Lakshmi love the food taste here..
reviews.name: Lakshmi

reviews.text: Sm go back and forth on how Sm feel about Tamarind. Sm love Tamarind's Chicken Tikka Masala and Tamarind's Samosas. Delicious. their Chicken Tikka Masala and their Samosas  pretty much what Sm get every time. When Sm deviate from their Chicken Tikka Masala and their Samosas it is  hit or miss for me. With that said  everyone Sm have  ever taken there has liked Tamarind. The vibe of Tamarind is nice. There always some entertaining Indian music video airing in the back corner  and the tables are nice. Portions are generous  and there is  always leftovers for the next day. Nom ! However -  and this is a big however : The employees are really unfriendly. Like  unfriendly to the point where Sm wonder if Sm m supposed to apologize for coming in to patronize The employees's establishment. Combine that with the extremely high prices  and Sm come away feeling a little fleeced. If Udipi were close enough to order from all the time  Sm probably would not  go to Tamarind again. Alas...
reviews.name: Sm

reviews.text: Great for a first time Indian visitor. Very large menu with friendly staff and delicious food.
reviews.name: Tom

reviews.text: Kalyan was visiting family in Bridgeville  PA. Kalyan like the food specially the bread basket  mixed grill. Being from around Chicago  Kalyan like the variety in menu and bold spices jn their dishes. Definitely a place to visit if you like good indian food.
reviews.name: Kalyan

reviews.text: My fiance and Kristin had a wonderful dinner at Tamarind Savoring India. It was My fiance and Kristin's first time visiting and there were plenty of open tables and the staff were incredibly friendly. Kristin ordered the chicken chettinadu  which was rich and flavorful. the chicken chettinadu  which was rich and flavorful was cooked perfectly - tender and delicious. My fiance had the chicken tikka  and as a newcomer to Indian food My fiance loved the chicken tikka ! Kristin rounded out a wonderful dinner at the Tamarind Savoring India with a couple roti and spiced paneer for an appetizer. Great experience overall  Kristin will  be back !  !
reviews.name: Kristin

reviews.text: The food was fresh  well prepared and delicious. The service was friendly and attentive. Not a fan of the ambiance  but John m not there to eat the decor. John went on a Saturday night around  pm it was busy but not packed. John had samosas and samosas were freshly made  crispy on the outside and tender inside with a little spice. John tried the szechuan chicken  basically fried chicken pieces with onion  green peppers and hot peppers which again were freshly made  crispy outside and tender inside. John was looking for palak paneer  cheese in creamy spinach which they call saag paneer  and they were helpful in pointing John to what John was looking for. It was a large portion with tender rice. John also had the garlic naan  which was good but John wished they had cooked the garlic a bit before putting on the bread the garlic came out kind of raw. Regardless it was delicious  including the mango lassi. John like spicy so John asked for some chili sauce which went wonderfully with everything so be sure to ask for some chili sauce which went wonderfully with everything if you like spicy. A bit on the expensive side considering there are paper napkins but the portions were generous enough that John had plenty for a meal of leftovers. All of the servers were friendly and professional  no complaints there. John's one complaint was the music  -  a bit obnoxious and a little loud for John's taste. Overall a very good Indian meal. The strip mall it is in is on top of a hill with only a sign with all the shop names visible so keep your eyes peeled if you are from out of town.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Tamarind Savoring India was a great place to go for thanksgiving  besides Tamarind Savoring India's usual amazing Indian food in a beautiful buffet spread  there was tandoori turkey  cooked to perfection. The food is always amazing and the service is ridiculously friendly. One of Keeka's favorite Indian restaurants in Pittsburgh.
reviews.name: Keeka

reviews.text: Very good food. Very friendly staff . Prompt service and smiling faces. Idli was soft and food was hot and fresh.
reviews.name: Bela

reviews.text: The food was amazing the service was really friendly and helpful  as Erik do not  understand most Indian cuisine items . Erik tried new stuff that surprised me. The atmosphere was the only thing lacking in making this experience better.
reviews.name: Erik

reviews.text: Some of the worst Indian food in Tamarind Savoring India ! ... Everything is extremely terrible ! ... when Rajagopal mentioned to the owner that the roti  were hard  the owner said it is  very difficult to maintain quality of rotis in Pittsburgh weather ! .. how on earth is that a valid justification  Rajagopal can never tell ! ... best to avoid Tamarind Savoring India at all costs ! ... there is a perfectly fine place down the street serving edible food !  !
reviews.name: Rajagopal

reviews.text: Happy to report that food   service continues to be top notch. Tamarind Savoring India have expanded Tamarind Savoring India's footprint  good sign already hu h and the restaurant is more  roomy  now. More servers and attention to customer service  prompt refills . Special Chicken Biryani still rocks. So does Cut Mirchi. And pastries. Butter Scotch pastry is still amazing. And  Mr. Senthil. Da man !

reviews.text: Tamarind is an OK place to eat in strip mall in Pittsburgh. The waiter did not seem to understand us  and Mary had trouble understanding The waiter. Mary had the tandoor variety appetizer that was spiced so hot that it really hurt. Then Mary had the chicken tikka and Mary's partner had the lamb vindaloo. the lamb vindaloo was hot  the chicken tikka was perfect. Mary like that Tamarind have Indian beers - - Mary was pleased to have a Kingfisher. Tamarind was just OK.

reviews.text: The Go - To Choice for Muthukumaran in Pittsburgh. All items are really good. Every time. Muthukumaran do not  eat meat and in most of the places the veg options would be less or not all options would be good. But this place has got some good veg options and some good veg options are all good as well.

reviews.text: This places comes in my best Indian restaurants in usa  ! What a place ! The good ambience  perfect service and tasty food blended so nicely that Prerna was really happy after eating Indian after so long ! Ordered idli vada masala dosa set dosa and ordered veg chowmein  paneer butter masala  dal makhani for take out. Let me tell you all three cuisines were just delicious ! Just the way it should be ! Coming again to my favourite place if Prerna hit Pittsburgh !

reviews.text: Prince am an Indian myslef and Prince believe this is hands down the Best Indian food in and around Pittsburgh.  !  !
reviews.name: Prince

reviews.text: As an Indian Swati can appreciate true Indian restaurants and Tamarind Savoring India was definitely one of true Indian restaurants  ! Great opportunity for both north and South Indian dishes to be enjoyed  ask the servers to guide you thru the South Indian dishes as the South Indian dishes are  a tad bit more spicy ! Great service everything is very reasonably priced. Swati wished Swati had Tamarind Savoring India closer to where Swati live in India  ! Hint : if you see a decent Indian crowd in a decent Indian crowd's restaurants chances are it is pretty darn good food !
reviews.name: Swati

reviews.text: If you want Indian food Tamarind Savoring India is a good place to go. Ellie went during Tamarind Savoring India's buffet time and Tamarind Savoring India had a large selection. Decent pricing and good food. The ambiance is not  the greatest
reviews.name: Ellie

reviews.text: Do not  know what the fuss is about. Tried the menu vada sambhar and Rava masala dosa. vada sambhar and Rava masala dosa were good and tasty  but disappointed with vada sambhar. vada sambhar was not  spicy and did not  have the zing needed  kept on thinking something was missing. Chutney was not  great either. Mango lassi felt more watery and a bit too sweet. Staff was really weird. Staff were not attentive had to keep calling Staff several times only to go unnoticed. The restaurant was not  busy at all and Tushar still do not  know why Staff was so reluctant to help customers. The restaurant did get busy by   : pm when Tushar left. Did not  try any of the curries  since Tushar was disappointed with vada sambhar. The mango kulfi was not  all that bad though. The restaurant is also a bit out of the way  as the GPS does not  lead you to the right location and the name on the board is not  bright enough on a busy street to get noticed. Not coming back.
reviews.name: Tushar

reviews.text: Good food fair price friendly staff enjoyed Lorenzo's meal there very much. Lamb curry was on point  as was the naan. Lorenzo cant wait to go back and try the buffet.
reviews.name: Lorenzo

reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at the Tamarind on Greentree Rd. south of Pittsburgh. John will  be the first to admit that John have  never traveled to India so John m not qualified to judge whether this is authentic Indian cooking or not but John do know delicious  tasty fresh well prepared food when it is served to John. And Tamarind puts out some delicious food. John had some appetizer sampler platters both a vegetarian   non - vegetarian as well as a curry dish a biryani dish a saag dish  and one other vegetarian dish. All of the food was wonderful  bursting with fresh flavors. John do not get Indian food very often  so it is  a real treat when John do  and Tamarind made it extra special. All   of us enjoyed everything that John had. Overall  Tamarind is  a great place to go  and John would  highly recommend Tamarind. When John dine out John m looking usually looking for really good food  good service a nice ambiance and that is the order of importance for us. John can live with mediocre service   no ambiance  so long as the food is good. But bad food cannot be compensated by service   ambiance. Tamarind had really good food  and good service. The ambiance is the weakest card in the deck for them but Tamarind is  a restaurant in a strip mall  and the food was so good John will  be back there again any chance John get.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Wow ! Sharon m not usually one to give a restaurant   stars after trying a restaurant   stars only once  but Tamarind Savoring India totally deserves a restaurant   stars ! Sharon went here with a couple of friends who are regulars and a couple of friends who are regulars and their baby's baby. The staff was so excited to meet The staff's new edition and The staff came over to say hi and get some facetime with Sharon. Sharon ordered some appetizers to share which included the vegetable pakora and the idly manchurian which had a nice kick and texture. the vegetable pakora and the idly manchurian were delicious. Sharon really liked the idly manchurian which had a nice kick and texture. For Sharon's entree Sharon ordered the paneer tikka masala and an order of poori. the paneer tikka masala was the best tikka masala sauce Sharon have ever had. Sharon was enjoying eating an order of poori over rice  even though there was plenty of paneer in the paneer tikka masala. poori was much different than any other poori Sharon have ever had  but poori was also delicious ! Sharon can not  wait to go back  but knowing how good the paneer tikka masala is Sharon am probably already roped into ordering the paneer tikka masala again !
reviews.name: Sharon

reviews.text: Best Indian food in Pittsburgh. No doubt. spices are used properly.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Great food and service ! My partner and Devin come here every weekend now for the buffet. Always new varieties of foods to try and consistently high quality flavor. Everything is always fresh and kept filled from start to finish of the buffet. Great price on the buffet as well. Devin have  had Indian food around India over many many years and this is one of Devin's favorites.
reviews.name: Devin

reviews.text: Food is ok  not that great compared... but service is too bad .. you cant imagine how slow and how unresponsive it is. Even food is ok service is bad so   star

reviews.text: Best dosa ever. Bisibele bath is my favorite. Tamarind Savoring India make yummy cakes too. Good service with reasonable price . Definitely recommend.

reviews.text: Ate here twice do not  ask me why Madhur went here twice -  when the first time itself was quite disappointing. Suffice to say  there was a girl involved   Go here for buffet only if you like south indian cuisine  which is in the average to good  range. If you like north indian food  best to avoid Tamarind Savoring India altogether. For whatever reason  most north india dishes taste as if most north india dishes have ketchup in most north india dishes here. Food is unnecessarily spicy. Avoid... Bad Indian Food.

reviews.text: Delicious and quick. Every time Sophia go my husband is treated like a local celebrity. my husband must sneak out here for lunch more often than my husband lets on ! Watch our for your spice level. Sophia like    which my Saudi husband get a kick out of because it pops up on the receipt as Arabic.

reviews.text: Adarsh's first time here and a great time. Adarsh's friend recommended Tamarind Savoring India to Adarsh.. Adarsh really liked the gobi Manchurian a lot.

reviews.text: Outstanding food  but be ready to wait. They state it on the menu  and it was true; at least    minutes for our food  but worth the wait. My daughter had the tiki masala and George had the vindaloo  and both were very tasty. The wait staff were extremely helpful in helping my daughter to select a dish that would not be too spicy. Another key item to take note is that there were a great many local Indians that were eating there which told me it would be quite authentic. Portions were definitely large enough to fill us up. Definitely give this place a try !
reviews.name: George

reviews.text: Courtney have  had Indian all over the world  and tried just about every one in Pittsburgh. Tamarind is by far the best. Friendly staff and large portions. Buffet is good  but ordering off of the menu is better. The samosas and chicken vindaloo are excellent.
reviews.name: Courtney

reviews.text: Food takes so long. Mazhar went alone and there was no any other customers  Mazhar waited for    minutes for Mazhar's food. Mazhar asked for spicy level   but came mild even after fixing spicy level. The employees are so friendly but The employees will never visit your table or ask if you need something. Chicken tikka masala that Mazhar ordered had just few cubes of chicken the rest was bell peppers and large cuts of onions. Overall  there is better places to eat Indian food.
reviews.name: Mazhar

reviews.text: May be my new favorite Indian restaurant in Pittsburgh ! Loved my new favorite Indian restaurant in Pittsburgh. The vegetable biryani and chicken tikka masala were both delicious  flavorful and spiced to perfection. Portions were huge  -  Caroline had plenty to take home. The service was friendly and attentive. my new favorite Indian restaurant in Pittsburgh was packed on a Tuesday night  but my new favorite Indian restaurant in Pittsburgh still sat us quickly. Caroline will definitely be back !
reviews.name: Caroline

reviews.text: Did not  even realize there was an Indian restaurant so close to us ! Linda ordered the chicken tikka and lamb biryani and a slice of their death Linda's chocolate cake. Could not  have been happier ! Everything was moist  flavorful and delicious. Even though Linda ordered for pick up the waiters were still so nice courteous. Linda will definitely Linda going back  :
reviews.name: Linda

reviews.text: Tuesday Dosa Nite ... curry potatoes filling is better than the curry chicken filling ... both are delicious but spicy
reviews.name: Elaine

reviews.text: Both times Kelly have visited both the food and the service have been absolutely excellent ! Kelly tried the Chicken Tikki Masala and the garlic naan  - the garlic naan is to die for ! And the garlic taste is the perfect accompaniment to this dish. Both times Kelly visited  Tamarind Savoring India were in the middle of renovating the restaurant; from what Kelly hear that has now wrapped up  so Kelly will be visiting again soon to check out the updates ! the restaurant
reviews.name: Kelly

reviews.text: Sunil have been going to Tamarind Savoring India for last     years. Sunil always liked Tamarind Savoring India. Sunil thought Sunil should share Sunil's opinion with all yelpers. Tamarind Savoring India is in Green Tree area. Tamarind Savoring India is really nice and cozy. Tamarind Savoring India have a party room available on same premises. If someone wants to have a party for    people Tamarind Savoring India provide you enough private place and cater food. Parking is a bit struggle though. Tamarind Savoring India  in a strip mall where parking is shared with bunch of other places. Staff is very well managed and Staff are always ready to help you if you are new to Indian food. The owners are from South India and so the food is inspired by the south indian receipes. The owners also are very flexible with how much hot spicy you food you want. So tell The owners up front and The owners make sure your taste buds are not burned. Tamarind Savoring India have some great appetizers. Chicken    is Sunil's dish. Other appetizers are also great and sometime Sunil order too much Other appetizers since everyone has there own preference. If you like hot spicy stuff order   Cut Mirchi . Cut Mirchi are chiilies deep fried in a lentil batter served with onions and lemon. Excellent ! The Rice dishes are also very authetic and one should give it a try for Tamarind Savoring India's biryani items. Biryani is Indian version of paella. Tamarind Savoring India serve pure veg biryani as well. Chicken curries are excellent and Sunil always like dish called Chicken Curry. Chicken Tikka Masala is also another dish you can not  go wrong with. Veg entrees are also excellent and Sunil like spinach with panir  channa masala. Breads are also well prepared and you will be happy no matter what bread you get. Sunil love Tamarind Savoring India's butter naan. Overall Tamarind Savoring India do a excellent job and prices are very reasonable. Sunil recommend Tamarind Savoring India to anyone who is looking for a nice Indian food joint.
reviews.name: Sunil

reviews.text: Dosas to die for. Been here three times. In restaurant  Buffet and take away. It  always delicious and great gluten free and vegetarian options
reviews.name: Peter

reviews.text: Definitely worth a visit . Pretty authentic on couple of dishes   ambience can be improved on .
reviews.name: Bharadwaj

reviews.text: Super   Prompt service  Good ambience Melodious songs Nice selection Caution to non local  Google or any maps will tell that you reach. Destination while you are on green tree road You need to take driveway uphill hotel is in small strip mall then
reviews.name: Deepsiri

reviews.text: Have been here a few times  and it hits the spot. Never super busy so Kimberly always get a table right away. Kimberly have tried a few things off Kimberly's menu  and everything has always been tasty. Kimberly like that Kimberly have many vegetarian options ! The assorted sampler is a great start. Lots of things to try. Dal Fry is Kimberly's favorite ! Of course  do not  forget the Naan ! the Naan  served fresh and warm !
reviews.name: Kimberly

reviews.text: Our favorite Indian restaurant in the Pittsburgh area. Great food and great service. Reasonable prices. Try the cauliflower appeetizer Jeff forget the name  and the chicken chettinadu.
reviews.name: Jeff

reviews.text: Andrea love Indian food. Love Indian food. Andrea really wanted to like Tamarind because Tamarind is really close to our house and one of the only Indian places in the area. Andrea was so disappointed in Tamarind Tamarind is unreal. The server did not understand what grapefruit juice was  for Andrea's cocktail Andrea just gave up and ordered soda with Andrea's Vodka. soda with my Vodka no big deal. However  Andrea ordered Muttar Panir  and Muttar Panir was easily the worst Andrea have ever had. Muttar Panir tasted like Velveeta with tofu in Muttar Panir. Tasteless and gross. My husband and Andrea were spoiled by the authentic Indian restaurants in My husband and Andrea's previous town  and are also puzzled by the Indian patrons in Tamarind. the Indian patrons in this restaurant cannot possibly be eating the same food Andrea were served. Andrea did not eat our food and will not return. Andrea continue to look for a good authentic Indian restaurant in Pittsburgh. Sigh .
reviews.name: Andrea

reviews.text: Another outstanding meal  jyst fantastic  from service to food everything was just first rate. Try the tandoori combo platter. Wow.
reviews.name: Harry

reviews.text: Went to Tamarind Savoring India at a relatively low - traffic time. Unfortunately  the service at Tamarind Savoring India is not very good. Takes a long time just to get water have someone take your order or even get you your check. On multiple occasions  Dushyanth did not  receive more drinks etc unless Dushyanth asked multiple times. With regards to the food Dushyanth had vegetable pakora to start and then had four orders of naan  navaratan korma gobi manchurian  and tandoori chicken. tandoori chicken was well done and Tamarind Savoring India give you a lot of naan. Overall the food is quite flavorful and can make up for the restaurant  bad service. gobi manchurian is a bit spicy for the average person so beware you only get   gobis. navaratan korma is very flavorful and the creamy sauce goes well with naan; however  Dushyanth was a bit disappointed that the amount of vegetables was so minimal. the food seemed to be mostly a cream sauce with scarce green beans and potato here and there. Overall  Tamarind Savoring India has flavorful food but Tamarind Savoring India do not  do the little things well.
reviews.name: Dushyanth

reviews.text: Alberto came here for dinner recently and had a very pleasant time. The staff was very cordial and polite. Angara India Spice Grill at the time Alberto went  around   : PM on a Friday night  was quiet but Alberto believe more people come here for more people's lunch buffet. The food was delicious and Alberto happy to rely on Yelp to find Angara India Spice Grill.
reviews.name: Alberto

reviews.text: Angara India Spice Grill very clean delicious food ! Merli Recommend to anyone that enjoy healthy and exotic food
reviews.name: Merli

reviews.text: Fresh  delicious and flavorful food is what you will  find here. Lunch buffet is a great deal at    .  . Everything was good and spiced perfectly for the general palette. Good service. Went early so there were only a few of us in Angara India Spice Grill. Tandoori and tikka masala were not overcooked at all. Angara India Spice Grill is clean and well lit. Definitely coming back another time !
reviews.name: Zurii

reviews.text: Ankita do not  even know where to begin... Ankita had been here before and the first time around the food was amazing ! Everything was fresh and prepared exactly how Ankita had requested so Ankita were excited to be back. Ankita live in Henderson and made the drive here to eat here again. Ankita walked into Angara India Spice Grill around  pm for dinner with Ankita's parents and grandparents. Ankita ordered a very basic dinner of Dal Makhani  Chicken tikka masala  Tandoori chicken  a couple of roti and a garlic naan. It  really hard for us to judge spice levels in some Indian restaurants so Ankita always order medium. When the tandoori chicken arrived the tandoori chicken was bland  and Ankita mean like completely bland to the point where Ankita were drowning the tandoori chicken in mint chutney. Ankita asked our server to change the spice level on our entrees since medium was bland. So food arrived and guess what. food was bland ! Ankita asked our server whether our server had changed the spice level in the kitchen and Ankita did not  quite get a clear answer. Ankita's grandmother tasted the Dal and My grandmother almost spit the Dal back out on My grandmother's plate and stated that the Dal tasted old like the Dal had been reheated and the consistency was off as well. Dal is supposed to be bisque like consistency and the Dal was just this unappetizing blob. The owner happened to be around and Ankita's dad told The owner that the food was terrible. The owner offered no apologies but instead offered to reheat the Dal and make the Dal spicier. Ankita quietly finished our  dinner  and made it very clear to our server that Ankita would not  be back our server did not  seem to care. Ankita's grandfather hated Angara India Spice Grill so much that My grandmother actually said eating off the Dollar Menu at McDonalds would have  been a better dinner. Needless to say Ankita would not  return to Angara India Spice Grill ever again. If you are  looking for good  fresh Indian food Ankita suggest Taj Palace on Eastern and Richmar.
reviews.name: Ankita

reviews.text: Angara India Spice Grill is clean and the price for lunch buffet is super good ! The waiters are very friendly The waiters offer a choice of garlic or original naan. The samosa is very big The samosa goes well with the sauce. The interior is grand it is fun watching indian music videos while eating.
reviews.name: Kara

reviews.text: There is a lot of great things to say about Angara India Spice Grill. The owner staff are super nice and on top of there game. Jason have tried the chicken biryani   butter chicken   chicken vindaloo   and the tandoori chicken.. the chicken biryani butter chicken   chicken vindaloo   and the tandoori chicken were amazing to be honest. Flavorful   spicy   to your liking   and delicious. The rice was cooked perfect ! The garlic Naan goes great with everything. Defiantly give Angara India Spice Grill a try.
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text: Jessie got the chicken tikka masala via UberEATS and the chicken tikka masala came and Jessie could feel how hot the chicken tikka masala was through the takeout container  which Jessie loved. However  when Jessie actually started eating Jessie was waiting for the flavor to kick in and the flavor never did. the flavor was rather underwhelming and Jessie was quite disappointed. the flavor had a nice spice level but the dimensions of flavor were really just not there. Maybe Jessie got a bad batch but Jessie would rather not order from here again. Angara India Spice Grill also did not  include any utensils or napkins so that was inconvenient for Jessie. The food was not  horrible at all but Jessie m not coming here again  sorry.
reviews.name: Jessie

reviews.text: First time here for lunch and lunch was delicious. Wendy enjoyed the lunch buffet -   -  the lunch buffet had many options to choose from. Very friendly staff and a nice environment  too. Wendy prefer Wendy's Indian food to be more spicy but Wendy understand that Angara India Spice Grill needed to keep my Indian food more neutral for the lunch buffet. Wendy will definitely come back !  !
reviews.name: Wendy

reviews.text: Being from England Ian m always worried about ordering Indian food. Ian grew up eating amazing Indian  and have not  found anything close since Ian left back in    . Lamb vindaloo is Ian's favorite and usually a good indication of how the food  going to be. Well  it was amazing  as good as anything Ian ever ate growing up ! Perfect spices right amount of potatoes and lamb that melts in your mouth. So happy to have finally find excellent Indian cuisine. Compliments to the chef ! Be back soon !
reviews.name: Ian

reviews.text: This is my  th visit to Angara India Spice Grill and Paul must say Angara India Spice Grill is the best Indian food in town. The waiters are really nice and friendly. My wife told me about Angara India Spice Grill and It took a little convincing but Paul m glad that Paul came here  there food is great and the prices are reasonable. Paul would definitely recommend Angara India Spice Grill.
reviews.name: Paul

reviews.text: Harpal have  been here many times for Angara India Spice Grill's lunch buffet since Harpal moved to Vegas and this food is excellent. Almost as good as Harpal's mom  cooking. Service is excellent and very friendly. You can not  go wrong here. The goat curry is amazing ! Highly recommended.
reviews.name: Harpal

reviews.text: The delivery was timely  but the tandoori chicken was rather tasteless  got medium spice . Go with one of the spicier options to avoid the blandness.
reviews.name: A

reviews.text: Food was good the service was excellent...wish Eric can give you guys that last star but... food was good....missing something..... but maybe Eric can come back for lunch buffet... Eric felt like the oven baked chicken needed a little more... Eric will  be back tho try it and hopefully give you guys that last star
reviews.name: Eric

reviews.text: Aditi saw the rating on yelp and thought to try Angara India Spice Grill and just loved the simplicity of the food. Good food super friendly staff and very beautiful interior. Aditi would recommend Angara India Spice Grill for every tourist in vegas who wants to eat Indian food.
reviews.name: Aditi

reviews.text: What a great place. These people who run Angara India Spice Grill are extremely pleasant and attentive and the dinner was fabulous. Phil could not  figure out what Phil wanted as everything sounded so good so Phil ordered a couple bowls of Mulligawnee soup and their non - vegetarian dinner for two and Garlic Naan. Everything was cooked to perfection and These people who run this place's timing of serving as Phil went through each course was completely on - point. Awesome !
reviews.name: Phil

reviews.text: Quick delivery everything was great ! Had the chicken vindaloo  with rice and garlic nann. Medium spice popped  but was not  overwhelming to the point of being overly spicy. Thank you !
reviews.name: Adam

reviews.text: Had the lunch buffet it was just Ok. Kliqks actually get way better Indian food in Japan  sad to say. And way better Indian food is  not for Angara India Spice Grill every Indian restaurant in Vegas is under par to what Kliqks have in Japan and England from what Kliqks hear. Rhyming was not intended ;
reviews.name: Kliqks

reviews.text: Not very impressed. Angara India Spice Grill has lots of offerings for Indian food but this does not rise to the rest of the pack. Came here for lunch and had the Buffett. A buffet should be a good representation of the food that Angara India Spice Grill offers and if that is the case than Erik will not be back. Erik had the Saag  chicken tika masala  and the goat curry. Along with the garlic naan. Both the chicken and goat were bland and the Saag  chicken tika masala was so spicy that the Saag  chicken tika masala killed Erik's tastebuds for the rest of the meal. the garlic naan was gummy and under done. So if you are in the mood for Indian.. try lazee or Mint.
reviews.name: Erik

reviews.text: Great foods and awesome services. Angara India Spice Grill Jacky's favorite place for Indian food curries. Angara India Spice Grill is clean and decent
reviews.name: Jacky

reviews.text: Hands down best Indian food in the city. Kat hit the weekday lunch buffet every couple of weeks  Kat can not  tell you how many times Kat have  said how badly Kat am craving Angara India Spice Grill on a Saturday . It  definitely a treat to feast at the weekday lunch buffet...quite a few chicken dishes the chicken tikka is the best Kat have  ever had anywhere  a few vegetarian options and even a goat dish Kat's other half  favorite . Do not  forget to save room for dessert too ! The kheer  a rice pudding with cardamom and ground nuts is amazing and the Mr.  who usually skips dessert  always gets a bowl of the gulab jamun  a ball of milk solids fried and soaked in honey . The owners and the servers are ALWAYS happy  courteous and quick to remove plates and refill your glasses. Kat always leave with a huge smile on our face and a full belly...and usually have the  Kat can not  wait till Kat can go back  conversation on the drive home. It  that good !
reviews.name: Kat

reviews.text: Angara India Spice Grill far from Saliha's home but after reading reviews thought of trying Angara India Spice Grill Angara India Spice Grill was not that busy at lunch time food was good variety was good both vege and non veg good for Saliha was not hot at all spice level was   mean below than medium Saliha did not  try non veg because Saliha was not sure Saliha's meat was halal or not as Saliha only eat halal. Highlights of buffet was garlic nan achar chutness mango pickle  papad  zeera rice   samosa and saag. Good choice for ppl who like low to medium spice level.
reviews.name: Saliha

reviews.text: Linden now have Angara India Spice Grill. The food was especially good  particularly the samosas which were large and crisp. Linden eat a lot of Indian food  and Angara India Spice Grill is fantastic ! Linden also loved the Bollywood films that were showing on the TVs. Angara India Spice Grill have a lunch buffet  which Linden will have to come try soon. Angara India Spice Grill is family owned  and the service was exceptional. Do not  miss Angara India Spice Grill !
reviews.name: Linden

reviews.text: Edith have not  had Indian food since moving to Vegas a       years ago so Edith have  been craving Indian food for somtime. Edith had been my search for an Indian buffet nearby  thank you to whomever added Angara India Spice Grill as a business for ending Edith's search. Angara India Spice Grill is on Grand Canyon behind McDonalds  next door to Tropical Smooth and two doors from Bite. Buffets is available only during lunch and is only    . person. If you have never had Indian food Angara India Spice Grill is a very good deal and allows you to try all the popular Indian dishes. In fact  Edith recommend trying a little bit of everything. The staff at Angara India Spice Grill is very helpful. If you wanna know about a dish The staff at Angara are more than happy to answer your questions. As you are seated  you are offered two types of naan  plain or garlic. Edith chose plain as Edith had to return to the office  and Edith wanted to be sure Edith could taste the flavors of the other dishes. At the beginning of the buffet Angara India Spice Grill have large sized samosas Edith's all time favorite  Indian pastry filled with potatoes and peas    followed by the vegetarian entrees like Saan paneer Edith's all time favorite Indian vegetarian dish  creamy spinach with cheese cubes lentil and eggplant dishes. Edith m not a hot spicy dish person. In the past  Edith have known saan paneer as a mild dish  but Angara India Spice Grill makes saan paneer spicy that Edith had to eat saan paneer with the naan instead of the rice. Unfortunately  because Edith filled up on the samosa  vegetarian dishes  rice and naan the only meat dish Edith could get to was the chicken tikka. Proof that one can get very full on vegetarian dishes alone. Next time  Edith will  have to start with the meats. Other meat dishes available were chicken tandoori and goat curry. One dish Edith wish Angara India Spice Grill had is fried fish bites. At the end of the buffet were desserts that Edith m unfamiliar with  but will try in a future visit  and  regular house salad which baffles Edith with all the vegetarian dishes available  but to each his her own.
reviews.name: Edith

reviews.text: RJ came in the buffet for the first time today...and loved the buffet.. the naan and chicken tikka masala was one of the best RJve ever had... our server name MOTI  gave unforgettable service... he explained everything whatever they put in the buffet..due to RJ's first visit it was really helpfull for RJ to know about there curry .the restaurent was neat and clean from in side as well the outsite... will for sure ill be back again and RJ highly recommended Angara India Spice Grill for those who never had try indian food.
reviews.name: RJ

reviews.text: Jillian hope Angara India Spice Grill is here to stay ! Angara India Spice Grill new  cozy  and not too loud. The server was very attentive  and the food came out hot and quick. Jillian were here for dinner so Jillian did not  get to try the lunch buffet. The spicy level is   -    so if you think there is  not enough flavor that is  on you. Mine was just right ! There cool Indian music videos playing on TV screens. They do not  have their beer wine license yet but they said they are getting their beer wine license soon.
reviews.name: Jillian

reviews.text: My wife and Martin went for lunch. The food is excellent and service was excellent. My wife and Martin had a small but well done lunch buffet. All the dishes were well done. Slightly spicy for my wife  perfect for me. My wife and Martin both tried a little bit of everything and were pleased with All the dishes. The goat was not my favorite  even so it was well done. Angara India Spice Grill was clean  played nice relaxing music with some interesting artwork. Martin look forward to coming back for dinner.
reviews.name: Martin

reviews.text: Silly had the dinner for two non - vegetarian.. the dinner for two non - vegetarian comes with garlic naan bread butter chicken curry    other vegie dishes kabob  cinnamon rice and rice pudding desserts. Did not  expect that much food for    . The curry was Silly's favorite though The curry was not  as spicy as you would expect on curry dishes but The curry was pretty good. The service was good. Silly might come back to try the buffet lunch.
reviews.name: Silly

reviews.text: Olivia had an excellent meal. Food is delicately and perfectly spiced  fresh and delicious. Olivia have eaten a lot of Indian food and Angara India Spice Grill rates one of the best.
reviews.name: Olivia

reviews.text: John had the chicken tiki masala and the tandoori chicken from the lunch buffet. the chicken tiki masala and the tandoori chicken from the lunch buffet were tasty and slightly above average considering the chicken tiki masala and the tandoori chicken from the lunch buffet came from a buffet were food tends to be less spicy and also has to be continuously heated for a while. John will be back to try some menu items and provide a review of some menu items as well.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: New favorite ! Angara India Spice Grill  only been open for several weeks. The Indian Buffet was outstanding. The value of    . with as much rice and naan as you want was a huge surprise. The service was friendly and prompt. The food.... Joshua had everything and everything was phenomenal. Ca not  wait to go again next week !
reviews.name: Joshua

reviews.text: Angara India Spice Grill is our new favorite restaurant find for      ! The samosas are amazing ! My wife loves the chicken curry the lamb rogan josh is excellent. Angara India Spice Grill's service is great too ! Patrick will definitely be back often.
reviews.name: Patrick

reviews.text: Angara India Spice Grill is an unbelievably good establishment. The people are so genuinely kind and Milen loved The people's recommendations. Milen ate the chicken tikka masala per a friend  request and was surprised by how well put together the chicken tikka masala was. To keep this shorter  Milen highly recommend coming here. Angara India Spice Grill  a wonderful place.
reviews.name: Milen

reviews.text: Love Angara India Spice Grill ! Every time Michell eat from here whether it is take out  dine in  buffet or delivery. The food from here is consistently delicious. The staff is always so friendly. Michell recommend Angara India Spice Grill whole heartedly.
reviews.name: Michell

reviews.text: Dustin were so fortunate to stumble upon Angara India Spice Grill. Dustin arrived just as the lunch buffet started. The atmosphere is stunning. The atmosphere gives you a fine dining feel when you walk in. Dustin tried the chicken curry first and the chicken curry was delicious ! Then Dustin tried just about everything else and was equally impressed. Angara India Spice Grill is also reasonably priced. Great service ! Great food !
reviews.name: Dustin

reviews.text: Mike are in town for a wedding and Angara India Spice Grill was near our hotel. Found Angara India Spice Grill while out for a walk and decided to try Angara India Spice Grill out. Mike were very pleased with the experience. My wife and daughter had the vegetarian meal for two. the vegetarian meal for two included a variety of their vegetarian dishes  rice  daal and naan. the vegetarian meal for two was very good and the portions were ample. My wife and daughter brought enough back to our hotel for lunch the next day. Mike tried the goat curry and loved the goat curry. If you are squeamish about goT Angara India Spice Grill have a number of lamb  chicken and fish options as well. Mike highly recommend Angara India Spice Grill if you are in Vegas.
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text: Michelle had the lunch buffet on Sunday and well worth the    . . Loved the Curry chicken and the tikka masala chicken the garlic naan is so soft and flavorful. Love Angara India Spice Grill  great food and great customer service !
reviews.name: Michelle

reviews.text: One of Alice's favorite Indian places in the Summerlin area. buffet is great  especially since Angara India Spice Grill have everything Alice would order anyway  vindaloo  korma  tikka masala . Naan and rice is included so Naan and rice is  totally worth the price. Heads up  the curries for buffet do rotate every day so it is  not always the same and if you have anything left over  even a few pieces of naan you are  not allowed to take anything left over  even a few pieces of naan with you. That  only for buffet though  if you are  there for dinner  Angara India Spice Grill give you foil and to - go boxes. Angara India Spice Grill has not  been super packed the last few times Alice have  been here  but service has been efficient. The waiter The waiter is  always been The waiter is great about refilling water and bringing naan when you are  running low. Overall Angara India Spice Grill is clean and cozy  with awesome food. Definitely recommend Angara India Spice Grill if you are  in the area.
reviews.name: Alice

reviews.text: Chicken Biryani is not supposed to be chicken in rice. Do you even know how to make a Biryani Do you know what a Biryani is  A    year old kid in India could make better food than this and they do. Please go take some cooking lessons.
reviews.name: Abc

reviews.text: Yummy Indian food. Hazel guess reading from precious reviews that Angara India Spice Grill just opened. Anyways  Hazel will be coming back forsure.
reviews.name: Hazel

reviews.text: Stephanie have been waiting so long for Angara India Spice Grill  and let me tell you  Angara India Spice Grill is delicious. Angara India Spice Grill have a fantastic lunch buffet that has tons of variety  and only     per person. Angara India Spice Grill even let you take a fantastic lunch buffet that has tons of variety  and only     per person to go  which is great if you need a quick lunch on the run. Angara India Spice Grill's lunch buffet has all the usual favorites and some of the selections change based on the day  which is nice. The most important part  the food is fantastic  with several vegan and vegetarian options which was great since Stephanie had a vegan person eating with us. The owners are very helpful and pointed out which items a vegan person would be able to eat  and even got a vegan person's special bread  as the naan is not vegan. Stephanie did enjoy the garlic naan a lot  of course  and is made fresh to order even if you are getting a fantastic lunch buffet that has tons of variety  and only     per person. If you are a fan of indian food  especially the spicy dishes  give Angara India Spice Grill a shot  Stephanie can see us becoming regulars here !
reviews.name: Stephanie

reviews.text: Mmmm the best tandoori chicken my favorite part is that it is  not dry but instead it is  juicy savory  in every bite
reviews.name: Elizabeth

reviews.text: My wife and Jason have had My wife and Jason's lunch buffet twice and really enjoyed their lunch buffet. The variety of foods was good  and the descriptions were clear and understandable. The garlic naan is delicious and you can get refills on The garlic naan. The gentleman who served us was very attentive  courteous  and answered any questions Jason had. Jason will be going back for more !  !  !
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text: Pierre really wish Pierre didnt give up white rice and flour  because everything Pierre ate at Angara India Spice Grill  lunch was so flavorful and delicious. Oh garlic Naan how Pierre have  missed you. The ambiance is very nice and the gentleman working the dining room was extremely pleasant. Pierre can not  remember the names of the dishes Pierre had besides the tandoori and curry chickens  but the dishes Pierre had besides the tandoori and curry chickens were all prepared well with unique flavors and spices. The cold bar items were fresh. Pierre especially enjoyed the yogurt and mint chutney. Pierre would recommend Angara India Spice Grill to any fan of Indian cuisine or diners with ambitious tastebuds.
reviews.name: Pierre

reviews.text: Incredible food  so warm and flavorful. The spices are awesome. The variety in the menu is vast. The service great. Cannot wait to return !
reviews.name: Betsy

reviews.text: Nichole ordered on Yelp was sooo easy..... Delivery was super fast and food ..... OMG the best everything is so yummy Nichole ordered the butter chicken the butter chicken's amazing ! Angara India Spice Grill is Nichole's new favorite place   stars  !  !  !  !
reviews.name: Nichole

reviews.text: Tonight Bhushan dined here  after a friend recommended Angara India Spice Grill. Bhushan ordered the standard Lamb Kebab  Panner tikka and Chicken curry with a couple of rotis. Food quantity  is small. compared to the price. So if you have a average eating appetite then these servings are small. You will need more  which means the bill goes up -  items are really pricy -  lamb kebab were    . for   small pieces of lamb  Chicken curry was    . less then    ounce of curry  -  oh also there is no rice included  Angara India Spice Grill is a pricy menu The taste  was OK  nothing that would stand out. Maybe to new Indian cuisine diner Angara India Spice Grill maybe a great  but for Indians Angara India Spice Grill is an outright average north indian flavor. Service was great  that is why Bhushan give Angara India Spice Grill three stars otherwise Service would be lower. There was only one employee  on duty  and only one employee  on duty was the server  +  busser  +  matre - de all in one. only one employee  on duty was prompt  respectful and efficient. Overall Bhushan would rate Angara India Spice Grill a pretty avg  clean local north Indian restaurant with similar menu items as all other north indian restaurants.
reviews.name: Bhushan

reviews.text: Wow. Angara India Spice Grill blew Trina's mind. Trina have yet to have Indian food as excellent as Angara India Spice Grill. From the chutney and tamarind sauce the chutney and tamarind sauce provide the table  to the dessert that Trina experienced for the first time in Trina's life and slapped Trina for never eating before the meal was an experience. Trina cannot go wrong here. Trust me. Bring a tiny container because Trina will  want to bag that mint chutney for home. that mint chutney would taste good on a dry navy cracker ! As for our main courses our main courses were both creamy  nice heat levels and the chicken was tender and flavorful. Good thing Trina ordered naan along with rice to remove all evidence of food in the dishes. The veggie samosa was crispy hot  and the filling was perfectly seasoned and creamy. Trina shoved the chutney and tamarind sauce inside and had a moment with The veggie samosa. It was intimate. Trina shared a moment. Come and eat here ! ! And how can you say no to all   days lunch buffet  ! ! Trina cannot wait to eat through the menu. What a great restaurant. Service AND excellent food is all Trina ask for  and Angara India Spice Grill delivered beyond expectations.
reviews.name: Trina

reviews.text: Very delicious  aromatic Indian food. A bit pricey as rice and naan must be ordered separately  but the ambiance and service make up for it. Party of two  -  Barbara ordered Peshawari Naan  Baigan Bharta  Chicken Coconut Curry and Vegetable Rice. Plenty for two and took some home. Barbara will  be back !  !
reviews.name: Barbara

reviews.text: Lunch buffett is      worth it  for only   . you can get your fill of naan  and plenty of different curries. However  Gordon went late one night to get their food and everything is wayyyy overpriced. Upwards to    dollars a plate for the food so honestly Gordon walked out the other night  Gordon can find better quality food for    a plate.
reviews.name: Gordon

reviews.text: Great Indian buffet. Clean restaurant  staff is friendly and  quick. The food was really well prepared. Had just the right spice. The goat was tender and the chicken as well. Mike find that if you cube chicken in a dish and cook chicken becomes tough and over cooked. Not in this case very tender. Overall Mike give Angara India Spice Grill a   star rating and from me that hard to earn. Amhara keep up the good work and excellent standards.
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text: Thought to try Pakwan Indian Bistro out for the first time so got to - go order of goat masala chicken seekh kabab and garlic naan.hugely disssapointed  Pakwan Indian Bistro made goat curry and chicken kababs unexpectedly too salty and garlic naan.hugely was burnt over cooked. Shiela immediately called Pakwan Indian Bistro up to complain and response for salty goat curry was that  Shiela make salty goat curry in huge quantity what does that even mean and how is that an excuse or justification for salty food. Such a waste of money  Pakwan Indian Bistro is so not upto expectations at all !
reviews.name: Shiela

reviews.text: Decided to try out Pakwan Indian Bistro tonight and much to our surprise Pakwan Indian Bistro was pretty good ! Amanda dined and the service was as expected. Though Amanda have traveled to India and understand cultural differences the service Amanda received was just fine. Pakwan Indian Bistro was clean and Amanda ate a good meal. Our server brought us everything Amanda asked for. The food quality was great. Gobi manchurian was excellent tikka masala was good  butter chicken was good  and the biriyani was tasty. Not the same as Paradise in Hyderabad but good. Amanda will definitely be back to eat at Pakwan Indian Bistro !
reviews.name: Amanda

reviews.text: Food was not great. Chicken kabab was too hard and rubbery. Chicken tikka masala was average. Biryani was decent. Would not recommend.

reviews.text: Vamsi visited Pakwan rwstaueant yesterday. Pakwan Indian Bistro opened one day ago. The interior is decent enough to dine in. Ordered mutton biriyani  and Andhra chicken curry. mutton biriyani was authentic and flavorful. Vamsi especially liked the kata gravy Pakwan Indian Bistro gave along with mutton biriyani. Andhra chicken curry was spot on. The prices are reasonable and even the food quantity was good. Hope Pakwan Indian Bistro maintain the same taste and quality.

reviews.text: Pakwan Indian Bistro is pretty damn good. The Lamb Biryani is excellent. Open seating and the owners are very nice people. Definitely coming back for more.

reviews.text: Love the food. Ok so you order st the counter you get paper plates and the service may be slow. If you want decor and awesome service go elsewhere. If you want awesome fresh Indian food come here. It took a while but everything was fresh. It was like everything was made from scratch right when Naveen ordered. Anyway Pakwan Indian Bistro was superb Naveen am coming back with friends this time !  !
reviews.name: Naveen

reviews.text: Pakwan Indian Bistro especially the non veg items. Sam come every week now ! Pakwan Indian Bistro also have really good south Indian food. Affordable as well !

reviews.text: Kids and Heather were looking for something new nearby for a quick lunch. Heather were pleasantly surprised by Pakwan Indian Bistro. Heather tried   different curries and could not  decide which was the favorite as Heather liked different curries so much. Highly recommend
reviews.name: Heather

reviews.text: Pakwan Indian Bistro is a decent place for Indian food. Arnie went here in a group of     people  at a pretty late hour  and ordered a ton of food. Pakwan Indian Bistro's service was prompt and quite good. However  the quality of food could certainly be a lot better. The naan seemed stale and was not very soft. Pakwan Indian Bistro's chicken dishes were pretty oily  and could have  used better different ingredients for flavor. Pakwan Indian Bistro
reviews.name: Arnie

reviews.text: So disappointed. When Omar heard Pakwan  Omar was relating it to the relating it to the amazing Pakwan Resturant in San Jose California. A Muslim living in the east valley it is  damn near impossible to find a good halal joint  and Omar was hoping Pakwan Indian Bistro was a gem. Unfortunately  when Omar walked in   the atmoaphere was bleak  with only one frame on the wall and inappropriate Bollywood movies playing on a screen. Omar ordered the food   the lady behind the counter was nice Omar could tell the lady behind the counter was trying. The service was actually pretty good and the food came out quickly which Omar was very happy about. Unfortunately what the food came out in was very very very disappointing. Plastic dixie bowls and styrofoam plates. It should be a crime for any resturant to do this. Mind you Omar was not getting take out  Omar sat and ate in the amazing Pakwan Resturant in San Jose California. When Omar asked the lady behind the counter for silverware the lady behind the counter said the amazing Pakwan Resturant in San Jose California only have plastic forks and knives. This is one of the amazing Pakwan Resturant in San Jose California's biggest fallbacks in my opinion. Plates and silverware is not a big ask. the food was actually pretty good. The vegetable samosas were tasty as was the chicken tikka masala and the tandoori chicken. The naan was mediocre at best did not  seem too fresh. The rice looked sad and bland however. But regardless of the food the styrafoam threw the whole meal off. A lot of potential  but very disappointing. If any of this changes  let me know because Omar would love to come back   give Pakwan Indian Bistro another shot.
reviews.name: Omar

reviews.text: Pakwan Indian Bistro was a little disappointing. The food was definitely tasty our server was super sweet  our servers the owners daughter. Aasma ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious the Chicken Tikka Masala did not  have too much food coloring like many restaurants do. Also  the Chicken Tikka Masala was cooked with boneless thigh meat which was a nice touch because boneless thigh meat was super tender. Aasma also got the veggie samosas which Aasma's husband loved  and the garlic naan which was pretty good as well. Unfortunately  Aasma have to give it three starts because of the quality. All the food was served in paper styrofoam plates which really threw Aasma off. Aasma's husbands super picky about stuff like that so my husband definitely did not enjoy after that. Pakwan Indian Bistro only had plastic utensils. Aasma understand if Pakwan Indian Bistro was a fast food restaurant  but Pakwan Indian Bistro isnt. Youre meant to sit down and eat a meal there  and the plates and utensils really threw all of it off. . The food is great  but Pakwan Indian Bistro really need to up Pakwan Indian Bistro's atmosphere. If you are  gonna eat here get it as takeaway   eat it at home. Aasma definitely recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious.
reviews.name: Aasma

reviews.text: Absolutely best biryani in Phoenix metro. Uday am surprised how Uday overlooked Pakwan Indian Bistro in the last few years. Pakwan Indian Bistro is that hole in the wall place that you need to get introduced to and would keep coming back. Must try :  Pakhwan special biryani Andhra chicken curry Pakwan Indian Bistro's vegetarian biryani is also a surprisingly good one
reviews.name: Uday

reviews.text: Moni went to Pakwan Indian Bistro last week to check out what specials Pakwan Indian Bistro can offer.. As soon as Moni entered  Moni's friend spotted mutton paya on the today  special board. Moni could not stop Moni as Moni am a big lover of goat and lamb meat. Moni ordered dosas and chicken biriyani along mutton paya First came dosas with roti pachadi and coconut chutney.. roti pachadi was so yummy that Moni finished off half of our dosas before Moni could get the sambar and paya.. seriously guys roti pachadi was worth selling in a jar.. Then mutton paya.. delicious.. right amount of spice and heat.. good proportion.. Moni had a big smile on Moni's face when Moni finished off Moni's dosa with mutton paya Then came chicken biriyani. chicken biriyani was not bad but not the best in town
reviews.name: Moni

reviews.text: Sitting and waiting for Kevin's order of Tandoori Chicken  Vege Korma  and Butter Chicken to be made fresh to order and wanted to check - in to say Pakwan Indian Bistro is a blessing. Pakwan Indian Bistro is a family - run business with a uniquely Southern Indian twist that puts the traditionally Northern Indian food spots you see everywhere to shame with it is  quality and variety of flavors  and Kevin do also love Northern Indian cuisine but Northern Indian cuisine has become all too commonplace . Kevin work in a nearby office park and love that Kevin can even walk here to enjoy Pakwan Indian Bistro's menu. It is really sad that the local competition goes out of the local competition's way to lower the reputation of successful newcomers to save successful newcomers from having to evolve  as you can tell by the obviously planted   - star reviews mixed in with all of the legit   -  and   - star ones from people who actually came in to eat. Still working Kevin's way through their menu and have loved everything Kevin have tried so far whether for lunch or dinner. Kevin eat keto as well which can be a challenge but gems such as Butter Chicken come chock full of delicious creamy protein fat and you can make it low carb by passing on the rice and naan bread. Consider Kevin a happy regular and soon to be king of check - ins if Kevin remember to load up Yelp each time !
reviews.name: Kevin

reviews.text: The best butter chicken Heather have had since moving to Arizona ! Heather also thought Pakwan Indian Bistro's garlic naan was amazing. Overall the food is simply fantastic !
reviews.name: Heather

reviews.text: Food is delicious.pakwan special biryani has a unique authentic flavor which you dong find in any other Indian restaurants . Andhra chepala pulusu is the best . Great food  ! keep it up.

reviews.text: Expensive and mediocre Indian food  small portions. Pass on this one.

reviews.text: The best fresh oven baked bread Miki021 ever had anywhere in AZ  if you want traditional food and bread in east valley  besides Persian Room you should definitely check Pakwan Indian Bistro out. Chicken kababs  curries and etc. is phenomenal here ! The food is like homemade and traditional you would feel like you are  sitting in a restaurant in Delhi  not on Chandler blvd lol

reviews.text: The hospitality is amazing  -  add to The hospitality the great quality of food and the late night options makes Pakwan Indian Bistro an all - time favorite Indian restaurant for me.

reviews.text: Wow  Pakwan Indian Bistro is hands down Amanda's favorite Indian restaurant ! The food is very good and Amanda m quite the picky eater. reviews.text: What a treat -  South Indian Food ! Come for the biryani. Disposable plates and utensils  but the flavors are delicious.

reviews.text: The food was good -  Chicken    is always the best. Really glad to have a halal option in the vicinity.

reviews.text: BEWARE ! What started out as a seemingly normal Indian dinning experience quickly turned into the most horrific culinary experience of my life... Sabrina really wanted to like Pakwan Indian Bistro but sadly Sabrina have nothing but awful things to say about Pakwan Indian Bistro. Sabrina think Sabrina m developing PTSD just thinking about the meal Sabrina received  but enough with the jokes let fill you in on the details that matter... Sabrina started out our dinner with a mixed pakora which was super greasy but had a good flavor. For the main course Sabrina decided to try out the lamb korma and the chicken tika masala... this is where it all went horribly wrong... when the lamb korma arrived at our table the lamb korma smelled rancid... the smell will forever be etched into my memory. The chicken in the chicken tika masala was pink  and Sabrina m not talking just a little pink... The chicken in the tika masala was raw. Needless to say if you value your health please take caution when choosing to dine here.

reviews.text: Viswanath tried multiple items in the menu at Pakwan Indian Bistro. Viswanath find the chicken biriyani to be amazing.

reviews.text: Food was good which is why Emily m leaving it at   stars but Emily  and my husband  had food poisoning for three days straight. Emily have an iron stomach and can handle any spice  and additionally have never had food poisoning before.

reviews.text: This is the best Indian food RaeAnne have  had thus far. RaeAnne ordered chili paneer as an appetizer and shared cashew curry and shrimp biryani. reviews.text: Pakwan Indian Bistro fantastic. Pakwan Indian Bistro tout Pakwan Indian Bistro as having the best curry in the valley and Wade would have to say that Wade can not  disagree. reviews.text: Just ordered take - out from here. The owners are incredibly friendly and answered all of our questions on the menu. My wife and Miguel ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala  garlic naan  and a Paner Dosa. the Chicken Tikka Masala garlic naan  and a Paner Dosa were extremely well made and flavorful and came out in exactly    minutes as promised. Every restaurant  level of spiciness is different. Miguel asked for a mild Chicken Tikka Masala and to our palette a mild Chicken Tikka Masala was more of a mild medium  which was fine . But  just mentioning as a tip when ordering your level of spiciness. Pakwan Indian Bistro is a quintessential family restaurant and Miguel highly recommend Pakwan Indian Bistro for eat in or take out.

reviews.text: Pakwan Indian Bistro First time trying biryani with Masala. Good flavors. Palak paneer thumbs up.

reviews.text: The food is very good. Lots of flavor and even some heat. The archana chicken had a ton of flavor. The rice was also delicious. reviews.text: My girlfriend and Farmer wanted some Indian food the other day and decided to try Pakwan Indian Bistro out and were glad Farmer did !  !  ! Pakwan Indian Bistro have tons of different food options and Farmer decided on the veggie samosas and pakwan briyani and was not disappointed ! reviews.text: love Wanlee Loy. Rajive just moved into Wanlee Loy recently and Rajive am glad Rajive found Wanlee Loy to grab a quick take out and maybe have a quick drink while Rajive wait. Rajive will be telling Rajive's friends about Wanlee Loy. Wanlee Loy

reviews.text: if you are from mumbai like me then you will definitely find Wanlee Loy close to what Jovel find in mumbai. Definitely a must go. Also for some reason am really impressed with Wanlee Loy's clean washrooms.

reviews.text: Wanlee Loy is not a typical hakka restaurant. Wanlee Loy's food is light and easy on the stomach Their food's also not overly spicy or salty ! Wanlee Loy have some options that are very healthy and you can have some options that are very healthy without breaking your diet plan ! Diet meal :  Try the cashew chicken the cashew chicken comes with white rice and the whole dish is just chicken and vegetables with some flavorful curry. the whole dish  not oily either. You can skip white rice and just have chicken and vegetables. A little bit more spicy : Beef chilli with gravy was a tad more spicy  but Beef chilli with gravy was still very easy on the stomach and very flavorful. Wanlee Loy seems to be very quite and off the radar. There were some old people sitting and having tea but nobody besides us was having food. Wanlee Loy also have great Chicken Corn Soup ! Would definitely recommend for a light lunch.
reviews.name: Shaheer

reviews.text: Hakka Indian Chinese with a better flavor There are umpteen Hakka Indian restaurants in the GTA. However  this outlet definitely offers better taste than most. Envoirnment is very simple and clean. Service was great; food was even better. Amount of food served for a lunch special at a very reasonable price is incredible. Jittu would prefer this outlet above many other Hakka Indian restaurants if this outlet was any closer to where Jittu stay. A must for anyone living in the area.
reviews.name: Jittu

reviews.text: My bf and Yvonne came here last night after work. Yvonne were not  sure where to go as it was already    pm by the time My bf was off work. Yvonne found this place on yelp.. was not  sure what to expect as there was only    reviews and no one inside. only    reviews were good and this place was open till so Yvonne are  like what heck .. The venue inside was nice and clean inside  Yvonne were the only ones there. Yvonne ordered seven vegetables with cashew  manchurian chicken  and beef chilli fries rice. Water was from the tap Yvonne could hear Yvonne pour Water  and a can of diet coke. The service is like any other Asian place  you get their attention when you need their attention. Yvonne was quick as Yvonne was in the front  but not the type where they come ask you if you are  okay every    mins. Food tasted wonderful  Yvonne had lots of left overs and the overall price was about    before tip. The only weird thing was some man came In half way through our meal to order a beer. . Stared at Yvonne for a few moments then went to sit down behind us... then    mins  later sat at a table beside us and was pretty much staring the whole time until some man was done some man's beer.. that was just a little uncomfortable.. not their fault ..but was still weird lol There was lot on the menu Yvonne still want to try.. Yvonne will  be coming back again  !
reviews.name: Yvonne

reviews.text: Not really authentic Hakka food maybe more Indian Hakka food. The Chef  Special Fried Rice is a little burned and the look of The Chef  Special Fried Rice is not very appealing. The service is good tho. But probably wo not  come back there are lots more good food out there it is just so - so food.

reviews.text: another mission of looking for good take out in toronto. Lynn used to live in this neighbourhood  way before all these plazas popped up  am Lynn dating myself  and every time Lynn come around here  which is not too often  Lynn always seem to find something of interest. this time it is a dingy little hakka restaurant at the corner of this plaza. When Lynn walked in on a week night  a dingy little hakka restaurant at the corner of this plaza was dark and empty  save for one table of south asian men. Lynn looked at a dingy little hakka restaurant at the corner of this plaza's menu on the counter and ordered the typical dishes :  chili fish  manchurian fried rice  szechuan fried beans  and manchurian chicken. Lynn got a discount for take out. The portions were huge ! both Lynn's dad and Lynn's husband loved the food. Lynn thought both my dad and my husband were decent too. Lynn think the total was only      -  great bang for the buck ! Lynn know Lynn's husband will definitely want to eat there again next Lynn are back in town.

reviews.text: Allen have  been to a lot of hakka places like federicks  Lin garden hakka work etc... And Wanlee Loy stands out due to the food and value. The pakoras here are excellent. The pakoras here are crispy  not oily at all  and full of flavour. Portion size is also huge. Chili chicken is also good compared to other hakka places. Allen usually get takeout and it seems like the choice for most people as Wanlee Loy is normally pretty empty in terms of dine in customers. You also get     off on orders over     if you pay cash.

reviews.text: Nice family run restaurant serving good tasting food with decent sized portions. reviews.text: Wanlee Loy  a small place for large groups to come and eat. The service is nice and polite usually but today The service was a bit rude. reviews.text: Wanlee Loy is a great choice for a single diner like Jennifer. different choice of   plate dish for   . with a pop The selection is good for both spicy and non spicy lovers even for a Hakka restaurant And of course Jennifer ordered Jennifer extra spicy. reviews.text: Yet again another amazing experience ! !  ! Great food. Fresh. Variety. Cheap. And amazing service !  !  ! Monika just wish Monika did not  have to empty Monika's dishes into the garbage and bins. It looks gross a little. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant have renovated since Monika's last visit. reviews.text: Nidhi have  been here   times and do not  think Nidhi want to come back again. There are so many good thali places in GTA Nidhi am surprised why Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is popular. Food :      too oily nothing special ordinary and sadly tastes like it is  been out for days and days. Service :      a lot of shouting from servers and no greetings manners Ambience and location : way too cramped  floors are sticky and dirty  tables are dirty it sort of kills the appetite. And it is  been this way during all of Nidhi's visits. So Nidhi doubt it was a one time thing. Price : Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is  very reasonably priced but quality is what matters. Nidhi would rather pay a couple of dollars more for better food. And in all honesty in the same price range you can get better Thalis in other GTA locations.
reviews.name: Nidhi

reviews.text: Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant Great and tasty North Indian food. Lunch combo nominal price and tasty curries. Chaats are very nice. Paav bhaji Gulab jamun parathas badam milk are popular and tasty here
reviews.name: Meenakshi

reviews.text: When Sonia walked through the door  Sonia could tell Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant was going to be a real authentic Indian restaurant. The food here is delicious. The sweets are fresh and the staff let  you sample before you buy. Prices and service are fair. If parking is full  park across the street. Sonia would highly recommend Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant and will definitely return !
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text: Yet again another amazing experience ! !  ! Great food. Fresh. Variety. Cheap. And amazing service !  !  ! Monika just wish Monika did not  have to empty Monika's dishes into the garbage and bins. It looks gross a little. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant have renovated since Monika's last visit. New tables and chairs ! !  ! But Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant need another TV. It  nice to watch the Bollywood actors and listen to the music.
reviews.name: Monika

reviews.text: My go - to Indian restaurant  Dominique have  never been disappointed. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant       vegetarian  affordable and delicious. Parking can be tricky. Do not  let the plaza discourage you  the food is delicious and the girls who work there are very nice. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant curries often times change but Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant have the staples like daal and palak paneer.
reviews.name: Dominique

reviews.text: Stopped in for lunch and puck some sweets. If you keep your eyes and nose close outside and make your way inside then you can find great sweets and decent Punjabi vegetarian food. There is a pan shop next door and outside is coated with people spitting that on side walks. Disgusting : ordered a thali and you can pick which sides.
