Do not order puri since the one Jawid got was cold and made who knows when. Completely deflated and was more like batura instead of puri  supposed to be fluffy but was chewy . Chana was bit hard and so was ghobi... they had some rice and attempted salad but some rice and attempted salad were not edible. Ended taking a spoon each and throwing rest away. Naan looked fresh. All in all people who miss home cooked Punjabi meal should visit. There are Ana poorna in Santa Clara with better taste yet home cooked. Sweets looked good and yet have to try Sweets. Will visit again if the outside area gets bit cleaner.
reviews.name: Jawid

reviews.text: Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant  good but the staff is a bit rude. Since last   -   weeks Neha have been to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant   times but still the behavior is same. Food is ok. Neha just like jalebi and imarti that is  all. Otherwise all the curries have same taste.
reviews.name: Neha

reviews.text: Ordered takeout. Everything was extremely delicious. Amazing flavours. Very good naan. One of the best samosas Sylvia have  ever had. Good service.
reviews.name: Sylvia

reviews.text: Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant  Fast food style. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant  not fancy but that is  ok. Staff are happy ppl. Food is amazing. Monika hate the parking lot. And the windows are always so steamy. You will leave smelling like curry. Kinda like when you leave grandmas house  lol.
reviews.name: Monika

reviews.text: Vikram's extended family catered food from here for Thatha  satyanarayana puja and Thatha satyanarayana puja's   th birthday. Apparently Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant can prepare food w o garlic and onions for Thatha satyanarayana puja and his   th birthday. The white rice w peas veg pulao    malai kofta mixed vegetable curry  mattar paneer  and bhoodi raita were all on point. Naan looked slightly different than most of what Vikram have  seen but Naan was still delicious nonetheless. There are so many Indian restaurants here and in Vikram's   -   times Vikram have  been here over the years it is been great to try so many of so many Indian restaurants out because so many Indian restaurants are all so tasty.
reviews.name: Vikram

reviews.text: Nalini love to try foods from different cultures  and Nalini found Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant while on the bus and decided to check Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant out... Nalini got   veg. Thali  for Nalini's sister and Nalini Nalini were so excited ! The food was decent the plating and packaging are so neat !  ! And the staff are nice Nalini happened to get extra naan so Nalini's total came up to     not bad actually ! The only complaints Nalini have is that there was a pepper of some sort that was fried and Nalini ate a pepper of some sort that was fried and a pepper of some sort that was fried was extremely bitter Nalini had to spit a pepper of some sort that was fried out also the naan tasted sour Nalini have  never had naan like that. Nalini was an experience and Nalini do not  think Nalini will  be back again.
reviews.name: Nalini

reviews.text: Looking for something greasy Indian Vegetarian  Head on over to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant and order a thali -  an assortment of various dishes served in a silver round tray  -  kinda like tapas for those non - South Asians out there. Afterwards  down a thali -  an assortment of various dishes served in a silver round tray  -  kinda like tapas for those non - South Asians out there with alot of water. While Singh like Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant  Singh will  only eat here once or twice a year  Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is  a greasy spoon. The decor on the inside is simple; the interior slightly awkward to navigate through  -  the seating arrangement is designed to maximize the most of the limited square footage. Oh  and the area Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is in ai not  that pretty  so beware. Despite some strange affection to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant Singh will  only give Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant    .
reviews.name: Singh

reviews.text: Its   : pm on a Tuesday there are only three people in Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant including myself. Leda ordered a veg. thali and it takes    mins. to get Leda's order. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is dead compared to other days. Leda would expect to have Leda's order quick especially considering the food is already made. Leda like the food and some of the staff are nice. That  why Leda keep coming back but the wait time is terrible. Leda do not  know the names of some of the dishes. Leda guess one suggestion Leda could make for not just this restaurant but others similar to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is to put a label on each dish. It would attract more customers as more customers would not be as intimidated.
reviews.name: Leda

reviews.text: Right on bovaird   location is convenient. James tried twice but James are  not convinced with the taste of food  ! Breads were good but gravies needs attention  !
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Bryce love Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant way out of the way from just about everything but Bryce make the hour plus transit journey frequently on weekends. The food is delicious. The food  not the best Indian food you will  ever eat  but The food is pretty darn tasty just the same. Bryce live for Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's saag. The naan is freshly made and so good Bryce have  never bothered getting any other roti. The gajar ka halwa is also dreamy. Soooo sugary and soooo buttery. The food is not  terribly hot - spicy but Bryce find The food is  increased in heat a little over the last couple of years. The excellent part is that for like   bucks you get three veg dishes of your choice  roti  rice dessert  and pickle. It leaves you stuffed. Way better than most buffets for a lot less money. The other handy thing about Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is that you can pick up all manner of sweets to take home for your diabetic coma needs. One can never have enough jalebi or burfi in my opinion. Anyway  if you are hungry in Etobicoke or looking for a nice long bus ride then Bryce highly recommend Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant.
reviews.name: Bryce

reviews.text: Neat bright diner with simple and easy to read menus. Prices are cheap  seating area is limited compared to Brars but Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is  slightly cheaper and a bit less grungy looking. Jessa ordered a veggie thali for   . with tax.
reviews.name: Jessa

reviews.text: Pros :   -  Naan is amazing. Seriously good ! ! -  Thali is at a great price for the quantity. Value  =  extremely high ! -  Malai kofta was exquisite. Mushroom masala was amazing. Cons : -  Place is pretty small. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant had around   tables and none of around   tables seated more than    unless you counted the first table which is near the main door. the first table which is near the main door is usually avoided as cold air enters through every time someone enters Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant. Fix the seating arrangement interior and EASY   stars !  ! : -  Achari paneer was too dry and not as tasty as Aasawari would have liked. Verdict : Takeout !  !
reviews.name: Aasawari

reviews.text: Like Singh A.  Roma have  got a pretty soft spot for Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant. Thali - style restaurants fill that falafel type of fast food niche where Indian cuisine is concerned. For   . you get an assortment of dishes with dessert  rice and buttery naan. Though lots of the items are greasy and  whited out  the variety and presentation is great. Do not  expect a spice - attack because you wo not  get a spice - attack. The food just is not  that spicy. The food  high on salt. The mango and plain lassis are made really well here  though sometimes a little too sweet for Roma's liking so adjust your order accordingly  because Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant are  very accommodating to requests. Customer service is great and Roma have  repeated Roma's visits to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant as Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is  a lot cleaner than Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's competitors nearby.
reviews.name: Roma

reviews.text: So Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is pre - renovation Salad King meets Indian Food. Order at the counter  find a seat and listen for someone to yell your number. There is little to no pretension to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant. Decor and comfort are minimal. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant pump out good quality Indian Vegetarian food and that is  about it. Get the thali  and go nuts. There is not  a bad choice for your dishes. Rohan m a huge fan of Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's kofta. Every time Rohan go back to Toronto Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is Rohan's  nd food stop.
reviews.name: Rohan

reviews.text: A no frills place with amazing food. Payal were visiting Toronto for a wedding and our group was craving snacks Indian food. Came across Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant and loved everything. Payal were a group of    people and Payal took over half the place. Ordered almost everything but Payal's favorite was chole bhature. chole bhature heavenly. Could not  stop eating being in New York Payal have yet to find a place that serves chole bhature. Other things were very good too  must try.
reviews.name: Payal

reviews.text: Upon a friend  insistence Shantanu landed here one fine Sunday evening. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is nestled away barely noticeable amidst a plethora of Indian shops. Shantanu was surprised by how unclean the carpet was. You could see the left overs strewn across trash can even before making it to register. Man Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is dirt cheap. And worth it. Shantanu got Thali for   . Paav Bhaji for   . and Ras Malai for   . All good stuff. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant have a big assortment of sweets at    per pound which Shantanu will try during our next visit. That is if Shantanu can overlook the unsanitary ambiance. And do not  even think about using the washroom. Stairs leading downstairs are hazardous  :
reviews.name: Shantanu

reviews.text: One of the top   places around Toronto to have good authentic Indian vegetarian food. Emm love the punjabi flavours Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant have in Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's dishes. Cannot beat value for money for the veg thali. And   big samosas for    is hands down the winner if you are hungry and have no time to sit and eat. Highly recommend Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's Palak paneer  Daal Makhani Muter Paneer  Chole Naan  Samosas and Pav Bhaji.
reviews.name: Emm

reviews.text: Ordered catering   Reasonable prices and really tasty food with generous quantities Ordered methi malai gravy  dal makhani  paneer achari with tava roti Dinesh would not  recommend the naan since the naan get chewy if kept out for long . Sticky with tava roti which comes. Ask to make it without oil   Cheers
reviews.name: Dinesh

reviews.text: This review is for Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's catering services. Pooja was extremely impressed with Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant  catering. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant prepared excellent food for a fair price and also delivered excellent food to Pooja's home for a reasonable fee. excellent food was also delivered on time and packed securely so excellent food did not  stain or spill. excellent food was t particularly spicy  but excellent food was tasty. Pooja would be happy to order Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's catering again.
reviews.name: Pooja

reviews.text: Food :   . Service : Food was nothing special and seats especially booths were VERY cramped.
reviews.name: Shivani

reviews.text: Justin have  been going to Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant for well over a decade  and Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is  always been good ! The food is spot on consistently  and the service is quite fast. The thali has always been Justin's go - to dish but The thali is  not the only thing on the menu. The assortment of sweets and snacks is also something which everyone must try !
reviews.name: Justin

reviews.text: Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is not where you should take your date or go out with your friends if you want somewhere to chill or share a drink. If  however  you are  in the area hungry  looking for a place to have a bite Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is it. For   . + tax you will  get a big metal plate with rice  salad and   options of veggies. No  there is  no chicken  meat  lamb  fish or any other traditional options. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant is strictly vegetarian but man Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant's food is tasty. Where else can you pay    for a healthy meal that will  leave you full  Andrei do not  know that many places in Toronto. The value for the money is unbeatable IMHO. Today was IMHO's first time here and Andrei absolutely loved the food. Did Andrei mention that Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant sell traditional Indian sweets  which are equally good
reviews.name: Andrei

reviews.text: Jay have done a takeout from here a couple of times and a takeout has been great. Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant have quite limited vegan options but having said that  quite limited vegan options are good. Jay have tried Samosa Chat Pani Puri some of the non - dairy sabzis and rotis. The food is delicious and the portions are filling. The staff is quite good. Not that very friendly in a North American way but The staff do The staff's job well which is pretty enough for Jay. Parking can be a problem since this plaza has a small lot and too many shops. But there may be some empty spaces in the lot on the opposite side of the road or the RBC branch next to this plaza.
reviews.name: Jay

reviews.text: Good quality and great value. Margarita have been coming here for over eight years and Rajdhani Sweets & Restaurant remains one of Margarita's favourite vegetarian takeout restaurants. Margarita m not even sure how they are  able to keep the prices so low. The Jalebis are to die for ! Thank you for existing ! P.S. the only downfall is trying to find parking in the plaza
reviews.name: Margarita

reviews.text: Roopika's husband bought chole bhature yesterday. While eating Roopika saw that the bhaturas were soaked with oil approx   table spoon of oil in one bhatura Very disappointed  !  !  !
reviews.name: Roopika

restaurants.name: Urban Hakka
restaurants.category: Hakka, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Chinese, Indian

photos.caption: Manchurian beef noodles.  Tasty barely any beef.  Tastes like a familiar Chinese noodle dish not very Hakka or Manchurian enough for me.
photos.label: food

reviews.text: Jessica are so happy that this restaurant has come to Jessica's neighbourhood ! The chowmein is delicious as is the crispy beef  Manchurian fish  and butter chicken. Jessica also like that this restaurant deliver !
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Probably Richa's favourite Indian Chinese restaurant in Toronto. The service and the food  The service and the food  both were fantastic. Richa ordered the Manchurian style chicken and Chicken Hakka noodles. Delicious ! ! !  ! Just amazing. Richa got hot and sour soup to start with. The temperature  flavour  consistency everything was just perfect. And Richa ended Richa's lunch with their mango lassi which was so refreshing with just enough sweetness. Ca not  wait to go back and try other items on the menu.
reviews.name: Richa

reviews.text: My mom and Radhika were excited to see a Hakka spot in this neighbourhood... Apparently a Hakka spot in this neighbourhood just opened a week or two ago ! Radhika walked in to a Hakka spot in this neighbourhood and were greeted warmly and seated right away. Radhika ordered the mango salad  crispy wontons manchurian shrimp  and Singapore noodles all of which were delicious ! crispy wontons were my favourite. They make their food flavourful and not too spicy  but provide two types of chili sauce for those of us that love the heat. Overall  great experience... My mom and Radhika were really pleased with the meal and the friendly staff.
reviews.name: Radhika

reviews.text: Ann was excited that a Hakka restaurant opened up in the area but was very disappointed with the portion size for take out. the portion size for take out are very small ! Ann ordered several meat dishes and each container was barely filled half way. Most of each container was filled with sauce  hardly any meat. Ann was not  expecting generous portions  but something at least decent for the price Ann paid. The rice that came with it was warm  but dry and hard. Overall the flavour of several meat dishes were decent but Ann would not  go back. It  simply not worth the money.
reviews.name: Ann

reviews.text: Milly ordered this for delivery to the Yonge Eglinton area and the food arrived faster than most UberEats or Foodora deliveries did with restaurants that were closer to us. A week before passing by Urban Hakka Milly were talking about how there are not  any Hakka options around the Yonge Eglinton area. Urban Hakka sure have the advantage of charging a premium at Urban Hakka  most of Urban Hakka's dishes are     + . Milly ordered :  lollipop chicken  chilli chicken  manchurian beef butter chicken  Singapore noodles  fried rice and stir fry bok choy. Everything tasted really good. The ones that stood out more were the chicken   beef dishes and fried rice stood. Milly can not  say it is  the best Hakka food Milly have  ever had but Milly would come back for my next Hakka craving in the Yonge Eglinton area.
reviews.name: Milly

reviews.text: Anita ordered from the lunch special menu only  got a spicy garlic tofu comes with soup salad spring roll and plum sauce not sure about soup salad spring roll and plum sauce but a spicy garlic tofu was really good well cooked mixed with veggies yum yum definitely ordering again ..
reviews.name: Anita

reviews.text: You have to try lollipop chicken and bombay chicken. Urban Hakka is probably the best hakka place around this area.
reviews.name: Ramesh Bahadur

reviews.text: Urban Hakka is new and clean. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. The food is just ok  Lindsey m not sure Lindsey would  ever feel the need to go back. Urban Hakka's Hakka game is weak. The chili chicken was lacking all the chili  Lindsey m so confused as to why Urban Hakka served us chili chicken with no chili. Lindsey's crispy sesame beef had more heat to My crispy sesame beef than The chili chicken. Having said this Lindsey's beef was good Lindsey would  order My crispy sesame beef again if Lindsey went back. Lindsey do not  think Lindsey will be going back because chili chicken is a staple for a Hakka restaurant. If Lindsey want Chinese food Lindsey already have Lindsey's go to and if Lindsey want Indian Lindsey know where to go. Urban Hakka is nothing special and Urban Hakka is  also not terrible. Overall Lindsey was disappointed in Urban Hakka. Lindsey was excited to have a Hakka restaurant in the neighbourhood and Lindsey will still make the drive to Scarborough when Lindsey want Hakka.
reviews.name: Lindsey

reviews.text: Great vegetarian rice  ! Kind and friendly service : Kris usually do takeout which is great.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text: Excellent delivery from Skip the Dishes last night. Chili shrimp with gravy  shrimp wontons and hakka style chow mein. All delicious  large portions  reasonably priced. Delivery was delayed by about    minutes but well woth the wait.
reviews.name: Raggedy

reviews.text: This place was absolutely amazing ! Good lighting intimate setting  and great food ! Kikee Auviance tried the Chilli Chicken  Crispy Beef  and the Chowmein with chicken  beef  and shrimp. All were absolutely delightful. This is Kikee Auviance's first time in Canada and This place is a great first stop !
reviews.name: Kikee Auviance

reviews.text: Chicken Pad Thai was Meh. More tofu than chicken. Ordered General Tso chicken not spicy Chicken Pad Thai came with extra chili peppers. Slg had asked for extra mild so Slg got extra spicy. Sent Chicken Pad Thai back it came done right. Not great value for   .
reviews.name: Slg

reviews.text: Absolutely shocked. Such good food.. in Midtown  impossible. High quality food. Affordable Price Point. Please Please Please.. Open more locations and Become very successful. Monty am a Fan now.
reviews.name: Monty

reviews.text: The food was amazing ! Tameka would definitely come back here. Tameka got here almost an hour til closing and the staff was super pleasant and helpful. Since this was our first time at their location the waiter helped us pick delectable dishes :  sesame crispy chicken  chicken beef shrimp chow menu  and the chili chicken.
reviews.name: Tameka

reviews.text: Probably the closest to Mumbai - style Hakka Chinese Prasanna have  tasted. After ordering take out a bunch of times and loving every dish Prasanna have  ordered  did a lunch dine - in. The Bento box lunch is great value for money as well. Great eat - in experience !
reviews.name: Prasanna

reviews.text: Amazing place. Upscale feel with jazz and moderate pricing. Clean flavours and spices. A very rare spot with actual table cloths and rice dishes at the     mark with shrimp. Small soup is enough for   or   ppl for    only ! For a place like Amazing place Mehrab was expecting the pricing to be higher and flavours to be more common among the dishes but no ! Amazing place maintain quality of flavours in the food and decor. Definitely enjoyed Mehrab's time and will return.
reviews.name: Mehrab

reviews.text: The food tastes just okay  pretty western taste ! Lori would have preferred more authentic Indian. Lori will go and again if Lori m close to the area
reviews.name: Lori

reviews.text: Jessica walked by Urban Hakka and realized Jessica were craving Hakka so decided to stop in. Our waiter was  super friendly and attentive. Urban Hakka was not  busy on a Sunday evening so the atmosphere was very relaxed. The food was satisfying ! Jessica do not  know if Jessica would  say Urban Hakka was the best Hakka Jessica have  ever had  but Jessica was not  disappointed. Jessica ordered the vegetable chow mein  chicken wontons  and chili chicken  with  gravy  . Jessica loved the chili chicken -  - definitely Jessica's favorite  of the three. Jessica could definitely see Jessica stopping by again if Jessica was in the neighborhood  ! Would recommend if you are  looking for a low - key restaurant  with fair prices.
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Glad to finally have a Hakka restaurant in this neighborhood ! Ordered delivery a few times  never been disappointed. Good food  !
reviews.name: Asmeeta

reviews.text: Was here last week while on a work meeting .. R got the crispy beef and chilli chicken. crispy beef was well cooked and the  chicken  was  tasty. Wont be back  but only because R am rarely in the area .. R do recommend you try the food here if you are in the area  because the food here is very fresh and tasty.
reviews.name: R

reviews.text: Awesome food great staff a bit pricey but hey you are in the center of hispterville Toronto on Yonge street
reviews.name: Omar

reviews.text: Unlike any other hakka restaurant David have been to. Urban Hakka is more of a fine dine kinda feel. David ordered the hot and sour soup  lollipop chicken   shrimp green curry  crispy chicken and chicken tandoori chowmein. All the dishes were very flavorful and at The end David finished everything David ordered . The presentations of All the dishes were very nice and the service friendly . Urban Hakka has been opened for over a month and David see a lot of take out orders for uber eats and skip the dish.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: This is based on uber eats. Rachel have been complaining for so long that there are no hakka restaurants in the area  which sucks considering Rachel grew up in Scarborough where they were everywhere. Rachel's prayers have been answered ! Rachel saw this on uber eats and decided to try two things Rachel absolutely love from hakka restaurants :  chicken and corn soup  and chilli chicken. two things Rachel absolutely love from hakka restaurants :  chicken and corn soup  and chilli chicken were both so delicious. chicken and corn soup had delicious  big chunks of chicken pieces inside  and was a huge portion for a small. chilli chicken was so flavorful  and although Rachel do like a bit more spice to Rachel chilli chicken still was so delicious. The prices were extremely reasonable  especially for the area. Rachel will definitely be ordering from here again.
reviews.name: Rachel

reviews.text: Take - out order. Food was terrible. Everything tasted the same everything was just very salty  bland and black coloured. No colour or sign of freshness. Our pakoras were raw on the inside. The Tom - Yum soup was SO salty and also had a weird sweet after taste and the garnishes in The Tom - Yum soup were really odd. Wo not  ever order take out from here again. Even the Bombay paneer was very odd. Was a stock based sauce thickened with cornstarch. WTF. Was expecting a cream sauce. Almost      spent on garbage. Dont get me wrong the quantity was very nice for the price but quality was way down.
reviews.name: Ares

reviews.text: Initially Neil was disappointed because Neil's order was this minor issue. Aside from this minor issue  Neil found that the quality and flavor of the dishes Neil ordered were surprisingly good. Neil ordered the following items for take - out :   Spring Rolls Vegetables  -       decent  Chilli Chicken  Gravy   -        excellent Rice Noodles Hakka Style Beef   -       boring Sesame Crispy Beef       excellent  Neil hope to see consistency. Neil will order again and update this review.
reviews.name: Neil

reviews.text: Love Urban Hakka. Try the chilli chicken dry sesame beef  lollipop chicken and Singapore noodles. So glad Urban Hakka opened in our neighbourhood !
reviews.name: Saba

reviews.text: Food is pretty good with generous portions for the price. The hot and sour soup has large pieces of meat  chicken  beef or veg options Josh think . Decor is tasteful and music classical   jazzy. Good for a date  passing by or even take - out. Tldr; Good value for the quality of the food and ambiance.
reviews.name: Josh

reviews.text: Been here thrice within a month and would go back again when in Toronto ! The best part is that the portion of the servings is good enough and the price is reasonable. Loved their Singapore noodles  American chopsy and veg curries options served with rice.
reviews.name: Pooja

reviews.text: Akash have been to Urban Hakka as part of office lunch on Fridays. Urban Hakka has a good lunch menu with a variety of options. Food is decent but not the best Hakka Akash have had in the GTA. For the lunch price Urban Hakka is an ok place to visit.
reviews.name: Akash

reviews.text: Urban Hakka had a very pretty in the dining area but then the floors to the bathroom and the entire hall was sticky and greasy. Dishes were not spicy  but the flavor was quite good. And the hot sauce on the side with peanut and oil was great ! Jia had fish pakora and Bombay chicken. Urban Hakka an okay place really. But Jia still prefer some of other hakka places in scarborough.
reviews.name: Jia

reviews.text: Sarah got take out from here  -  chilli chicken  crispy beef  tandoori chicken chow mein Gobi Manchurian  cauliflower  veg pakora and fried rice. The standouts were the chilli chicken  with gravy  and Gobi Manchurian  dry . the chilli chicken  with gravy  and Gobi Manchurian  dry had decent heat and were very flavourful. veg pakora and fried rice were pretty good. Sarah was disappointed with tandoori chicken chow mein as tandoori chicken chow mein did not  have that  smoky  flavour usually you have with Hakka noodles. Lastly  crispy beef was a little more on the tough side although the flavour was nice. Overall the good outweighs the not so good and Sarah would definitely return here. It not the best Hakka food Sarah have  had before but decent. Sarah did find the prices and portions very reasonable -  Sarah got a ton of food  !
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Vincent came here for a late lunch around  PM on a Sunday as a party of five and were seated immediately. The first thing Vincent noticed was how spacious the interior was  with both a front and a back dining area  along with an outdoor patio that was not  being used at that time. There were a number of other patrons and the place seemed decently busy. Vincent ordered the chicken pakoras  shrimp hakka style rice noodles  tandoori chicken fried rice  crispy beef  and chili chicken gravy. The chicken pakoras came out first  and were covered in a sweet sauce. Vincent was only used to eating the dry version  but the sweet sauce pakoras came as a pleasant surprise. Vincent also loved how savory all the entrees were. crispy beef was a party of five's favourite dish. So sweet. So sesame - y. So savory. They also make their own chili oil garlic hot sauce inhouse. Vincent would definitely recommend trying their own chili oil garlic hot sauce. It was a party of five's first time trying Hakka cuisine  but Vincent were very impressed despite the complaints. Hakka is a great thing to happen to Toronto !
reviews.name: Vincent

reviews.text: Crispy beef butter chicken  lollipop chicken  chili chicken.... all .. staff delightful helpful. Highly recommend !  !
reviews.name: Azhar

reviews.text: Came by on a weekend for dinner with a few friends Easily the most classy hakka place Mark have  ever been to...they obviously need to make the locals feel comfortable. Mark was a bit scared for the quality of the dishes as Mark's favourite hakka places do not  have    tablecloths    good service and    ambient music Mark ordered chili chicken  chicken pakoras and Singaporean noodles. Mark m relieved to say all of it is outstanding and compares favourably to Mark's favourite east end spots. the dishes are brought out crispy and hot with a solid amount of spice. Prices were also surprisingly affordable for the location. the location do a steady stream of takeout too Mark think everyone is happy to finally have a good non - Italian spot in the neighborhood !
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text: Solidly  . stars  but James will give the benefit of the doubt  despite my price concerns  because James like having Hakka food available in the neighbourhood. Ordered lunch for the crew through  Skip and everything was solid. James ordered the crispy beef chili chicken  tandoori chicken chow mein  plus veggie and chicken pakora  -  hot garlic style. Everyone enjoyed the food. Pros : Crispy Beef and Chili Chicken James spicy and flavourful good quality  and enjoyed by all. Cons : -  Prices are quite high for Hakka  perhaps due to Yonge Street rent vs. Scarborough for many places. -   tandoori chicken chow mein was rather bland and not extra spicy  as ordered. -  Pakora are very much on the dry side  and required a lots of sauce to rescue Pakora  the hot - garlic sauce coating on the chicken pakora was odd  but saved the chicken pakora from being a total bust. Veggie Pakora were a dry disappointment. Federicks or Wong  Pakora win by a long margin. Overall a nice date - night location  solid food overall  but rather pricey  and skip the pakora.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: The food and portions are awesome. The staffs are friendly and the place is nice and clean. Highly recommend !
reviews.name: Viko

reviews.text: Oh Urban Hakka... such a mixed review. Probably somewhere between a   and a  . On one occasion Ruth dined in Urban Hakka and had the Tandoori Chicken Chow Mein. the Tandoori Chicken Chow Mein was probably one of the best in Ruth's life  -  such an amazing blend of Indian and Chinese dishes. the Tandoori Chicken Chow Mein was Ruth's first time trying Hakka and Ruth was a true convert. Desperate for more  Ruth ordered take out from Urban Hakka just days later. Ruth ordered the Cashew Chicken and was super excited because Ruth love love love nutty chicken dishes  but the Cashew Chicken turned out to be a real disappointment  as was Ruth's partner  dish. The sauce was just blegh and Ruth could not  even eat my partner  dish. the Tandoori Chicken Chow Mein would keep Ruth coming back regardless  but Ruth would  be wary of trying new dishes here.
reviews.name: Ruth

reviews.text: Everything was great  -  Mary want to make a special note on their Tom Yum soup ... their Tom Yum soup was the best Mary have  ever had. In their Tom Yum soup  there were ingredients Mary have  never seen  which Mary learned later ingredients Mary have  never seen  which Mary learned later it was  galangal  and lime leaves was  galangal  and lime leaves. their Tom Yum soup was very aromatic could be less salt inspired Mary enough to search for a recipe for authentic Tom Yum. their Tom Yum soup was a work of art. Restaurant was spacey  standard Jazz as a background music. Clean and quiet. Seemed they had lots of takeout orders  but hope more people will done in  Restaurant has a nice atmosphere.
reviews.name: Mary

reviews.text: Truly a hidden gem ! Found this joint by mistake AKA Serendipity ! !  ! Gotta have this joint's hot   sour soup manchurian chicken   Hakka noodles. If you pick up  you get a decent discount ! Do not  sleep on this !
reviews.name: Shakti

reviews.text: Amazing place to have Lollypop Chicken  also Urban Hakka's Bombay Chicken is absolutely brilliant. For Convenient location  friendly people and out of this world taste everyone should visit Urban Hakka. Highly recommended !  !  !  !  !
reviews.name: Kabir

reviews.text: Great Indo - Chinese food and Natalia am so happy that Great Indo - Chinese food is  in Urban Hakka  easily accessible by TTC. A lot of Indian friends miss and crave Indian - style chow mein but have shared that Indian - style chow mein is  tough to find in Toronto  and even Brampton. Urban Hakka is the first place that seems to satisfy even the biggest Indo - Chinese food connoisseurs. Natalia personally like the fried rice and chow mein  both Hakka style. As well as the paneer with gravy and the chili cauliflower. Pro tip : get the kulfi  Indian ice cream  for dessert ! The malai flavor is Pro tip's favorite.
reviews.name: Natalia

reviews.text: The restaurant is on Yonge street and finding a parking spot is a bit difficult. The restaurant has a bright board and hard to miss. Thinking The restaurant was a Chinese place seeing the  Indo Chinese cuisine  threw Vimal off. Seeing the menu was a surprise as the menu indeed have a mix of both Indian and Chinese cuisines. You would find both chowmein and rice. The restaurant is a long corridor and Vimal find the inner most room might have some warmer tables as the front tables can get cold easily due to the doors proximity. the menu has lots of dishes so take your time to go through the menu. Our waiter was from Nepal and Our waiter was very friendly. Vimal got some Singapore rice noodles and Chow mein. The dishes came in quick and hot. some Singapore rice noodles had a bit too much herbs in some Singapore rice noodles but Vimal's friend really liked some Singapore rice noodles. And Vimal loved Chow mein -  Chow mein was dry and the chicken and shrimp pieces were juicy and fresh. Over all had a great experience at The restaurant  -  defined recommending. Oh btw  Yelp also gives a     discount when you checkin.
reviews.name: Vimal

reviews.text: very very very delicious  insane amount of flavour in the tom yum soup   hot garlic chicken pakora. nd time coming back  last time Jesse also had the crispy beef which was delicious too. Good heat backed up with tons of herbs spices
reviews.name: Jesse

reviews.text: Not bad if you are  looking for your Hakka fix. Leonard had the chilli chicken  with gravy   crispy beef  dry   shrimp fried rice  Hakka noodles Cantonese style  and shrimp pakora. Leonard were not disappointed. Leonard also asked for extra spicy gravy on the side and they gave us a huge portion free of charge. Service was great and the staff had great recommendations.
reviews.name: Leonard

reviews.text: Given the hype David was hoping Urban Hakka would be amazing but David found Urban Hakka just ok overall. David got   dishes and  balancing out the outstanding with the not - so - good  David put this at   stars  though would have bumped it up to  . if David could  -  bonus points for offering a good alternative in the area . David got :   -  Sesame crispy beef :  Really amazing flavour  and Sesame crispy beef was properly crispy  though started to become rubbery as the meal progressed . David would  definitely order Sesame crispy beef again. -  Singapore noodles with shrimp :  Singapore noodles with shrimp : were a bit dry  though the faint curry taste was nice. Also not as much shrimp as David would have liked. David would  pass on Singapore noodles with shrimp. Service was attentive and personable  though a tad slow. The place itself was a bit  fancy   with white tablecloths and cloth napkins. And again  it is  a different taste to other offerings in the area so hope The place itself lasts.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: David have  walked by Urban Hakka a couple of times and have definitely been curious  so when David were trying to decide on a restaurant from which to order food it did not  take long for David to choose this place. David decided to order a couple of old standbys : Pad Thai Chicken  Shrimp Beef : Though this is far from the worst pad thai David have  ever had  - it does not   at least  taste like it was made with ketchup -  it is  certainly nothing special or worth ordering again. The big problem here is that it is  just so darn sweet; David m not sure which ingredient caused this or if sugar was added separately  but it mostly tasted like a pad thai dessert. The proteins were plentiful and cooked well  and the pasta was not  soggy so the pasta was definitely edible  at least . Chilli Beef :  David chose the gravy option and Chilli Beef : was one of the sauciest dishes David have  eaten in a while. And  like the pad thai  Chilli Beef : is  fine but completely forgettable. The pervasive taste here was basil  oddly enough  and the one - note nature of Chilli Beef : did ensure David got a little sick of Chilli Beef : towards the end. Chilli Beef :  kind of spicy  at least. Urban Hakka needs to step up Urban Hakka's game  because if the quality of the rest of Urban Hakka's food is similar to what David got it is  hard to envision this place lasting much longer within this crowded marketplace  David.e. put a  little  effort into your offerings  guys .
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: The restaurant itself is a hidden gem for Hakka lovers ! Very close to the subway station.. and there is also street parking on Yonge. The restaurant itself looks very nice and divided into two sections.. so you got options where to sit and bar section in between. From the tables spoons to customer service  -  everything was just perfect ! Sreekar ordered quite a bit of food  manchurian chicken and chowmein  Hakka style  reminded me the authentic flavours of Hakka and definitely going back here again and again when the cravings are to happen for Hakka Chinese  : Also The restaurant itself have quite a lot of options in the alcohol section for a good price. Overall it was a good experience  best hakka place so far in many years where food is not oily or greasy !
reviews.name: Sreekar

reviews.text: Great little place on Kingston ! Liz think Great little place on Kingston ! is  been the makeover - branded as Kingston Gourmet in the last couple of weeks. Liz just moved into the neighbourhood and Liz's boyfriend and Liz decided to check Great little place on Kingston ! out to see what is was about as Liz saw the makeover happening. Happy surprise ! Reasonably priced and delicious. A bit of an odd menu with Indian  Italian  and burger - fare  but delicious. Liz had veggie samosas while Liz waited and took a margarita pizza to go. Both had a bit of a spice kick to them Liz have zero spice tolerance  for Liz  but just right for Liz's boyfriend  who loves spicy . Liz highly recommend checking Great little place on Kingston ! out. The owner is very sweet and nice as well. Liz plan on showing more support to Great little place on Kingston !.
reviews.name: Liz

reviews.text: Does not disappoint !  !  ! Amazing service and food Jax just had the allo gobi  chicken biriyani and butter chicken ...... All was amazing  !
reviews.name: Jax

reviews.text: Great place and recently renovated with an updated menu  fresh fries vs frozen  that sort of tweak to make things fresh. Menu is very eclectic so there is  pretty much something for everybody and prices are very fair. The staff always thank you for your business which is a nice touch. Hope the renos bring in more business for Great place  - the renos deserve it !
reviews.name: Stephanie

reviews.text: Rachel have  lived in the neighbourhood for years but always overlooked this spot which has re - branded and is now called  Kingston Gourmet  . What a gem ! It tiny  but cozy  two tables for dining in but they also do take out and delivery  and the owner chef  Gulam  truly cares about the food the owner chef  Gulam prepares. Rachel had a fabulous spaghetti carbonara and my husband loved Rachel's lamb curry. Do not  walk past this one  -  go in and enjoy !
reviews.name: Rachel

reviews.text: Yelp let us down. My wife and Christopher ordered from Star of Kingston using justeat. Christopher thought  based on the interviews  that the food would be tasty. Christopher were sadly disappointed. Christopher ordered the butter chicken and Christopher ordered a napoleon pizza. Because Christopher had a coupon Christopher decided to get an order of onion rings as well. the butter chicken was not  terrible; the butter chicken was watery  and no better than what Christopher get in a bottled grocery store butter chicken sauce  but the butter chicken was not  terrible. The portion was massive with the rice. onion rings were cool when the food arrived  and Christopher are  very nearby !   and had a gross fishy taste to onion rings. onion rings were edible but not appealing. a napoleon pizza was a travesty. There were multiple calls between us and Star of Kingston because Star of Kingston did not  know how to make a napoleon pizza ! Apparently Star of Kingston changed Star of Kingston's menu but their menu is not  updated on justeat so Christopher had to walk Star of Kingston through the items of a napoleon pizza. While that was annoying  it was understandable. The problem was Star of Kingston absolutely loaded a napoleon pizza with anchovies  to the point where a napoleon pizza was almost inedible. Christopher threw out more than half of a napoleon pizza. Christopher can not  warn people away from Star of Kingston enough. Based on our experiences Christopher will  never spend another dime here again.
reviews.name: Christopher

reviews.text: Had the fish and chips. Damn good and very nice people. Total hidden gem.
reviews.name: Hendy

reviews.text: The food is quite good and the staff are very friendly. Every time Orange order  the staff thank Orange for Orange's business which is not  something you hear too often Not much to the look of the place and agree with other reviewers that the place is for take out. Orange have  had a few dishes including the fish and chips BLT burgers. the place have a super cheap breakfast for around   or   bucks. a super cheap breakfast for around   or   bucks a little small but a super cheap breakfast for around   or   bucks is  under   dollars so can not  really complain about the size. If you are  in that area and looking for some good diner style take out  Orange would really recommend.
reviews.name: Orange

reviews.text: Patrick ordered Pizza yesterday  Pizza was burnt and tasteless. When Patrick called the answer Patrick got was  that is the way it comes . Patrick understand that the edges could be a little burnt but most of the bottom should not be. Patrick suggest you try somewhere else if you want Pizza !
reviews.name: Patrick

reviews.text: Almost each time Kris eat there  Kris's stomach feels bad because food is too oily and Kris  ordered pasta carbonara veggi samosas burger with fries at different times but Kris's boyfriend likes it. Breakfast items were at the very good level. Do not  take apple pie. Prices are fine and service is fast.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text: A fantastic little restaurant in a residential part of the upper beach. Just stopped in for appetizers and it was excellent. The Lobster bisque was fantastic  scallops in celeriac where perfectly cooked  frites and garlic a oli where amazing. A couple of large cold Belgian beers and Kate were good to go. Will definitely make it back in.
reviews.name: Kate

reviews.text: Ravin had the pleasure of stopping in  midweek to this new location now under new management  -  and a friend and Ravin sauntered in to taste some key pieces Ravin knew were on the days menu. Located right on Kingston road this new location now under new management  the brightest gem in an otherwise low key street front resto that is  just getting going  -  as a local charming dining experience this new location now under new management evokes a flair and ambiance that you would  think was lifted right out of small town Quebec -  no pretentious attitude   just an empathetic passionate entrepreneurial spirit based around the love of food  -  and just an empathetic passionate entrepreneurial spirit based around the love of food is what drives ownership to continue to innovate and provide a flair for good eats As ownership finds ownership's voice for the local market to discover this new location now under new management  -  the menu is constantly rotating and has the flexibility to cater to the changing flavours of the season  -  given the other dining options in the area this new location now under new management is  a fresh respite from the templated pub fare foods and certainly a refreshing twist on some favourites The Fresh Fennel and Pear salad with goat cheese has a simplicity to The Fresh Fennel and Pear salad with goat cheese that truly is delightful The  oz beef short ribs with banana mash is certainly a signature piece that would warrant continued praise -  Ravin would  simply say try The  oz beef short ribs with banana mash and fear not be disappointed The butter chicken burritos and samosa is well made  flavourful and tempered with coconut milk to allow for a beautiful entree option though not truly French per se  -  The butter chicken burritos and samosa is a very enjoyable piece worthy of your attention and for the burrito daring crowd The fish and chips have a distinct batter that is both light and flavourful and served with a spicy mayo and house Aioli presented in onion cups  that pairs well with the home fries The homemade cheesecake is in the vein of the firm New York style that was set just right for Ravin's liking and one which chef proudly will give you chef's history with the dessert -  The homemade cheesecake is simply well paired with a well made long espresso or coffee Ravin m a fan of both effort and interest and Ravin will say that despite any shortcomings that come with new hip restos adjusting to find new hip restos's voice in a crowded marketplace    -  this new location now under new management is one Ravin would  expect to continue to innovate and have an ever evolving menu that will speak to both local tastes with a Quebec twist that is  sure to please. Ravin would  highly suggest your support to this new location now under new management as this is the kind of love that Ravin should all want behind our dining experience.
reviews.name: Ravin

reviews.text: Teresa live nearby and drive by this restaurant every day  but never stopped in until today  and Teresa are  glad Teresa did. Teresa ordered the oyster stew  caesar salad  short ribs and pasta of the day  penne with sausage . For dessert Teresa got the strawberry cheesecake. Everything was so good ! the oyster stew was so fragrant. And Teresa am still thinking about the strawberry cheesecake ! Teresa only wish Teresa had more room in Teresa's stomach so Teresa could try more items off the menu. Teresa will  definitely be coming back again soon.
reviews.name: Teresa

reviews.text: Looking at this place from the outside you might never go in. this place tiny  and has only a few tables. David think These Indian owners make These Indian owners's money on take out and delivery. An eclectic menu includes everything from pizza to pasta to fish and chips. These Indian owners have recently added a new cuisine...a new cuisine David have  only ordered pasta... even for company  and have never had a bad meal. If you have  been scared off by this place  give  These Indian owners a call and giver a try ! this place  at the north end of Waverley  in the Upper Beach.
reviews.name: David

reviews.text: A local gem. A local gem  a small restaurant with exquisite food. Tonight Ganni's husband and Ganni split a shrimp with bacon appetizer. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and blended nicely with bacon. For entrees  Ganni absolutely loved Ganni's risotto with yummy fiddle heads and peas that popped with freshness. Ganni's husband  short ribs were out of this world  served with carrots  Bok Choy  zucchini and mashed potatoes flavoured with a hint of banana. Extraordinarily delicious. Ganni will definitely go back.
reviews.name: Ganni

restaurants.name: Needle and Pin
restaurants.category: Burgers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Nightlife, British, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars, Indian, Bars

reviews.text: First time guests  my wife and Billy shared   dishes from the menu and   specialty cocktails  classic and contemporary . Everything was outta sight ! Billy love Needle and Pin. The environment was intimate and current without pretension. Billy might go back tomorrow. Needle and Pin have a new menu rolling out soon and Billy would like to try everything on a new menu rolling out soon  before a new menu rolling out soon goes. Billy are from a large food forward city and believe Pittsburgh needs a lot more places like Needle and Pin.
reviews.name: Billy

reviews.text: Was excited to try Needle and Pin. To start off  Eva's one friend and Eva split the plate of lamb chops. lamb chops were quite overpriced as two  lamb chops were    . In addition  Eva's friend had the vegetarian curry and was not impressed. the vegetarian curry was a dish  but not substantial at all. my one friend is vegan so my one friend was really disappointed when my one friend could tell that the meal had been contaminated by oil used in meat. my one friend barely touched the vegetarian curry and they did not  even take the vegetarian curry back or get another option. After a lot of back and forth  they finally took off the vegetable curry. Eva had the tikka masala grilled cheese  which was fine. the tikka masala grilled cheese  which was fine was good and the soup had some hints of Indian spices. Eva's friends enjoyed My friends's tikka masala. Throughout the duration of our meal  three of us never even got refills on water. Towards the end our waitress became apparently hostile. Overall  Needle and Pin's food is overpriced for the quality and quantity and Needle and Pin's management was just not accommodating. Unfortunately  Eva will not be back.
reviews.name: Eva

reviews.text: Fred recently stopped in to sit at Needle and Pin and have some appetizers and drinks. The food was awesome  beef Wellington bites and chili paneer . Robbie was a great bartender. Very knowledgeable and great to talk to while sitting at Needle and Pin.
reviews.name: Fred

reviews.text: Caroline live right down the street  and this is my first time coming here. Caroline have  been missing out. The drinks.... Caroline think Caroline tried   of The drinks... Caroline can not  say a bad thing about The drinks. The drinks were perfection. The atmosphere was great and the food was super good too ! Between the both of us  Caroline split    plates   and   entree - it was a good amount of food  but a wonderful combo of everything. Will. Definitely. Be. Back. !  !
reviews.name: Caroline

reviews.text: Drinks are off the hook  so nice to have a craft cocktail spot close to home ! Food is Indian British style and pretty good but Missy really go here for the drinks. Bar service is very friendly and decor is cozy.
reviews.name: Missy

reviews.text: Sara enjoyed our dinner at Needle and Pin. Definitely make reservations if you are planning on having dinner during the weekend. Needle and Pin was very busy. One downfall was that even though Sara had a   : pm reservation Sara were already out of fish and chips pani puri  and rabbit Masala. This is understandable but still a bummer.
reviews.name: Sara

reviews.text: The drinks are absolutely amazing. The food is very good but not  off the chain good . Somewhat cooler weather type dishes but this is expected since its English and Indian.... the Impossible Meat dish is really amazing.
reviews.name: Nikole

reviews.text: This is Kate's second time here. The first time there were moments of brilliance so Kate went back for more. The salad was the best ever on The first time -  so fresh and wonderful combination of tastes and textures. Tonight The salad was wilted. The tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup was also a real downer. The tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup was first serve and not even warm. They took The tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup back and The tikka grilled cheese and tomato soup came back curdled and bland. The grilled cheese was more like grilled farm bread with a piece of cheese that stayed for a minute. Kate could go on but why bother. If it is a change of chefs then a change of chefs does not  bode well. All Kate know it will be sometime before Kate consider going back and spending Kate's hard earned cash
reviews.name: Kate

reviews.text: First of all Jennifer will say that the food was good  but small portions. Jennifer entered and waited for over five minutes before Jennifer were greeted. Jennifer waited for our food for over an hour  only table there . No paper towel in the bathroom. Something floating in my drink. Definitely need to work out some kinks....but Jennifer expect Needle and Pin will be a good restaurant when that happens.
reviews.name: Jennifer

reviews.text: Mark was very excited to try Needle and Pin for Needle and Pin's selection of gin cocktails and it is  British pub Indian style food. The food was not bad  but as opposed to the interesting mix of traditional pub food with Indian spiced and flavors described in the menu the dishes Mark had were just pub food with very little Indian flavoring or pub food with an Indian side sauce. The unexciting food aside the service was terrible. Mark were a table of two  each ordering an entree and one appetizer to share. an entree was brought before one appetizer. When the server was informed that Mark were expecting an appeziter first the server made it clear this was not the server's problem nor was the server going to address the situation. So an entree sat on the table getting cold while Mark waited for one appetizer and the second entree to be server  which was a total of about    minutes. In additional the wait staff was rather inattentive and made few appearances at the table. Because of this experience Mark will not be returning to Needle and Pin for a meal. Mark would however go back for cocktails at the bar. The gin cocktail list was unique and the cocktail Mark ordered was very good.
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text: Holy crap ! Mouth orgasm. As a group  Pris ordered   or so dishes and shared amongst ourselves. The brunch dishes were delicious ! The only sub par one was the omelette. For having only one other table to service  the food took quite a while. To deal with our hangriness Pris ordered mimosas and boy were mimosas good.
reviews.name: Pris

reviews.text: Our second trip back Timothy Love the drinks and watching an artist at work. As much as Timothy love the drinks oh my gosh oh golly the food menu is incredible the chilli Paneer and the Mali Kofta wonderful delicious
reviews.name: Timothy

reviews.text: Brunch review. So excited there is a good place for drinks and non - diner food in south hills ! Autumn went for brunch and brunch was pretty quiet but the drinks and food were delicious. Bread plate was amazing. Autumn had the curried chicken popover and the curried chicken popover was the perfect mix of spice. Poached egg on top was perfection. Autumn's companions ordered scotch eggs and porridge -  - My companions raved about scotch eggs and porridge. Cocktails were slow crafted and thoughtful. Autumn can not  wait to go back for dinner.
reviews.name: Autumn

reviews.text: Linda have tried Needle and Pin a couple of time. Once for full on dinner and once for drinks and apps. The beef Wellington bites were amazing. Linda's husband is not  a gin drinker so opted for a beer  but was wowed when My husband tried Linda's gin cocktail ... yummy !
reviews.name: Linda

reviews.text: The cocktails were excellent ! Maggie got the aviation  which Maggie have  had at other restaurants  and Needle and Pin was certainly the best. At first the concept of the menu was a little difficult to understand but basically Needle and Pin is  a tapas bar with   entrees. Mostly everything was super tasty ! Maggie like the blending of Indian flavors with English dishes. The gobi manchurian.... daaaaaaamn. So good. My only complaint was that Maggie ordered the steak and for     they should have  at least cooked the steak properly. Little over cooked. Our waitress was very nice and helpful. Attentive without being overbearing. The atmosphere is a little weird for being in the middle of Dormont so The atmosphere will  have to grow on us  but Needle and Pin is nicely designed.
reviews.name: Maggie

reviews.text: Excellent  creative cocktails and unusual  delicious food. A great addition to the Dormont Mount Lebanon metroplex.
reviews.name: Bill

reviews.text: Ok so Needle and Pin just opened this weekend so take this into consideration. My friends and Erin went here for drinks around    on Friday. The cocktail menu had a lot of variety. There were not  many people in there but it took a really long time to get My friends and Erin's drinks. When Erin got our drinks  the person that brought then was confused about what the person that brought had but they turned out to be right. our drinks were pretty good... Erin had an Aviation and an Aviation tasted right. Erin ordered a second round and by that time it was just us and it still took forever to get My friends and Erin's drinks. The atmosphere was kind of plain. Erin guess Erin was just expecting more from a place that has such a unique concept. The food menu looked really good  but Erin did not  eat. Erin would definitely like to come back and eat and see what Needle and Pin is like after they get a little more experience so take this review with a grain of salt  Erin may change Erin's rating after trying Needle and Pin again.
reviews.name: Erin

reviews.text: My friend and April tried the mimosa for the first time during brunch. My friend and April were really excited to try the mimosa. the mimosa was delicious  but April wish the glass was filled up a bit more. the glass was in a huge    wine glass and not even filled up halfway. April did love the aroma of the flower that added a little spunk to My friend and April's drink ! April decided to split the bread board which was two different types of bread  along with a really two yummy dipping sauces and some butter. My friend and April really loved this. April ordered the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg. the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg is not something April would normally order  but was glad that April did. the mini bagels with salmon and a poached egg was delicious ! The portion sizes were not  big  but decent size for brunch. April also decided to order vodkas and orange juice. vodkas and orange juice were a cheaper option than the mimosa and tasted great ! The bartender clearly knows what The bartender The bartender is doing. Needle and Pin is very decorative and cute. Staff is very friendly. Hidden gem in Dormont that April will be returning to !
reviews.name: April

reviews.text: actually. Excellent cocktails  friendly  attentive staff. The food was a bit uneven  -  the scotch eggs are amazing and so is the gobi. The fish in the fish and chips was gummy and the batter was soggy  which was a bummer after how crisp the gobi were. The bangers were good but the mash was more of a potato cake  which was just OK. Lamb lollies were good but a pretty small portion  -  essentially     for what amounted to perhaps two ounces of lamb. Atmosphere cool and stylish  hard to believe how much they have  transformed it. Marcy will return for cocktails and small plates  probably will skip the larger plates though as the larger plates just were not  worth the spend. One suggestion Marcy would make is to offer a bit more sauce with some of the menu items  -  for example the amount of tartar sauce with the fish and chips  about a rounded teaspoon  was not enough for sharing.
reviews.name: Marcy

reviews.text: Tried Needle and Pin on a friend  recommendation. Mary am not very  adventurous  with food but tried a few dishes and enjoyed each of a few dishes ! Am also not a gin drinker  but may be one now as Mary thoroughly enjoyed both drinks Mary tried. Loved the atmosphere the team there is friendly and knowledgeable and appreciated a brief visit with the chef !
reviews.name: Mary

reviews.text: The bartender is a genius ! Aviation is a great one -  - and cool shade of lavender  also loved the negroni spaticella   Nice to have interesting veggie options. The jackfruit curry was good the malai kofta yum  and the star of the show -  - the grilled cheese. Wait staff were nice and helpful as well -  - the note about the G and T was appreciated -  - it is definitely not your typical tonic. Really herbal and unusual. Hope they keep bringing out new veggie options as the cocktails will bring us back here for sure !
reviews.name: K

reviews.text: Michelle have now been to Needle and Pin twice and have been thrilled both times. The drinks and food are excellent and the service has been fantastic. Michelle look forward to my next visit.
reviews.name: Michelle

reviews.text: Second trip at pm : bar food was of the same caliber as dinner  -  good. Needle and Pin's bartender continued to impress. Hell or High water is quite nice even if you do not  care for gin.
reviews.name: Rupesh

reviews.text: Needle and Pin is one of the best Elias have  come across as far as the combination of concept and location. As someone who grew up close to the area Needle and Pin now is Elias am glad to see Needle and Pin in Dormont. Needle and Pin has an outstanding cocktail menu within which is Elias's favorite cocktail at the moment the Hell or High Water. The food menu is also solid  especially outstanding is the grilled cheese. A new chef recently came on board and did an excellent job. Food is great  drinks are great  design is great and Needle and Pin is kept clean. Elias work late and usually go here at night and on a few occassions have not received a welcoming feeling perhaps due to the late - night hours. However  this issue has been quickly responded to by the GM who reached out to Elias and Elias will gladly update this review upon Elias's next visit.
reviews.name: Elias

reviews.text: Wow. Found a  needle  in a haystack;  The flavors here pop off the plate and pair amazingly with the gin creations. Highly recommend the goji Manchurian  lamb lollis  and the heirloom tomatoes. Also  have dessert if Needle and Pin have the macaroon. Yes you will  be full and your date will say no dessert. But  order the macaroon anyway. Incredible.
reviews.name: Darrell

reviews.text: First time checking Needle and Pin out on Saturday night and Needle and Pin was delicious  ! The drinks were awesome with a great presentation. Very interesting menu and everything Katie got was great. Looking forward to going back to try more items !
reviews.name: Katie

reviews.text: Needle and Pin is a great addition to the neighborhood. Delicious cocktails and delicious small plates. Jill sat at the bar and watched some really lovely looking drinks being crafted; gave me some ideas for what Jill want to try next. Despite being busy  bartenders were friendly and kind enough to answer questions about what bartenders were making. Seriously  there were some really pretty gin concoctions coming out of the bar. The blackberry bramble was a nice sip. To eat  Jill had the malai kofta  which had an unexpectedly kicky  in a good way  sauce and the gobi Manchurian  which was light and crispy. Next time  Jill will  do full dinner and Jill will  come back here and hopefully drop that fifth star. Everything was reasonably priced and well executed. Happy to have Needle and Pin in in my backyard; looking forward to a second trip.
reviews.name: Jill

reviews.text: What a wonderful experience Stephanie had at Needle and Pin ! Creative dining is important to me ! If you are not a brave taste tester this might not be the culinary experience you are looking for. The atmosphere was cool  service excellent and the food was an incredible fusion of Indian with a contemporary twist !  ! Loved it !  !
reviews.name: Stephanie

reviews.text: GF TOOK ME FOR ME birthday Great food delish drinks   and cool atmosphere ! Wendy m going to try and head there tonight  !
reviews.name: Wendy

reviews.text: Needle and Pin is a great bar. Needle and Pin specialize in gin mixed drinks as well as Indian fusion food. Greg tried the impossible paratha which was delicious. Next Greg had the BBQ jack fruit sliders which were just like BBQ pulled pork and also delicious. Derek the bartender was very fast with the drink and food orders and explained everything about the food and drinks. Greg will definitely come back here when Greg come back to the Pittsburgh area.
reviews.name: Greg

reviews.text: Went for happy hour. Drinks were delicious and the bartender was friendly and helpful. Lots of vegetarian options for small plates  which is great to see. Basically the perfect experience for happy hour at a cocktail bar. Go here !
reviews.name: Adam

reviews.text: Kaitlyn's whole experience was not  perfect but the food was very good. Service could be more attentive. Needle and Pin is ambitious but Needle and Pin pull it off. Kaitlyn will be back !
reviews.name: Kaitlyn

reviews.text: A cool new place for the area ! Saw the idea of the British Indian fusion and found the British Indian fusion very interesting ! Came with a couple of friends for dinner on Friday and were very pleased. The inside of A cool new place for the area is well lit and well decorated  -  cool bar areas with lots of different types of gin to choose from. Shirley were seated quickly at a booth and ordered our drinks and dinners. Shirley got the Blackberry Bramble which was super tasty  -  fruity and refreshing ! Shirley also ordered the Tikka Grilled Cheese w  Curried Coconut Tomato Bisque  such a mouthful  while Shirley's two friends both got the Tikka Masala. The food came out quickly and was fresh   hot. a couple of friends enjoyed a couple of friends's Tikka Masala  -  spiced well and had some heat to the Tikka Masala ! The grilled cheese   bisque was also very good ! The grilled cheese   bisque was very heavy  so even though The grilled cheese   bisque did not  look huge Shirley was pretty stuffed ! For dessert  a couple of friends got the cheesecake and bread pudding. Cheesecake came wrapped in a puff pastry thing  Shirley nicknamed Cheesecake The Cheesecake Poof   and a side of fruit puree. Cheesecake was super soft and delicious and went really well with a puff pastry thing ! bread pudding was very dense and well spiced ! The garnishes of cranberries  raisins  and dates were also a nice touch. Experience was very good overall ! Service was relatively quick and very friendly. The food did not  blow Shirley away but was definitely enjoyable  and Shirley would  be interested in visiting again to try more dishes. A bit more expensive than a casual dinner  but a nice place to go for something a little more special. Given the unique menu  A cool new place for the area would also be a great place to bring out of town - ers !
reviews.name: Shirley

reviews.text: Needle and Pin definitely hits as a fit for the new  Dormont is actually kind of cool  scene. The food is well above average  eclectic  creative  and tasty. Some are knock - outs  and some are average. For example  the sauce with the chick pea dust encrusted cauliflower was top - notch... the chips that went with the fried cod :  mediocre at best. But this imperfection seems inevitable when you are trying to fuse Indian and British pub food. The real question is -  - will The food continue to get better Jason would call The food overall a solid  . Jason would like to note here that this is often the case for even the most  in  restaurants -  - inconsistency is everywere . The drink menu however  is a   + . Jason's guest  and others in Needle and Pin  were loving the mixed drinks. for a lot of creativity and kick. Jason was driving so Jason just had a glass of wine  -  which was actually quite good itself. There is also a passion in which the servers  bartender  manager  approach the whole endeavor... Jason hope it is sustainable. D cor is nice  and a little odd  -  just like The food. Jason think Needle and Pin has a pretty good chance  if Needle and Pin continues to evolve and stay edgy and happy. Jason's advice to the owners would be to view the opening of Needle and Pin as the beginning  not the end  of the innovations.
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text: The bartender was very attentive and the drinks were incredible ! Erinm not much of a gin drinker but Needle and Pin changed Erin's mind. Erin had the curried jackfruit for dinner which was also very good the curried jackfruit was a nice mild flavor and the portion was generous. Will definitely be back !
reviews.name: Erin

reviews.text: Megan tried Needle and Pin last weekend for a late night dinner. The service was friendly and attentive. The lighting was a bit dark Megan had trouble making out what Megan was eating. Needle and Pin are a gin bar so Megan tried a spicy sweet gin cocktail. a spicy sweet gin cocktail was more sweet than spicy  and pretty tasty. For dinner  Megan had the lamb lollipops and the jackfruit curry. the jackfruit curry came with thin noodles that needed a bit more sauce  fortunately the waitress brought Megan some extra when Megan asked. the jackfruit curry had actual chunks of coconut and a good flavor. The jackfruit tasted a lot like eggplant. the lamb lollipops were a cooked perfectly to medium rare and came with a great sauce on the side. Megan's friend ordered the spicy fried paneer appetizer  that probably had the best flavor of everything Megan tried. the spicy fried paneer appetizer that probably had the best flavor of everything Megan tried was sweet and spicy and the spicy fried paneer appetizer that probably had the best flavor of everything Megan tried had a pretty strong flavor. Megan's other friend had the chicken tikka Marsala. The thin noodles were a different twist on the usual tikka. Next time Megan will have to try the English side of the menu.
reviews.name: Megan

reviews.text: Meredith Blake wish it was possible to give three and a half stars  -  Needle and Pin really was not  bad at all. Meredith Blake LOVED the Scotch Eggs and Cumin Crusted Lamb Lollipops. Tons of flavor and a great size for a small plate. Meredith Blake's husband ordered the beef tenderloin and the beef tenderloin was no bigger than the appetizers Meredith Blake would  just eaten. While the sweet potatoes and chili gastritis were both amazing the beef tenderloin was slightly underdone and was just far too small to be considered a main entree  especially for the price Meredith Blake paid for the beef tenderloin. Meredith Blake understand that it is  a recent trend to serve small portions but this just left Meredith Blake hungry and it was not worth the cost. Meredith Blake got the seared scallop soup while and the broth and scallops were delicious  Meredith Blake's rice was extremely underdone. my rice was not  just al dente my rice was crunchy and retained no flavor from the broth. Because Meredith Blake were both starving  Meredith Blake wound up ordering beef Wellington at the end of the meal. While Meredith Blake are  always happy to taste Meredith Blake's way through a menu Meredith Blake should not  have had to do this out of hunger for the prices Meredith Blake were paying. beef Wellington was also underdone and these flavors sadly were not  there. The puff pastry was not  cooked and left the dish soggy. And the flavor of the cauliflower  in Meredith Blake's opinion  you may feel differently  did not  complement the flavor of the beef tenderloin. On a positive note  the staff was very friendly and the cocktails were great. Needle and Pin  a Gin bar and neither Meredith Blake's husband or Meredith Blake are big gin fans but Meredith Blake still loved Meredith Blake's Hell or High Water and would come back for my Hell or High Water.
reviews.name: Meredith Blake

reviews.text: It was Keith's one year anniversary with Keith's wife and was utterly amazed by the extent Needle and Pin went through to accommodate my wife and Keith's reservation. The newly featured food menu had choices that not only met Keith's love of food  but especially to Keith's wife who is vegetarian. Keith absolutely recommend Needle and Pin to anyone and everyone. Keith also can not  forget to mention the cocktail menu. Now this being said from someone who highly enjoys bourbon and scotch served net when it comes to liquor. Needle and Pin's mixologist bartender has a very diverse knowledge of gin. A spirit that has been on Keith's  Keith want to try  but have not  really had a reason  list. Well now because of the very very wide selection of gin varietals available at Needle and Pin  Keith am fully open to discovering a new found respect for gin and the variations of cocktails gin can be utilized for with their creations. Keith know Keith's wife and Keith highly loved and appreciated my wife and Keith's one year anniversary and the many many more to come but Keith will definitely be going back to Needle and Pin at a moment notice.
reviews.name: Keith

reviews.text: Needle and Pin is a hot new restaurant that Nicole have  been really wanting to try ! Nicole love that Needle and Pin offers some Indian dishes  and the GIN ! Love the lemon gin drink  but a simple dirty martini was not  their thing. Dishes can have a kick to Dishes ! So ask if spice is not  your thing. Prices were moderate. Parking can be hard to find on the street and Nicole m not sure if there is a parking lot. Would Nicole go again Yes. But if it had to be in that area Nicole would  check out somewhere else before going back.
reviews.name: Nicole

reviews.text: Needle and Pin was great ! Needle and Pin  an excellent mix of English and Indian food Colin did an outstanding job with the interior and ambiance. The food is top notch -  -  standouts were the Chilli Paneer and the grilled cheese coconut tomato soup. the Chilli Paneer had great heat and was a generous portion. the grilled cheese coconut tomato soup was made with custom bread that was to die for  so light and fluffy ! and an aged gruyere cheese. Honorable mention to the Wellington bites and tikka masala. Tons of great shareable dishes It  a gin bar but the manhattans were A +  + Needle and Pin is a great addition to the South Hills... Chase can not  wait to try more cocktails and other items on the menu soon !
reviews.name: Chase

reviews.text: Awesome place ! Very creative menu both with food and drinks. Drew tried several of the drinks and many of the items on the menu and it was great for sharing. The tikka masala with noodles was a really cool twist and absolutely delicious. Friendly staff and fun atmosphere. Highly recommend Needle and Pin and can not  wait to go back !
reviews.name: Drew

reviews.text: Needle and Pin is exactly what Dormont needs ! Needle and Pin is different than all the others... you can not  miss it. Inside is a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The decor is extraordinary  particularly the mosaic elephant in the back. There are little tiny lights that light up the bar - very unique and nothing like Tracy have  ever seen before. Tracy's family and Tracy had a few cocktails at the bar to start. Tracy have  never been a big gin drinker but Needle and Pin may be turning Tracy into one. Tracy had the clover club to start and throughout the night made Tracy's way through the bees knees and the white lotus. a few cocktails seem complex to make but totally worth a little bit longer of a wait. a few cocktails were amazing  see pics . For food  Tracy had the tikka grilled cheese the Bombay greens  and the beef Wellington bites. Tracy thought the food was excellent and delicious and loved the presentation. You can tell these guys care about the tiny details. Server  Nicole  was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. If these guys can pull all this off on Tracy's next visit Tracy will add a  th star. Until then  cheers !
reviews.name: Tracy

reviews.text: If you enjoy great food and amazing cocktails it is  hard to find a better place in the south hills. It  a unique experience with the English Indian fusion and the food is new an interesting. The presentation is nicely done as well. Mike feel the big stand out is the fish and chips which is only available on Friday and Saturday. Mike's favorite aspect are the cocktails. The bartenders work very hard to turn out very well crafted cocktails that are both well presented and delicious. Needle and Pin  also one of the few places Mike have  been to around all of Pittsburgh that Mike am able to get a Ramos gin fizz. Mike hope you try very well crafted cocktails that are both well presented and delicious out !
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text: Kyle enjoyed our experience at Needle and Pin. As others noted  Needle and Pin did a great job of decorating. Needle and Pin provides excellent sunset lighting. The bar is really cool and the back area is very inviting. The drinks were awesome. Kyle never liked gin until Kyle drank a few here. The food was okay. It might be Kyle's taste for The food that makes it harder for Kyle to enjoy The food. The biggest issue for most people will be that portions are very small. Needle and Pin describe the menu as shareable items. Kyle recommend getting about   shareable items for a full meal. For pricing  you are  looking at about     a drink and about    -    a plate. Think of it as a tapas experience. Overall  Kyle would definitely come back and would recommend it. Like Kyle said before  The drinks were sessions and easy to love even if you do not  care for gin.
reviews.name: Kyle

reviews.text: Great spot all around. Needle and Pin value Needle and Pin's customers and take what Needle and Pin are doing seriously. After a previous issue it was clear Needle and Pin made efforts to improve and cared about the experience of a single customer. Really Like the crew here and everything the crew here do.
reviews.name: Elias

reviews.text: Matt was very excited about Needle and Pin  especially Matt thought a great add to Dormont...but a big letdown. Gave Needle and Pin a chance food - wise and drink - wise and it was a big disappointment. The customer service was not that friendly by any means. Average over - priced drinks and food. Matt usually give things many chances but the experience was so bad that Matt wo not  return.
