reviews.name: Matt

reviews.text: The hubz and Nicki tried the dinner menu out over the weekend and were very impressed. Nicki tried many of the small shared plates since Nicki wanted to get as many things as possible. Nicki started with the Scotch Eggs. Nicki's hub considers The hubz a connoisseur of scotch eggs and was happy as a clam with the Scotch Eggs. Nicki also go the Gobi Manchurian which was good but a little light on the sauce. The Chili Paneer was awesome ! One of Nicki's favorite dishes was the Curry Chicken Potpie. So savory ! Our main dish was the Bangers and Mash which involved the mash in a puff pastry. Nicki could not  finish it all but did bring it home to snack on later. Nicki will  definitely go back again sometime !
reviews.name: Nicki

reviews.text: bartender was an absolute jerk. L do not  drink gin and bartender's response was essentially to tell L that L am an idiot and that bartender would make L like gin. instead  L ordered a diet soda but was told they did not  have any. what bar does not have diet soda then L asked for a water but instead of pouring L a normal water  bartender made a show of it and poured water into a fancy rocks glass garnished with a flower in a gesture of smartassery. L will never go back.
reviews.name: L

reviews.text: Needle and Pin is in Dormont. Michelle do not  care where you are in Pittsburgh  come here. First  Needle and Pin is  a GReat gin bar. Like great. Second....yummy food. It  kinda like Indian fusion. Michelle came here for small plates with my mom one afternoon. Michelle got three small plates to share. Michelle should have gotten two. The charcuterie plate was off the charts. So fresh  creative and delicious. Michelle ate everything on The charcuterie plate. No one eats everything on a charcuterie plate...but The charcuterie plate was just perfect. Michelle got the yuccas -  Michelle would easily skip the yuccas -  and Michelle got the street something or other. It was good. Michelle really enjoyed Needle and Pin so much and had so many things that Michelle still wanted to try that Michelle came here on a date a week later. Michelle's date got the tiki masala and Michelle got the grilled cheese and soup. the grilled cheese and soup were out of this world. So good. the grilled cheese and soup was A.mazing ! And Michelle cant wait to go back and get the tiki masala after a bite of Michelle's dates. both times Michelle got a drink and both times Michelle enjoyed their creations. Very creative. Pricey but creative. Michelle will be back soon. You should check it out too.
reviews.name: Michelle

reviews.text: Went over here to celebrate my birthday. Just start Lori had the scotch eggs and gobi Manchurian. the scotch eggs and gobi Manchurian were very delicious. Lori was here about a month ago and since then the food has improved. For the main course our party of four had the fish and chips the chicken pot pie  tikka masala  and vegetable curry. our party of four tried each other  dishes and each other  dishes were all excellent. Two of our party of four tried two Gin cocktails  -  two Gin cocktails were super tasty. Lori highly recommend Needle and Pin. The decor is really great too. Definitely worth a try !
reviews.name: Lori

reviews.text: They told us Jasmine had    mins to order because they were closing. Jasmine ordered. Food did not  arrive until    ish mins later because they were tending to the take out orders. Jasmine sat there for a very long time...hungry. It was after Jasmine got our food that the waitress gave us the rushing vibe. Jasmine know they were aware that they were taking a really long time to give us our food so why not give us some naan bread to help make the wait a little easier  Customer service really lacks here. If you are  here Jasmine would  recommend going to another restaurant that is  nearby.
reviews.name: Jasmine

reviews.text: Denny used Just - Eat.ca to order food from Amaya Express. Being Indian in Toronto  Denny are  usually very skeptical about ordering - in Indian food. But being lazy and craving Indian food on a Friday night  Denny ordered from Amaya Express  and it was delicious !  !  !  ! Denny would even go as far as naming Amaya Express the  Best Indian Restaurant in Toronto . Denny ordered the  Mixed Grill for two  as appetizers .. which included kabab  chicken  and prawn -  all were scrumptious  and goes really well with scotch soda -  if you are  Indian you know what Denny m talking about  -   hort eats  ! The meats all retained The meats all's moisture  and were not  dry at all on delivery. Denny also ordered the Madras Curry Braised Lamb  -  which was super - flavorful  savory  had just the right amount of spice  and the lamb piece was amazingly tender ! Denny had the Madras Curry Braised Lamb  -  which was super - flavorful  savory with the garlic naan not overly garlicy just right  and still warm . Thinking Denny had not  ordered enough  Denny also got the Chicken Biryani  -  that was a bit of an overload  as Denny were just too stuffed to eat anymore. the Chicken Biryani was good  although the cardamon aroma was a bit over - powering. Nevertheless our whole in - house dining experience was great  -  and Denny are  hoping to order from Amaya Express every week  Amaya Express even gave us a     coupon on our next order   -  thank Amaya Express Amaya Express !
reviews.name: Denny

reviews.text: Leonard m impressed ! Leonard have  found it hard to get good Indian food in Toronto  which makes no sense ! -  previously Leonard would have rated Banjara on Bloor as Toronto  best Indian restaurant. But since moving to my new digs near Ossington Leonard have  been doing takeout at Amaya Express. The flavours are excellent and things taste like excellent home made food. Try the chutneys and pickles that come with the poppadoms and you will  see what Leonard mean. Amaya Express's sweet and sour eggplant sounds strange  sweet and sour  ! but is outstanding ! The My only complaint is that if you eat in you will  end up smelling smokey like the kitchen  -  the kitchen need better extractor fans.
reviews.name: Leonard

reviews.text: Was looking for somewhere to eat on this street and after leaving James's phone number with a few other restaurants James smelt Amaya Express in the air and hunted around until James found Amaya Express. James came back the next night and was a little worried as there were no customers inside. Amaya Express smelt so good that despite the lack of a crowd James decided to roll the dice. James ordered butter chicken and beef vindaloo to go. After getting home James was blown away by how good butter chicken and beef vindaloo were. butter chicken tasted like butter chicken is  suppose to and beef vindaloo burnt James's Caucasian palate appropriately. The meat was well cooked in large chucks and not shitty cuts  no fat or gristle . Amaya Express is a little bit more expensive than your typical hole in the wall      for   meat dishes  + rice  but considering the taste and James did not  have to get aquatinted with the bathroom multiple times the next day  James would  do it again.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Sara am very picky about Sara's indian food so Sara may be a harder critic than most. Food is slightly better than okay. Delivery was quick but the food was lukewarm when delivered  saag panner was a bright green which Sara have not seen before in a food dish. Not bad for the price and they deliver which is a huge plus for Indian food.
reviews.name: Sara

reviews.text: Miranda got takeout  dinner for two. Miranda are  new to the city and received the menu  which was very professional and seemed promising  in the mail. The best thing Miranda can say is that the menu  which was very professional and seemed promising  in the mail was hot. However... the pakoras were terrible  -  the onion was not cooked properly and the batter had an eggy consistency. They messed up Miranda's first dish  which was supposed to be fish in madras curry. Instead Miranda received shrimp in some curry. The first thing Miranda noticed was that some curry smelled like garbage. Upon further inspection Miranda realized that shrimp in some curry were rancid. The vegetarian dish was mediocre at best  the flavour resembled chef boyardee  -  sweet tomato sauce. There was no heat at all. The lamb dish was OK the sauce was fine but The lamb dish was not great. The only thing that was actually good was the rice  -  fluffy and mixed with cumin seeds  and the naan was not shabby  -  not burned like other Indian restaurants. Miranda did go back the next day to return shrimp in some curry and they offered Miranda a full refund so at least they were polite about a full refund. Too bad the food was not  good  -  shape up Amaya Express !  !
reviews.name: Miranda

reviews.text: Jon also picked up some takeout for dinner. Jon guess everyone does cause there was no one sitting and eating. A fair amount of takeout orders it seems  must be good to have justeat website. For a place that is said to be  express well they were quite quick. Jon went in  ordered  was out of there in short order. But the other aspect Jon had hoped was a slightly lower price point given a place that is said to be  express is  a takeout fast food type. Jon really could not  get out of there with dinner for   for under    . The food though is quite good. Jon had the spinach curry  saag  with chicken which was a good size portion. Chicken pieces you could tell just added  as Chicken pieces did not  have too much flavor. Jon liked watching the cook make the naan though  was a really cool process. the cook takes a small piece of dough  stretches and flips a small piece of dough back and forth kindaa like pizza. Then the cook put a small piece of dough on some tool to stick to the side of this the naan oven. a place that is said to be  express also have pakoras  but pakoras was not  on the menu. Jon m no expert on Indian cuisine  but for Jon's non - expert taste Jon quite liked pakoras as an appetizer. a place that is said to be  express though seems very sterile  clean to eat in but not very warm and welcoming. Jon guess a place that is said to be  express are  going for the order  eat  leave thing.
reviews.name: Jon

reviews.text: A gluten free delight for all of those who like Indian fare the staff is kind  warm   helpful with suggestions regarding the staff's menu. The atmosphere is relaxing as it is  never too busy but busy enough to know that the food is good people are enjoying people's meals. Humdip highly suggest for anyone looking to eat done delicious Indian food to head down to any location and try something. You will never know how good tell your taste buds tell you otherwise.
reviews.name: Humdip

reviews.text: Amaya Express is dangerously near my new digs and Amaya Express deliver. Actually  maybe it is  not so dangerous since Amaya Express are  so close  as Evelyn will  be embarrassed to have Amaya Express deliver since it would  be kind of pathetic of me. Or maybe Evelyn will  be OK with it in a pinch Maybe Evelyn will  fake a limp  OK these things should have stayed in my head. Ooof. What you really want to know about is the food  not my neurotic relationship with delivery so here goes... It  the cleanest and freshest Indian food Evelyn have  had in Toronto at this price point ! Mutter paneer  chicken vindaloo and achar with basmati rice and garlic naan all made it to my door in a timely manner. Amaya Express's online menu is huge  but Amaya Express did not  have the paneer Evelyn wanted listed but when Evelyn asked for Mutter instead of saag Amaya Express did not  even note Mutter not being on the menu. When it comes to delicious Indian  at Amaya Express if you can dream it Amaya Express can do it. Yes  it is  so good Evelyn m writing in clich s.
reviews.name: Evelyn

reviews.text: My husband and Kelly work very specific hours  and Kelly try to plan ahead if Kelly need to order take - out  -  how long is it going to take  when is it going to arrive between My husband and Kelly's shifts if Kelly have a night shift. Amaya Express has such crazy delivery it is  hard to predict. Sometimes it arrives in    minutes sometimes it takes literally over two hours. Kelly know they can get swamped  but they should give a heads up when you call to order. The food is okay. The food  about on par for how much Indian costs  and The food tastes okay. The samosas are pretty good  especially the day after  but Kelly guess most Indian food tastes pretty good the next day.
reviews.name: Kelly

reviews.text: Just finished a meal and watched as the  chef  picked up rice  in the  chef's fingers and watched as the  chef stuffed rice in the  chef's mouth  -  fingers and all. Made me want to vomit. Told server was totally grossed out. Told server was more concerned with bringing me the bill. Gary told Told server the bill was not good enough. Told server was not rude -  but really did not seem to know how to handle the situation. Manger was not there. When the  chef came out of the kitchen on the  chef's way out to leave for the night Told server told the  chef of the issue in Told server's language. Everyone very apologetic. The management needs to better train The management's staff   in the kitchen and server that should a problem that that arise  -  comp the meal or something more than a apology......
reviews.name: Gary

reviews.text: South Indian is always Aastha's fav for freshly made vegetarian dishes ! Ordered the rava masala dosa  with a side of idli and vada. Sambhar was a bit thick for Aastha's liking the chutneys were good so overall all flavours were a good blend. Made the mistake of doing take - out so the food was a bit soggy by the time Aastha got to the food. Best to enjoy in the restaurant. Tons of free parking on site. Reasonable prices and prompt service.
reviews.name: Aastha

reviews.text: Annalakshmi is a great place to eat vegetarian South Indian food ! The dosas Ganges ate were delicious -  Ganges had madras masala dosa and the special rava masala dosa. Sambar accompanying the special rava masala dosa was especially great ! Annalakshmi could be a good competition for the other existing South Indian restaurants in the area. Service is excellent -  Annalakshmi were very accommodative to Ganges's requests for hot water  modifications to some of the food Ganges wanted and extra plates. And unlike Gurulakshmi  Ganges did not feel rushed to finish Ganges's meal. Only small note : Thalis are only available for lunch -  the menu did not  mention that  which would have been nice to know in advance before Ganges came for dinner. Menu should be updated to reflect when food is  is not  available.
reviews.name: Ganges

reviews.text: Great selection of South Indian vegetarian food. Home cooked flavours  great prices  excellent weekend buffet. Simple  good value  friendly service.
reviews.name: Aaron

reviews.text: Great Sunday Lunch Buffet ! !  ! Such a surprise ! The food tastes very homely and variety of tastes ! Simple buffet  but good buffet. Oh  unlimited dosa and puri rotti ! ! ! My new favorite Brampton restaurant.
reviews.name: Viranjith

reviews.text: Fun experience here. Food was good  -  Lisa have  never had Sri Lankan food before and Lisa really enjoyed their dosas. Lisa had an eggplant  Lisa think  appetizer that was absolutely insane. The chocolate dosa at the end almost caused a fight at Lisa's table  -  LOL. So good. Totally affordable.
reviews.name: Lisa

reviews.text: Non authentic south indian restaurant ! stop fooling people   Disorganized staff management and had wait for a lifetime to get a table n be served  after repeatedly calling server to take our order  Only saving grace was the sambar to an extent. Coconut chutney was awful  instead of using freshly grated coconut used powdered coconut  which gave a bad after taste. Dosa was bad tasted like readymade batter with loads of soda rather than letting Dosa naturally ferment  and caused indigestion after    mins finishing Karthik's dinner. Not going to visit Annalakshmi again. NOT RECOMMENDED
reviews.name: Karthik

reviews.text: Good quantity  good quality and great price. Lassi was okay. Wish they had dessert options to offer or filter coffee to finish the meal. Washroom is super tiny
reviews.name: Mehvish

reviews.text: Ordinary Dosa you can have in town. The experience was not anything over the top. Regular Dosa  decent sambar not the best chutney. Customer service was ok. Only took care of you when you called the server. Servers all stand together around cash area and just wait to be called or cued by kitchen. If you are looking for the best Dosa experience this is not the place but if you just want a quick Dosa for dinner you can find ordinary Dosa here !
reviews.name: Abi

reviews.text: Gurpreet think they switched owners and the food used to be great. Gurpreet and   others didnt finish
reviews.name: Gurpreet

reviews.text: Got   Masala dosas which came very quick but were cold and not crispy. They did replace Masala dosas which came very quick but were cold and not crispy with two new crispy dosas but did not listen to our spice request. two new crispy dosas was spicy and not that great. Also poor service.
reviews.name: Meenu

reviews.text: Highly recommend. Looks like a relatively new business and a relatively new business was full ! The service was quick and friendly. The portion of the dosas were much bigger than what Michele have  ever seen. They had this tipi shaped dosa. Will try next time !  !
reviews.name: Michele

reviews.text: Based on the reviews and pictures  Annalakshmi seemed to have the potential to be as good as Guru Lukshmi  with the pictures on Yelp showing that Annalakshmi's dosa  even looked exactly the same  served on a plate with pre - made sections for all the chutney  . Ashna was immediately intrigued to try Annalakshmi out  since it would be great to have a place to go to when you have not  made reservation at Guru Lukshmi but you are craving for an authentic dosa  really bad. Located in Brampton  surprise surprise  in a plaza not very noticeable. Ashna luckily got one of the last tables available in Annalakshmi. The servers were very friendly  which was the first thing Ashna noticed. Since Ashna's brother is vegan Ashna was happy to see that Annalakshmi serve a combo consisting of medu vada and dhai idli  but a combo consisting of medu vada and dhai idli was pretty deceiving  or maybe Ashna just read it wrong because what came was a medu vada and idli both soaked in yogurt  rather than a dhai idli and a separate medu vada. a dhai idli was not  very good because a dhai idli was literally a tiny idli drowned in a huge  gigantic  rather  bowl of watery and flavourless yogurt. For mains Ashna got the mysore masala dosa and Ashna's brother got the chilli garlic dosa. Ashna liked that Annalakshmi did not  serve the food within a minute  which is what Guru Lukshmi usually does. the mysore masala dosa  arrived in around   -    minutes. Ashna asked for no oil on Ashna's dosa  since no oil was an option however oil was clearly used. Furthermore  Ashna's dosa was pretty bland. Ashna could not  taste any mysore paste and the mysore masala dosa lacked flavour. Ashna did enjoy Annalakshmi's sambar  though ! the chilli garlic dosa seemed to be fine  since Ashna did not  hear any complaints. while Ashna were eating a waiting queue had formed  which showed that Annalakshmi is doing really well. One thing Ashna did appreciate was that when another customer asked to sit at our table while waiting for another customer's own table my brother kindly gave another customer a seat somewhere on the side and explained that Ashna should get our privacy when eating. Overall  Ashna think Annalakshmi has potential and that Ashna just ordered wrong. Therefore  Ashna will give Annalakshmi another shot for sure.
reviews.name: Ashna

reviews.text: Sheethal tried Sheethal's weekend vegetarian buffet. Authentic south indian cuisine. their weekend vegetarian buffet was packed. All you can eat Buffet for about    CAD per person. Give Buffet a try if you are a dosa  idli liver. Sheethal wish Sheethal had some indian bread as well like roti and Naan. Value for money.
reviews.name: Sheethal

reviews.text: Delicious dosas and uttapams. Good service. Place could be a tiny bit cleaner. Skip the vadas and idlis. Comfortable seating.
reviews.name: Jenna

reviews.text: Annalakshmi is one of the Best South Indian restaurant in Brampton. Lunch thali was very good and will always come back here to relish some authentic South Indian food.
reviews.name: Balaji

reviews.text: Excellent food anything you order exceeds expectations !  ! Alka come here for aloo parathas aloo parathas are super excellent The chicken sweets anything Alka order is really amazing Alka come here twice a month and go back feeling happy about the food Alka ve had Papri chaat chicken samosas everything exceeds expectation
reviews.name: Alka

reviews.text: Great food. The Indo - Chinese - South Indian fusion is out of the world  -  Chilly Idli and Chilly Garlic Dosa is a must have for spice lovers. The batter sold separately also lived upto the expectations.
reviews.name: Rishi

reviews.text: There  two kinds of good food  -  one that has excellent display if culinary skills and sophistication  and one that is  simply a good healthy nutritious meal  like home. Annalakshmi has some of the best home cooked meal like tasting food in the area. Abhishek were there for Abhishek's weekend buffet  and everything from Abhishek's idli sambar to Abhishek's chole and biryani reminded Abhishek of home. If you are expecting oil soaked overly spiced creamy buttery food Annalakshmi is probably not the place. But  if you want to taste idli dosai like your mom would make  do visit !
reviews.name: Abhishek

reviews.text: Been here few times. Staff serves you with dirty hands. Do not believe in washing hands after brooming the floors and cleaning tables with dirt hand towel. THE WILL GIVE YOU SPOON FORK AND WATER WITHOUT WASHING HANDS. Tasty food with dirty service. Spoke to the owner and attendant last time but still same. No change. Dirty services.
reviews.name: Bhoot

reviews.text: Very good dosa and chai. The owner comes out to check on your order. Annalakshmi smells heavily of strong spices so your clothes will smell when you leave Annalakshmi. The buffet looked ok so Anya always ended up ordering from the menu. Good place to come for a quick dosa meal.
reviews.name: Anya

reviews.text: Our favourite South Indian eat - out in the area. Nitin went to Annalakshmi sometime back based on a friend  recommendation. Annalakshmi is nice and clean and the servers were good. Of course  the ambience is not comparable to Gurulakshmi but again  Nitin did not  have to reserve or wait in queue. Overall  Nitin were seated nicely and ordered Idli sambhar  Vada Sambhar  Paneer Masala the Dosa  Onion Tomato uthapam. The food was very very good and delicious. Nitin ordered the Dosa to be crisp and it was spot on. The Paneer Masala filing was also very good. The sambhar had all the right flavours and Idlis were soft and nicely cooked. Annalakshmi  a perfect place to enjoy South Indian flavours and would highly recommend for anyone looking for a quick bite.
reviews.name: Nitin

reviews.text: Best South indian restaurant around Annalakshmi. Better than Saravanan bhavan. Was never disappointed on any of Dheepak's visit. Weekend buffets are fresh and prepared on the same day unlike other restaurants which reheat the food. Hope Best South indian restaurant around the town. expand Best South indian restaurant around the town. 's business and open up additional space as the place is very compact as of now
reviews.name: Dheepak

reviews.text: Visited Annalakshmi for Dosa. Jackie was surprised how busy Annalakshmi was. The food is ok Jackie did not  love the Dosa Jackie have had better. They sell a tamarind rice which Jackie would recommend. The decor is a bit drab. Jackie may revisit but would not go out of my way to eat Jackie as they food was ok. The service was good and staff were pleasant.
reviews.name: Jackie

reviews.text: Visited Annalakshmi. Food is excellent and lots different kinds masala dosa. This restaurant pure vegetarian.
reviews.name: Karis

reviews.text: Ahad should preface this review by saying Ahad usually avoid vegetarian Indian food whenever Ahad can because vegetarian Indian food is something Ahad do not  usually enjoy; except for the food served here ! Ahad was introduced to Annalakshmi by a friend who said nothing but good things about Annalakshmi admittedly Ahad was a little hesitant at first but Ahad was glad Ahad went for Annalakshmi. Annalakshmi has a decently sized Dosa menu consisting of different variants of Dosa to appease each pallet. Ahad went for the Madras Dosa which was quite amazing it had robust flavours and tasted quite spicy ! As an accompaniment Ahad had the Onion and Chilli Bajjis which were slightly oily but still tasted good. You also have the option to customize how your Dosa is made  less oil  more oil  extra crispy  etc. . That is something to note if you like your food a certain way. Service is always great here the staff always greets you with a smile and are very courteous; something generally not found in smaller ethnic restaurants from Ahad's experience. Ahad would definitely check Annalakshmi out if you want to get your Dosa craving fixed !
reviews.name: Ahad

reviews.text: Wow just wow for the delicious food ! Ferzyn headed to Annalakshmi on a Saturday afternoon  as were were craving for Annalakshmi's dosas and what took us by surprise was to see how busy Annalakshmi were ! Ferzyn had not  made a reservation and so wrong of me to assume Annalakshmi would not  be busy ! Ferzyn had to wait approximately    minutes as it was a packed house and this told us to have a look at the buffet. For sure Ferzyn changed our minds and went for the buffet instead of a la carte which also includes freshly made dosas and hot  hot puris served at the table ! the buffet comprised of chutneys  pickles rasa  sambhar    vegetarian dishes delicious ! ! masala potatoes for the dosa  idles vadas  yoghurt pulao  papads and   deserts hope Ferzyn am forgetting any other eats . My family and Ferzyn ate to My family and Ferzyn's hearts content and more. Simple  uncomplicated  delicious food for My family and Ferzyn's soul ! Thank you to service staff especially the   ladies who took such good care of us  always asking if Ferzyn wanted more dosas or puris ! Such pleasant smile on service staff especially the   ladies who took such good care of us  always asking if Ferzyn wanted more dosas or puris's faces in - spite of it being extremely busy. Thank you very much for helping me to tick off my cravings for South Indian food and Ferzyn will be back soon !
reviews.name: Ferzyn

reviews.text: Been here twice   food is good but the only irritating thing here is u have to pay for coconut chutney if u order idli sambhar . Charging for chutney is insane to customers if u r eating South Indian food. Restaurant business is all about customer satisfaction which leads to word of mouth marketing . CUSTOMER VOICE IS BUSINESS. Owner should revise the policy . Would rate this place above   if they more customer oriented . Good food n superior customer experience makes business prosper  !  !  !
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Daraious really love Annalakshmi ! Daraious used to love south - indian cuisine when Daraious lived in India and it was wonderful to find Annalakshmi. The food is really excellent when consumed in the restaurant. For take out  if you order dosas dosas become soggy and not so good. The staff is very polite and efficient. Daraious like Daraious's dosas to be crispy and The staff get my dosas just right ! Daraious have tried several of The staff's variations on dosas and while several of their variations on dosas are all good  Daraious's favourite remains the Butter Paper Masala Dosa. Annalakshmi serve chutneys coconut green and red  as accompaniment to the dosa and chutneys   are excellent except watch out for the red ! In addition to that there is Annalakshmi's absoutely delicious Sambar ! Daraious could have their absoutely delicious Sambar as a soup  : Do give Annalakshmi a shot -  Daraious will love their absoutely delicious Sambar.
reviews.name: Daraious

reviews.text: Neil love Annalakshmi's dosa ! Neil used to go from Brampton to Mississauga for dosa  but finally found a good place closer to home. Annalakshmi's dosa  are spicier pav bhaji and chilli paneer  than some of the other places Neil go to but Neil love the extra kick. Neil usually do takeout  but are looking forward to trying Neil's weekend buffet soon
reviews.name: Neil

reviews.text: Mel was on Mel's way to another restaurant when Mel drove pass Annalakshmi's new Mississauga location on Argentia Road. Mel eat a lot of Indian food but their new Mississauga location on Argentia Road is the first vegetarian restaurant Mel have  visited. The service was very attentive  as their new Mississauga location on Argentia Road was new and there was not  any crowd. The chutneys were a little too watered down  which diluted the taste  but the dosa itself was well made  -  thin  crispy  flavourful. Overall  Mel felt the food was over - priced  hence the   - stars. Mel paid     dosa  +  tax  +  tips  for nothing more than flour  potatoes and very diluted chutneys. Mel would have happily paid    or    and gone back again but at     a piece  Mel doubt Mel will  return.
reviews.name: Mel

reviews.text: A close friend was in town and so instead of taking A close friend to a more well established joint  Ahmed decided to try Choolaah Indian BBQ. Ahmed were not disappointed. Ahmed am a bit of an amateur chef Ahmed and consider Ahmed's palate to be fairly sophisticated when it comes to all kinds of South Asian cuisine. This is not authentic Indian food -  Ahmed do not  have rice and salad bowls  - but it is good wholesome  high quality Indian food. Ahmed ordered a bowl of rice  yellow daal and the koftas  meatballs . rice  yellow daal was perfect  the way rice yellow daal should be cooked. the koftas  meatballs were a little bland for Ahmed's taste  but otherwise not bad... soft and the right texture. Paired with the many sauces and onions and the whole dish was wholesome and rich and very filling. Ahmed's friend ordered the biryani which while not bad  still is not  the way real biryani should be  and Ahmed come from a city known for a city known for its biryani's biryani  - but then Ahmed still have not  found a single place in America that makes biryani the way they do biryani back home. The ambiance is good and there is  plenty of room to sit. The line moves quickly and at most you will  face a    -    min wait on a crowded day. The only issue Ahmed had was with the music  -  being a designer it bothers Ahmed that the music selection to go with such great interiors  could have been better... Ahmed would expect Bollywood classics or Indian classical fusion instead of the usual loud pop music. Tldr :  if you are  looking for authentically prepared and presented Indian food you will  be disappointed. If you are  looking for high quality Indian - American food Choolaah Indian BBQ is a great place to get high quality Indian - American food. Will be coming back to try Choolaah Indian BBQ's tikka masala and chicken next. Update :  went there again with a bunch of friends and tried Choolaah Indian BBQ's chicken tikka masala and pav bhaji. Choolaah Indian BBQ is hands down the best Indian place in Pittsburgh  -  pav bhaji is to die for. Make sure you sprinkle lemon on top and have pav bhaji with mango chutney.
reviews.name: Ahmed

reviews.text: Good food  may be a bit overpriced. F went while they were somewhat new and it seemed like they were still working out the flow of order and wait. F got an large order to go and they forgot a few things. F will go back again.
reviews.name: F

reviews.text: Good atmosphere and really helpful employees. Kelsey am not an expert with Indian food but Kelsey thought theirs was tasty. Especially for a counter service restaurant.
reviews.name: Kelsey

reviews.text: This is Indian food the way Chipotle is Mexican food. An approximation  an assembly line  if you are  in the mood for quick food that tastes decent. The flavour is good. Tried some Choolaah Indian BBQ bowls  lamb bbq and veggie croquettes . The paneer was fresh. Anusha would  definitely go here rather than a typical Indian restaurant in America  which usually serves dishes Anusha can make better .
reviews.name: Anusha

reviews.text: Solid quick Indian. Do not  go their expecting the experience  of a regional Indian restaurant with many options. Great healthy options for a quick bite for lunch or a casual weeknight dinner.
reviews.name: Andrew

reviews.text: Keri m officially a Choolaah Indian BBQ head. Keri almost always get the Samosa Chat... the Samosa Chat might be one of Keri's all time favorite foods. Keri also really enjoy Choolaah Indian BBQ's Pav Bhaji  which is like an Indian sloppy Joe. Pile it high with onions and squeeze some lemon on top  and Keri feel like Keri m back in India !
reviews.name: Keri

reviews.text: THE BEST. Sabina have been waiting for Choolaah Indian BBQ to open. Finally did and Sabina have been every Friday since opening weekend. Sabina love love love it. As an Indian person and a student Sabina super appreciate fast and delicious Indian food
reviews.name: Sabina

reviews.text: Tikki masala was very flavorful. Des had Tikki masala with lamb and brown rice and veggies. One bowl was two meals for Des. Des also had the paneer wrap which was decent. Naan was good. Des loved the sauces that you get to try. Des would like to come back again and try something new.
reviews.name: Des

reviews.text: Overpriced and oily. It made me and my boyfriend sick. For that price Cat could have  gotten food at an actual Indian restaurant. The sauce was so broken and oily ugh. Cat had such high expectations for Choolaah Indian BBQ too.
reviews.name: Cat

reviews.text: Brian have  been to Choolaah Indian BBQ twice now. Brian want to love Choolaah Indian BBQ because the format reminds Brian of Brian's favorite Indian restaurant chain in Austin  -  Tarka. Unfortunately  Brian have  been kind of disappointed in the food and dining experience. Both times Brian went it was totally packed inside. Sure  Choolaah Indian BBQ is new  and people are excited to try Choolaah Indian BBQ. The space is vast  -  well  the vertical space is. Seating space however  is pretty limited and cramped. Some parts are right up against the windows and line  and there is  little room for patrons to move around get toppings  and employees to bus the tables. It is also quite loud. Choolaah Indian BBQ play music that sounds like you are  shopping at an H M. As for food  -  it is not  bad. But also  it really lacks that punch of flavor that Brian have  come to expect and appreciate from Indian food. It really tastes like Choolaah Indian BBQ dialed back the spices and heat to appeal to the midwest palette  and Brian m not very happy about that. Choolaah Indian BBQ do not  offer any spice level when you order  -  but do have some hot sauces in the condiments area. Unfortunately  some hot sauces just are not  the right flavor profile  -  some hot sauces taste more on the tabasco pepper side of the sauce spectrum  and less on the delicious hot curry spice side. It  just not the same. Mango lassi is delicious. Samosa chaat is also quite good. Brian wish Choolaah Indian BBQ did not  use so many disposable plates  cups  plasticware. Another negative compared to my favorite Indian restaurant chain in Austin  -  Tarka. All in all  Brian think Choolaah Indian BBQ is a fine quick alternative to say  Chipotle but if you really want quality and interesting flavors  -  look to one of the old - school restaurants like People  Indian  Tamarind  or All India. In reality  Brian can get in and out of People  Indian just as fast as here.
reviews.name: Brian

reviews.text: Jae have visited Choolaah Indian BBQ yesterday. Choosing menu was little bit complex since Choolaah Indian BBQ have lots of options. Atmosphere -  Choolaah Indian BBQ is very clean and fency. All staffs and onwers are nice. All staffs and onwers have passion for what All staffs and onwers do. Foods - The foods are very authentic and tasty. Lots of tasty sauces are available Speed -  It was taking   mins to get a lamb meatball wrap and Choola bowl with a naan. Little slow but it is not boring since Jae can watch Choolaah Indian BBQ's cooking processes. Employees might have learning curves at this moment since Employees started leas than three weeks. Overall -  Indian Chipotle
reviews.name: Jae

reviews.text: Deliciously flavorful  fresh  not greasy  made to order fast casual meal. Gail love the Choolah salad and the chicken masala with fresh naan. The Paneer wrap is also delicious. Gail crave it all ! Get it to go or dine in for a bright  open  interactive dining experience.
reviews.name: Gail

reviews.text: Sneh decided to try Choolaah Indian BBQ after Choolaah Indian BBQ's grand opening because of all the hype about Choolaah Indian BBQ in the Indian community. Choolaah Indian BBQ does live up to all the hype about it in the Indian community. The decor is artsy and contemporary. Choolaah Indian BBQ is kind of crowded Sneh think since Sneh went there at noon once and also at like   pm once which is not  lunch or supper. Maybe it has to do with Choolaah Indian BBQ being so new. The queue for ordering could move faster but Sneh think this is not  restaurant  fault but merely because of the unique concept of presenting Indian food as most people think of  curry when ordering Indian food and Choolaah Indian BBQ has so much more to offer. Sneh have tried salmon tikka with salad bowl and chicken tikka with perfect combo bowl while Sneh's vegetarian wife has tried samosas  pav bhaji  and veggie bowl. samosas pav bhaji kind of suck and are far from being authentic but everything else was spot on. Sneh ate in and the ambience is casual. Choolaah Indian BBQ have these bench and seats right in front of stalls for condiments and drinks which makes Choolaah Indian BBQ really stuffed up and hard to move around and Sneh would  suggest Choolaah Indian BBQ take that off. The open kitchen with naans being made right in front of you is amazing and definitely worth watching if you have not  ever. All Sneh's friends who have been to Choolaah Indian BBQ have loved Choolaah Indian BBQ and Sneh all will surely come here again and again !
reviews.name: Sneh

reviews.text: Go to Choolaah Indian BBQ ! Authentic Indian flavors in a modern setting. Reminded me of an Indian Chipotle  where you can customize what goes into your order. Atmosphere was welcoming and playful and so fun ! Highly recommend.
reviews.name: Kripa

reviews.text: Laure ordered online from Choolaah Indian BBQ a few weeks ago. When the order came  the order was missing one major item. Calls to Choolaah Indian BBQ went unanswered. Laure then tried to contact Choolaah Indian BBQ in a variety of ways  through the website  etc. leaving a couple of written messages about the problem. Laure have never gotten any response  even though the situation resulted in a customer paying for food that never arrived. Just now Laure called the number on the website that is under the heading  let  talk and it seemed as though the number on the website that is under the heading  let  talk was only for ordering food at particular locations. Really frustrating. The food Laure did get was okay.
reviews.name: Laure

reviews.text: Choolaah Indian BBQ is the Chipotle - equivalent of Indian BBQ. Choolaah Indian BBQ is a great fast - casual place to get Indian food  which can be hard to find in Pittsburgh. There is free    - minute parking on site  which is also hard to find. Amanda am knocking one star off for the price. Expect to spend     person if you dine in and get a drink  which is somewhat steep for fast casual. That being said  the food is delicious  and Choolaah Indian BBQ definitely is near the top on my list when Amanda m looking for a fast - casual meal.
reviews.name: Amanda

reviews.text: Choolaah Indian BBQ is an awesome addition to Pittsburgh ! The ambiance is fun and modern and the servers are always polite and accommodating. Holly love the lamb meatballs. PLUS the automatic hand washer is sweet. Holly think chipotle is a better value but Choolaah Indian BBQ is still fun to go to every once in a while.
reviews.name: Holly

reviews.text: Creative  fun  unique ! Food was great and served up quick. Staff was informative and friendly. A welcomed addition to foodie neighborhood of East Liberty.
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: New fav place to eat. New fav place to eat. 's food is so wonderful ! New fav place to eat. let you try all the different masalas sauces  special drinks New fav place to eat. make daily. Trying new food can be a bit much for some people  so getting to try before you buy is PERFECT ! Free parking quick cook time  great location. winning You can even watch New fav place to eat. cook your food Traygen find that awesome.
reviews.name: Traygen

reviews.text: Rich had Rich's second Choolaah Indian BBQ experience this weekend and though there were some frustrating moments  Rich will still be going back. First off the frustrations :  Rich went Sunday afternoon for a late lunch    : ish . The line was long and there were a limited numbers of cashiers. Rich waited in line a good    minutes to order. Rich both agreed that Rich would use order ahead on our next visit. Now here is where Rich's frustration is mixed. Part of the reason The line was moving so slow is that cashiers were guiding customers through the menu in such excruciating depth that orders were taking multiple minutes to put in. One cashier actually brought samples of each masala to a group of four so a group of four could taste before ordering. While Rich appreciate the commitment to customer service and satisfaction this was frustrating to watch. Rich would rather see samples be given in a separate location so customers can make informed decisions before standing in line. Now for the actual food :  On Rich's first visit Rich got the Perfect Balance bowl with Tikka and Lamb. the Perfect Balance bowl with Tikka and Lamb was exceptional. Lamb was perfectly cooked and the sauce was the perfect pairing. On Rich's most recent visit Rich ordered the Choolaah Indian BBQ salad with Salmon. Rich would not  normally order salmon at a fast casual restaurant  but the strength of Rich's first visit encouraged something out of the ordinary. the Choolaah salad with Salmon was quite good  though not as a good as the Perfect Balance bowl with Tikka and Lamb. Note that this is probably due to the fact that Rich rarely if ever  feel fully satisfied after a fish meal. Overall Choolaah Indian BBQ is great. Choolaah Indian BBQ's ordering system is a little slow  definitely consider ordering ahead ! but that can be worked out.
reviews.name: Rich

reviews.text: Toni feel bad giving Coohlaah   stars but Toni think it comes down to the fact that Indian food just is not  Toni's  thing . Toni was excited to come here after seeing a lot of hype on social media about Choolaah Indian BBQ. The best way that Toni could describe Choolaah Indian BBQ is the Chipotle of Indian food. If you are an Indian food lover Toni think Choolaah Indian BBQ would be a must visit ! The atmosphere inside is very trendy and clean. Toni love that you could see inside the kitchen and watch them make the naan -  that was a fun part of dining here ! Choolaah Indian BBQ also huge  with seating downstairs and upstairs so there is enough room to be comfortable with a large crowd. All of the staff here was super friendly and helpful with the menu   provided a nice experience for us. As Toni said before  this was actually Toni's first time eating Indian food so Toni did not  know what to expect. Chris and Toni Chris and Toni ordered the  bowls Chris got the lamb and Toni went with chicken. the  bowls came with rice   the tandoori vegetables as well. You can pick any of the masala sauces to put on top of your bowl Toni chose the only one Toni was familiar with which was the tiki masala. They also had a few sauces to add on the side that were all unique. the masala sauces were the only part of Toni's meal that were actually spicy. Toni also ordered a side of naan that was delicious ! The chicken and the vegetables were both super flavorful -  Toni think it was the tiki masala sauce that Toni did not  love. Great addition to the Pittsburgh food scene if you love Indian food !
reviews.name: Toni

reviews.text: Very good and unique indian restaurant. There is a line on weekends and they   mins free parking right next to them. The paneer is out of the world and very nice and soft. The curries can be better but tikka masala and chana masala are really good. The biryani is an over hype and would say have had better elsewhere. The naan and kulfi arenvery good too. Pav bhaji was average and samosa was decent too. Overall Choolaah Indian BBQ Kaleend went there twice in   days
reviews.name: Kaleend

reviews.text: So Paul had to try   different Choolahs in PA just to see if amazing came with the name.... well it did. The food in king of Prussia was just as good as Pittsburgh. Watch out Mexican food has met Mexican food's match.
reviews.name: Paul

reviews.text: Natalia went to Choolaah  soft opening and was very impressed. Natalia would  been reading about Choolaah  soft opening for over a year  so was anxious to try Choolaah  soft opening. The first thing that struck Natalia about Choolaah soft opening was the ambience; the artwork on the walls is interesting the space is huge and airy and you can see into the kitchen  where the cooks work with big tandoor ovens. But  even better is the food. Natalia tried the lamb choolah bowl the lamb meatball wrap  and finally some samosas along with excellent mint sauce. All of these were great  and there are still many other interesting options Natalia want to explore. Finally  all of this comes at a great price point considering the great quality and taste. As Natalia was leaving  the wonderful staff happily thanked Natalia for stopping by. Natalia will definitely be returning !
reviews.name: Natalia

reviews.text: Nicole had high expectations for Choolaah Indian BBQ but were very disappointed. First  the portions are very small. For    -    per meal Nicole expected to leave full and that was not the case. Nicole ordered a chicken dish and a chicken dish was pretty slimy. Almost seemed undercooked. My favorite part of the meal was the   . nan that Nicole added on to my meal. stars for fast service and decent sauces but Nicole wo not  be going back.
reviews.name: Nicole

reviews.text: A bit pricey  but really enjoyed the experience. Carly like the menu  range. Carly m not super versed in Indian food so the cashier helped me pick out something  which was nice. Carly got our food quickly and were able to get a table on the second floor. The atmosphere is modern  airy and millennial - friendly.
reviews.name: Carly

reviews.text: Great Indian take - away ! Ed had the chicken roasted vegetables bowl -  very good ! Lamb meatballs -  very good... but you will be reminded of Lamb meatballs -  very good for the next few hours :  . Apps were ok. Lots of sauces from which to choose. Drinks are excellent. Ed suggest ordering online to avoid the line. But there is free short term parking in the lot underneath
reviews.name: Ed

reviews.text: Really loved the food every time John have  been here ! Service is quick and friendly. John took off a star because John think the food was a bit overpriced.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Rosta really do not  understand the whole buzz around Choolaah Indian BBQ. There are so many better more authentic Indian food in Pittsburgh. Rosta found Choolaah Indian BBQ busy  slow  over - priced and not tasty food. Rosta do not  think Rosta will really go back again. Even tho that Rosta really appreciate the lady who took Rosta's order who was super nice and friendly. Rosta would say that was Rosta's only positive experience there.
reviews.name: Rosta

reviews.text: Sanjeev have a feeling that most of the meat and vegetables and curries are frozen   cooked at different location and shipped to Choolaah Indian BBQ and just heated up here and served. Things like naan thin n tasteless    rice  paav are made here. Wooden furniture is not comfortable at all. Too loud music.ginger lemonade was something new and refreshing. The onions kept on chutney bar should be sliced and not chopped . All in all Sanjeev may not come again to a high priced low portion frozen food and uncomfortable place. for   balls of lamb .. table spoons of rice . scoops of tikka masala is too much
reviews.name: Sanjeev

reviews.text: Came here for a soft opening and Mike was really impressed. The interior looks nice and there is  plenty of seating because Choolaah Indian BBQ have an upstairs as well. The service was excellent and Mike's order came out in under   minutes. Now onto the food Mike got a lamb tikka masala power bowl  naan on the side  and mango lassi. mango lassi was very refreshing the only thing Mike would  say is that mango lassi could be a bit colder. a lamb tikka masala came with white rice and vegetables everything was seasoned perfectly. The game changer was really the sauces that Choolaah Indian BBQ have on the side. Mike tried every single one and the sauces that they have on the side were delicious and complemented a lamb tikka masala amazingly. Mike will definitely be back to try other things when Choolaah Indian BBQ officially open. Lamb tikka masala :
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text: Believe the hype ! Choolaah Indian BBQ lived up to the hype and beyond. First of all  Choolaah Indian BBQ have made such great use of the space. You come inside and the space is bright  clean  and open. The kitchen is totally visible from the dining area  including the massive ovens cooking up all kinds of deliciousness. Free parking for    mins in the garage next door is a huge bonus. The ordering process is generally smooth  but the menu can be confusing at first so you will  probably need to take a few minutes in line to figure out what you want and how to order it. Dont be deterred by the lines. John m sure the lines will move faster as people figure out how to order. Now  about the food  obviously the most important part . John got a chicken masala bowl with basmati rice and chick pea masala and a side of Naan. John dare say it may have been the best meal John have  ever had for    bucks. The chicken was so incredibly juicy The chicken is  Bell and Evans !  !  ! and covered in a heavenly blend of spices. chick pea masala had the perfect amount of kick to chick pea masala. When mixed with basmati rice the entire bowl became a hearty and unbelievably satisfying meal. John scooped up every bite with the rest of Naan. John will be back again very soon. Choolaah Indian BBQ is amazing.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Everything was great  ! Jessika received the wrong order they quickly fixed the wrong order after Jessika told them Love the mango lemonade
reviews.name: Jessika

reviews.text: The food was tasty and the people were amazingly friendly ! Misti attended the Yelp event here with a great DJ  solid food  and even got one of Yelp's great PGH tshirts ! Our group ordered a variety of menu items and shared everything. Top of Misti's wishlist was the tiki masala  and the tiki masala was good ! Misti had chicken and white rice and the flavor was delicious and that portion plus naan would have been well enough for a meal. A great vegan option is the cauliflower and chickpea wrap  -  the cauliflower and chickpea wrap had great flavor ! The owner also provided a small portion of the chickpea soup  which was fantastic  and also vegan  ! Other dishes Misti tried at the table included the Croq Choolaah Salad with tamarind ginger dressing and the Paneer Choolaah bowl with yellow lentil sauce... both also very good ! What Misti loved about all the options were the distinct flavors and then the options to add the sauces to spice all the options up. Misti also tried the two kinds of lemonade available  mint ginger and mango. mango was very mango - y that is  a word right  ! and mint ginger was just a hint but was very refreshing. So The food :  Good ! Now  the atmosphere : everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. The space is very open and offered a variety of options for seating both on the main floor and upstairs in a loft. The open kitchen and modern decor make The space a nice place for a quick meal or to sit and chat. Misti also read that The space is a BYOB  so next time Misti think Misti will  have a nice bottle of white wine to go with Misti's spicy dish !
reviews.name: Misti

reviews.text: Came here for Choolaah Indian BBQ's soft opening today and could not have been more impressed ! As soon as Ashley walked in  Choolaah Indian BBQ was immaculate smelled delicious  and was organized ! The food was AMAZING !  ! Ashley got the pandeer and Ashley's bf got the lamb. Will definitely be back.
reviews.name: Ashley

reviews.text: Choolaah Indian BBQ. Choolaah Indian BBQ features a variety of menu items that satisfy the vegan vegetarian  or carnivore in your life and takes service to a whole new level. The staff are incredibly attentive and have separate areas for you to order and pick up your food. Have doubts about what is  in your dish  Have no fear you can watch The staff make your dish ! The kitchen is surrounded by a glass wall and allows you perfect vision into the food The staff are preparing for you. The staff are also incredibly knowledgeable about all of the ingredients in each dish and can assist you in choosing which sauce pairs well with what. The interior of Choolaah Indian BBQ is clean and modern  and has enormous windows for natural lighting. Lots of seating to choose from  including an upstairs balcony. The staff are also BYOB friendly  so have a go at pairing your favorite beverage with your favorite meal ! You wo not  be disappointed !
reviews.name: Jenny

reviews.text: Taylor love the food there and the people who work there are friendly. The tikka masala bowl is awesome and filling
reviews.name: Taylor

reviews.text: Lakshmi have  been very excited to try Choolaah Indian BBQ as Lakshmi drive past Choolaah Indian BBQ almost daily and watched the construction. The space is big and beautiful and well lit. The line  for a Saturday night  was long. But moved quickly. The staff even gave us some complementary drinks while waiting. The food :  as an Indian food snob  Lakshmi was pretty impressed. Especially something labeled as Indian  fast  food. Several of the dishes were average  but a few standouts :   - the dal  masala aka dal makhani -  dal makhani takes hours to cook and this was executed very well. The lentils and kidney beans were soft yet had still of a bite. The gravy was silky and well balanced  - pav bhaji  -  the classic Indian street food. The buns were nicely toasted  and the  bhaji   the mashed vegetable and lentil mix  was nicely spiced and excellently paired with minced red onion and chilis. The tandoor meat paneer  and vegetables  -  when you enter Choolaah Indian BBQ you see the gigantic tandoor ovens to the left of the register. The chicken  paneer  and vegetables were superb. All well charred on the outside. paneer was soft on the inside   paneer was still juicy  and the vegetables were perfectly roasted. Things Lakshmi could have done without :  the samosas chaat. the samosas were just average.
reviews.name: Lakshmi

reviews.text: Choolaah Indian BBQ is like an Indian Chipotle. Ben consider that to be a compliment. Since Ben like Chipotle and love Indian food Ben think it is  a great combo ! Ben had lamb with rice and tikka and tandoori veggies along with a side salad and a mango lassi. The only thing Ben would  say is that the price and the serving sizes are not  a good match. The servings should larger for the price in my opinion. Unfortunately  Ben m back to being a glutard and was not  able to have any of the fresh naan. Clearly the operation is centered around the naan ovens  so Ben would expect it to be excellent. The sauces station has some great sauces as well. If Ben lived close Ben would probably come here a lot.
reviews.name: Ben

reviews.text: Sasha love indian food  -  REAL indian food  -  but this will definitely do in a pinch. Quick service  lots of variety and vegan options as well. Like the BYOB option here in a fast food joint. Decent location quickly prepared  taste is not  too bad at all. Sasha cannot remember which vegan dishes Sasha had  but the roti was ok for sure.
reviews.name: Sasha

reviews.text: Alycia's lamb balls must have cocaine in Their lamb balls. Alycia never had cocaine but Alycia assume cocaine eventually releases the same feeling Alycia feel as Alycia eat the lamb. Alycia wish Alycia had some free lamb balls right now ! God bless Choolaah Indian BBQ
reviews.name: Alycia

reviews.text: This was Julia's second time at Choolaah Indian BBQ. Julia had a similar experience to Julia's first time... no disappointment ! Julia ordered the choolah bowl with paneer and a choolah salad with veggies to split with Julia's husband. the choolah bowl with paneer and a choolah salad with veggies to split with my husband were really good. The paneer pieces were very thick. Julia loved The paneer pieces. Julia ordered our food to go. Everything was packed very well and it was intact when Julia got home. Julia parked in the garage behind Choolaah Indian BBQ. It is free for the first    minutes. Beats trying to find a spot on the street. Juliam not in the mood for indian food everyday but when Julia am Julia will be sure to return.
reviews.name: Julia

reviews.text: Abbie think Choolaah Indian BBQ is  an ideal place for those who likes Indian food but do not  wanna spend time at dine - in. Choolaah Indian BBQ is a nice place to have decent Indian food with fast - food service. Abbie had Choolaah Indian BBQ rice bowl with chicken and added extra naan  and extra masala. Abbie like there are  many options for the masala sources  Tikka masala and Yellow Daal masala are really good ! The size portion is pretty large for small appetites but Abbie think for guys will be perfect.
reviews.name: Abbie

reviews.text: Expensive but good for  fast food  Indian. Honestly  the no fee on Uber eats makes it hard to resist. The not so secret sliders were great !
reviews.name: Jamie

reviews.text: Great ambiance and tasty fast food. Good atmosphere. It  also byob. Not very spicy but you can tailor your spice once you have ordered.
reviews.name: Glen

reviews.text: If you want an expensive soulless trendy and sterile pseudo - ethnic experience where they have  turned       tears of sub - Asian cuisine tradition into Panera Paneer and a tikka made out of Campbell  organic tomato soup  see picture  ... you will  like Choolaah Indian BBQ. The naan is very thin and generally the food is mild. The  Amish paneer  tastes a lot like  Amish farmer cheese  and has none of the sourness or creamy qualities. One actual Indian American worker in the    +  staff Herb saw. This is the mall food court version of Indian cuisine. They also messed up our order the first time Herb was here when someone else wanted something changed Herb ended up with hybrid of what Herb ordered and what they did. The manager gave One actual Indian American worker in the    +  staff Herb some free cheese as an apology and corrected it  too. The naan so thin The naan is  naan - existent and the biryani got merged with pot pie. Enjoy upbeat house music encouraging you to eat  and leave quickly.
reviews.name: Herb

reviews.text: It was a little intimidating when Mary Lou came in to order but once Mary Lou figured out how it worked it was awesome ! Mary Lou chose a bowl with veggies and tikka masala. Mary Lou also got the samosas. Indian food is my fave and to have a place like Choolaah Indian BBQ where it is  quick makes Indian food even better. A really great additional to the Pittsburgh food scene.
reviews.name: Mary Lou

reviews.text: Fresh and tasty food. A great way to indulge some quick vegetarian and other Indian options.
reviews.name: Yaier

reviews.text: Right from the start Alfonsina were greeted warmly. The gentleman who waited on Alfonsina gave Alfonsina a tour of the menu and even gave Alfonsina a sampling of Choolaah Indian BBQ's different masala sauces. Alfonsina also got an appetizer the samosas. the samosas were wonderful and although fried were not  greasy. Alfonsina each had lamb meatballs as Alfonsina's protein and my version came with the tandoori veggies. Definitely will be coming back !  !  !
reviews.name: Alfonsina

reviews.text: Indian fast - casual  ! Ca not  be beat. The decor for Choolaah Indian BBQ is very cool. You sort of walk in and need to take a few minutes to look around. Ordering can be a bit overwhelming when you literally want to try everything so go with a friend so you can order a few things and split. Choolaah Indian BBQ's cashier was very friendly and helpful when Maroula made out decisions and Our cashier even chatted with us about culture  which mean Our cashier enjoys what Our cashier is doing ! Maroula ordered a Lassi  Choolah Salad with Chicken  Naan the Veggie Sloppy Joe type appetizer  and the black Lentils with Rice. The Salad had to be Maroula's favorite with the Indian - style Ranch dressing  which is more flavorful than the other dressing . The Salad had chickpeas pickled onions and roasted cauliflower which made The Salad unique. The Mango Lassi was good  but not as refreshing as Maroula would have thought. It was Maroula's first experience so Maroula am happy Maroula tried The Mango Lassi. Choolaah Indian BBQ is really clean and everyone is smiling. Parking was easy in the lot next door. Maroula paid just    for   +  hours. Maroula will definitely be back to try some more items !
reviews.name: Maroula

reviews.text: As the only non - South Indians in Guru Lukshmi  Meems were wowed. Our  st time dosa meal was a great surprise. Delicious  fresh coconut flavours  friendly and helpful service ... very cramped location but they are moving soon ! Definitely worth trying if you are  adventurous and ready for some tasty heat. YUMMY ! PS. also great for my daughter who is wheat - free  as the Dosas are made with rice chick pea. Tonnes of choices for my daughter who is wheat - free's which is never the case in restaurants.
reviews.name: Meems

reviews.text: Whatever opinion jaspal have of south indian food esp dosa  please leave them at the door. Guru Lukshmi is not for the weak hearted though Guru Lukshmi do have some non spicy dosa . jaspal was simply blown by the variety of dosa  Guru Lukshmi has. The Green chilli dosa is the best.
reviews.name: jaspal

reviews.text: If Guru Lukshmi was my regular place to eat  Bernard would  have a coronary heart attack by the time Bernard   . That said  Guru Lukshmi is  definitely a place worth checking out if you have the heart for some Indian dosa with some spice but be aware of the ghee  butter cause the ghee  butter is  heavy. Bernard found a single dosa to be gigantic and definitely filling with many to choose from. You will be amazed with size and mostly the taste. The dosa  are meant to be eaten with your hands so be sure to wash your hands and fingers before eating The dosa and also if you are  not familiar with this be sure to ask for extra napkins. Meanwhile  wash you are  meal down with a nice Lasi or Limca. By the time you are  done your hunger will be easily satisfied. Definitely come back every few months or if you can handle the spice and ghee hey it is  your heart not mine. Guru Lukshmi is about    -    mins from downtown Toronto. The wait can be long at times so come prepared.
reviews.name: Bernard

reviews.text: AWESOME ! ! Robin would give it all   stars if the seating was a bit better. Robin would however like to say that today              was my first visit and Robin was not even a bit  disappointed by the service... so Robin guess the negative service reviews have helped. OVERALL : Robin found the staff to be courteous and helpful and upon my asking the staff what the staff would recommend  Robin was suggested a couple of things off the menu... Robin ordered the first thing the guy ordered and was delighted to receive the first thing the guy ordered. TASTE : The taste was BETTER than my last recollecting of South Indian food while Robin was in India... The taste was better than Udupi  Gerard St.  Toronto  and LEAPS AND BOUNDS better than Madras Dosa Hut ... My wife ordered the usual  Onion Rava Masala Dosa ... that too was out of the world and Robin shared amongst Robin... all in all  a wonderful experience yes the ambiance is lacking and there are snarling lineups but the food makes up for it all ! A +  +  +  Highly recommended !  !
reviews.name: Robin

reviews.text: Best dosas in GTA ! You know the food is good when the parking lot is full of people waitin to get in. Clean and modern atmosphere. Place is small but the flavor is big. Will not disappoint !
reviews.name: Gajen

reviews.text: Living in downtown Toronto  Jessica am always down to take the    minute ride outside of the city for the simple purpose of eating a Guru Lukshmi dosa. Jessica have moved around quite a bit in the past few years  and Jessica's search for a dosa that tastes even slightly similar to the ones in Bombay and Delhi had not ended until Jessica found Guru Lukshmi. Regardless of what day and time you go  Guru Lukshmi is always packed. The tables are small and they do their best to squeeze in as many people as possible. Despite the wait and serious lack of personal space the dosas here are truly worth it. Jessica's favourite is their Chettinad Dosa. their Chettinad Dosa incredibly spicy  and the waiters never forget to tell this white chick every time Jessica order their Chettinad Dosa. Perspiring from under the eyes  their Chettinad Dosa is worth the pain you may feel for the rest of the day. their Chettinad Dosa  amazingly yummy. Jessica have tried several of their other dosas as well  -  spinach rava  paper mysore -  -  all so so good. Their little slogan under the sign outside says  your search for a good dosa ends here and they are not  lying.
reviews.name: Jessica

reviews.text: Eric's first time having Dosa . Eric's only disappointment is that Guru Lukshmi is not  closer to Eric's house. However it was definately worth the drive. Eric suggest if you have the time to make it out to that end of town for some quality indian dosa . There is a great selection of spicy non - spicy   veggie meaty dosa   along with many desserts and appetizers. Eric had the breaded and fried peppers as an appetizers and the matar paneer dosa as Eric's main dish. Very tasty fresh  and quickly prepared. Also had one of those special indian coffees for dessert. The bill was     including tip. So much quality food for so cheap. So much quality food for so cheap. blows Eric away !  !
reviews.name: Eric

reviews.text: Whenever Kam have guests from outside GTA  Kam take guests from outside GTA to Gurulukshmi. Food taste is really authentic Indian. Very good to excellent.
reviews.name: Kam

reviews.text: The five stars here is for the dosa   -  the dosa is best authentic  dosa Dharti have  tasted in a very long time ! the chutneys they serve with the dosa  are all fresh... each dosa comes with   chutneys  -  coconut  coriander and tomato along with sambhar Not only do they give you a variety of dosa both standard and unique  and south indian fare to choose for but they give you choices ! You can order the spice level for both the sambhar and dosa. You can choose no oil  little oil or regular. And the best  drum roll you can order dosa crispy or soft !  ! sambhar is good as the dosa and sambhar's just very satisfying. Dharti have  been there twice now and have not been disappointed. Dharti also get the chocolate dosa which is basically the dosa with nutella spread  -  the chocolate dosa which is basically the dosa with nutella spread looks like a crepe  -  so yummy ! Other new variations are pav bhaji dosa mysore bhaji dosa  and coriander dosa... all tasty ! Also for all the Jains Swaminarayans out there  -  they have onion and garlic free items on the menu  : The only negative is the seating and the organization. The place is always packed and it does not  appear they have  really figured out an efficient mechanism. Here  to hoping they work it out !  ! otherwise highly recommend going at an  off  time. Our first time Dharti waited for an hour ! well worth it tho !
reviews.name: Dharti

reviews.text: Joanne have  never had a dosa before. Okay  -  Joanne lied  Joanne have  had a dosa  but never an authentic one. It was   : PM on a Saturday night and there was STILL a line - up ! This is when you know this place is  going to be a good place. Joanne's friend recommended this place to us and My friend really pushed for this place. Service was great  -  they were very friendly with us but it was funny because the waiter made us order different things. Truth be told  Joanne had no idea what Joanne was really eating but it was delicious. Not only that  Joanne got to eat with Joanne's hands for the first time. Joanne was not as elegant as those who have eaten there before. LOVED this place. If only Joanne came to Mississauga a bit more often.
reviews.name: Joanne

reviews.text: Being an avid lover of dosa Steven had to try Guru Lukshmi. Friends in Mississauga raved about Guru Lukshmi. Being a frequent customer of various South Indian restaurants around Mississauga Steven's palate is very familiar with this cuisine so Guru Lukshmi had better measure up. In Steven's opinion some of the best South Indian food still resides in Scarboro..but let  give sauga a chance  : p Steven's first impression of Guru Lukshmi was that Guru Lukshmi was not  really much to look at  but who came here for looks Surely Steven did not . Steven mean you could tell they did try to give Guru Lukshmi that sophisticated look  but with the table arrangement it does not  work. First and foremost  Guru Lukshmi is small ! Steven mean really small. So do not  invite a big gang or show up with a party of   . Guru Lukshmi was busy Steven got seated quite promptly. Maybe its just me  but Steven found the seating not comfortable at all. It was like Steven was kinda leaning forward ! The service was excellent  organized mayhem is what Steven would call it. When it looks like everyone is confused and does not  know what is going on Guru Lukshmi still hums along.. and they get your orders right. All that aside the food is what brought Steven here and Steven was not disappointed. Steven absolutely loved the vada sambar  in fact to this day Steven still think about the vada sambar. the vada sambar was very authentic. Since Guru Lukshmi has so many different dosas to choose from  Guru Lukshmi recommended Steven try a bit of each ! So Steven ordered about   dosas and they cut it up for us so that Steven could have one piece of each dosa ! That was simple but it went a long way in Steven giving a thumbs up to Guru Lukshmi ! Guru Lukshmi is the real deal  the best in Mississauga. Guru Lukshmi did mention that they are opening a new location  so if Steven were Steven  wait. Once a new location is open  then check Guru Lukshmi out  Steven Steven sure the overall experience will be better.
reviews.name: Steven

reviews.text: Roma came here tonight for a dinner as recommended by many of Roma's Mississauga friends. Roma m extremely excited with the excellent results. Guru Lukshmi is a nostalgia - inducing family run South Indian restaurant. What was a gem Roma thought Roma discovered is actually a classic community restaurant. a classic community restaurant  packed during the dinner service. Be prepared to wait a while because Roma do not  believe a classic community restaurant take reservations. a classic community restaurant felt like Roma's favorite dosa chain in South India  through service and hospitality. This location is tiny for the amount of customers a classic community restaurant receive but a classic community restaurant are moving soon to a larger location. On visit Roma tried the bonda      two small deep fried flour balls stuffed with spiced potatoes and served with coconut chutney . the bonda      two small deep fried flour balls stuffed with spiced potatoes and served with coconut chutney was okay as Roma have had better. spiced potatoes seemed to be the same spiced potatoes they used in dosas and a little creativity would have served dosas better. Roma also had the green chili masala dosa spicy garlic masala dosa  and the ghee masala dosa all    -    each . They were all excellently made and the dosas actually consisted of fresh chilies garlic  and ghee  respectively. The chutneys and sambar were strong  flavorful  and very peppery as a nice change to the stale status quo of uninspired dosa restaurants in the GTA. a classic community restaurant only accept cash or debit. Roma have to say that Guru Lukshmi blows Mississauga  Dosa Palace http : www.yelp.ca biz dosa - palace - Mississauga hrid : gf evlForvGRDgrs -  tw src : self  out of the water.
reviews.name: Roma

reviews.text: Amazing world class dosas and chutnies ! ! !  ! You must try Guru Lukshmi's special dosa with the bhaji  vegetables  added to the Mysore Masala Dosa. A little hint is to get your masala  potato mixture  on the side  your masala potato mixture keeps your dosa crispy !  ! BUT one star is missing because the place is so jam packed you can barely stand................please expand !
reviews.name: Naureen

reviews.text: Came here with some friends from northern India. Sarah all got the lunch buffet with a side of naan  obviously  and some additional kebabs. Everything was delicious. Sarah's personal favorites from the lunch buffet with a side of naan  obviously  and some additional kebabs were the paneer and the butte chicken but Sarah all did  also have lamb and some veggie samosas that others at the table liked. Prices were also extremely reasonable at around    pp.
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Bommie had veg tali cauliflower potato and chickpeas. Bommie m not an Indian food expert but Bommie really love this place cheap and this place give a lot always full and happy !
reviews.name: Bommie

reviews.text: So unfortunate to have moved away from this part of the city. Had a serious craving for Indian food so Lily went on a little walk and found this restaurant. It was midday and Lily saw a sign for an AYCE buffet for what Lily think was    . no more than    . . Lily were a little wary being vegetarians and not knowing what would be offered but the staff was so welcoming and kind and showed Lily the whole spread so that Lily could decide. And after seeing what was offered Lily would be silly to have declined. The buffet included flavourful dishes both meaty and vegetarian  with an appetizer section including salad  samosas and naan that kept on coming. Lily were beyond satisfied with Lily's small adventure here and are even planning on taking a trek to this side of the city just to enjoy this restaurant again. So to sum it all up : Flavourful filling food Extremely friendly staff Affordable prices
reviews.name: Lily

reviews.text: Jason had alot of doubt as the food in Montreal has been extremely bland  and in extremely small portions. Jason figured... aye if the food in Montreal sucks... Jason will  deal with the food in Montreal. Jason was given the menu and saw that the items listed the ingredients  which is not  really common in most indian spots that Jasonve visited . Jason ordered the Chicken tikka masala and the mango chicken  along with garlic naan. This is the best Indian food that Jason have  ever had in Jason's life so far. In most western European countries  the Chicken tikka masala are stew based. In the US  the Chicken tikka masala is  very cream based. THIS had the perfect mix of cream       and stew. Robust flavor in each bite. garlic naan  was PERFECT. garlic naan was so soft and tender  while have a crispy edge. The price was also reasonable. Jason m extremely happy to Didar for preventing Jason from giving up hope for properly seasoned and DELICIOUS food in Montreal.
reviews.name: Jason

reviews.text: Excellent food !  ! Sam's girlfriend says it was the best samosas My girlfriend ever had. My girlfriend  a vegetarian and had the thali vegetarian plate and loved the thali vegetarian plate. Sam had the butter chicken and loved the butter chicken. The naan bread was also amazing. Would highly recommend !  !

reviews.text: Went here with Hiro's friends tonight. Probably Hiro's favourite Indian restaurant. The room is clean  food is nice. Hiro would recommend the butter chicken. my favourite Indian restaurant  close to the metro orange line station so it is  very easy to get there. After all  food is nice  and cheap.

It is sad because one thing Roxanne really liked about my favorite Indian restaurant is that my favorite Indian restaurant were not rushing my favorite Indian restaurant's clients to eat fast like robots and then leave  like the ones on jean talon acadie but it seems my favorite Indian restaurant are starting to follow the trend as well  : Hopefully it wo not  happen again

reviews.text: My friend and Victoria ordered the butter chicken along with the chicken biryani. The prices and portions were reasonable. the butter chicken was very tender and the chicken biryani was very flavorful ! : Both dishes were delicious and Victoria will definitely go back !   :

reviews.text: Delicious food with a large menu selection. Low prices and large portion. Very friendly personnel. Quick service.

reviews.text: Nic drove by here the night before and Didar was packed. Nic figured what the heck  give Didar a try and Nic were so glad Nic did. Nic definitely recommend making a reservation as Didar was packed. Didar  a family - run business and Nic enjoyed how Didar seemed to know many of the clients. The dahl soup was ok but Nic found The dahl soup too liquidy. The tandoori fish  butter chicken and saaq paneer were absolutely terrific. Nic had a side order of rice and garlic naan bread and brought our choice of wine. The setting was ok but food and service were great and prices are very reasonable.

reviews.text: This place keeps changing between Dev and Didar. The food is always solid and pricepoint is good. People Mari know who have spent substatial amounts of time or are from India like This place so This place is  probably good.

reviews.text: Ordered the Channa Bathura  basmati rice  tandoori naan butter chicken  and beef korma. Everything was delicious. The curries were well spiced with deep flavours. The chicken was not dry and beef korma was really tender. Soaked up all the sauce with the naan and bathura. Service was good. David was quite polite. Will definitely return and try their other dishes.
