reviews.text: Didar is very similar to the ones in the parc extension area  byob  great prices and delicious  what Roxanne find better at Didar is that on busy nights they do not  tend to have you out of Didar asap like some waiters and waitress in the parc extension area byob tend to do. Didar have a nice menu with desserts Roxanne m posting pictures . Another great thing about Didar is that the waitress always ask if you want your dish medium or spicy so the meal you pick can please you even more  :

reviews.text: Update  June       : Em have  been back and what Em left out from Em's first review continued again. Em will  update this later. Em hope they realize that most brown South Asians understand What they are  saying in Punjabi because Em have  grown up watching Bollywood movies all our lives not to mention the fact that our parents also speak Hindi very clearly because our countries were once emerged and considered one single country.
reviews.name: Em

reviews.text: Didar is the perfect place for an affordable  low - key dinner on a cold night. Didar  a family - run restaurant near Plamondon metro and Didar is  BYOB. Tamara have  now visited Didar five times. Tamara really love Didar because Didar never fails to impress newcomers. During Tamara's last visit   Tamara ordered an assortment of delicious Indian food for the table :  lentil soup  chana samosa  vegetable pakoras  chicken pakoras  four types of naan  plain  garlic  stuffed with chicken  stuffed with potato . chicken pakoras and the garlic naan were our favourites. For our mains  Tamara ordered a sizzling platter of chicken tikka  spinach stew manchurian chicken  chicken tikka masala  mango chicken and jalfrezi chicken. Our favourite curries were manchurian chicken  first time trying manchurian chicken and Tamara were all impressed  as well as the chicken tikka masala Tamara's go - to order   and the mango chicken  deliciously sweet and savoury . The service is always great. While it is  on the slow side  the woman who owns Didar is sweet and has the woman who owns the place's son working as a waiter. Because Tamara ordered a lot it ended up costing us     per person but Tamara felt that was reasonable for the quality of the food.
reviews.name: Tamara

reviews.text: A family managed business. Cozy restaurant with a rich menu. Decent prices and quality Indian food. You could go mild or medium spice - wise. Ali did medium and loved medium. Naan  lamb curry and dessert is all Ali had and almost no complaint. Indeed Ali would go more lean lamb instead. But it was ok.
reviews.name: Ali

reviews.text: The food here is quite excellent  and Shelvin have  ordered delivery each time. While once the driver had forgotten a naan  part of the order Shelvin created no fuss  and promptly showed up with a fresh replacement. The food quality and spice levels are quite authentic  food prepared to taste as well . Really do recommend the sweets  especially the laddoos and lassi.
reviews.name: Shelvin

reviews.text: Em recently ordered take out from Em. Had chicken biriyani butter chicken  paneer masala and mixed vegetables. chicken biriyani was exceptional since Em used meat from chicken drumsticks and not just chicken breast since just chicken breast has potential to become too dry if over cooked. mixed vegetables smelled amazing. Em did not  care for the butter chicken or paneer masala so much because Em was already full from chicken biriyani but It would not  hurt if Em cooked it is  chicken a little less since it was a bit on the dry side. Service was really quick. Em were done preparing and packing the order before Em even got there. Em will  definitely be replacing Em's go to biriyani places with Em now.
reviews.name: Em

reviews.text: Came here for lunch buffet the staff is very nice and welcoming. The naan was amazing as well. Love the food here  highly recommend.
reviews.name: Mandy

reviews.text: Great quality Indian food. Came here for the lunch buffet and the lunch buffet did not disappoint. The options were butter chicken chicken curry  a spinach dish lentils rice  vegetables samosas  and a sweet Indian delicacy for dessert. Michael spoke to one of the people who work there and one of the people who work there said that The options vary throughout the week. The options were full of flavour the meats were very tender and did not look like the meats were just sitting there all day. One thing that Michael noticed was that  although Great quality Indian food was great  they could have  made the meats a little hotter and potentially spicier  Michael m a fan of spicy food . All in all  great meal  great value and cannot wait to go back.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: Terrible customer service. Argues with me on phone  rude. Then they got my order wrong and when David called back they hung up on me.

reviews.text: Decided to go try some Filipino food on a Saturday evening however  Didar was hosting an event and Richard were not able to eat there. Walked around Victoria avenue and stumbled across Didar. Richard must say Richard were truly impressed. Richard have not  seen such an eclectic menu in an Indian restaurant in such a long time. Richard ordered a variety of dishes butter chicken beef vindaloo  tandoori chicken  okra lentils  shrimp masala etc... and none of the dishes disappoint. The flavours were incredible and on point. The service was fantastic. Didar is a family run business and Didar do a great job in managing the night time rush. Richard need to head back there shortly as there were so many dishes Richard wanted to taste. Richard think it will take Richard at least   visits to try such an eclectic menu in an Indian restaurant and Richard am positive such an eclectic menu in an Indian restaurant will taste as good as Richard's first time. You can savour the love Didar put in to each of Didar's dishes.
reviews.name: Richard

reviews.text: Great lunch option ! . Sam had the buffet for lunch yesterday and enjoyed the variety and hearty flavours. Things could have been warmer yes. But all you can eat indian food for     makes you forget the flaws. Sam was surprised that Sam were just one of two occupied tables at prime lunch time. Maybe people do not  know about the deal because now that Sam do  you can bet Sam will  be back ! The naan came out fresh and hot and was just to my liking. The restaurant itself is not fancy but seems to be clean. The staff were nice and welcoming. The restaurant itself do delivery for    on orders more than so Sam will probably take advantage of this at some point. Looking forward to trying some of The restaurant itself's other dishes.
reviews.name: Sam

reviews.text: Great quality Indian food. Came here for the lunch buffet and the lunch buffet did not disappoint. The options were butter chicken chicken curry  a spinach dish lentils rice  vegetables samosas  and a sweet Indian delicacy for dessert. Michael spoke to one of the people who work there and one of the people who work there said that The options vary throughout the week. The options were full of flavour the meats were very tender and did not look like the meats were just sitting there all day. One thing that Michael noticed was that  although Great quality Indian food was great  they could have  made the meats a little hotter and potentially spicier  Michael m a fan of spicy foo . All in all  great meal  great value and cannot wait to go back.

reviews.text: After having come here    +  times  visit has become a much needed regular in Sam's life. Consistency with Indian food tends to be an issue at some places but not here. Every time Sam come  Sam get fresh  hot and delicious food. Seriously the best value for good Indian food. Sam most often get the non Veg Thali       with either Chicken curry or Butter chicken and either with Chana masala or lentils. Sam have  tried many other dishes and have been amazed with the mix of flavour and spices. Some dishes that stick out to Sam is the Lamb vidaloo and the mango chicken. the Lamb vidaloo and the mango chicken delicious. the Lamb vidaloo and the mango chicken also have the best naan Sam have  ever had in Sam's life. If you are vegetarian  they have extensive veggie options as well ! The restaurant itself is clean  comfortable and casual. There are often families there and groups and The restaurant itself can get quite busy some nights. The BYOB aspect here is great as well. The locations across from Plamondon metro makes it easy to access. Sam have never ordered delivery but plan to during the winter months. There is a small fee but Sam m sure that it is the same great quality ! off for pickups ! Sam seriously can not  recommend The restaurant itself enough !  !
reviews.name: Sam

reviews.text: Pushap  Cheap and greasy. Tanjay  not bad but Harry m not sure why Tanjay did not  impress Harry. Le Taj Great but overpriced. Didar  Boom ! The sweet spot. So overjoyed today for finally finding this Indian place where they managed to bring the best  most deliciously prepared succulent dishes accompanied with friendly  aim to please attitude and all for a reasonable and fair price. Ok ok Yelp and Yelp friends helped Harry a lot of course discovering The sweet spot.. All the credits go to Yelp and Yelp friends and Harry thank Yelp and Yelp friends for Yelp and Yelp friends's honest and just reviews. Kudos. Harry ordered Chana samosa  samosas shrimp masala  lamb karahi  paneer saag butter chicken  spinach  potatoes and chicken naan and rice. One is better than the next but got to say lamb karahi was the star amongst today  choices. No funky smell or anything  fall off the bone tender juicy meat. Just amazing ! A bit too much food for   where Harry got stuffed and had to ask to take the leftover home. When asked our spiciness level  Harry had to go between mild and medium. Not to Harry's liking of course but had to be accommodating to the rest on the table. Sigh    The sweet spot. is not one of the best looking but The sweet spot. is  clean  modest and has this authentic setting. Who cares about the looks Once you start eating The sweet spot. 's super tasty food and the wine you brought with you  looks of The sweet spot. wo not  matter. You are  now indulged in gluttony ... Nothing else matters at this point Harry's friend. Just dig in and enjoy the moment. Harry will most definitely come back and try the other goodies. The sweet spot. is waaay up on Harry's Indian resto list now. Number   for sure. Most likely will come alone at least once and ask The sweet spot. to make it extra spicy for Harry bcs Harry's usual company are bunch of chicken with weak tolerance for spicy and hot food. Harry must have  been an Indian in Harry's previous life just bcs Harry love The sweet spot.'s food with The sweet spot.'s same tolerance level for spiciness. An amazing find indeed.
reviews.name: Harry

reviews.text: Denis visited Didar for dinner on a quiet Wednesday Evening. There were a few group of people enjoying a few group of people enjoying their dinner's dinner and a steady stream of take out orders coming in and out so it seemed like a good sign. Denis ordered an entree of veggie pakora  Butter Chicken  Saag Lamb and a Chickpea Chana with two garlic naan bread. Everything was hot  fresh and very well seasoned. Denis will definitely be back to try other dishes !
reviews.name: Denis

reviews.text: Didar gets better every single time. Michael have  been coming here for a while now and Michael can not  get enough ! The value is amazing. Great quality Indian food for an appropriate price. Didar's butter chicken is incredible. Their butter chicken is jam packed with flavour and spices. Their butter chicken is a perfect meal on a wintery evening. The lentils are also delicious. Didar do not skip out on the portion sizes as well as the amount of actual lentils in the dish which is nice. The naan bread is incredible. There  always some crunch as well as some fluff to The naan bread. The texture is amazing. The chicken tikka was a new dish that Michael tried this time. The chicken tikka came out sizzling hot  full of steam. There were green peppers  onions and large portions of chicken. The chicken tikka was also delicious  full of great flavour. Overall  Didar is amazing ! The staff is friendly and kind and the food is delicious.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: Im writing this review based on the service it is mediocer. Ive been standing at the entry for    minutes and all the server are doinng nothing but standing at the cash staring at me hoping id go away or something. Elsa dont feel welcomed at all
reviews.name: Elsa

reviews.text: A friend of mine kept insisting to go to Didar. Vikrant went after a few years. Vikrant was highly disappointed in the food. Everything is sweet and tastes highly americanfied Indian food but to a degree that it starts tasting bad. Vikrant ordered   -   different things and most of the stuff tasted the same. Do not  recommend going here.

reviews.text: Best Naan ever ! The tikka masala was also great. Abiar will return.

reviews.text: Perfect place for authentic Indian cuisine. Perfect place for authentic Indian cuisine  not a fancy place but food is absolutely delicious.

reviews.text: The food is simply amazing  prices under     Friendly staff  the waiting time is under    minutes. If you want authentic Indian food  go to Didar !

reviews.text: Always friendly and helpful ! The food is delicious ! Zara's favorite dish is a lentil soup and tandoori naan flat bread

reviews.text: Very nice restaurant well priced for the portions you get with friendly service.
reviews.name: Karl

reviews.text: Although the decor is simple  Dev makes amazing Indian food ! My husband is Indian so My husband knows... our   yr old daughter loves the butter chicken Anne-Marie ask for the butter chicken mild for our   yr old daughter and they accommodate  . Tonight Anne-Marie got a Thali some pakoras  butter chicken and naan... so much food and so flavourful !  ! Definitely one of our favourite local spots !
reviews.name: Anne-Marie

reviews.text: the lovely food Better than the Indian food AC have  had in Manhattan and equal with that in Queens. Driving through the area  AC found this restaurant and ordered carry - out. The mint sauce had a little extra kick to The mint sauce; the samosas were light; AC's cauliflower was fresh and the seasoning had depth. Ca not  wait to be in the area again so AC will  have an excuse to eat the lovely food  and this time AC will  eat on the porch. The service was amiable. Excellent value. Glad to find high quality food in a quiet neighborhood.
reviews.name: AC

reviews.text: l Ile Perrot voici un excellent resto indien situ  sur le Grand Boulevard. Les plats offerts voici respectent la tradition toute en saveur de l Inde. Nous avons opt  pour un poulet au beurre et un b uf Madras accompagn s de l gumes m lang s  de riz basmati et  bien s r  de pain nan. Voir mes photos pour les couleurs . Le poulet  tait tendre et savoureux  marin dans une belle sauce cr meuse. Le meilleur plat  tait de loin un b uf Madras pr par  avec des cubes de viande marin si tendres qu ils se coupaient la fourchette. Il s agit d un plat relativement relev . D ailleurs  une note au menu averti le client   ce sujet. Pour ma part j ai d j  connu du Madras plus piquant. Sur ce point  j ai t l g rement d u  mais le tout reste quand m me balanc  et d licieux. Le resto offre quelques sortes de bi res dont la Cobra India Pale Ale  brass es Bromont qui accompagne parfaitement les plats relev s du Dev. Je vous la recommande   Un conseil  :  Ne vous laisser pas d courager par l apparence snackbar du resto. Il semble que c est une philosophie chez les restaurateurs d origine indienne et pakistanaise de ne pas mettre trop d nergie et d argent dans la d coration et l ambiance Le Dev ne fait pas exception la r gle. Ici comme dans bien d autres restos de ce genre dans le grand Montr al tout est dans l assiette.
reviews.name: Luc

reviews.text: Amazing butter chicken  friendly and good staff. William have eaten the Samosas Chilli Chicken Chicken Curry  Fish pakora Vegetable Pakora  Tandoori chicken leg basmati rice freshly hand made naan breads. The dipping sauce with Samosas is a tamarind sauce and the other one is a green sauce very interesting herbal flavour and spice. As a chef William can tell its home made and made with love. William always go to  Dev  and when you pick up your food you get     off and William usually call in my order and when William get there its all nicely packages and ready in a box. Amazing butter chicken  friendly and good staff.
reviews.name: William

reviews.text: Solid tastes and very family oriented Indian cuisine. Dollar  to value is excellent. Howard will return.
reviews.name: Howard

reviews.text: One of the best Indian restaurant in West Island. Service and taste is really good. All food prices were really cheap and best.

reviews.text: The food was tasty the service great but Joanne had intense stomachache and was sick... dont know why  Sometimes chicken can be finicky if not stored well. Joanne will try it again one day
reviews.name: Joanne

reviews.text: Got sick from eating here ! Food poisoning and a work colleague got sick from eating here too. Not sanitized. Food tastes good but not worth getting sick over .

reviews.text: What a spectacular Indian cuisine restaurant Again and again Sonia come. Always happy Food Service Best
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text: Excellent Indian cuisine served up in a nondescript converted house off the main strips on Ile Perrot. Like many restaurants of this type or category you are not  going here for seductive ambiance but rather the food  confirmed by the fact Liquid does a brisk takeout business  at a     discount  to boot . The menu is expansive but The menu are all fairly unique in terms of seasoning  type to type  -  curries will be distinct from vindaloos which will be distinct from kormas  which is how it should be  -  and Liquid will adjust the heat spice level on any given dish to your preference. Be sure to give Liquid's mulligatawny soup  channa somosa  and chicken tikka a try  as their mulligatawny soup  channa somosa  and chicken tikka are standouts and very good values for what you get. Liquid have not  really had a dud dish yet so couple that with the overall affordable prices and quality of ingredients used  and that merits full marks in my book.
reviews.name: Liquid

reviews.text: Excellent Indian food ! Anna were a large group of    people and Anna accommodated us without any problems. They are a large selection of meat and vegetarian dishes and Anna's service was very fast. Our food arrived within    minutes. All dishes varied around     for a very sizable portion. Will definitely be back more often !
reviews.name: Anna

reviews.text: Do not be intimidated by the underwhelming outside  Dev is  a good food spot. Dev looks almost residential  but Dev has a nice themed dining room. My little sister and Benjamin stopped here on the way home from a trip to Montreal  and Benjamin were very happy Benjamin did. Benjamin each got a different lamb curry  and the portions were perfect. The lunch special was     CAD  like  ish American dollars  and included naan  chick peas  and rice. Liked The lunch special enough to seek The lunch special out again. Dev take credit cards
reviews.name: Benjamin

reviews.text: Consistently excellent food quality... The rating is based on the food... The inside dining experience is ok... Prices are reasonable. Rob make it a point to eat here every time Rob come to Montreal. The chani samosas are delish and so is the beef vindaloo... It  a family run joint... The owners are very nice people to top everything off...

reviews.text: Not a big fan of lamb so guess Bac went to the wrong place. There were only few items on the menu that Bac could have. Bac ended up trying spicy chicken with some chicken kebab and house salad. The food quality is just okay nothing stands out. Service is very slow though.
reviews.name: Bac

reviews.text: Would give Charcoal Kebab House a  . star if Erika can. The kebabs and the pollo rice are tasty  but service is the worst. Erika were there for  . hours  only ordered   kebabs  rice and   noodles. kebabs finally came out after Erika asked the waitress to check on our order which was after    minutes of waiting. Chicken kebab and rice came out after another    minutes. Noodles came a bit after that but after  . hours Erika decided to leave and cancelled the remaining dish because the remaining dish was not  worth the wait. Charcoal Kebab House are under staffed and it is  too bad.

reviews.text: Update August      :    . star  -    star  =   . star   Got a PM from owner telling star that Jennifer am not welcome and do not come back  which Jennifer am ok with. But using profanity Jennifer am not ok with that.      . star   Noodles !  ! Hand Pulled Uyghur Noodles ! Pro Tip : Do not  be fooled by the name of Charcoal Kebab House ! Charcoal Kebab House just disappointing.. Skip ! Jennifer tried  Lamb    . -  meh Beef    . -  meh Shrimp    . -  meh Lamb Kidney    . -  dried and bland All the skewers just bland tasting All the skewers supposed to be marinated before bbq on charcoal.. definitely lack the fresh off the grill taste ! Pro Tip : Order the   noodles off the menu Jennifer shared   Langman with Lamb    . -  noodles cooked al dente with good bites  -  Love the green beans that not overcooked give good contrast to the noodle  -  spicy pepper and sauce are delicious ! -  portion on the smaller size Jennifer really enjoy Charcoal Kebab House's house made hot sauce which has a really distinguish favours and wondering what is  the ingredients. The waitress just said The waitress is not sure because The waitress did not  make their house made hot sauce which has a really distinguish favours The waitress    Charcoal Kebab House has a really limited menu. Hopefully there will be more interesting items be added and Charcoal Kebab House would improve on Charcoal Kebab House's grilled skewers since Charcoal Kebab House just opened recently ! Maybe Jennifer might come back and try Charcoal Kebab House's Danpanji  Big Plate Chicken with Home made noodle  or Manta  Steamed Lamb Dumplings      . but definitely not in a rush... Pro Tip : There are a lot of other restaurants in the Scarborough area that offers similar items at a much lower price point and taste better... Jennifer really want to love Charcoal Kebab House because of Charcoal Kebab House's nice family vibe but hopefully Charcoal Kebab House would improve over time as Charcoal Kebab House are really relatively new !
reviews.name: Jennifer

reviews.text: First experience with muslim Chinese food  lamb soup  lamb kebabs  noodles all very delicious
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Mimi was totally surprised when Mimi first came to Charcoal Kebab House. A very different kind of Chinese Halal food. The environment was great  unique interior as well. Mimi tried Charcoal Kebab House's famous hand - made noodle The dumpling  chicken   lamb skewers and lamb soup. The noodles  texture are tender  that is  exactly what it supposed to be Mimi like their famous hand - made noodle the dumpling  chicken lamb skewers and lamb soup  but the whole dish was way too heavily tomato - ed too much like an Italian dish. The dumpling was delicious with lamb and onion fillings. The skin was soft and at the same time strong enough to hold everything without breaking apart when you pick up The dumpling. lamb soup was really good with clear broth and lamb meat. Tasty not too salty. Mimi like the chicken skewer more than the lamb skewer  even though Mimi love lamb personally . Charcoal Kebab House is a nice restaurant as a whole and the waitress was very nice. Great service. Large portion with the price tag they are asking for. Will come back for sure.
reviews.name: Mimi

reviews.text: It does not  get more down to earth and fulfilling than this. If you love Uyghur  or otherwise Xinjiang food  Charcoal Kebab House beats any place in Toronto  most places in Beijing as well. Yes the service is inconsistent Charcoal Kebab House have  an amazing waitress on some days  and sometimes maybe another who deserve zero tips and a serious complaint  but all that aside  the food is what keeps people coming. Charcoal Kebab House keeps me  a over - indulgent foodie with no dietary restrictions  lusting over the label  halal . Indulge in lamb  and indulge in spices Charcoal Kebab House's portions are large  the quality have always been exceptional at least for the +  times Emma have  been there. So man up  eat halal
reviews.name: Emma

reviews.text: Charcoal Kebab House ! !  !  !  !  !  !  !   Foodie think the skewers are   x better than the next best skewers Foodie have  ever had in Foodie's life. Charcoal Kebab House have these awesome BOYLAN soda drinks in Charcoal Kebab House's fridge... If you come you should try the black cherry one omg but all of the other flavours are pretty good too !  !  ! Wish Foodie knew where to buy them in Toronto  : The lamb buns are SO GOOD there are actually chunks of lamb meat in The lamb buns and the flavor is so amazing. And plz if u wanna have some good da pan ji you can not  say u found the best until you compare some good da pan ji to the one here  !  !  ! :     Foodie am drooling just thinking about the food here !  !  !  ! Foodie saw a lot of ppl complained about the service but Foodie come here regularly and Charcoal Kebab House must have improved a lot since Charcoal Kebab House opened bc Foodie never really had much of a problem with service. So no reason for anything less than    now hehehehhe

reviews.text: Very fulfilling food ! Rather than middle eastern kebab  Charcoal Kebab House is more Chinese style Kebab ! ! Cynthia wanted to try a lot dishes. So Cynthia ended up spending    buck after tax and tips for a group of four. It was great food ! Big portion for sharing ! Nice service ! But very limited space and not taking reservations. If you want to go as a big group you might want to call Charcoal Kebab House for special arrangement rather than just walk - in.

reviews.text: L ordered a skewers combo  langman and a marinated kebab for   people. The food was awesome nothing to complain about. Minus   star for service. The waiters were not  that attentive and friendly. Will come back for more !  !

reviews.text: great food and good service. P wish Charcoal Kebab House have some more rice stuff.. great lamb kebab and spicy chicken dishes.

reviews.text: This is a truly deserved   start rating. Oh man  Marc am literally making Marc's mouth water just by thinking of that dish dapanji  made of tender chicken flat and wide handmade noodle west China style   as well as some random supplementary vegetables like potatoes bell peppers scallion n onions etc. Charcoal Kebab House is an Uyghur restaurant  and Uyghur is an ethnic group mainly dwelling in the west part of China and mid Asia. Most Uyghur are Muslim so the food Charcoal Kebab House serves is Halal. Besides Charcoal Kebab House's signature dish Dapanji  there are   more stuffs Marc would like to strongly encourage foodies to give a shot. One is the cumin - spiced lamb skewer. Another one is the  Naan   made from flour . In general  none of the stuffs Marc have tried there so far disappointed Marc. Marc have tried a few Uyghur style restaurants nearby GTA and Marc personally think Charcoal Kebab House is THE ONE you have to go. :  -
reviews.name: Marc

reviews.text: Having recently become interested in the Uyghur culture and cuisine after having looked up several media sources on - line  Eric was very keen to come out Charcoal Kebab House after hearing Charcoal Kebab House mentioned as a dinner with friends. Given Charcoal Kebab House's location Eric knew Eric would have to set a side a good day to commute here if Eric wanted to reward Eric's quest with a taste of the intriguing looking cuisine that was significant of to distinct Central Asian nation. But Eric's quest to go there was commenced sooner that Eric had planned when yesterday a dining companion keenly wanted to take a look when Eric mentioned Charcoal Kebab House to a dining companion. And so Eric did just that. Eric were both off to a funny start when Eric unexpectedly discovered that Charcoal Kebab House caters to both Mandarin speaking and non - Mandarin speaking customers when Eric were given menus with Chinese scripts in menus with Chinese scripts in them. Eric both had an amusing moment when trying to figure out what each dish was while also pretending to be academic linguists in the making by trying to decipher the Chinese description. Pretend - time was cut short when Eric decided to ask the waiter if English menus were available  Eric had a brief moment of embarrassment while going to get the respective menus. Most of the items are laid out across on a one page fold - out menu each accompanied with a picture depicting the described dish. There are a few noodle dishes that looked similar to one another with the beds of noodles making the distinguishing the difference a couple of soups and stews and the more familiar kebabs with the turkic style thicker naans. So Eric decided on getting the lamb kebab combo which comes with naan and an iceberg lettuce salad and also a langman noodle plate. The kebabs came out first and having not had lamb in a while taste of the bite size pieces were dainty for Eric and even more so when wrapped in a piece of the naan bread. Eric hope that the owners start serving an Uyghur style salad at some point  an Uyghur style salad would make all the difference compared to the ice - berg salads that are served at other more distinct places. But Eric definitely loved the noodles and what made it really good was the spiced - up gravy from the lamb curry that it was cooked in. Eric kept alternating between the noodles and spoonfuls of the naan bread. The flavor in the spiced - up gravy from the lamb curry that it was cooked in reminded Eric of similar flavors found in some of the curry based noodle dishes in Eric's country so it was really enjoyable to be able to taste something familiar from the langman dish. And if naan bread was also available as a side order Eric would have asked for one to soak up some of the spiced - up gravy from the lamb curry that it was cooked in yes delicious. Alot of the reviewers have mentioned the Dapanji so that what Eric will  have to try next time and maybe some of the other noodle dishes.
reviews.name: Eric

reviews.text: Worst restaurant ever  ! !  ! Jerry waited for    mins only severed me one dish. And it is  so crowed here  there is  almost no distance between tables  Jerry wo not  come to Charcoal Kebab House ever again.

reviews.text: Really like Charcoal Kebab House's lamb skewers !  ! Jamielyn also like Charcoal Kebab House's hand made noodles. Although   Jamielyn wish their hand made noodles has more noodles.

reviews.text: Absolutely Charcoal Kebab House is  a five star restaurant !  !  ! Great food friendly people do not  want to say too much but you definitely should try it ;

reviews.text: Jiaqi were really disappointed for the food here Jiaqi tried   dishes none of dishes made Jiaqi wanna come again. the lamb kabab was chewy and dry so were the kidneys. the lamb noodle soup was okay but the noodle tasted just like packaged noodle that bought from store. the other handmade noodle had uneven thickness and some thicker pieces were still raw in the center...plus Jiaqi had to use saltshake for everything !  ! normally Jiaqi am the one complian the food was too salty but today Jiaqi found everything was tasteless... plus Jiaqi waited   minutes for water     minutes for the first noodle soup...certainly not worth it

reviews.text: What terrible service. Allowed multiple groups to budge ahead in line simple because the other groups were rude enough to bully the other groups's way ahead. Refused to even talk to people who complained about it. The food is nowhere near good enough to put up with the management.

reviews.text: Charcoal Kebab House did not  have the best service. Though our waiter was good it seemed as though our waiter was the only one working. Which caused heavy delays for our food. When Amirtha finally got our food the aroma was great and our food looked good. However  it was not satisfying  considering how long Amirtha waited to get our food as well. The kebab  were nothing special  as Amirtha expected more considering Charcoal Kebab House has kebab in Charcoal Kebab House's name. Would not  recommend Charcoal Kebab House to someone there are other places that are better.

reviews.text: The food is great. Tried the lamb skewers and this huge bowl of stew. Really flavorful  but the service was terribly slow. Waited a very long time for food to arrive. Asked and waited for    min for water. And left before Atikur got our whole order. Charcoal Kebab House has great potential and will definitely go back that is  how good The food was. Hopefully service gets better ASAP

reviews.text: The rice with lamb is very good ! Too much salt in the noddles the kidney is raw and undercooked  lamb kebab is very very bad !

reviews.text: If it was just the food Charcoal Kebab House would get a five star. The kebab is the best in town and the noodle dishes are amazing. The service  however  is chaotic and unorganized. Charcoal Kebab House need a manager who is incharge of organizing the waiting staff and communicates with customers. There was a line of   -   different groups waiting at the door. It took over    minutes and customers overflowing into Charcoal Kebab House before a waitress acknowledged the presence of people waiting. By then everything has become chaotic. If Charcoal Kebab House had a hostess who greeted customers at the door it would help organize seating.

reviews.text: Found another gem in Scarborough ! First time tried Uyghur foods... Absolutely loved Charcoal Kebab House's chicken and lamb skewers ! So fresh and juicy.. no doubt their chicken and lamb skewers was made with perfection ! Also the staff was so friendly and helpful. Very cozy  dark   warm interior.

reviews.text: Very traditional taste. Very classic. Good restaurant for going out with friends especially who love lambs. Charcoal Kebab House is a restaurant you can go back. But sometimes the service is too slow.

reviews.text: Kevin stopped by Charcoal Kebab House tonight for some take - out. Kevin ordered the lamb dumplings and the Yangman noodles with green   red peppers  chillies  lamb  and onions. the Yangman noodles with green   red peppers chillies  lamb  and onions tasted good  although misshapen. Kevin really enjoyed the Yangman noodles with green   red peppers  chillies  lamb  and onions and the Yangman noodles with green   red peppers chillies  lamb  and onions were spicy. Kevin loved the green and red peppers :  the green and red peppers were cooked really well and tender but still a little crunchy. Kevin did not  really like the lamb dumplings. As Kevin do with any foods encased in another food ie. lamb encased in dough Kevin cut one open and looked inside before eating. Lamb and onions were inside  but many of the lamb pieces were lamb fat as opposed to lamb meat. Lamb is a fatty meat but the fat pieces  relative to actual meat  seemed high. Kevin would  estimate it was over     fat and so it was not  worth the     half - dozen dumpling price. Kevin considered ordering the chicken or lamb skewer  and regret not doing that as Kevin would have received more meat and paid less. Overall the meal was okay  just less fat in the lamb dumplings please. Kevin think Charcoal Kebab House is growing and improving and Charcoal Kebab House add a new style of food to the neighbourhood.
reviews.name: Kevin

reviews.text: Great food but very slow service. Sat    mins and they would not even ask unless ask. One person servicing al the people seated and standing is a problem. You ask One person to take order and One person will still not show up.

Da Pan Ji was bad bad bad  less flavour than before. Lamb rice was undercooked  way too greasy. Kebab was great but way too small portion for the crazy price. Seriously    Never come back again ! Totally not recommend !

Catherine have removed it from my comment  thank you .

reviews.text: By far  the best handmade noodles and kebabs in Toronto  -  undeniable robust with mixed flavours which is a cross between Chinese and Turkish. Small and bleak family business. Charcoal Kebab House is a haven for Asian palettes. Yummm

reviews.text: Love Charcoal Kebab House ! ToEat think Charcoal Kebab House is the second Uyghur restaurant in Toronto. The other one is Silk Road. ToEat used to go to Silk Road constantly. But ToEat live in North York so Charcoal Kebab House is a way better option. Charcoal Kebab House made  good noodles kebab dapanji  and ToEat also like Charcoal Kebab House's polo lamb rice. The only thing ToEat have to point out is that you have to be patient to wait your order. Charcoal Kebab House made everything very slow the average waiting time is    -    mins . So do not  go there if you are in a hurry. But ToEat have to say that most of the dishes are worthy the wait.
reviews.name: ToEat

reviews.text: Charcoal Kebab House is located just East of Scarborough General Hospital and McCowan Road  tucked away in a tiny non descript plaza on the North side of the street  but Charcoal Kebab House is  worth a visit. The noodles are very special made by the owners who are Uyghurs and where noodles were a staple long before the Italians made noodles the Italians's own. Uyghurs come from an Autonomous Region of China that borders  India  East Turkistan  Mongolia and Tibet. http : uyghuramerican.org about - uyghurs. The cooking is more Persian but different and unique in Toronto. Charcoal Kebab House would be a good fit in any of the cultural hot spots of Toronto such as Korea town  or Queen St. W  in Parkdale. Charcoal Kebab House's food is home cooking in the Uyghurs tradition with an emphasis on lamb and charcoal cooking. The best dishes are the ones with the hand made fresh noodles made by Buhachan who is the co owner along with Buhachan who is the co owner along with her husband Avi's husband Avi. The flavours are a mixture of Middle Eastern with Asian influences. Sue highly recommend the Uygher Somen and the Langman   lots of noodles and cumin and hot peppers   along with an abundance of fresh vegetables. .. The aromas are intoxicating when your plate arrives ! Look past the red roses on the table and ask the owners her husband Avi or Buhachan who is the co owner along with her husband Avialso known as Brigitte  what the owners Avi or Buhachan  also known as Brigitte recommend to eat. the owners Avi or Buhachan  also known as Brigitte are expecting a liquor license shortly. If you love lamb  Charcoal Kebab House is the place and if lamb is not your meat of preference order chicken. Other than charcoal shrimp which was overcooked  Sue recommend any dish with thehand made  noodles.
reviews.name: Sue

reviews.text: Fantastic food  very authentic along with the artwork hanging on the wall. Lamb skewers were perfectly cooked  and much larger than Ellen anticipated  very worth the price  and everything Ellen tried was very flavourful  but watch out !  ! The food is very oily  but delicious !  . Ellen tried the dapanji  lamb skewers  with naan Uyghur lamb polo  rice  lamb  and raisins kidney skewers lamb soup  and the langman noodles. the langman noodles are very long and have great texture. Ellen do not  have any negative comments for anything Ellen tried. It was all fantastic ! Ellen recommend Ellen's signature lamb skewers and the dapanji. The only negative comments Ellen have for Charcoal Kebab House are :  the food is served rather slowly  and the seating   service was a bit awkward... Tea took a while  which was strange to me Ellen am a regular at Chinese restaurants and tea is usually served immediately . Charcoal Kebab House is a very tiny place but it was worth it. The complimentary salad is nice  too.
reviews.name: Ellen

reviews.text: The food is excellent  service on the other hand is very slow  only one person to serve and work the cash and clean up in the entire restaurant. The kabob is to die for and the noodles are very fresh. Decent ambiance and newly renovated venue. Will would recommend the Lagman and Lamb Kababs
reviews.name: Will

reviews.text: Very disappointed  ordered lamb soup and vip noodle lamb soup and vip noodle came after    mins of waiting. Very poor service. Also ended up finding hair in my soup.
reviews.name: Ish

reviews.text: Yum... Charcoal Kebab House ! !  ! Just as you pull into the plaza parking lot you can already smell the lamb skewers from Charcoal Kebab House. The interior of Charcoal Kebab House is quite unique  kinda small but having a very homey vibe to The interior of the restaurant  with some interesting quotes on the wall. The server was very friendly and seated us right away. The menu is all in Chinese but everything on The menu looked so bomb  - Victoria wanted to try all of them ! You can either ask for water  or grab a drink of your choice from Charcoal Kebab House's fridge that Charcoal Kebab House have near the front of Charcoal Kebab House  and pay for a drink of your choice afterwards. Victoria ordered the lamb skewers lamb soup the hand pulled noodles and the short noodles sorry -  forgot the names of the hand pulled noodles and the short noodles !  !  ! the lamb skewers were flavourful  but a bit dry. Victoria have  read reviews that the lamb skewers were juicy but unfortunately  Victoria did not have the same experience. Otherwise  the lamb skewers were huge and the lamb skewers comes with handmade naan -  Victoria's favourite  esp anything with carbs ! ! ! the hand pulled noodles and the short noodles were super chewy and yummy as well ! The portions are enough to share between two people. Victoria would definitely recommend getting one of these dishes along with the lamb skewers.
reviews.name: Victoria

reviews.text: Definitely the best Xinjiang Food in GTA. This is including the famous Silk Road in Etobicoke. Almost everything is the same taste as they are in Xinjiang  where Lei had spent more than    years since Lei was born. If you are from Xinjiang  where Lei had spent more than    years since Lei was born  visit Charcoal Kebab House and you know what Lei am talking about. Best of all  -  VIP langman well  this is more personal as it is simply VIP langman's favorite Xinjiang  where Lei had spent more than    years since Lei was born dish - and it is hard to find something so authentic even in most part of China outside of Xinjiang  where Lei had spent more than    years since Lei was born Roast Kidney  remember to bite both the fat and the meat together -  if you remove the fat then you lose the best part of it lamb soup yes lamb soup is totally greasy but you just do not  feel it when you eat Dapanji is definitely delicious if they are not very busy...if they are busy let them cook Dapanji for a bit longer to make sure the chicken is fully flavored. They have been adding new dishes onto the menu and my two visits have been totally satisfactory. My only wish is they can keep the quality when they expand ! And they definitely will because they are simply so busy these days.
reviews.name: Lei

reviews.text: Tried lamb skewer with naan. Not cheap but tasted good and higher meat quality than other Chinese BBQ restaurant. Also tried soman  noodles    also good. Will come back to try others on the menu.
reviews.name: junkman

reviews.text: Mariam have  never had anything like Charcoal Kebab House. Mariam tried two dishes  the main being the beef skewers and it was unbelievable !
reviews.name: Mariam

reviews.text: This was a recommendation from a friend and it came with a history lesson that the Uyghur people that represent this cuisine are descendents of the individuals from the silk road that gave Marco Polo Marco Polo's first tastes of pasta. Suresh will tell you that Charcoal Kebab House is located in a strip plaza and has a quaint little ambience. The sounds and smells from the kitchen add to the experience. The menu is simple and is presented with pictures. While Suresh waited for Suresh's meal Suresh enjoyed some tea which had to steep for    minutes. Suresh ordered the lamb and chicken skewers as the lamb and chicken skewers are a staple on the menu and came highly recommended. It was good and eating it with the naan is incredible. You can taste the cumin and other spices as the cumin and other spices came through. The chicken was so soft and tender The chicken was Suresh's preferred choice. Uyghur Somen a dish that is made with a short noodle with veal and peppers cilantro  string beans tomatoes  and other fresh vegetables. The broth was hearty  earthy and flavourful there was something familiar yet new about the taste. The spices were hot but you could not  taste The spices on the front end The spices blended nicely and complemented the overall flavour. You can tell if this was Marco Polo's first experience to pasta how Marco  s first experience to pasta was the inspiration for what the world knows today. A really excellent experience  while the food is not fast that is  one of the redeeming qualities as everything is fresh. Suresh will definitely be coming back.
reviews.name: Suresh

reviews.text: A delightful experience ! !  ! Definitely it was worth driving there from mississauga. A small but nice place. Tastefully decorated. Great service. Shabbir had Lamb Kabob and Lamb Kidney. Shabbir have not  found this Kidney Kabob in other restaurants pretty  unique Shabbir rather say... and pretty good. All the items were very well prepared and delicious. Charcoal Kebab House is one of the best Kabob places Shabbir have been so far.
reviews.name: Shabbir

reviews.text: looking for longevity noodles you will  find longevity noodles here. longevity noodles are never ending  -  to the point where a single strand will fill up half your bowl ! after much effort to get a single strand into your bowl to begin with.. longevity noodles shone on longevity noodles's own with longevity noodles's toothsomeness  but longevity noodles also comes with a decent amount of veggies LAMB SOUP is on the greasier side  as a lot of the meat is quite fatty. if you are  not careful  the spicy oil drizzled on top will catch you by surprise. all   of us were coughing within the first few sips. oops ! luckily the spicy oil drizzled on top is  not a lingering nor mouth - numbing kind of spice. still necessary though  as Yvonne have a feeling LAMB SOUP would have  been way too lamb - y without the spicy oil drizzled on top. there is  a LAMB KEBAB COMBO which comes with   large skewers of tender grilled lamb naan  and a vinaigrette - heavy  though still refreshing  salad. the flavor of this kebab was super intense; spot on. the UYGHUR LAMB POLO rice pilaf had some carrot and raisins mixed in  with a chunk of lamb on top. rice was toothsome too; not bad. menu comes in English and Chinese versions. selection is quite limited  but judging from their website it seems like there might be a secret menu as well. would not  hurt to ask for additional options. the entire restaurants seats maybe     and it was decently busy on a Saturday afternoon.
reviews.name: Yvonne

restaurants.name: Masala Kitchen
restaurants.category: Restaurants, Caterers, African, Halal, Indian, Event Planning & Services

reviews.text: Review from Sept      visit Al went with Masala Kitchen to cater a pre - wedding Dinner event on a recommendation  and Al were thoroughly pleased. One should be aware of what Masala Kitchen is so that one  expectations are realistic. Masala Kitchen have the capacity to do two things very well  -  take out food and catering orders. While Masala Kitchen have a couple of small tables where one may consume freshly made food Masala Kitchen is not a sit down restaurant in the typical sense. . What is also useful to know is while the cuisine is Indian the cuisine has an East African influence and therefore there are some important differences to the usual Norther Indian restaurant food. So for example the samosas have a thinner crispy  triangular wrapping rather than the doughy  thick wrapping associated with Northern India. Masala Kitchen also have fried Muhogo  cassava that you do not find in Typical Indian cuisine. Masala Kitchen make Biryani in two styles  the East African way with the rice and the masala gravy separate or the Lahori style where Biryani is cooked and presented in one vessel. Al had the opportunity to sample various dishes during our two vists there to work out a catering menu for our event. The challenge was to accommodate the significant number of vegetarians among the majority carnivores. The management was very helpful in helping us come up with a good combination of items. Al's biggest problem was in trying to pick a few dishes as so many delightful items are available. Al would highly recommend the Black Kebabs -  fried meatballs essentially  with the right combination of spices. Bet you cannot just eat and stop at one. For vegetarians Masala Kitchen have the spicy potato balls  BatetaVada . Al had Chicken Pakoras that were a huge hit with our guests. The Chicken Biryani is a must. Next visit Al want to try Masala Kitchen's masala fish -  their masala fish looked so appetizing but Al truly was way too stuffed to try one more thing. Our order for     people was ready to be picked up at the appointed time. The portions were overly generous. The management had gone out of The management's way to obtain disposable serving thalis for us  knowing Al were out of town and a pre - wedding Dinner event was in a rented community center hall. Al was impressed by the quality and quantity of food and the professionalism of the staff.
reviews.name: Al

reviews.text: Pretty good  nothing special  but Flydyl like Masala Kitchen. Masala Kitchen are  just so eager to please so sweet  so hard working. Masala Kitchen want to be good. Flydyl think in this spirit Flydyl are  going to improve and get a loyal base. Flydyl will  gain fans with service first and later with the food. So :  the food needs more flavour and spice. the food pretty bland. And the naan is sub - par. On the bright side the naan was not  at all greasy. A lot of South Asian fast food can be truly oily and MK is not at all. Take out is emphasized here :  Masala Kitchen are  almost no space to eat in  though Flydyl did . Flydyl suspect Masala Kitchen are  a healthier restaurant than most. Masala Kitchen seem quite clean and wholesome  and Flydyl wish Masala Kitchen well as Masala Kitchen grow.
reviews.name: Flydyl

reviews.text: Great value as many others have mentioned  and lots of flavour too. A small space  but very clean and well - decorated. Jonathan ordered the chicken mishkaki  masala rice and masala potatoes plate. the chicken mishkaki masala rice and masala potatoes plate was    and a large plate  so great value. Jonathan have to say however that the chicken was quite overcooked which pulled the experience down a bit. Worth another try for sure but hopefully that is  not always their approach when cooking meat.
reviews.name: Jonathan

reviews.text: Possibly the best Indian food Z have  had. Masala Kitchen also have little bonuses like Masala Fries which are a must eat. Z have not  tasted a butter chicken as good as Masala Kitchen . The curries are flavourful. Z get dahl with every order. Masala Kitchen's naan is great and Masala Kitchen embed garlic into the garlic naan. The employees are friendly and efficient. Do not  be in a rush when you get here and expect to wait for your food to be prepared  depending on what you order. Masala Kitchen do not  have everything precooked and waiting under a heat lamp. The best part about Masala Kitchen is that the food is priced right. Z can order enough food for two people for    .
reviews.name: Z

reviews.text: Great new lunch spot since La Familia was closed for lunch. Split between two people the large butter chicken  chana daal    rice and   garlic naans was more than enough for   people. Will be ordering again !
reviews.name: DeMarco

reviews.text: Just popped in here on Lisa's way home from work and took the daily meal deal of Masala Fish  Potatoes and Roti. Was freshly prepared in   mins while Lisa ate a lovely beef samosa ! the daily meal deal of Masala Fish  Potatoes and Roti was excellent and fresh and Masala Kitchen was clean ! Lisa will be back  -  a lot ! Good home cooked food  -  great value. Thanks !
reviews.name: Lisa

reviews.text: Although John enjoyed our first meal here a year or so ago  John were very disappointed today. John ordered a   meat thali with beef curry and butter chicken and for Indian food  a   meat thali with beef curry and butter chicken was quite bland. John also ordered the round kebabs as appetizers which were dry and came with a cilantro chutney dipping sauce which had very little heat. The food was not  bad  just unmemorable but it was not  The food that was our biggest disappointment... The service was terrible. There was one girl on the counter  one girl on the counter took our order then proceeded to dish our order out from the hot plates into the thali plastic take away container. The phone rang and from the conversation The phone was a personal call. John waited close to five minutes for one girl on the counter to get off The phone while our food was on the counter  uncovered cooling off. one girl on the counter got off The phone went back to filling the thali plastic take away container with the roti  tomato  rice  and chopped onion then The phone rang again. This time The phone sounded like a take out order but again  John were ignored and our food was left to cool off more. The call ended and at this point one girl on the counter passed the Thali containers to a girl in the back to put the lid on and wrap the Thali containers in a box and sure enough The phone rang again. Once again ignored. John m not quite sure why one girl on the counter could not  help fill the thali plastic take away container or answer The phone. There so many awesome Indian dining options in East York and Scarborough next door that John can not  imagine returning.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: food quality is good. quantitiy is too small  highly over priced. Masala Kitchen is in scarborough but Masala Kitchen is priced like a downtown toronto takeout place. options are not that great.
reviews.name: Keshav

reviews.text: Now it is  been   months and Prodip have  been craving for a properly spiced Indian food... not like the usual ones in north america. Today Prodip stumbled upon Masala Kitchen ordered chicken biriyani and lamb curry. chicken biriyani and lamb curry were just as spicy as the north indian food should be. The delivery was fast and the employees were friendly. Overall it was a   star worthy experience. There not enough siting arrangements there as Masala Kitchen mostly targets the customers who wish to take away the customers who wish to take away their food's food.
reviews.name: Prodip

reviews.text: How do Masala Kitchen do it How do Masala Kitchen fry up Masala Kitchen's Batata Vada  Chicken Chop and Shami Kebab and still keep the mashed potato soft  fluffy and moist  Masala Kitchen definitely are working some culinary magic in Masala Kitchen's hidden kitchen. Once you enter MK you can smell the delicious aroma of exotic spices in the air  exotic spices not incense . The inside is bright and clean. Masala Kitchen have   small tables a bench and a fireplace :  a nice place for couples to have a lunch. Outside Masala Kitchen have three picnic tables for groups to sit down and eat. Most people order to go so three picnic tables for groups to sit down and eat are always available. When you want to order look through the kitchen window and get someone  attention the cashiers double as kitchen help . The staff have always been warm and helpful. The staff patiently answer all Colanie's newbie questions with a smile. If you need to use the washroom you will  need to go through Masala Kitchen to get there. Masala Kitchen have the best Indian Street food  Samosas included as well as above mentioned items  in the GTA. Masala Kitchen use a harmonious blend of spices that work so well together. Add in the tamarind dipping sauce which has a little heat and you have got all the five basic tastes of sweet  sour  bitter  salty and yes umami  savory  covered. Colanie took away a star because not all Masala Kitchen's food is well spiced  Butter Chicken is bland   and the temperature of the food is not  hot enough for Colanie's liking. Colanie like Colanie's food piping hot right out of the pan fryer oven. TIPS : For the best bang for your buck check out Masala Kitchen's daily specials and definitely add one or more of Masala Kitchen's yummy  bitings -   . or maybe a cup of Masala chai for   .  . Learn from the regulars on which items to order; remember  Colanie did say the balance of spices are perfect in some things but not others.
reviews.name: Colanie

reviews.text: Masala Kitchen  Henry visited Masala Kitchen twice already and both times Henry were not disappointed. Masala Kitchen have daily specials that run you only   . Our favourite thing to get so far is the chicken biriyani. At    you get huge chunks of chicken with a side of flavour explosion. You will not be disappointed. Masala Kitchen is definitely a place Henry will be going back to for our Indian food craves.
reviews.name: Henry

reviews.text: The food is okay  nothing special  but the service is terrible. Jamil have  been disappointed in Masala Kitchen's customer service here on numerous occasions  including having to wait over    minutes for a simple pick up order and another time where Jamil was told Jamil's food could not  be made when Jamil went to pick my food up. Jamil understand there are sometimes technical issues with kitchen appliances but at least call me ahead of time and let me know that you are  having issues vs waiting until Jamil get there to tell me. You have my number for the order !
reviews.name: Jamil

reviews.text: Yum ! They are  chicken corn soup is so great. Some of the best Osmaan have  ever had. Also the Chinese rice was superb. The only reason Osmaan gave it a     was because the take out was a little messy and disorganized.

reviews.text: This visit is our second visit and our first Yelp review. This visit Seema ordered Tofu Ma Po  which is a dish of stir - fried soft tofu in a spicy black bean sauce. Tofu Ma Po  which is a dish of stir - fried soft tofu in a spicy black bean sauce was delicious ! Exactly as described. The tofu was soft not mushy  Seema had been expecting crispy tofu so was pleasantly surprised when The tofu was not   and the flavour made Tofu Ma Po  which is a dish of stir - fried soft tofu in a spicy black bean sauce the star of our meal. Seema also ordered Manchurian Vegetables  which are veggie pakoras in a spicy sauce. Seema think a spicy sauce might have changed from our last time visit sniff  . Manchurian Vegetables  which are veggie pakoras in a spicy sauce was the main reason Seema had wanted to come back. Once Seema got over my disappointment LOL   Seema still ate a lot of Manchurian Vegetables  which are veggie pakoras in a spicy sauce. Manchurian Vegetables  which are veggie pakoras in a spicy sauce was still good  and a spicy sauce this time had more of sweet and sour flavour than a Manchurian flavour. To complement the two dishes  Seema ordered a veggie fried rice and was shocked by the generous portion. With a mix of fresh and frozen veggies  a veggie fried rice was properly cooked and was tasty on a veggie fried rice's own. Overall three dishes was plenty of food for three people. Seema took home two meals in leftovers  and overall  enjoyed good food at good prices... Seema will  be back when in the area !
reviews.name: Seema

reviews.text: Mehvish have  been coming here since      when Mehvish lived closer to Bao-Shin and honestly Mehvish still come here for Mehvish's chicken soup  manchurian chicken and fried rice. Hands down Bao-Shin nailed the Hakka cuisine for an affordable price and good quantity. Mehvish do wish Mehvish had more space since it can tend to get busy and barely room to sit.

reviews.text: Delicious hakka food  and the price is very cheap ! Ahmed decided to dine in with a friend  during the evening  a while back and Ahmed were shocked by the enormous serving size  -  one dish was enough for two people !  ! What Ahmed found the most remarkable was the amount of chicken in our dishes. Moreover  the lady at the cash was soft spoken but very kind. Ahmed do not  eat Hakka regularly  but to me it seemed that there was no compromise on quality  while maintaining a very good price ! Bao-Shin do have a very nice variety of dishes but try to catch a special if you can. A word of warning  the plaza where Bao-Shin is located has limited parking spots  so try to avoid the plaza where Bao Shin is located during weekend nights.

reviews.text: Eily wanted something really fast to eat as Eily were hungry. Ordered the chilli fish and hot and sour soup. Eily were there one minute past the  pm lunch time and she refused to let me get the special price. Had to pay the special price for this. They must have put a whole bowl of chilli in the chilli fish and hot and sour soup as the chilli fish and hot and sour soup was soooo hot that Eily could not eat the chilli fish and hot and sour soup. hot and sour soup was so so. Nothing to write home about. Just a few pieces of shrimps and some bean sprouts for   bucks. Small portion soup  -  felt cheated. Sat down to eat on one of the two tables. Looks like they needed to clean the tables and floor Not impressed at all. Wo not  go back as there are better Hakka places sprouting all over Mississauga and in the GTA. Eily m Hakka so Eily have  been fed intravenously on this food for the past    plus years. So NOPE. Eily m not going back.

reviews.text: Indian food always offers some excellent vegan options  and Saffron Fine Indian Takeout had Something something with eggplant  something with chickpeas  and something something mixed vegetables on the warmer tonight. Something something with eggplant  something with chickpeas  and something something mixed vegetables. Gabino's two vegetarian entrees combo came with about a cup of white rice  a slab of naan bread  and cost about    . The food was great. The servers were pleasant and The servers knew where to steer Gabino. If Gabino ordered ahead from Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's menu Gabino could get more custom options than Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's daily buffet  but Saffron Fine Indian Takeout change the specials every day and Gabino like rolling the dice.
reviews.name: Gabino

reviews.text: As an individual of south Indian heritage  Adam grew up with Adam's grandmother and mother making food that very closely resembled the dishes that Saffron Fine Indian Takeout makes. The key difference between Adam's experiences at Saffron Fine Indian Takeout and those of Adam's own family  are merely the hands which prepared Saffron Fine Indian Takeout. Adam can confidently say  after trying nearly every dish on Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's continuously rotating menu  that my own family have yet to have a single dish that was mediocre. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout make a selection of Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's menu daily so as not to compromise Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's food quality by having several dishes sit. If authenticity and uncompromising food quality is important to you you should try out Saffron Fine Indian Takeout. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's aloo ghobi is not  just mashed potato and minced cauliflower like so many places seem to do. Their aloo ghobi has huge chunks of well cooked potato and cauliflower  which still has some consistency. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's Korma is actually not overbearing with the cashew paste you can differentiate the constituent spices. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's veggie samosa is right on with seasoning and actually crisp. Adam's personal favorite has to be Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's Lamb vindaloo. To which  you may ask Saffron Fine Indian Takeout to make your order to your chosen spiciness level. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's regular spice level would be mild - medium for the more adventurous. Give Saffron Fine Indian Takeout a try. Adam promise you that Adam's tastes are very decerning. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout has more than exceeded Adam's expectation everytime Adam have been. Even with all the good things going for Saffron Fine Indian Takeout Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's prices are the lowest average cost of any Indian takeout anywhere in the nw. There are a couple other places close ish  by; however  Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is superior and more economical. Everytime Adam go there are always a couple people getting a couple people getting their orders filled's orders filled. Happy eating !  !
reviews.name: Adam

reviews.text: Food is so yummy  and priced just right ! Saffron Fine Indian Takeout offers take out only  and Saffron Fine Indian Takeout do have daily specials. Ask Saffron Fine Indian Takeout which dishes you should try ! You usually can not  go wrong !  !
reviews.name: Dave

reviews.text: Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is the best Indian take away in the area. Rose the owner is really nice and by far a great chef of Indian cuisine. The meals are filling  always different and delicious. Try the butter chicken.. Paul's favourite.

reviews.text: Really enjoyed the butter chicken here. The food is fantastic and the service is good as well. The lady who owns Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is really sweet and very helpful. Definitely will be back !

reviews.text: Wonderful food  great service and good prices. Got the combo     which is two non - vegetarian dishes and it was more than enough ! Had left overs for the next day ! Would HIGHLY recommend the butter chicken. Probably the best Mackenzie have  ever had !

reviews.text: Picked up some veggie take out combo    which came with mixed vegetable curry  a bowl of rice and   halves of naan for less than     on our way to the airport. The food is sooooo good ! Bella wish Bella would  come here earlier so Bella could have eaten here both days Bella were in Calgary. The portion was perfect for   people Bella do not  eat heavy dinners . The portion was really thick with tons of veggies. Bella will  definitely be back if Bella visit Calgary again !

reviews.text: The food at Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is amazing Mike have  never had anything that was not  outstanding. Phone ahead if you want a specific dish as Saffron Fine Indian Takeout will make things to order  or just show up for a little adventure in your meal choice to go with the daily specials.

reviews.text: A girlfriend and Rhiannon actually picked Saffron Fine Indian Takeout up on Friday night ... for takeout and Rhiannon finished the balance of Saffron Fine Indian Takeout last night  so much better a day later allowing the spice to flow !  . Rhiannon highly recommend Saffron Fine Indian Takeout for anyone that appreciates great home cooked Indian Food  Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is family owned  Rhiannon met the mother and daughter . Rhiannon enjoyed Vegetable Samosas Safron Basmati Rice Naan Bread  Chicken Curry and a Lamb Curry  Aloo Gobhi and a mixed vegetable curry ! Will be returning for sure... Now Rhiannon want curry again !

reviews.text: Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is pretty good  but not the best place in town for East Indian food. The service is fairly quick  about a    minute wait the food is relatively good  and the staff are very friendly. But  John have  had better. Just a warning  Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is takeout style only -  -  there is  no place to sit and dine in Saffron Fine Indian Takeout. Call in and place an order and go pick an order up or you can just order at the counter and wait about    minutes.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Feeling like Indian food the other night and did not  want to make the trek back downtown to Tandoori Hut Kal's favorite EI restaurant in Calgary  so looked around for somewhere closer to home. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout's menu has a decent number of choices and is priced fairly. However finding Their menu was a bit of a pain. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout have a website but has been taken offline so Kal had to go to archive.org to get a copy. Not a big deal restaurants without a website is a HUGE annoyance for Kal. Anyways....ordering was quick and easy. Arrived at the planned time and Saffron Fine Indian Takeout were just assembling our order. The staff was very friendly and helpful in getting everything well packaged and out to our car. Now the important part of the review...the food ! Kal started with the  mix   match  appy consisting of   samosas Kal took beef     kababs and   pakoras. samosas were ok  not the best but still very tasty. beef     kababs were tasty but very dry. But pakoras were amazing ! Perfectly spiced and very crispy. For entrees Kal went with butter chicken  chicken korma  dhaal makhani and veg curry and here  where Kal m conflicted. While everything tasted good  nothing tasted like what Kal used to. Kal like Kal's butter chicken to have a noticeable tomatoy taste but butter chicken  chicken was more rogan josh sauce. korma  again korma tasted good did not  have much of a coconut taste. dhaal makhani was quite good. veg curry were well spiced and good selection. Kal's rating of     is not  completely fair in that the food   service were both good the food service just did not  have the tastes Kal have  come to expect with EI food.
reviews.name: Kal

reviews.text: Saffron Fine Indian Takeout has me a bit torn. One hand Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is  solid food served quickly  friendly staff  and reasonable prices for Indian in the NW side of town. On the other if Cori m craving Indian Saffron Fine Indian Takeout does not  quite satisfy. From someone who loves Indian food and had traveled to India and eaten the real deal -  Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is  not quite to my quality of authentic. For example   the naan is closer to greek pita than Cori would  expect. Not that Cori have an issue with greek pita... but just not always what Cori m hoping for. That being said  there is not  a lot of NW competition for Indian so it is sometimes better than taking a bit of a drive to something a little more authentic or going to a higher price point place that takes a while. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is a bit different that some restaurants in that Saffron Fine Indian Takeout make a handful of dishes that day and you choose from a handful of dishes  -  not the menu unless you order in advance for a lot of people or something. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout will always have butter chicken and a dahl but other than butter chicken and a dahl you will  have to call or just go check it out. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout will always have a few vegetarian dishes and then some with meat. Saffron Fine Indian Takeout often have ocra and saag which are far from my favourites  -  and that is  sometimes a bit disappointing to me. The good thing about Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is the food is made when you stop in  but does NOT taste like buffet style that is  been sitting  so it is  quick to stop in and pick up. The prices for NW are not bad. For a veggie combo you get veg dish rice  naan and a curry for   . Add a buck for a meat combo. Add a couple bucks for a second veg dish. A combo with   dish is more than enough for me most of the time. A combo with   dishes is usually   meals if Cori buy more naan. Overall that is  not a bad deal when facing the cost of other NW alternatives. Overall   Saffron Fine Indian Takeout is definitely a good option to have around. Review   of    in Yelp     Day Challenge
reviews.name: Cori

reviews.text: Ron work near Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall and wanted to try the lunch buffet. My timing was off as Ron came on the Friday before Memorial Day weekend when many skip lunch and leave work early. Nothing spectacular. Ron have  been to better Indian buffets but willing to give it another try in the future to see if the experience is any better.

reviews.text: The staff was super friendly. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall a buffet place filled w eggplant  chicken and cheese dishes in spicy Indian sauce and   types of rice. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall killed that spicy Indian craving Leticia was having. Beer  wine and liquor available. Happy hour everyday from   -  pm  Leticia visited on a Saturday afternoon so  Atmosphere was quite  staff was very attentive buffet was full. The eggplant dish was cold the rest was warm. With just us   in Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall it felt very stuffy. Could not  imagine how it would be with a full house. Overall it is was good and satisfied Leticia's craving for Indian food. Leticia's hubby was so full and for     bill for all Leticia cud eat and beers Leticia would  have to say it Leticia were pretty content.

reviews.text: Based on some the positive reviews on yelp  wife and Rohan decided to try out Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall. Sunday night at around pm there was not a single customer in Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall. No take out orders coming in either. The server that Rohan had for the night was really an odd case. Rohan could not  understand what The server that Rohan had for the night was saying and perhaps The server that Rohan had for the night could not  understand what Rohan were saying. They had a special offer on yelp for draft beer which Rohan wanted to check in and take advantage of. The server that Rohan had for the night did not  know what yelp was or the types of beer Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall had in stock on draft or bottled. Rohan asked The server that Rohan had for the night to send someone else to talk to us. Seems like the only other staff in Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall was the  only   cook. the  only   cook was of no use either. Rohan settled on not having beer and ordered ginger chicken kabob as an appetizer. ginger chicken kabob was decent but not great. ginger chicken kabob can on a bed of lettuce vs onions as mentioned on the menu. The chicken was tender but lacked flavors. Also  was not  cooked kabob style per se if you know what Rohan mean. Rohan decided to not order main course  paid the ticket and got out of there. Summary :  will not go back here. Thanks for reading.
reviews.name: Rohan

reviews.text: Indian food has a huge British influence from the days of the British Empire and being English Darren have  eaten Darren's fair share of Indian food  since moving to Arizona Darren's wife and Darren have eaten at a few Indian restaurants and Darren have been pleasantly surprised that it was comparable to the Indian food Darren would  had in England. Darren was craving popadoms and the sauces and mango chutney that usually come with popadoms so Darren chose Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall because of the online ordering since Darren where getting it to go. Darren ordered a bunch of stuff including   orders of popadoms at   . each and   chutneys  Darren expected at least a couple of popadoms per order at the same price as a nan bread. Darren went to collect it and when Darren arrived the order was only just coming in so Darren had to wait mins this was not  really an issue as it was a Sunday night and the game was on for us to watch. Since Darren where waiting and watching the game Darren's wife ordered a crown and sprite with a lemon the gentleman poured about   shots of crown into a small wine glass followed by a small squirt of sprite and handed a crown and sprite with a lemon too Darren's wife with a bowl full of lemons no ice ! a crown and sprite with a lemon was warm and horrid ! my wife  a trooper and just chugged a crown and sprite with a lemon down in   attempts  after squeezing all the lemons into a crown and sprite with a lemon lol Darren got our food  Darren double checked with the gentleman about chutney and left. Darren got back to the hotel and became very disappointed to find the order   was for a single popadom and there was no mango chutney or sauces. Our   orders of chutney was   styrofoam cup of carrots and a bit of cauliflower ! Darren's chicken samosas had no potato or anything else in My chicken samosas other than what seemed like ground beef. The garlic nan breads seemed to have no sign of garlic. The rest of the food was extremely bland and the rice was not the basmati rice you usually associate with Indian food. The usually crispy mounds of onion bhaji were a bunch of soggy onion rings. Darren have  learnt Darren's lesson and will think twice about getting togo from an Indian restaurant that Darren have  never eaten at again.
reviews.name: Darren

reviews.text: Very disappointing. Ian used to come to Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall when Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall had a different name. The selection is worse and the food is very bland. Many better options in Chandler Tempe area. Lunch buffet    but still not worth it

reviews.text: Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall majorly went down hill. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall must have  gotten a new chef because Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall used to be very good but now not so much. Everything tastes different compared to how it tasted previously. The chicken tikka misala being the main disappointment. reviews.text: Kamela used to come here when Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall was India Gate. Kamela noticed Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall changed names and just have not  been on that side of town until this past fri night Kamela took our young daughters there for our young daughters's first try at Indian cuisine. The staff is unbelievable friendly and professional. The staff are truly happy to have Kamela there and you can feel that. The staff had Indian music videos playing on the tv which made the atmosphere feel authentic. Kamela came about an hour before The staff close the buffet and even then all the food was fresh and plentiful. Kamela asked The staff to surprise Kamela with an Indian wine The staff perfectly matched a sweet white Indian wine that went fantastic with all the options on the buffet. All in all... Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's the place to go for excellent cuisine  excellent atmosphere  and excellent owners.
