reviews.text: Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's food... was average. Their food was delivered in waves. Naan was delivered to the table at the end of the meal. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's menu selections were adequate. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's prices.... were okay. Their prices seemed to be in - line with the quality of Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's food. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's service... was slow and steady; food was delivered in a disjointed manner. The server would not accept an Entertainment Book offer stating   the  owner  told The server to not accept an Entertainment Book offer. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's denial of a offer to get you in Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's restaurant was obviously a scam. The server also made a point to leave a cash tip when Rob were paying for the meal. That was a classy touch to end the Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall experience. Overall.... Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's food was average  Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's prices were average  Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's service was average and Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's denial to accept Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's offer was shady. The overall experience gets one star because Rob can not  select zero stars.
reviews.name: Rob

reviews.text: Even though Lori read the previous posts about it being too salty Lori decided to give it a try  bad choice... Lori just wanted Indian food so badly . Lori went to the website to order takeout and there were no prices listed  just description of the food  odd . When Lori ordered they were very nice. Lori told them to make the dishes  chicken tikka masala and the vegetable korma  mild. the dishes  chicken tikka masala and the vegetable korma were tooooooooo spicy and tooooooo salty  plus the raita is thin and watery. Lori like spicy and can Lori tell you the raita was inedible. Lori called Paul who said he would take Lori's name down but Lori wo not  be going back. Too many have said it is  too salty over a long enough period of time that this must be their norm. Needless to say     . later Lori's husband is eating cereal and Lori am heating ravioli for Lori's son. Lori should have listened to the other reviews  :
reviews.name: Lori

reviews.text: Decided to try Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall for the first time and fell in love with all of the choices the buffet had to offer ! Definitely coming back and bringing the rest of the family !
reviews.name: Katy

reviews.text: Really great food   service -  Beth Ann did the lunch buffet today  -  YUM and reasonably priced. Beth Ann will go back !
reviews.name: Beth Ann

reviews.text: Decided to try this out rather than go with Brad's usual go to indian food place. Brad Ordered Chicken TIkka Masala  Paneer Tikka Masala  Chili Naan and Garlic Naan. The Naan bread was awesome  but there was an issue that Brad and Brad's buddy at work had. THE MASALA WAS WAY TOO SALTY !  !  ! me and my buddy at work found me and my buddy at work picking out just the chicken and Paneer because the sauce had way too much salt. Normally Brad would give this only   stars  but the lady at the counter threw in a free desert. a free desert was   donut hole looking things in some milky tapioca water  a free desert did not suit Brad's taste buds. Brad will give it another try in a month or so and see if there are any changes. Brad did like the atmosphere in Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall and the people were really nice. stars.
reviews.name: Brad

reviews.text: The food was great and so was the service. The Tandoori mixed grille appetizer was very flavorful and straight off the grille hot just as The Tandoori mixed grille appetizer should be. The Samosas were awesome as well and the chicken Biriyani was amazing ! Definitely recommend Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall to anyone looking for authentic Indian cuisine.
reviews.name: Traci

reviews.text: OUT OF BUSINESS -  L came here on         only to find a sign taped to the door stating they are no longer in business.
reviews.name: L

reviews.text: Vinny want to give Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall  - ve stars but is forced to give Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall a star. A star for  below average food and utterly poor service. Lets take food. The food was very much below average. - Garlic Naan had no garlic. - Rice was definetaly not basmati as the describe. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall use some cheap variety of rice. -  Food tastes as if some amateur guy has prepared Food. Food lacks taste and flavor -  Food does not look hygeinically prepared. -  Buffet items are generally never gets refilled. -  Dessert looks as if  Dessert were prepared a month ago. Finally Lets take service -  Service is super slow and pathetic. -  The server will not even serve you water and you would have to request water to be served. And by chance you. -  Server will serve you naan generally after your meal is over. -  If you are at the lunch buffet the server will restrict you to use service bowls to be used only for dessert. So you end up mixing curries on your plate along with rice and naan. So you will end up eating siggy naans. On the bright side  Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall's  billing is right on.
reviews.name: Vinny

reviews.text: Love the buffet  the service location  and atmosphere. Service is fantastic and the beverages were good
reviews.name: Corin

reviews.text: Steve came here for a family event. The hostess was very friendly. Steve were seated promptly. Steve did not get flustered and were able to accommodate even the pickiest of my family. Steve m an Indian and so when Steve have Indian food Steve m very critical. Steve have to say  all the food here is delicious.
reviews.name: Steve

reviews.text: Decent lunch buffet. Enough variety  but not a ton. The butter chicken was delicious. The chicken vindaloo was good  but could use some more kick. The paneer tikka masala had that nice tangy flavor. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall had some kind of cauliflower dish that Mike had not  seen before and some kind of cauliflower dish that Mike had not  seen before was delicious. The desserts were average. The chicken tikka was pretty dry. Service was friendly. Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall could use a renovation though.
reviews.name: Mike

reviews.text: Sean came here recently for a family dinner and a family dinner has to be one of the best indian restuants Sean have been to in Arizona. Sean am indian Sean and the food to Sean was very good. The waiters were attentive and very polite. Will definitely come back.
reviews.name: Sean

reviews.text: The phone number is not working and they are closed here on Monday at   : PM Not sure what there timing is

reviews.text: The food is actually really good ! However the service is so terrible. The one waiter that is always the one that seems to serve us  Have been a few times because the food is so good . The one waiter that is always the one that seems to serve us treats us like The one waiter that is always the one that seems to serve us wishes Christy were not there. Last night was the worst  Christy were the only ones in Taj Indian Cuisine & Banquet Hall and The one waiter that is always the one that seems to serve us glared at us as Christy walked in   would think in this day and age  places would be happy to have business since restaurants are always closing . But this is not the case here. Then another family came in  that appeared to be friends or relatives of The one waiter that is always the one that seems to serve us and The one waiter that is always the one that seems to serve us was all smiles with another family  then back to our table and Christy got nothing. They close at   : so at   :    Christy left  as soon as the door closed behind us they lights went out and they followed us out. It was really weird. Christy guess they were rude because they wanted us to leave. Well Christy wo not  be back.

reviews.text: Ate there tonight and found Minerva Indian Cuisine to be the best Indian food in the Madison area. The website stated Minerva Indian Cuisine is under new ownership so Kathy was a little apprehensive but all of the food was outstanding. Kathy went with an Indian friend and an Indian friend agreed with the quality of the food. Highly recommended and Kathy would definitely go back. Kathy ordered off the menu so Kathy can not  speak to the quality of the buffet.
reviews.name: Kathy

reviews.text: My family and Johnny ate at Minerva on Sunday  June         as part of a Father  Day outing in Madison. Minerva came as a recommendation from a co - worker and Minerva did not  disappoint. Johnny sampled three dishes  not including naan and rice : Idli Vada  Chicken Madras  and Bhagara Baigan  none of which are typical Indian restaurant fare. All choices were delicious but Idli Vada  Chicken Madras was outstanding. Johnny really appreciated the variety of dishes available  especially since Johnny am not that familiar with Southern Indian cuisine. Price - wise  Johnny thought dinner was a good value :  Around     for all the food listed above plus   mango lassis. Johnny am very much looking forward to going for the lunch buffet  especially after reading previous reviews. Overall :     stars for the food and  .  for ambiance. Minerva  location in a strip mall does not  help but Johnny think Minerva could spruce things up and be attentive of piles of things strewn around. This did not  really bother me but my family commented on it. This in no way  should detract you from visiting for lunch and dinner. The food  like Johnny said  was outstanding and a great addition to Madison.
reviews.name: Johnny

reviews.text: Achyuthan generally do not like buffets at Indian restaurants either because of the options available or because the quality is not good enough. The buffet at Minerva surprised Achyuthan. The buffet at Minerva was actually very good. Some of the things you can look forward to  : Malai kofta -  was very creamy. Mango ice cream  -  tastier than usual Garlic naan -  was soft Paneer tikka  -  max masala but tasty  Something to note  : the menu has a lot of options.
reviews.name: Achyuthan

reviews.text: Stopped by on a whim  Tuesday night. Staff was very attentive and service was prompt and courteous. My wife ordered a curry mango chicken dish which was great. Alex ordered a lamb dish with basmati rice also great. The only thing Alex could point out was the glass of wine Alex had  came from the right bottle but can tell the glass of wine Alex had had oxidized for more days than necessary  that said  if Alex truly were looking  for fresh wine ordering a bottle is the way to go.
reviews.name: Alex

reviews.text: Aaron have  been frequenting the Indian Buffet seen in Madison for the past    years  and Minerva blows everything out of the water. Every dish is uniquely flavored and is actually spicy ! The Dosas brought to your table are a nice touch as well. Aaron am so excited to have found the Indian Buffet seen in Madison  Aaron m glad Aaron do not  live closer to the Indian Buffet seen in Madison  as Aaron would  be putting on some major weight. Thanks Minerva  keep the Indian Buffet seen in Madison as the Indian Buffet seen in Madison is now  and Aaron m confident that you will develop and maintain a strong  and supportive customer base. Aaron have  seen so many places in town that started strong and eventually cut corners  ingredients  spice  heat level  variety  etc. really losing so many places in town that started strong and eventually cut corners  ingredients spice  heat level  variety etc's touch  and eventually closing down.
reviews.name: Aaron

reviews.text: - Star because Minerva Indian Cuisine is the only restaurant that offers really South Indian food in Madison. Minerva Indian Cuisine adds much diversity to Madison  food scene. John Chung-En tried Dosa and Uttapam. Dosa and Uttapam are REAL !  ! Get a Ghee dosa. It would be both a month - opening and eye - opening experience if you have never tried a Ghee dosa before. Fish curry was a very memorable dish. John Chung-En also tried things under the  Chettinadu  category. Good stuff. Minerva Indian Cuisine have a incredibly long menu. It will take maybe    visits to savor the full selection. For first few visits John Chung-En suggest sticking to things you can not  find in other Indian places in Madison. Based on our two dinner visits both food and service is pretty good. John Chung-En hope Minerva Indian Cuisine will thrive in the coming years. CAUTION : The  Hyderabadi Dum Chicken Biriyani  is insanely spicy. John Chung-En like spicy food in general and take on very spicy dishes. But The  Hyderabadi Dum Chicken Biriyani will be over the limit to most people. Consult before you order.
reviews.name: John Chung-En

reviews.text: Worst place ! Vik ordered food two days ago and Vik's daughter vomited. Please do not  go there.
reviews.name: Vik

reviews.text: Minera is one of the lousiest Indian eatery places in Madison. Service sucks. There is NOT even a single good thing about Minerva Indian Cuisine. The owner has NO idea about how to run a restaurant business  . In the era of technological advancement and social networking Minerva Indian Cuisine does NOT have a running website.   . Lunch buffet is a  copycat  of another restaurant in town : Minera tried to even place the same items in the same location as another restaurant in town Minera do not  have any originality  ! And surprisingly Minera have the same items even : can not  Minera have something different of Minera's own  ! . Standard of lunch buffet is nothing great. Even food quality of dinner is nothing to die for.   . Tables are too small and cramped up :   a   - person table is ideally suited for   persons.   . Minerva Indian Cuisine is very small and cramped up  ! When people line up for Lunch buffet it is a complete chaos.   . For dinner  the   - person tables do not even have a table cloth  !    . Wait staff sucks Wait staff do not  have any idea of what Wait staff are doing.   . In dinner there is NO control of the ordering status : Wait staff has no idea whose order is what and when the food comes out Wait staff does not does not know in which table to bring the food  ! It  a big CHAOS. . Amongst this  the turnover time for the food to come out after order is placed is rather quick  which is appreciated  ! .    . Food tried certain Dosas  the south Indian delicacy in which Minerva Indian Cuisine specializes in  ! certain Dosas  the south Indian delicacy in which the restaurant specializes in came without the sides  sambar  chutney  ! had to ask for the same :  which is ridiculous  ! The Sambar  chutney was stale and had no great taste. Sambar felt like having grains of sand in Sambar. . The other families who were dining with us in other tables were equally unhappy with the service. . Food ordered a Rava Masala Dosa Food messed up and an Onion Rava Dosa came out. When Food mentioned that a Rava Masala Dosa was messed  Food took a Rava Masala Dosa back inside the kitchen and put a Rava Masala Dosa in a small bowl and brought a Rava Masala Dosa back out  ! That was terrible  !     . Appetizers are served in small side dishes of Corelle brand  ! Minerva Indian Cuisine even does not have proper serving bowls. Minera purchased cheap dishes for serving food. . Minerva Indian Cuisine is a substandard restaurant. Minera have made the menu items very attractive encompassing all different platter but that has back - fired on Minera. Nothing is turning out great. Had Minera emphasized on Minera's strength and specialized on South Indian platter Minera would done a better job.
reviews.name: Food

reviews.text: Four star food  two star experience. So the food is delicious  and the wait was not long. Host  owner was very friendly and talked with Esther while Esther waited for Esther's chicken curry. The chicken in Esther's chicken curry was moist and spicy. Rice was cooked well. The bad aspect of Esther's meal was how the ingredients were misrepresented. Esther asked what dish did not  have dairy  and Esther was told to get my chicken curry. Definitely Esther's fault for not double checking the ingredients but Esther assumed Host  owner knew best. my chicken curry  but gave Esther the worst stomach pain after. Esther almost had to call in sick to work the next day. Esther do not think Host  owner had ill intent but Esther think Host  owner just pulled a suggestion from the menu and claimed my chicken curry was dairy free. Previous reviews are correct :  the food is great  and the spices are so delicious. But Esther's goal is to find and review dairy free food  and Esther was misled to think Minerva Indian Cuisine had dairy free chicken curry. Esther will return  but next time Esther WILL be skeptical and not take any suggestions  and probably read every ingredient on the menu
reviews.name: Esther

reviews.text: Minerva had a change of ownership within the last year  the prior owner has opened Amber  on University Ave  and apparently took all of the authentic flavors and quality with the prior owner. If you want good quality Indian in Madison  Amber is the far better choice.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Ravi always order only one item from Ravi's menu  Chicken dum biryani and only one item from their menu Chicken dum biryani is top notch.
reviews.name: Ravi

reviews.text: Big fan of Minerva. Excellent food  staff  and well worth the trip. Recently moved to the Madison area from the west coast and can not  get enough Minerva. Have been there twice and left fat and happy both times. David Marshall's wife had the butter chicken  both times  and David Marshall have tried whatever the owner tells David Marshall David Marshall m having. And the owner has not  let David Marshall down yet. David Marshall get a   for spicy and a   for spicy is  just right. Next time a    David Marshall's wife gets a   and says just right. But David Marshall like a spicy   employee only spicy  and Minerva delivers !
reviews.name: David Marshall

reviews.text: Indian food is spreading like wildfire  of late. For Ami  that is  a darn good thing. Last night  food was right on the top of the list along with Dhaba. Ami's sweet Pakistani beau showed up at Ami's house with takeout. Ami was cold and tired from walking outside getting ready for a  k. Putting Ami and  k in the same sentence is crazy. Anyway  the food from Minerva was just what the doctor ordered. Ami ate the Hyderabadi Dum Chicken Biriyani and the Fish Curry. Ami loved the Hyderabadi Dum Chicken Biriyani and the Fish Curry equally. The heat level was  medium  which for Ami was perfect. The rice in the Hyderabadi Dum Chicken Biriyani was lovely and perfectly prepared. Each grain stood alone. The chicken was on the bone  tender and plentiful. The fish was excellent  not overcooked and really enhanced by the curry sauce. Ami had both plain and garlic naan. both plain and garlic naan were fluffy and tender even after reheating. Ami dipped the bread in the curry sauce not leaving behind even one drop. The servings sizes were generous and today Ami revisited the Hyderabadi Dum Chicken Biriyani for lunch. Glad Ami did not  have to share that last portion.
reviews.name: Ami

reviews.text: Ordered the chaat items. Have had much better. The green chutney they add to chaat is the idli chuney. Not meant for authentic chaat. Havent tasted anything else  so cant comment.
reviews.name: Adwait

reviews.text: Finally Madison has an authentic South Indian restaurant. Jan may be biased  but south Indian food is way more awesome than the typical north Indian food you get at most other Indian restaurants. an authentic South Indian restaurant's dosas are to die for  -  crispy and yummy and there are so many kinds of Their dosas. an authentic South Indian restaurant's kothu parotta  savory minced bread  is absolutely authentic and delicious and Jan's favorite item on the menu. Their kothu parotta  savory minced bread is a street food that is popular in Tamil Nadu and this is the first time Jan am seeing Their kothu parotta  savory minced bread on a menu in the US. And an authentic South Indian restaurant's Indo - Chinese dishes are tasty too. Do yourself a favor and try some new Indian dishes at Minerva
reviews.name: Jan

reviews.text: Now under new ownership  Minerva will be undergoing a name change in the near future. Great place for an Indian food buffet. Typical offerings of simple salad with Raita dressing  tamarind and mint chutney  along with classics like tandoori chicken  tikka masala  chicken biryani and saag paneer. There were at least six additional selections of vegetarian  chicken and lamb dishes  and two desserts not typically seen on Indian food buffets  -  a sweetened paneer soft fresh cheese in rose flavored  pistachio sauce and beet root pur e. two desserts not typically seen on Indian food buffets  -  a sweetened paneer soft fresh cheese in rose flavored  pistachio sauce and beet root pur e. were rich and satisfying and a nice alternative to kheer and mango ice cream. The food was fresh  even at   :     and kept hot in clean  covered serving dishes. Wonderful   warm buttered naan was served at the table. You can make a meal out of Wonderful   warm buttered naan by dipping in the tasty chutneys. Very friendly staff  and a chef who seems to know how to do it right  -  spicy but not excessive. The meat in the curries was lean  moist and tender. The buffet selections change daily. Tim have  been to many Indian food buffets in Madison and Milwaukee and Great place for an Indian food buffet is better than most.
reviews.name: Tim

reviews.text: Ray m hooked on the lunch buffet. the lunch buffet have a good variety and serve some different items than the other Indian buffets Ray have  been to while still remaining familiar. The two things that enamor Ray to Minerva over the other nearby Indian buffets is that the lunch buffet allow the lunch buffet to be carried out in a to - go box and cup and the lunch buffet is  slightly cheaper while being of the same or better quality. The only downside to the lunch buffet is there is not  much seating.
reviews.name: Ray

reviews.text: Pretty good indian food. Paw have eaten here multiple times  and each time the food was delicious. Minerva  a small place but Paw will certainly go back .
reviews.name: Paw

reviews.text: My husband and Rosie tried Minerva for the first time today. The food was outstanding. As often as Rosie eat Indian Cuisine  Rosie am not good at describing most dishes by name. What Rosie can tell you is that the selections on the buffet were fresh  hot and deliciously seasoned. Plus  there were several offerings on the buffet that Rosie have  never tried elsewhere. It was nice to try something new. The tandoori chicken was especially moist and meaty  not at all dry. The spices in every dish were just right. The only thing Rosie found missing from the condiment section was the salty mixed relish that Rosie enjoy on the side. This is a smaller - sized restaurant  and it was nice not to have to stand in a line to fill Rosie's plate. Despite the smaller dining room  the size of the buffet and number of dishes offered was equivalent to both the larger Indian buffets Rosie frequent. If you are a fan of Indian buffets  you will be very pleased by the quality and selection !
reviews.name: Rosie

reviews.text: This humble little Indian buffet is so tasty ! This humble little Indian buffet prepare all This humble little Indian buffet's food fresh from scratch Shawn asked !  . No pre - packaged or reheated foods. The selection is enough to make   or   rounds with many things on your plate and still not get the same thing twice. My buddy and Shawn agreed that This humble little Indian buffet was My buddy and Shawn's new favorite place.
reviews.name: Shawn

reviews.text: Ri's boyfriend and Ri went to this restaurant last sunday for the first time and Ri tried the buffet and since Ri started to eat Ri noticed the difference between the other indian restaurants Ri have been to and this restaurant and Minerva this one and Minerva is  so much better ! Every single thing Ri tried was sooo tasty Ri's favorites were :  the chili chicken  the channa masala garbanzo beans in a creamy sauce the deep fried vegetables   the deep fried vegetables were sooo crispy  and this restaurant's cottage cheese their cottage cheese was sooo delicate Ri did not want to finish eating their cottage cheese Ri would definitely come back for more ! The only reason Ri gave this restaurant   stars its because the buffet area the buffet area is so small and Ri think this restaurant should rearrange the buffet area this restaurant have the main entrees in the narrower side where most of the people stand most of the time  this restaurant should put the main entrees in the beginning area  where everybody start to get their empty plates since it is a more open area.
reviews.name: Ri

reviews.text: Disclaimer : Mad am vegetarian so Mad have not  tried chicken or lamb entrees. Mad have been to buffet more than    times  ordered for take out many times. Mad have been to all parts of india  been to some of the best restaurants in all major cities. Minerva Indian Cuisine  food taste is closest to authentic indian food compared to other restaurants in madison. Buffet is not that exceptional but if you order individual dishes the must try things are   -  Veg biryani  -  kutthu paratha  -  various south indian dishes Food quality is incredible. South indian entrees and few north indian entrees are very good. Not all north indian entrees are good. Taste of Indo chinese entrees and starters has deteriorated in last few months. Pros  -  great food  -  authentic taste spicy  -  unique menu  : menu has various things that other indian restaurants do not have  -  friendly staff Cons -  limited space Mad have heard they are moving to bigger place    -  mediocre ambience
reviews.name: Mad

reviews.text: The lunch buffet had a great variety ! A highlight was the Bindi Masala okra dish... delicious and unique  definitely recommend ! Go here and try a little of everything to find your favorite Indian dish.
reviews.name: Alice

reviews.text: Minerva Indian Cuisine is must if you enjoy South Indian food ! The service is nothing spectacular  but the food is well worth it and because of that  L m able to overlook The service. This is not  to say service was bad  service just did not  go above and beyond L's expectations. The menu is extensive with a lot of options -  - everything from your traditional curries to some more adventurous fare. L's curry and naan was fresh  delicious  and perfect in every way.
reviews.name: L

reviews.text: Authentic south Indian restaurant  Tamil style cooking .. Had lunch buffet here loved starters both veg and non veg... Chicken     tandoori  pakoda curd rice dosa are delicious....
reviews.name: Dineshkumar

reviews.text: This is now Theresa's favorite indian restaurant in town ! They have a very extensive menu for dinner. Theresa ordered the Dum Chicken Biriyani Bhagara Baigan  and Punu Gulu. It was amazing ! Everyone was incredibly nice as well. Theresa m excited to try their lunch buffet and all the items on the menu that Theresa have never seen before !
reviews.name: Theresa

reviews.text: Excellent curry  quality of meat was a bit below average  dark meat chicken pieces  somewhat gristly . Slow service as well  and restaurant seemed a bit dirty. Upgrade the quality of the meat and clean the bathrooms and tablecloths restaurant was NOT clean  -  somewhat worrisome   and this would be a winner.
reviews.name: Ryan

reviews.text: star for food  -     star for ambience  Best south Indian restaurant in Midwest far Sai tried biryani  noodles paneer veg manchuria dosa  idly etc. none of them have disappointed us so far. Best south Indian restaurant in Midwest far's food is an authentic Indian food. All other indian food  places modified for non indians. But here you will  get      indian food. Wish Best south Indian restaurant in Midwest far was a little bit bigger and have good ambience. No other restaurant in Madison can beat Minerva for south Indian food.
reviews.name: Sai

reviews.text: Went on opening weekend. Kira opened up two days previously. Kira do not  even have Kira's liquor license yet -  the waiter said would be through in a week. The staff was very nice and the food was really delicious. The paneer was some of the best Kira have  ever hard. Kira do not  know if this will be Kira's permanent model but it was all buffet  no menus. The only particularly negative thing is that the floor was really dirty...to the point of the floor being very noticeable and odd. Kira would also suggest Kira would mark veg or non - veg on the buffet  - it was kind of hard to guess. All this said  Kira will definitely go back -  maybe in a month or so when Kira have  got beer. :
reviews.name: Kira

reviews.text: The food was mediocre at best. Dosa and vada were so oily. The Pongal and veg manchurian tasted fine. Sravya did get the biryani to go after reading the reviews. Hopefully the biryani tastes as good as the biryani smells.
reviews.name: Sravya

reviews.text: My friends and Haliee enjoy going to Minerva Indian Cuisine because of the authentic South Indian food. However  in the past two visits  Haliee have always been rushed by the same waiter. While Haliee were still ordering the main course  the same waiter wanted to know what Haliee would like for dessert ! There was still two hours left for Minerva Indian Cuisine to close ! Next time Haliee went  the same waiter took away our plates while Haliee were still eating. Before Haliee could tell the same waiter to leave our plates  the same waiter disappeared into the kitchen... What  the hurry ! Food is great  but Haliee have been disappointed with the service repeatedly. Haliee wo not  be recommending Minerva Indian Cuisine to my friends  or visiting Minerva Indian Cuisine again soon.
reviews.name: Haliee

reviews.text: Yet another excellent meal. Even the standards like the vindaloo and tikka marsalas and especially the garlic naan is just fantastic !
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Oh  no  -  -  Craig hate to downgrade these guys because the staff is so friendly it is  a clean place and the staff work hard and do so much the right way. However  there are other Indian places that sell Craig's favorite dish for about the same price  but use tender chunks of white meat chicken. Craig's vindaloo here had what Craig assume is dark meat  with what many of what Craig consider to be inedible pieces tough  grisly  veiny  fatty . Craig Craig not going to rule out returning here  but if the price of an entree is going to be comparable to the competition  Craig would suggest to match their quality as well. For the aforementioned reasons  Craig wish these guys the best and Craig will be back. Craig hope Craig's suggestion helps.
reviews.name: Craig

reviews.text: The most authentic South Indian food in town. Very reasonable prices and convenient location. The lunch buffet also has a lot of variety. Definitely recommend !
reviews.name: Samir

reviews.text: Minerva has awesome Biryani !  ! The best in Madison. Tenny also love the different variety of dosa. Tenny's personal favorite -  egg dosa ! !  ! So yummy. Every time Tenny crave Indian  Minerva is our go to place !  !  ! The service is a little slow though... Just have to have some patience !  !
reviews.name: Tenny

reviews.text: Heck yeah ! Talk about the system working ! Props to Matt who started the awesome thread on Yelp Madison Talk re :  openings and closings http : www.yelp.com topic Madison - the - official -      - Madison - openings - and - closings - comings - and - goings - thread  and thanks to Steve for letting the community know about this new Indian joint on Junction Rd. It may have taken me a few months to get this new Indian joint on Junction Rd otherwise ! Corey was bouncing around the threads last night saw  this new Indian joint on Junction Rd  and got in the car. Corey called on Corey's way to make sure this new Indian joint on Junction Rd were actually open. Folks this is easily the best Indian food Corey have  found in Madison for three reasons :    . The Menu... holy cow The Menu S HUGE ! Corey went for dinner and spent forever pouring over each and every page  looking up a few items on Corey's phone because a few items were new to Corey. No shortage of variety here. . The Dosas... this and this alone should make you speed over. Corey think this new Indian joint on Junction Rd have    ! That nuts ... NUTS ! Corey m used to seeing maybe   or   different kinds at a place.   . The Flavor... everything Corey tried was incredible. And although spice heat is key to Indian cooking theirs is well balanced  and not so hot that you can not  taste anything. Corey had vegetable jalfrezi chicken tikka masala  masala dosa and garlic naan. All of it was awesome ! GET THESE THINGS ! Even the garlic naan  which Corey sort of feel like is tough to make incredible  but garlic naan was incredible. garlic naan arrived at the table piping hot and aromatic and did not  have an offensive garlic flavor. The chicken tikka masala was some of the best Corey have  had  topping some of the curry Corey long for in London. The veggies were tender yet crisp and in a super tasty sauce. And masala dosa. Ohhhh masala dosa masala dosa was good  not Corey's favorite  but with so many options  Corey can not  wait to get back and try another one... maybe more adventurous than masala dosa. Huge props to the stellar staff that made sure Corey had no questions about The Menu  kept water glasses full  and told us the stellar staff that made sure Corey had no questions about the menu will have beer wine liquor soon. Just wrapping up some paperwork. the stellar staff that made sure Corey had no questions about the menu also sent us home with leftovers in boxes and gave us extra rice. Very kind. The atmosphere ai not  much so do not  go expecting to be transported to India or anything. There is some nice stuff hand painted on one wall  but some nice stuff hand painted on one wall is  about it. Small space. Bright light. No tunes playing the night Corey was there. Corey did not  notice construction dirt or dust so Corey m guessing the stellar staff that made sure Corey had no questions about the menu cleaned up after what sounds like a rushed opening. And my feeling has always been  if Corey m there the first week  Corey m going to make a few exceptions anyway knowing the stellar staff that made sure Corey had no questions about the menu are  still trying to find the stellar staff that made sure Corey had no questions about the menu's footing. These guys have though. And if food remains consistent  this will be my go to for Indian stuffs in Madison !
reviews.name: Corey

reviews.text: Minerva Indian Cuisine is one of the worst and sad restaurant in Madison. Pathetic service. The manager or someone of Minerva Indian Cuisine is so irresponsible of what is  going on in Minerva Indian Cuisine. The food is not at all freshly made.. The food is  very oily and rotten ! Bhavana would never ever go to Minerva Indian Cuisine again !
reviews.name: Bhavana

reviews.text: Charlotte found out about Minerva Indian Cuisine from the owner of the indian grocery that Charlotte shop at. Went there for the lunch buffet on a weekday and for the price the lunch buffet was good. More meat options than vegetarian  but still enough vegetarian food to fill Charlotte up. The vegetarian options included Jerra Aloo palak paneer  and a black channa. All tasty with the complimentary dosas. Only reason why Charlotte did not  give Minerva Indian Cuisine five stars was because Minerva Indian Cuisine did not  have Charlotte's favorite chutney and the buffet prices were a mystery until Charlotte paid. The layout is L shaped and a little awkward but the people are friendly and the food was good. Charlotte will most likely go back in a few months.
reviews.name: Charlotte

reviews.text: Simply the best South Indian food in Madison so far. Minerva Indian Cuisine's pongal vada is to absolutely die for ! Just the right amount of dal  ghee and cashews  : And Minerva Indian Cuisine's dosas -  wow Minerva Indian Cuisine have over a dozen varieties  -  all scrumptious. Arun also like Minerva Indian Cuisine's Madurai idli  -  spiced and fried goodness. Minerva Indian Cuisine's sambhar and coconut chutney is also good. Not really a fan of most of Minerva Indian Cuisine's other dishes though. Arun prefer the other Indian restaurants in Madison for North Indian food. So  this is quite complementary since Arun do not  really like the others South Indian fare ! Minerva Indian Cuisine's service is decent and the owners are nice. Not giving   because Minerva Indian Cuisine's quantity to price ratio is a bit low  -  understandable for an upstart but hopefully Minerva Indian Cuisine will fix it in due course.
reviews.name: Arun

reviews.text: Ridiculously good ! Quaint ! Cozy ! Lost one star only because  -  Lil Lacking in True Indian Atmosphere. -  Food is teriffic ! ! That  what matters !
reviews.name: Sean

reviews.text: Definitely the best Indian restaurant in Madison
reviews.name: Abhishek

reviews.text: Lu Ann used Minerva Indian Cuisine to feed a large group of people for an event after doing some calling around for price comparisons Minerva Indian Cuisine was the best deal and willing to work with us Lu Ann picked up the food and the food was excellent.
reviews.name: Lu Ann

reviews.text: A little out of the way in a strip mall but Minerva has really good food. In particular  Minerva had an Indo - Chinese type chicken  chicken maybe The name is escaping Jim. on the buffet line that was really enjoyable. The buffet selection is a little on the small side  but The buffet selection is  all well done and tasty. Also a little bit on the expensive side for the lunch buffet. Jim agree with some of the comments here that sometimes it feels a little bit like you are  imposing when you come in the door and that the staff is a little...tentative Is that the word   Jim dunno. Enjoyable place  will definitely come back from time to time  but Enjoyable place is  not at the top of Jim's list.
reviews.name: Jim

reviews.text: Alan really want to like Minerva like many of Alan's family members who have not had experiences similar to my spouse and Alan while there. The food is pretty good compared to the other Indian restaurants in town. Alan's favorites are Haveli and Swad. To give them a fair chance  Alan's spouse and Alan have been to Minerva three times for the lunch buffet on the weekday and weekend at least an hour to an hour and a half before the lunch buffet was to close. Each of three times  Alan did not feel particularly welcome or that my spouse and Alan's business was appreciated. Frankly  Alan felt like Alan were imposing. Alan thought it was Alan and did not say anything until Alan's wife made the comment after Alan had left the first time. my spouse and Alan's next two visits were the same. On all of my spouse and Alan's visits  my spouse and Alan's table was cleared reasonably promptly so there is  no issue there. It has always been upon entering and exiting that Alan get these blank stares with barely an acknowledgment. Alan have not heard this from other people so suspect it could just be my spouse and Alan although Alan am not sure why since Alan are pretty affable and well mannered. A simple hello  thank you and a smile or nod would suffice. Minerva's buffet selection is on the small side and is just OK quality and taste wise. The space is a little cramped. If there were any more than a few other tables of people  a wheelchair bound guest could not be accommodated readily. All told  there are more comfortable and welcoming settings with better food. But for the lack of pleasantness and difficulty accommodating my spouse and Alan's more physically challenged brothers and sisters  Alan would give our more physically challenged brothers and sisters       stars.
reviews.name: Alan

reviews.text: Place could be better  Place is  okay. Food was not  great. The chaat that Priyanka ordered was cold. The chaat that Priyanka ordered should not  have been. Priyanka know that because Priyanka am an Indian. Priyanka only had north indian food so Priyanka can not  comment about the south indian food available there. The plus side was that Place's menu had a lot of variety.

Rebekkah was extremely disappointed. Rebekkah arrived around   :    -  -  the lunch buffet at Minerva goes until   : -  -  and everything Rebekkah tried was cold and looked picked - over. The food tasted fine  but Rebekkah have  definitely had much better Indian food. Tina have tried a few Indian lunch buffets in Madison and their lunch buffet is now one of Tina's favorites.

reviews.text: Have been here twice for dinner and both times were excellent. Huge menu  authentic and delicious food. Could use a better wine list but the basics are there. Sevice is good as well.

reviews.text: At last ! Madison has a place that serves proper  Dum Biriyani . All the other Indian restaurants in Madison serve some sort of weird amalgam of Pulao and Chicken Fried rice but a place that serves proper  Dum Biriyani is the real deal. Try a place that serves proper  Dum Biriyani out if you have never done so before ! Another thing Binit liked about a place that serves proper  Dum Biriyani was a place that serves proper  Dum Biriyani's menu their menu was really broad and covered multiple sub types of Indian cuisine  -  mainly Northern  Chinese Yes ! Southern. Binit have not  had to try the Northern or the Chinese but if the food Binit had was anything to go by the food Binit had should all be good. Binit tried out the Chicken Dum Biriyani   Chettinadu and both were awesome. the Chicken Dum Biriyani   Chettinadu was a bit too spicy for Binit's palate  and Binit like spicy food and have higher threshold than most but Biriyani more than made - up for higher threshold than most.
reviews.name: Binit

photos.caption: The best food for entertaining! Call ahead and use your own dishes!

reviews.text: Holy god  Bollywood Bites is delish. But if you are  stuffing your face with deep fried  hot toddy S.Indian goodness  tables in full    degree sunlight do not  work as seating  -  an umbrella  perhaps  would make this an easier lunchtime sell. Fav Lilva Katchori -  tiny nuggets of buckwheat groats and mustard seeds turmeric  curry leaves  covered in pastry and fried. Crunchy  textural  rad. Comes with Bollywood Bites's house hot tamarind sauce  -  a sweet  gradually crescendoing spice experience thin and everything tastes better dipped in hot tamarind sauce. Got some sort of sandwich let  go with curry and lime pickle and chickpea spread  -  and damn it was awesome. A slider by way of Punjab. Killer. Prices are low to mid  -  and there are things being made here that you can not  get anywhere else  plus the classics are fab  -  samosas  two huuuuge pastry - covered piles of fennel seed  potato  unidentifiable delish  for   bucks. A garlicy  smoky dal multiple legumes  a cup or so of Paneer Masala a perfect amount of rice  papadum  and thin  pancake - like Naan  for  . Sweet.
reviews.name: Julia

reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is unprofessional in every way possible. It  really a shame that for a place that serves up very decent  authentic indian cuisine  that the customer service is so deplorable. Monali's parents and Monali went in today to pick up an order of undhia and bhajia at  pm. My parents and Monali had pre - ordered an order of undhia and bhajia and arranged the pick up time. Monali were told to wait for   minutes which Monali did with no problem. minutes turned into         and almost   . When it finally came out Monali's father rightly expressed concern about the timing since Monali were ordering a very large amount for a special event. The owner snidely replied  well  if my father are so concerned then why are Monali even ordering from Bollywood Bites Ummm  say what   First rule of customer service the customer is always right. And even if the customer are obnoxious which Monali were not  Monali APOLOGIZE for being late. And Monali do not  make snide comments. And here  the kicker  Monali let it slide because there were other people in the store  and when Monali got home Monali realized Monali had gotten the WRONG order  Monali had   orders of bhajias. So Monali called The owner  to note this error. Instead of an apology  at this point Monali were owed two  Monali got Monali's adamant denial that Monali was in the wrong. No it was Bollywood Bites who had placed a wrong order. Monali's father expressed my father's disapproval of Monali's behavior and you know what Monali said  Monali do not  have to listen to you  Monali have  opened restaurants before  Monali do not  need to be told how to run it. UM  actually  Monali do. Because Monali are RUDE  UNPROFESSIONAL  and cocky enough to think that just because Monali's food is good Monali can get by with the worst service Monali have ever encountered. This is America you can not  treat your customers like this and get away with it. And it is  such a shame  because in this small indian community of Charlotte  one wants to spread the word about their fellow indian  business and help their fellow indian  business out. But Bollywood Bites is not worth all the undhia in the world. Bollywood Bites left a really bad taste in Monali's mouth and Monali will never step foot in there again.
reviews.name: Monali

reviews.text: CLOSED ! !  !  !  !  !  Invalid number ! No longer open ! Website still up with no contact info. Google map links you to a strip mall and an Indian grocery. BS

reviews.text: Wow ! Himanshu really like the food here. Bollywood Bites is a dive and really can be difficult to find. But Himanshu think for the taste and price it really is worth the trip to South Blvd. It is just a walk - up counter where you order the food and then wait in a dingy seating area. To - Go food only. Service is very lacking. Himanshu do not  think they have ever heard of the phrase  service with a smile. But the food is the only reason Himanshu come here. Himanshu's favorites to order are the :  Bhel  Paneer Tika Masala and Chhole - Bhature. Sooo Good ! If you like Indian food then Bollywood Bites is a must try for a quick to - go Indian meal.
reviews.name: Himanshu

reviews.text: Last weeks creative loafing had an article about Bollywood Bites that inspired Shauna to give it a shot. Shauna's co - worker is married to an Indian man and is quite familiar with the cuisine Shauna am not   - so My co - worker offered to take a group of a group of us in and help a group of us decide what to get. Be warned :  Bollywood Bites is difficult to find - CL did not  refer to Bollywood Bites as a hidden gem for nothing. If you look on Bollywood Bites's website Bollywood Bites give great directions with a map  making it much easier. Also be warned that if your meal is under     it is cash only. Shauna came with a group of us   and waited for about a half hour for a group of us's meals... it is take - out only so this may not be ideal for a workday lunch unless you work in the vicinity. Bollywood Bites also do not have everything listed on Bollywood Bites's menu on a given day -  so unless you are extremely familiar with Indian fare  -  Shauna recommend going in and talking to My co - worker rather than calling the order in. My co - worker was friendly and helpful. Despite the above warnings  the food the food itself is really beyond delicious and earns the four stars solidly. Shauna's co - worker said the food itself reminded My co - worker of meals cooked in My co - worker's in - laws kitchen. Shauna ordered the paneer tikka masala Which was killer  make sure you get the roti that goes with the roti that goes with it. Shauna also had the Pani Puri  which isnt on Bollywood Bites's menu online . If you have never tried the Pani Puri  which isnt on their menu online  -  get the Pani Puri  which isnt on their menu online now ! So delicious ..make sure you ask how to eat the Pani Puri  which isnt on their menu online though or you will  be lost. Shauna had quite a bit of food for    -  the menu is super affordable. Keep in mind everything is vegan and or vegetarian. Bollywood Bites was certainly worth the effort of finding !
reviews.name: Shauna

reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is small Vegetarian takeout Indian food place. Though the menu is limited   food is made freshly. Avyaktha tired Bombay sandwich samosa samosa chat  Chole  Gulab Jamun  mango lassi and Chai. Avyaktha have been to Bollywood Bites around   -   times and  Avyaktha have seen people coming for Tea and Samosa   pm snack in India . Very limited curry menu

reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is both so wonderful  and so ghastly messed up that it is  hard to write a proper review that reflects how wildly Bollywood Bites swings to both sides of the spectrum. Cat happened to be driving right past Bollywood Bites today so Cat stopped in to pick up some chaat  just a quick little snack. It is indeed nearly impossible to find Bollywood Bites. Just when you are  about to give up  drive     feet farther and Bollywood Bites is  on your left. The woman in the front was nice and smiled a lot  but understood very little Cat asked so Cat just went with an order of Samosas and an order of Aloo Tiki. The woman in the front told me   No credit card. Cat said fine  that Cat would  brought cash. Cat said Cat would go drop off my order in the kitchen and come ring me up. Cat stood at the counter for five minutes before Cat decided to sit in one of the plastic chairs. Cat realized Cat was not  coming back for awhile. Cat brought out my food about ten minutes later and told me an order of Aloo Tiki would be   . Cat handed Cat a    . Cat went in the back  then came back and asked me if Cat did not  have    exactly. Cat said Cat did not   and asked if Cat would  take a check or something. Lots of miming with my checkbook here. Cat shook Cat's head and made a phone call. Cat spent another   -    minutes waiting while Cat was in the back with my     trying to figure out what to do with my checkbook. Finally Cat came back to the front and went over to the cash register  that had been ignored throughout this whole time. While still on the phone Cat tentatively pressed a button twice and  woosh ! the cash register drawer flew open and Cat's eyes lit up. Yes  Cat had to make a phone call to figure out how to get change for a    . Cat left  amused at how screwy Bollywood Bites was and expecting never to return. Then Cat got home  and Cat tried an order of Aloo Tiki. Here  the deal Aloo Tiki was the most flavorful Aloo Tikki Cat have  ever had in Cat's life. Samosas were incredible. It is quite clear that there is a master in the kitchen at Bollywood Bites. But it is equally clear that the management of Bollywood Bites is horribly inept. Both from the reviews here  and from my own personal experience trying to simply order    worth of food from the management of this little hole - in - the - wall restaurant. Whoever is running the show has made a series of bad decisions and wrong turns. The location is terrible. The lack of tables is ridiculous. Leaving a woman to manage the orders who can not  communicate and does not  know how to open a cash register is laughable. Cat do not  know whether to love Bollywood Bites or hate Bollywood Bites. Cat am absolutely sure Cat will be back to try more of the delicious food but Cat wo not  get too attached to Bollywood Bites. Bollywood Bites just does not  feel like a place that is  going to be there more than a couple of years at the rate Bollywood Bites is  being managed.
reviews.name: Cat

reviews.text: CLOSED Tonya m sad to report that this little slice of heaven has closed. Tonya m crying in Tonya's mango lassi.
reviews.name: Tonya

reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is one of Tonya's favorite kind of restaurants limited menu but what Bollywood Bites serve is delicious. Bollywood Bites  tucked away in a very nondescript building there is no accidentally finding Bollywood Bites you have to be on a mission. Half of Bollywood Bites's menu is street food  little bites of hot  flavorful goodies. The other half are curries  lentils  breads and rice dishes. You can order lots of food because it is so inexpensive Tonya ordered  rice bread a chick pea patty appetizer and a lentil dish to the tune of    . It makes Tonya want to dance like a Bollywood movie  big smiles with dramatic hand gestures. To get there turn on the road at Arby  on Polk Street South Blvd near Pineville  go to the end of the road turn left and Bollywood Bites is  on the end of the road. Driving up today Tonya thought Bollywood Bites was closed then Tonya saw the magical OPEN sign ! There are a couple of picnic tables or you can take it to the food court at the mall. Well worth the journey !
reviews.name: Tonya

reviews.text: Take out only ! Glad someone told me it was Take out -  Messer was going to take a date out  though date out and take out are not a pairing Messer would normally choose by choice  unless it were you ! Getting kicked out  nor kicked in  is never what Messer have in mind. Bollywood Bites do have two Picnic tables out back... This whole place is out back and if the weather is decent you will probably get eaten by mosquitoes if eating outdoors here ! Hidden ! ! ! This whole place is well hidden ! Thinking Messer would just ride up and down Polk Road  for two weeks though not continuously  until Messer saw This whole place  and did four times Saturday Night  date night in case you do not  know  and finally walked in to India Grocer and India Grocer politely pointed me in the right direction. Vegetarian ONLY ! !  ! The guy working there was great ! The guy working there explained everything and made some suggestions. Rated : Baigan Bhartha   yelp stars Undhiyu Curry      yelp stars Rice                       yelp stars                Service                  yelp stars                Bread yelp stars                Masala Tea yelp stars  Masala Tea Chai when Masala Tea is good Messer m crazy about Masala Tea and when Masala Tea is not it Messer will not use that language ! This Masala Tea  as they call Masala Tea at Bollywood Bites  was the best or a close tie for best ! reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is what you would  call an Indian snack spot small servings  take out only and cheap prices. Demetria truly love Indian food which has to be the only reason Demetria would the drive cross country to visit Bollywood Bites from my side of town. It was certainly worth the drive. The young lady working the register was so patient with me being such an indecisive patron...... Demetria do believe Demetria need medical assistance for that issue : -    Demetria finally decided on the Pani Puri  paneer tikka masala and samosa  and everything was great. Demetria think Demetria will return to try the Mah ki Daal as they were out.

reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is fantastic. Bollywood Bites  very authentic and the customer service Jenny experienced was great. The lady at the register took the time to explain all of the dishes to us. Bollywood Bites is carryout only and our food took about    minutes as Bollywood Bites said our food would. Jenny would call ahead next time and order. Jenny had Chhole Tikki which was a chick pea dish with something like potato pancakes in it. It was fantastic and tasted like authentic Indian food that friends have made for us. Jenny also has Samosas and Jenny think Samosas were easily the best in the area. My husband had a combo with a dal and a curry. Jenny think a combo with a dal and a curry was the Tikka Masala and Five Daal. a combo with a dal and a curry was also very good. Jenny highly recommend Bollywood Bites. Bollywood Bites  much better than any of the Indian restaurants in Charlotte and is also much cheaper. Bollywood Bites vegetarian but Jenny did not  really miss meat. Jenny spent     total on an appetizer and two entrees. Bollywood Bites is hidden away and is in the very back of the   rows of buildings on the same street as the Arby .
reviews.name: Jenny

reviews.text: Do not  eat here ! J had the pav bhaji and on the last bite J discovered a dead cockroach. J went back n gave a dead cockroach back. They nicely returned J's money but damage is done -  permanently.

reviews.text: Made the trip here on          and unfortunately Bollywood Bites is closed down. Not a sign of life nor morsel of Indian food. Only a FOR LEASE sign in the window.

reviews.text: Misha prefer Rabhjog which is North of Charlotte  that being said  if Misha am  in the area and feeling some samosa chaat Misha will  still stop by. It  a little hard to find but Misha think that is  half the fun.

reviews.text: Some fairly good street food that is not  easy to find in North Carolina. The service is less than cordial  and while the food is good the food is  not always worth the hassle. John personally enjoy Bollywood Bites's chole bhature and kathi roll. Most of Bollywood Bites's food wo not  disappoint. It  just too bad there is  no place to sit. Worth the visit and Bollywood Bites is one of the better Indian restaurants in the area. The hours are horrendous. Bollywood Bites close at   : pm except on weekends  which is   : pm. John recently went there on a Thursday  called at   : pm no one picked up  this has happened before so John figured John would  just order in person . When John arrived at   : pm John was refused service with a hideously smug smile in which a single person declined John's business and said Bollywood Bites were closed. Another time John went they got John's order wrong  intentionally . John specifically ordered batata vada and even spelled batata vada out because John's pronunciation is terrible. They gave John the overpriced vada pau  which John can pronounce  and also  do not  get that item because you are  really only buying the bun. In India and some other restaurants they give you much larger vada pau worth your money . The food is good John wo not  deny that but The service is utterly horrible. Almost every single person  attitude is terrible.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: The very first thing you would need to know Bollywood Bites is Take Out Only !  ! Maddie thought of checking Bollywood Bites out for lunch since Maddie found out Bollywood Bites is one of the very few  or the only one Maddie know  places in Charlotte that serves Indian Maharashtrian street food  one of the biggest things Maddie miss about India. When Maddie walked in  Bollywood Bites was empty but then the owner heard the door open and came out to take our order. Maddie was having a little tough time explaining all the dishes to Maddie's boyfriend but then the owner gave Maddie a menu that explained most dishes for someone not familiar with Indian terms. Just like someone else said in their reviews Maddie was disappointed when Maddie was not  greeted or did not even get a smile. Maddie tried to ease whatever tension was in the air by discussing some of the food items on a menu that explained most dishes for someone not familiar with Indian terms but it seemed like it was such a big task to get the owner to even talk to Maddie. That being said  the food still gets Bollywood Bites   stars and since Bollywood Bites is  a take out place the lack of smiles does not  bother Maddie that much. Definitely a place to check out if you want to try something more than the usual South Indian or North Indian food. The  bataka vada   which should be  batata  vada  was delicious ! Even writing about The  bataka vada   which should be  batata  vada here is making Maddie drool. Maddie's boyfriend had the paneer kathi rool and Maddie had the Bombay grill sandwich both of which were great. Maddie's masala chai was good too ! Something about the sev puri amused Maddie though. They gave us whole puris  potatoes  noodles and sauces chutneys separately and Maddie had to make the puris  or mix the puris into the end product  Maddie when Maddie got home. Maddie see the reason why they did it  the reason why they did it is to keep the puris from going soggy with the sauces filled in the puris too long but Maddie doubt someone who is not familiar with Indian Maharashtrian street food  one of the biggest things Maddie miss about India would understand what to do with a bunch of puffed up puris and sauces or how to make the sev puri. Maddie you need to tap one side of a puri to make a hole through which you put in just a bit of potatoes  mint chutney tamarind sauce  yogurt and then top a puri with the sev  noodles  and eat a puri in one go ! Maddie hope this helps some confused soul out there in tasting this mouth - watering off - beat cuisine  Update : Make sure the yogurt and chutneys are fresh before you take food home. Maddie once got a bad batch where the yogurt had gone sour and the chutney container was puffed up with mold growing on the surface. Since it was too late to go back Maddie mentioned that to the owner the next time Maddie went there  but the owner did not even so much as apologize for it. That did seem a little rude to Maddie and so Maddie had to knock off one star for service.
reviews.name: Maddie

reviews.text: Bollywood Bites is super DELISH ! Every time G go and get something G feel like G am eating G's mom  food. my mom  food Bollywood Bites's a hole in the wall but once you try Bollywood Bites's food you will  keep coming back for more. Bollywood Bites is not  a place where you can sit and eat so you will  have to do take out and enjoy it elsewhere. Ca not  get enough !  !  !

reviews.text: LOVE Bollywood Bites ! ! ! ! It is completely awesome to have another Indian option in this particular part of town. Service was awesome. Went straight in  place M's order after talking to the staff about the vegan options THIS IS A MUST  and immediately got M's food. BEST thing about Bollywood Bites is price value. You can get an appropriately sized serving and the price is outstanding. M look forward to returning !

reviews.text: Who would not  want to go Hyderabad House -   ! Srita have  been to Hyderabad House -  's buffet thrice and quite honestly their buffet has been very good. If Hyderabad House -   can maintain the same quality and flavor  Hyderabad House -   is going to be Srita's go to place for Indian food. But what Srita am really disappointed about is Hyderabad House -  's take out. Srita am knocking off just a point for their take out because there is  room for improvement. What Srita ordered :  Ulavacharu Veg Biryani  -     . There were no vegetables at all. It was just rice. Gongura Egg Biryani  -     . Good flavor but nothing out of the world. Srita would  rather go eat their buffet than order takeout for dinner. That  just me. Others who have eaten there for dinner liked the food but maybe there is a difference if you eat in or take out. Hyderabad House -   are better than the previous restaurants in the same spot and Srita hope Hyderabad House -   fare well.
reviews.name: Srita

reviews.text: WOW. Incredible Indian food ! Jason was not  impressed by the last high - rated Indian place Jason tried in the Midwest  but Hyderabad House -  Madison blew Jason away. Jason got butter chicken and plain naan and it was INCREDIBLE  -  the perfect balance of creamy and flavorful without being too heavy. Wish Jason could come back tomorrow !

reviews.text: First of all  Tim m supper bummed that Fast Buryani is gone the southern India restaurant was Tim's fave. They were more southern India versus guys more northern India. So keep in mind Tim prefer the southern flavor more. Having said that :   Tim had the butter chicken. the butter chicken came out in a reasonable amount if time. Tim also ordered butter naan. the butter chicken was sweet with very little heat. As the only white guy in the pace maybe they assumed Tim wanted mild. That was disappointing. Yet the butter chicken did have a nice rich flavor and texture. The Baan was normal  good. If Tim go back Tim will offer the tika masala and be sure to indicate Tim's spice level. But still disappointed the southern India restaurant closed.
reviews.name: Tim

reviews.text: Have sampled most of Madison  South Asian Indian restaurants  some very good ones  but Hyderabad House -  Madison is in a class of Hyderabad House -  Madison's own. Been there several times with friends everyone has loved friends's dishes  including biryanis  curries  dosas  and more. Lots of veggie options animal proteins are chicken  goat shrimp  and paneer. There is a large selection of South Indian dishes as well as Hyderabad cuisine  which is similar to the Mughlai N. Indian  cooking found in most Indian restaurants. The spicing is superb every dish tastes different  and Hyderabad House -  Madison do not  gratuitously use hot spices when hot spices are  not called for  something Americans seem to expect in Indian food . this delicious cuisine is authentic Hyderabadi food. The service is prompt  the prices reasonable  and Hyderabad House -  Madison is usually packed with happy  mostly South Asian  diners. Worth going out of your way to the wilds of E. Washington  just past E. Towne  to taste this delicious cuisine. Buffets are also good  varied selection.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: If you like biryani Hyderabad House -  Madison is the place for you ! Wow Sarah have  never seen so much biryani on a menu before and so much biryani on a menu is absolutely delicious. The menu focuses a lot on regional dishes but Sarah also had some very good paneer masala. Sarah also went to the buffet and Hyderabad House -  Madison had a very nice variety of foods all of which Sarah enjoyed a lot. It is nice to find another great Indian restaurant on the east side now that OM is closed. Sarah would go here mostly for biryani or the buffet but Sarah believe Hyderabad House -  Madison have something for everyone. Hyderabad House -  Madison's desserts were really good too !
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Hyderabad House -  Madison seems to be out of the crowded areas  which is good as Hyderabad House -  Madison is  peaceful and the food is amazing however Hyderabad House -  Madison give water bottle by default and charge you for water bottle why   Santosh were crazy hungry after a good   hour activity and crashed Hyderabad House -  Madison with huge order. Hyderabad House -  Madison accommodated Santosh well the server was thoughtful in taking huge order made sure Santosh got huge order right and gave a heads up if something is not available that day and specials available. Food was served fresh  hot and delicious !

reviews.text: So glad they are open in Madison Aditi have driven to schaumburg just to parcel food from Hyderabad House -  Madison !  ! Been there the day it opened in Madison and a couple more times already and could not  be more happy !  ! Just hope they do not  degrade the standard like all the other Indian places have done after having a good run !  !

reviews.text: Madison people. Try Hyderabad House -  Madison for truly good and authentic Indian food. Mads tried Hyderabad House -  Madison's weekend lunch buffet and Mads was really impressed. Mads's favorites were idli sambar  onion pakodas yogurt rice  lemon rice and all the desserts. Hyderabad House -  Madison's non veg food though is more like other Indian restaurants in Madison -  not extraordinary. But its Hyderabad House -  Madison's south Indian food  vegetarian fare that makes Hyderabad House -  Madison truly unique when compared to all other Indian restaurants in Madison. Hyderabad House -  Madison have all these new dishes that Mads didnt find in other restaurants. And Mads am going back for more . The only critique would be Hyderabad House -  Madison's decor and size :  smaller than most and not too well done. But Mads went to satisfy Mads's taste buds so who cares !
reviews.name: Mads

reviews.text: For a newly opened joint  Hyderabad House -  Madison sure felt like a BETA version. Akshay tried Hyderabad House -  Madison's Weekend Lunch Buffet     pp  and at the outset itself  Hyderabad House -  Madison is considerably smaller than other establishments had a below average seating arrangement and planning  which implied less room to move about You literally enter right into the seating area of Hyderabad House -  Madison !  . The cashier section is smack in the hustle bustle of Hyderabad House -  Madison so you are  bound to rub shoulders with someone carrying food back forth  especially if you have  been given the seats adjacent to the billing counter. Also  did Akshay mention someone just casually sat on our table and was texting while Akshay were away to get our food ! But the biggest gripe Akshay had was with the food itself. Most if not all the dishes were almost Cold A MAJOR NO NO ! ! the meat dishes lacked seasoning and had mostly a one dimensional flavor. IMO the biryani which Akshay was hoping would be Hyderabad House -  Madison's star  was average at best  especially having had much better ones locally. Some of the desserts were WAY over - sweet  Hyderabad House -  Madison's coffee mousse especially. The variety on offer was also less in comparison to other establishments. The Chutneys Signboard still hanging around can cause confusion as Akshay had to swing by Hyderabad House -  Madison twice as the ACTUAL board itself is minuscule and on top of the building. If Hyderabad House -  Madison hopes to survive  theres quite a few chinks in Hyderabad House -  Madison's armor Hyderabad House -  Madison need to fix asap !  !
reviews.name: Akshay

reviews.text: David went there the first week Hyderabad House -  Madison opened  and everything was great. The food was hot  delicious  and in good portions. David got a chicken entree and this type of traditional recipe has the bones but you can also order this type of traditional recipe boneless as well  which David will definitely be doing next time. Very friendly staff and reasonable prices too. Great new Hyderabad House -  Madison find !

reviews.text: Amy suppose every culture has it is  diner with mediocre food. And there is  always someone who will  eat at such a diner. Be forewarned. They will charge you for the bottled water whether you drink the bottled water or not   another reviewer wrote about the bottled water . It took the cashier quite a while to figure how to ring up lunch without the bottled water. the cashier did not  bring the bottled water up Amy did. And the cashier was going to keep Amy's change too. Amy do not  drink single - use bottled water; Amy do generally drink water at lunch and Amy went without. They do not  even offer tea or point out a beverage fridge   which Amy only noticed when getting dessert . So bring your own water if you have to eat here. There is no service  greeting other than point at a table. Amy could not  see the back row of the food because the sneeze guard was so scratched up  foggy. There were   -   rice dishes some okay vegetable dishes  and   -   chicken dishes. There was only chicken. The salad was wilted even the tomatoes were floppy and falling apart. Amy think The salad was yesterday  leftover salad. The condiments were labeled  condiments Amy guessed which one was raita raita was watery and flavorless. Amy skipped the other two. Hoping for a decent dessert  especially since there was so many rice dishes  and Amy love a good Kheer and a a sweet gajar Halwa. Nope. Only a bad gulag jamun. Really bad. The ice cream cooler was empty when Amy opened The ice cream cooler up expecting ...something. Amy was expecting something eating here and it is a huge nothing. zero stars

reviews.text: Rajdhani Sweets is the only place Mel come for Chaat !  !  !  ! Mouth watering.... you will keep going back for more  :  -

reviews.text: Rachel do not  know if it is  because Rachel m relatively new to Indian cuisine  or that Rachel do not  eat in Brampton very often  but Rachel loved Rajdhani Sweets. Not only is everything vegetarian but the prices are ridiculously low and the food ridiculously good. Food : The VEG. THALI was a plate of   different curries and sauces that came with rice and roti on the side. Each curry was unique in Each curry's own way and some greek yogurt on the side gave a good balance to the dish. The portions were so large for what Rachel paid  and Rachel felt quite full especially with the rice and roti on the side. The PAV BHAJI was Rachel's favourite. The PAV BHAJI  also a curry dish but with these sweet  beautifully toasted pieces of bread on the side. Rachel was in love. Rachel would      recommend trying The PAV BHAJI ! You just tear off a couple pieces of bread and dip a couple pieces of bread in the sauce and oh my goodness The PAV BHAJI is  heavenly. Price : VEG. THALI :    . ridiculously cheap PAV BHAJI :    . Ambience : Nothing to write home about  almost like a fast - food vibe to Rajdhani Sweets. Overall : Definitely not a fancy restaurant but if you want cheap Indian food that also tastes BOMB; Rajdhani Sweets is the place to go ! Truly     stars on the food alone. Rachel think Rachel blacked - out a couple times from the taste  : O
reviews.name: Rachel

reviews.text: Came to Rajdhani Sweets for dinner today. Rajdhani Sweets's prices are super cheap. The food is okay. Cyn got the naan and Palak paneer and also a veg thali for   .  . a veg thali came with rice  onions  choice of   veg curries and a desert item. the naan is warm  soft and delicious. veg curries are buffet style so it is a bit of that bulk cooking with no real flavor and soggy veggies. Also there were fruit flies buzzing everywhere... kinda gross. Overall...it was just not memorable... . rating.

reviews.text: Manisha work int he plaza right beside Rajdhani Sweets.... the service is a little slow during lunch hours but other than Rajdhani Sweets's good indian food for the right price and a good filling lunch.. food has always been on point.... Price wise Rajdhani Sweets's a much better bang for your buck than any other fast food chain like subway and pizzanova ......if you enjoy indian food Rajdhani Sweets's a place to check out...

reviews.text: Food is awesome here. Tip :  for takeout  call ahead so they can get the naan ready.

reviews.text: Choll  Bhatur   -  hahaha Charandeep really love Rajdhani Sweets than any herbivorous vegetarian  restaurants. Rajdhani Sweets's is lot parking space good place the best part is royal paan is royal paan's neighbour. Yes Charandeep indians eat a lot of spices and fried food this one of indians. A fermented rolled fried traditional bread is famous in north INDIAN dish known as BHATURA. A fermented rolled fried traditional bread's been served with many accompaniments like chickpeas curry  sweet pudding prepared with semolina known as HALWA. Rajdhani Sweets is good for kids  family. Rest you will know when you discover by yourself Rajdhani Sweets good family place. Don forget to try gulab jamun

reviews.text: Place Rajdhani Sweets is conjugated and not very spacious. But man do Rajdhani Sweets make good chaat paapri. starts for chaat papri -  everything else is pretty average. If you want chaat papri and you are in brampton  go to Rajdhani Sweets !

reviews.text: Good sweets samosas Are okay  sometimes a bit dry. Service is so so  Sometimes Amazing and sometimes barely satisfactory. Smells like a typical Indian place with deters you from going cause even if you step inside for a Few Minutes you will walk out smelling like Rajdhani Sweets

reviews.text: Above average punjabi vegetarian food. Service was good and courteous. As Rajdhani Sweets is vegetarian so had limited selection but still did not miss any popular dishes. G ordered vegetarian biryani and thali   platter with bread  rice  vegetables and sweet . Most of the restaurants have sweet and yogurt in thali but Rajdhani Sweets gives you only one to choose. The price of thali is same as most of the restaurants in Brampton     . +  Tax  . Rajdhani Sweets has seats where you can eat your food but not a full service restaurant. The food is not very spicy so G's kids could eat The food. If you are a fan of  gajar ka halwa    carrot dessert   then dont forget to add to your meal as they are really good in gajar ka halwa    carrot dessert. If you like punjabi food then also try Rajdhani Sweets's makki roti   corn dough bread saag spinach and mustard puree  with lassi   yogurt drink   on Tuesday . At the end  G will go again only if in the area and will try to have Rajdhani Sweets's Saturday breakfast special.

reviews.text: Rajdhani Sweets is Vani's go to place every weekend. Vani always order Rajdhani Sweets's thali which is   . Vani feel so full after. Vani have not  seen such cheap and yummy food anywhere else in GTA. Rajdhani Sweets's shahi paneer is the best. Vani love Rajdhani Sweets's chana bhatura as well which is   . Vani think. reviews.text: Ritu ordered food for    people but at the last minute had to increase it to    people. There was no issue in getting more food but Ritu just had to wait a little bit while Rajdhani Sweets freshly cooked extra rotis. The kadhi  bhindi  and aloo ghobi were all hot but the rice was room temp when Ritu got the rice home  requiring reheating the rice in batches in the microwave  a bit of a hassle as everyone was hungry . The food was excellent ! Not spicy at all.... but The kadhi  bhindi has way too many onions in The kadhi  bhindi. Ritu did not try the bundi raita as Ritu do not  eat dairy but everyone enjoyed the bundi raita. Ritu also did not  eat the rotis but the rotis were warm and soft and enjoyed by others. The tray of salad also had the pickled carrots in The tray of salad and there was plenty. There was plenty of food except the pakoras in kadhi seemed less. The Gajjar halwa was enjoyed by all but some people said The Gajjar halwa was too sweet. Overall good food  reasonable price and great service.

reviews.text: Very friendly service and great foods. The prices are very cheap for the vast amount and variety of food you are  getting !

reviews.text: Vik have been a regular of Rajdhani Sweets but over last year or so  Vik have seen a decline in the taste and quality of food served here. The prices are very nominal and the quantity is not  bad either. Waiting time over here has always been high just because of number of customers coming here to eat. Food quality has gone from great to pretty mediocre and inconsistent. Vik wish Rajdhani Sweets would shift from using disposable cutlery   spoons forks cups  to actual one. Overall Rajdhani Sweets but really need to tighten Rajdhani Sweets's belts to compete with newer restaurants opening in the area.

reviews.text: Amazing food and always ready for pick up on time. A great spot for vegetarian Indian food to either dine in or for catering services. Totally worth it !

reviews.text: One of the cheapest good quality indian thali available in brampton. Sweets are decent  other snacks are good and reasonably priced too. Not many options in the menu but whatever is available is great for the price.
