reviews.text: Roma came here for a visit today not knowing Rajdhani Sweets is also owned by the same owners of the Etobicoke location http :   www.yelp.ca biz rajdhani - sweets - and - restaurant - etobicoke . While the variety in the meal offering is pretty much the same  all vegetarian   Rajdhani Sweets is much nicer than the other. Presentation is the focus here the service was not as good  but Roma m going to overlook it as it was Diwali and Rajdhani Sweets were inundated with customers. Rajdhani Sweets offer thalis here which are very delicious  though a little rich. The rice was flavoured with raisins and almonds but Roma know Rajdhani Sweets have plain rice as well. Roma had a delicious dish with sliced fresh ginger and mixed vegetables. Rajdhani Sweets is worth a visit for vegetarian lunch or an inexpensive  casual dinner. Roma look forward to a return visit here.

reviews.text: Great tasting vegetarian food prepared from good quality ingredients. Servings are not too generous if you dine in. However Rajdhani Sweets are more generous with the take out orders. Rajdhani Sweets is a bit too crowded and the servers are a bit too rushed in the servers's service. But at least the servers are not rude like some other places Melwyn have been to. For a thriving business such as Rajdhani Sweets Rajdhani Sweets sure need a bigger place or at least a separate lineup for the sweets. Rajdhani Sweets have a great variety of items but most of them come with the same chickpea with gravy called channa. After eating at Rajdhani Sweets do not  miss going next door for some delicious paan.

reviews.text: Was in the neighbourhood and wanted to pick up some food for dinner and Salim have had some of the dishes at one of our friends place. Picked up   Thalis. Lately many restaurants will refuse to combine the   or   dishes that come with the thali. Rajdhani Sweets let us combine the four dishes that Salim wanted  Salim replaced the dessert with an extra dish curry  - most  Indian restaurants will let you do this . Salim picked up a Palak Paneer  Spinach with Cottage Cheese   -  amazing dish a must try  Malai Kofta creamed Paneer ball in a sweet gravy   -  too sweet gravy for some reason. The Chole  chickpea  hit the spot right on. Not too spicy overly seasoned and not greasy as well. And then there was Mushrooms and Paneer not seen in many Punjabi restaurants  but liked by all in the family. The quantity provided was plenty to eat   if Salim had enough naans  which were soft and fluffy. Ordered Rotis as well  but opening of package found that Rotis were griddle rotis and not tandoor oven baked as Rotis are Salim's preferred option. Nevertheless Rotis were perfect. Lots of rice  salad and yogurt raita provided as well. As and extra thinks for appetizers Salim picked a few samosas and Paneer pakoras fritters. All in all a few samosas and Paneer pakoras fritters turned out to be good as well. Only wish that this closer to where Salim live or was in an area Salim frequently visit.

reviews.text: Service is definitely bad. When you go to dine in  no one arrives to give you the menu or take your order. You must go in line and place your order and wait for your number. They forgot to update the order numbers on the screen so many people were confused. Maria ordered two mango shakes and three thalis. Our turn came to pick our food and Maria went. There is no dahi  yogurt  to start off with like at other Indian restaurants. They put the salad  onions  and cucumbers under the rice which makes no sense. The naan came way later and two mango shakes by the time Maria were done our meal. No one informed us that two mango shakes were ready  Maria had to go about four times ourselves. The staff does not  even ask or care. The naan were mostly very crisp and oily  not appealing at all. Most were burnt. The naan had no spices  lacking severe taste. two mango shakes was garbage two mango shakes was just mango juice. The staff does not  even ask if you need anything else. Again  had to ask and find unprofessional foam cups in the corner with some open straws for people to take if they were dining in. reviews.text: Paradise India is a fantastic spot for Indian food because everything is fresh prepared. reviews.text: Johan have  know William the owner for some time now and still find Paradise India to be the best authentic Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. William the owner has a great Vegetarian and Non Vegetarian lunch special  perfectly delicious and at a great price. Johan come here once a week for our Indian treat ! This particular visit instead of a great Vegetarian and Non Vegetarian lunch special  perfectly delicious and at a great price Johan wanted to have the Chicken curry again. However Johan wanted the authentic Indian version  not the Westernized cubed chicken breast version. See Johan grew up true Indian food with close family Indian friends and have come to love the Chicken curry. Johan asked William the owner if William the owner could make the chicken curry this way for Johan  surprised by Johan's request William the owner said this way is  how they have the chicken curry at home and this way is  the true way to prepare the chicken curry  however to make the chicken curry more commercially acceptable they make the chicken curry the chicken curry with chicken breast cubed in Paradise India. William the owner was more than happy to prepare the meal for Johan this way and got right to it  and by the looks of it  happy to accommodate Johan's request  even down to the spice level Johan required. While William the owner was whipping up Johan's special request Johan started with a truly delicious hot and spicy crispy crunchy flaky Samosa filled with a curry potato and pea filling appetizer served with a delicious mint sauce and tamarin sauce. James had a great Vegetarian and Non Vegetarian lunch special  perfectly delicious and at a great price  Chicken Tikka Masala Chicken  Korma served with rice. William the owner brought out Johan's chicken curry and my request was absolutely superb ! this way has so much more flavor ! Johan enjoyed my request so much ! Taking Johan back to Johan's aunty Priscilla chicken table    years back. Only when something is truly authentic will it transport you back in time to a childhood kitchen table where one was enjoying the real deal  and take it from Johan  William the owner Indian cuisine is as real as William  Indian cuisine gets !
reviews.name: Johan

reviews.text: Stopped  here for a quick lunch Chef William is currently    Indian Chef in Las Vegas. This comes from an Indian foodie . The menu is pretty elaborate  with a  range of Indian cuisine across regions  unlike other restaurants which focus on North Indian only. Bhushan had the Masala Dosa truly authentic . Crispy  well - marinated  dosa batter which has a  slight tinge  of butter. Crispy  well - marinated  dosa batter which has a  slight tinge  of butter is how it needs to be and most  in fact   all other restaurants  do not  get this right. the Masala Dosa was perfect took Bhushan's taste buds right to southern India. Bhushan will be back and try their Lamb Biryani which Chef William is so famous for.
reviews.name: Bhushan

reviews.text: Joanna Marie's friends and Joanna Marie decided to try Paradise India on a Tuesday night. It was pretty dead for a Tuesday night with only two other customers on the other side of the restaurant. Our server was pretty nice though. Our server handled our group of   people  orders flawlessly and was constantly checking up on My friends and Joanna Marie. It took a while for My friends and Joanna Marie's food to come out Joanna Marie understand  big order but Our server was letting My friends and Joanna Marie know that Joanna Marie will be served shortly. The food was pretty good. Joanna Marie personally enjoyed the Tandoori Platter that had a bunch of different meats. Joanna Marie like variety and this was a great way to sample the different meats and flavor Paradise India offer. It was Joanna Marie's first time trying a Peshwari Naan. Joanna Marie definitely liked a Peshwari Naan due to a Peshwari Naan's sweeter taste. a Peshwari Naan was a great contrast to most of the dishes Joanna Marie sampled. Overall My friends and Joanna Marie's experience was positive. It was very kind of the chef to give My friends and Joanna Marie free desserts in the end ! Joanna Marie appreciate the hospitality. Joanna Marie do hope Paradise India stays open  though Joanna Marie fear Paradise India might not. The plaza where Paradise India is currently at overall could use more business. Joanna Marie remember going here just to get Bachi but maybe a juice bar would do better here with a gym right next to a juice bar.

reviews.text: Tina placed Tina's order online for carryout  which is through GrubHub. reviews.text: Pati took a chance on going here  as Pati's English husband fancied some Indian food. In the UK  great Indian restaurants are everywhere  while great Indian restaurants are less common in Arizona. Pati were pleasantly surprised. The menu has standard Indian classics  such as biryani and curries of all types  as well as naan and other breads  and is quite tasty. Pati ordered bhajis as a starter  then my English husband had vindaloo and Pati had chicken biryani. The mint and cucumber sauces were yummy  as were our main dishes. India's Flame also has a buffet if you want to try a variety of dishes  which Pati plan to do for lunch one day. Portion sizes are quite good Pati had leftovers to take home. India's Flame is a decent local spot for an evening dinner. Pati were there on a Friday night while India's Flame was not super busy  India's Flame had a good flow of customers and people ordering takeout. India's Flame  still new and Pati do hope people continue to patronize India's Flame and keep India's Flame open. One thing to keep in mind is that India's Flame's heat scale is    -    . That would be Scottsdale    -      as a medium was actually quite mild and a   was less spicy than Pati's husband expected. Not a problem you can just tell your server you like spicy and your server will adjust the heat to your liking. Pati do recommend India's Flame -  Pati want to try India's Flame's tandoori chicken sometime  as well as other dishes.

reviews.text: My husband and Raji like to come here for My husband and Raji's buffet on the weekends after My husband has had a long bike ride My husband  an avid cyclist  and needs to calorie load. The servers are nice  and the place is always clean and well kept. Raji's only suggestion for The servers would be to check in patron  drink status frequently. reviews.text: India's Flame was on my radar ever since Roger was craving Indian food. After hiking South Mountain and walking around the Phoenix Arts Festival my friend and Roger quickly grew for an appetite. Insert India's Flame as India's Flame was a perfect time to subdue my hunger for Indian food. Greeted by Roger believe the owner  son  and quickly was asked if Roger wanted regular or garlic naan bead. Roger love naan bead so Roger chose to be adventurous and had garlic naan bead. garlic naan bead was hot  fresh  and delicious. Now to the buffet of foods. India's Flame serve the most distinguished dishes for India's Flame's patrons to divulge in :  chicken curry  chicken tandori  chicken  and goat marsala my favorite  the goat was not hard or chewy  but fall of the bone tender . Also to add India's Flame serve mango lassi for a perfect touch to your meals. Roger wish India's Flame had better servings or variety of desserts as India's Flame only had rice pudding and fruits to consume. Roger had to ask for the gulab jamun  which the owner  son was friendly enough to give. Overall the experience at India Flame was good enough to warrant another visit. Plus you can not  beat    . for fresh and delicious Indian food !

reviews.text: Went here today for the lunch buffet and was very satisfied ! A basket of either plain or garlic naan is brought to the table with the lunch buffet  and perhaps with a la carte  but -  Russel would not know   and the garlic naan smelled and tasted Great  as well as the food on the lunch buffet. What was a particularly unexpected delight was a dispenser of mango lassi at the lunch buffet -  Russel did not  try mango lassi b c Russel was already Quite Full but Russel certainly will when Russel go back  assuming Russel have mango lassi again. The veg options were fairly standard for a North Indian lunch buffet  -  spinach lentils  vegetable korma rice -  but very good versions. The veg options were very low - spice  with some variation b w options like  -  the spinach was super mild  whereas the korma was just hot enough to leave a pleasant heat at the back of the throat. Russel was also really delighted by the lunch buffet's kheer -  Russel really love kheer but have not  found kheer at most of the other Indian buffets Russel have  checked at around just outside Tempe whereas their kheer had a wonderful texture   a pleasant subtle taste of cardamom. My only kind of weird and very particular complaint is that Russel chose to sit at a table instead of a booth  b c Russel m a small person w a short torso and Russel often find that the distance b w booth seat and table height is uncomfortable for me  but the chairs for the tables were also kind of high. But like  unless you are  also short and weirdly proportioned you will  probably be fine     human bodies vary so much Russel would never hold that against human bodies at all.

reviews.text: One of the best buffets Samuel have  ever had. Each dish was freshly prepared with homemade sauces and fresh ingredients  from the Goat Masala to the Paneer Masala and Palak Paneer. Also  the Naan bread is fresh well seasoned  and perfectly cooked.

reviews.text: Irina drove by   other Indian restaurants today to try India's Flame and were not disappointed. Excellent flavors and great service. reviews.text: Nathan have been to a handful of Indian restaurants in the valley  and so far India's Flame is Nathan's favorite one ! Buffet had a great variety and the spices were just right. Service was quick and extremely friendly  always Johny on the spot to take Nathan's dirty dish or fill Nathan's water cup. They did not  have their alcohol license at the time but now they do ! Will definitely be back for a Taj Mahal to go with the excellent food !

reviews.text: Another Indian restaurant that offers lunch AND dinner buffet ! Karen m in curry heaven ! They offer some flamin  hot deals here for both lunch and dinner which includes mango lassi and chai tea. The buffet had a good variety of items. Some dishes Karen remember at the dinner buffet were goat curry chicken curry  chicken tikka masala palak paneer aloo gobi tandoori chicken  and dal. There  also an area with salad  soup and what appeared to be some chaat. For dessert there was kheer  mango pudding  and carrot halwa. You will also get freshly baked naan brought to your table  your choice of garlic or plain. Karen got the garlic naan and the garlic naan was tasty ! the garlic naan went well with the other The buffet items. mango lassi was a nice balance of creamy and tangy flavors. As for the spice level you wo not  need to channel Johnny Storm to Flame On  for the dishes at The buffet ranged from mild to maybe medium. The decor is quite an improvement over the last business here which was Pitalicious. It looks like they have  done quite a bit of remodeling to turn this space into a beautifully designed spot. Service was warm and friendly. The buffet wo not  be burning any holes in your pocket  for the lunch price is   . and dinner will run you    .  .
reviews.name: Karen

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food ! The  Butter Chicken  was incredible. Marshall had the  curry chicken    tiki - masala  and  butter chicken  all fantastic. Great atmosphere and helpful staff . Do not  forget to order the garlic nan bread !

Venkesh tried guys's goat biriyani in Santa Clara  Fremont and Artesia CA... so let Venkesh highlight why this biryani was a let down.... there was hardly any meat ! Dum biriyani is known for meat.. guys included more rice to fill the void ! Less meat and masala this biryani hardly tastes like one. Venkesh hope guys improve and maintain the consistency of guys's other locations Good luck guys do not  let Venkesh down the next time on meat !

reviews.text: Let me start by saying how excited Pratishruti was when Pratishruti heard that Paradise Biryani Pointe had come to Paradise Biryani Pointe. Pratishruti drove a good    minutes from Scottsdale just to get a taste of Pratishruti's favorite biryani. The Dum Biryani is something that Paradise Biryani Pointe always gets right but compared to the others in California especially Santa Clara my favorite biryani is a let down. my favorite biryani tastes nothing like the biryani one expects from a chain like Paradise Biryani Pointe  no fried onions and the flavor of the rice was just average .The Spice level Pratishruti asked for was Medium but my favorite biryani was too hot to handle. The raita and mirchi ka salan were fine. This is not the quality one expects from Paradise Biryani Pointe my favorite biryani tasted like something you would get at an average Indian restaurant. Definitely not worth the Drive or the Hype. Cheers !

reviews.text: This review is hoping that you will improve with respect to quality and do not play with customers health. Last Saturday Chakradhar ordered Goat dum Biryani  chicken    and naan. Biryani and Chicken    definitely not cooked on Last Saturday. It felt so dry and Biryani and Chicken taste like they just got it out of refrigerator and warmed it up. Only the naan and kadai paneer curry somewhat better. It  so stupid to spend     on this. And the worst part is serving this food to guests who arrived on that night. All the food is in trash. reviews.text: Nice Indian authentic taste. Affordable prices ! Jagan usually take biryani to go and order biryani in bulk in weekend gatherings and occasions. Biryani has never failed in taste and South Indian authenticity except in few cases when Biryani initially started business at Paradise Biryani Pointe. Jagan heard about new entries in Paradise Biryani Pointe's menu and wanted to try. Jagan revisited to try Maharaja Bhojanam. Maharaja Bhojanam has got a Thali with veg non veg curries and fries with one roti accommodated along with white rice and biryani. Also  came with a spicy papad and a desert. Apart from all this tasty stuff  treated with a freshly made sweet paan which Jagan liked the most and bought   of them for Jagan's family. Got a glass of butter milk with sides like yogurt and dal. It is hard to get this kind of treatment and Jagan think this kind of treatment beats the price  taste and quantity against a buffet as long as Paradise Biryani Pointe maintains and keeps this bundle always. Keep it up  Paradise Biryani Pointe !
reviews.name: Jagan

reviews.text: Probably the longest Uday have waited for a to - go. mins and counting.. They better make the greatest biryani ever in the world.

reviews.text: Great service for sure ! The food is good  but do not  order hot unless you can handle eating a jalapeno raw... whew ! Food came out really quick and is super fresh -  - a certain plus. Lucky had the butter chicken which was delicious so Lucky heartily recommend it. Also had a chicken biryani which was good -  - and Lucky did notice that the native S. Indian types eating there ordered a chicken biryani which was good  too  so a chicken biryani which was good must be the common dinner food in India. a chicken biryani which was good was good  but Lucky was to be mild but tasted medium. The dosa Lucky ordered was really good. Looks like a huge pizza crepe with spinach and potato in The dosa Lucky ordered and   different sauces to dip The dosa Lucky ordered in. Lucky liked Paradise Biryani Pointe. The food was good the service was  too. Lucky will  be back ! P.S. You know Paradise Biryani Pointe is good if you are the only White people in there and the rest are natives of the rest's country  area.
reviews.name: Lucky

reviews.text: The Biriyani was good and the chicken   .The only place where which provides a whole boiled egg in biriyani

reviews.text: This is the best Indian food Jessie have had in North America and quite possibly outside of India. When you walk into Le Tandoor the sweet scent of curry and cardomon flirts with your senses. Abdul was Jessie's waiter and was very attentive. Abdul  Jessie ordered chicken tikka  comes with a small salad  and onion bahji  a personal fav  for appetizers; chicken korma  garlic naan and basmati rice for the main course. Wow ! Jessie have never been able to find a korma that comes this close to what Jessie had in India. Presentation was different but the flavour was bang on. Jessie was so happy with Jessie's choice of restaurants  so many to pick from. Le Tandoor was just on the other side of the mall from Jessie's hotel so a quick walk from the quality inn. Jessie will make every effort to stay here again just for another dinner like that ! Oh and Jessie also had the mango Lassi  delicious. Jessie felt the price was fair given the portion sizes. Jessie was unable to eat all of the mango Lassi  delicious and was delighted to be able to take some home with Jessie !
reviews.name: Jessie

reviews.text: Yi used to come here for Le Tandoor's decent food for brossard standard  but the service is so bad that Yi cannot recommand Le Tandoor anymore. The waiters are slow and unprofessional. Yi flagged one down from the cash registered he just nodded at us then went to the kitchen  returns at the cash and answers the phone that just rang ! Totally ignored us ! Will not be returning.
reviews.name: Yi

reviews.text: Amazing food by Le Tandoor. Amazing food by this charming family - run restaurant is about as good as it gets for indian food on the south shore and even stacks up against similar offerings on - island. The service can be atrociously slow and somewhat cold but really The service is  kind of what makes the experience. It  the Seifeld soup - kitchen of montreal indian food : You despise going and waiting every time because you are  slightly fearful of some of the staff but once the food arrives the food warms your soul. DO NOT  come here if you want quick - indian. Waiting for the food on an empty stomach is one of the sickest intellectual see - saw mind games any man can put any man through :  one of the sickest intellectual see - saw mind games any man can put themselves through  a sick game between the compounding desire to scream in a fit of hunger - fueled rage and the cultural norm of sitting quietly hunched - over with your arms tightly folded across your stomach in some sort of cro - magnon survival tactic. Either way Amazing food by this charming family - run restaurant is excellent and Alexander highly recommend the saag paneer and chicken tikka. - Reserve on fridays and saturdays as they fill up fast.
reviews.name: Alexander

reviews.text: Savoureux. Petit resto. Service m dium.
reviews.name: Marie-Eve

reviews.text: Being of Indian origin  having grown up on Indian food  and since Sharm have  frequented my fair share of Indian restaurants in and around Montreal  Sharm would  say Sharm m in a position to judge Indian food from an informed standpoint. In my opinion  Le Tandoor offers delicious Indian food. Apart from the food the service is absolutely outstanding. The delightful people who work here will treat you like a guest of honor.
reviews.name: Sharm

reviews.text: Have stopped eating here as service and food has gone downhill. Orders often missing a dish and seem that pushing alcohol is main aim.

reviews.text: Every once in a while Amanda get flashbacks of the takeout Amanda had from Le Tandoor. Amanda m not sure if it was because the food was exceptional or because Amanda have not  had Indian in awhile but regardless  the takeout Amanda had from Tandoor must be a good thing. One weekday lunch while in the area Amanda stopped in to get a takeout thali plate  as a way to try out Le Tandoor. The staff were pleasant  and the food tasty so Amanda will  definitely be back to try eating in sometime.
reviews.name: Amanda

reviews.text: Norine ordered take out from Le Tandoor. Norine waited in the dining space as they prepared Norine's order. Le Tandoor was clean and pretty busy with locals. Norine got Norine's order pretty quickly. Packaging was great -  they put Norine's food in styrofoam containers and then in a box to ensure nothing falls. Quality of food was poor : samosa chaat -     was just   broken samosas with sprinkled salad and yogurt on the side Shahi paneer      -     Shahi paneer more looked like a tomato soup  fairly small amount of food paneer was too crumbly the sauce was made of corn starch instead of a creamy sauce; the regular naan        way too small; the salad which is so basic was the only good thing about this meal. For a quick Indian fix Norine would not  even go here.
reviews.name: Norine

reviews.text: Sonia ordered take out... it took two hours before Sonia realized it was not  going to be delivered. Asked for a refund. Owner gave us a hard time for a refund. Terrible
reviews.name: Sonia

reviews.text: This review is for Le Tandoor's take - out service. Maximilian came one day for take - out. As Maximilian entered  there were a few employees near the cash register. Maximilian came up to one of a few employees near the cash register and asked if Le Tandoor offered take - out. Maximilian got a very rude glance as if Maximilian had interrupted a few employees near the cash register's conversation. The man  perhaps the owner  gave Maximilian a very long and roundabout answer but basically yes Le Tandoor do offer take - out. It seemed as if Le Tandoor did not want Maximilian's business. When Maximilian asked how much time it was going to take if Maximilian were to order butter chicken       and naan bread The man paused and thought for a while  and then answered   It  going to take at least    minutes  as if to dissuade Maximilian from ordering. At this point  Maximilian was already there  so Maximilian decided to just go ahead and order  as    minutes was not  going to kill Maximilian. Finally  the order literally took   minutes  not    ! When Maximilian left  Maximilian realized the lid of the meal was not sealed properly and Maximilian's bag was leaking  and there were no utensils. As much as Maximilian love Indian food  Maximilian will not be going back.
reviews.name: Maximilian

reviews.text: Excellent food and the staff is really nice ! The portions are very big. The lunch special is     tips and taxes included and is delicious  and super filling !  !  ! Would go back there anytime
reviews.name: Reetu

reviews.text: Summary : The service here was very attentive Sophie felt like The service here were doing The service here's utmost to make sure Sophie had a wonderful and memorable experience. The food was absolutely delicious  and those portion sizes were perfect for sharing. Fantastic way to spend an evening eating great food as a group. Long Version : Sophie were a party of   the evening that Sophie went to Le Tandoor for dinner. The service here was very accommodating and offered Sophie a proposal that was not  already present on the menu  since it seemed that many of Sophie simply could not  this plight what Sophie would  like from the plethora of delicious sounding options on the menu. As someone who enjoys sampling a wide variety of dishes The service here's solution to this plight seemed perfect. The came out with such a wide variety of things to try. Crisp and plump samosas  savoury onion bhadgi tender chicken tikka  steaming and tart mixed veg steaming basmati AMAZING naan still sizzling chicken tikka masala  and let  not forget creamy butter chicken  among other things. The server was even kind enough to dish out the sizzling hot chicken tikka masala The server to avoid having Sophie pass around a really hot dish  thus avoiding a potential disaster : p . The thing that really got me though was when Sophie spotted chicken dopiaza on the menu  something Sophie find so rarely in Indian restaurants !  . Upon mentioning my excitement The server promised The server would work chicken dopiaza into the mix. It did not disappoint. If you are  an onion fan do not  miss chicken dopiaza ! All in all  wonderful service magnificent food did not  have a single thing Sophie did not  love ! and would definitely visit again. It  a bit far from where Sophie live... but something tells me Sophie will  be making the trip ;
reviews.name: Sophie

reviews.text: Notre restaurant indien favori depuis   ans ! La qualit est constante et la propri taire toujours chaleureuse. Je le recommande fortement.
reviews.name: Thierry

restaurants.name: Wong's Asian Cuisine
restaurants.category: Hakka, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Chinese, Indian

reviews.text: Amazing food. Very reasonable priced and hearty portions. Ordered sweet corn soup  chicken pakoda chilly chicken  chilly garlic chicken and chicken fried rice  everything thing was prepared very well. The icing on the entire experience was the warm and attentive service. Will definitely be Ruchika's go Hakka place in the future. Recommend     .
reviews.name: Ruchika

reviews.text: It is extremely difficult not to give Wong's  Asian Cuisine   stars  and here are the reasons  :      Portion  -  gigantic is the right description. Allison ordered a Manchurian Beef Noodle      for take out. a Manchurian Beef Noodle filled   boxes. My BF and Allison could only finish   of boxes together. Price -  Very affordable. for a Manchurian Beef Chicken Noodle. for a Chicken Pakora. There were about    pieces of pakora  see picture . Each piece was the size of a golf ball. Lunch special is    per item  available Monday to Friday. Services  -  The waitress was fast  effective and friendly. The waitress gave us extra napkins per request. Like   extra thick napkins. It was pretty generous. Cleanliness -  the exterior of the store looked divey. The interior looked nothing special. The washroom  ladies  was  surprise surprise  very clean and tidy. Yes the bathroom amenities were no frills and basic but it was CLEAN as in no dust no spot or mark no mess on floor. Allison wo not  say completely dust free but it beat the cleanliness level of many expensive restaurants. And there was hot water hand soap  paper towels. Allison was impressed. Someone cared about washroom here. Food  -  Allison am no authority of Indian Chinese food. Did the food taste the way the food was supposed to taste like   No clue. Allison could tell you everything tasted bold. There were strong spices flavours. The pakoras were delicious. The noodle was average :  mostly noodle  little beef  orange in colour. The noodle was noted as non - spicy on menu. The noodle was actually mildly spicy. Food was made to order. Food came out of kitchen piping hot. The food rating is   stars in truth. Allison round The food rating up to   stars  because the first   aspects are not just good  but extremely strong.
reviews.name: Allison

reviews.text: Tried their lunch special  Kung Pao Chicken with steamed rice and hot   sour soup. Nothing amazing to be honest  - hot   sour soup was missing egg and had an off taste and egg roll had definitely been sitting out so egg roll was pretty stale. However their lunch special  Kung Pao Chicken with steamed rice and hot   sour soup was good. They have a great selection of lunch special
reviews.name: Shefali

reviews.text: Wong's is one of the best Hakka restaurants Colleen have  been to. The portions are huge and The portions's prices are really cheap. For a little over      Colleen got    huge fried wontons chili chicken  white rice and the manchurian beef noodles  and Colleen had a lot of leftovers to take home. The owner and staff are also really friendly and go out of The owner and staff's way to ensure that you have a good experience.
reviews.name: Colleen

reviews.text: Outstanding value  portion sizes  service and great quality food. High Sticks would have never thought of going to Wong's  ever. The plaza is sketch the location sucks  but wow. The food and service were fantastic. Well worth a visit if you are  ever in the area.
reviews.name: High Sticks

reviews.text: Boom ! New fave Hakka joint ! Bombay chicken was amaaazing ! Definitely the single best dish James have had at any of the Hakka restaurants in the Toronto area. Bombay chicken looks and tastes way better than the pictures suggest  the pics do not do the food justice Bombay chicken was really really great. The only reason New fave Hakka joint is  not five star is that the portions are good but not huge  spice level is medium - low  and James still have a nostalgic affection and preference for Federicks fiery chicken pakora  but the food here was truly great and definitely worth a try  despite the shady location in a divey plaza. If you find yourself near Birchmount and Lawrence  hit New fave Hakka joint up  and make sure to try Bombay chicken !
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Had the shrimp pakora   chilli garlic beef and the eggplant. This is by far the best hakka food Allister have  had. Everything was amazing but Allister especially liked the shrimp pakoras. It was like eating tandoori flavoured popcorn shrimp.
reviews.name: Allister

reviews.text: When Andrew walked into Wong's Asian Cuisine  there was only   free table in Wong's Asian Cuisine. The table immediately next to only   free table in the restaurant  had customers with customers with their bare naked feet propped up onto the table and chairs's bare naked feet propped up onto the table and chairs ! The waiters and staff did not  even say anything about it  and in fact  made us look like the weird ones for thinking  that Wong's Asian Cuisine is  both disgusting and unhygienic. Needless to say  Andrew immediately headed for the door  and Andrew wo not  be coming back.
reviews.name: Andrew

reviews.text: Came back here today for lunch. James ordered ginger beef beef fried rice and wonton soup. Big portion  good taste and friendly service. The server catered to James's request to put Chinese broccoli instead of green onion in the ginger beef dish. Only wish they turned up the heat as the restaurant felt like an ice box today. Other than that  no complaints. Still a good place to get Hakka food.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: GREAT Hakka Chinese food ! Sajan have  been many in GTA most of them do not  even come close to Wong's . Sajan got Chicken Pakora  Chilli Chicken gravy   and Spicy Cumin Beef dry . Sajan would re - order the exact same order again and more next time Chicken Pakora  Chilli Chicken gravy   and Spicy Cumin Beef dry were all really good. Spicy Cumin Beef definitely stood out  cumin flavor comes through but well balanced with the spices. Service is very friendly they know what they are serving and Sajan got exactly what Sajan was told. The place was not  busy at all it has only been a couple of years since they have opened up shop  so solid recommend to anyone looking for Hakka Chinese Food !
reviews.name: Sajan

reviews.text: What a nice find in Scarborough. Located at the SE plaza at Birchmount and Lawrence  Wong's Asian Cuisine serves great Hakka food and the price is more than reasonable. Lunch special comes with pop or soup. Wong's Asian Cuisine has very nice decor as well  with friendly service. The lady was really attentive and helpful. James ordered James's sweet and sour chicken special and their sweet and sour chicken special came pretty quick. James am not an expert in Hakka food but chicken was quite tender and the sauce was delicious. Next time James would like to try some items on Wong's Asian Cuisine's dinner menu.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Came here with a friend who frequents Wong's and Suzi were pleasantly surprised. Wong's  hidden in a small strip mall sandwiched beside a few other restaurants and is really clean. The owners were really friendly and helped us pick out our dinner. Chicken pakoras with coriander sauce were so tasty ! The owners also gave us masala flavoured fries -  which is not  on the menu and you would  think would be weird to order but they were perfect and crunchy and delish ! Suzi ordered dry chili shrimp  perfect spice ! ginger chicken  beef and broccoli and green beans. All came with a bowl of rice as well. Really big portions and for three of us Suzi could barely finish and took food home. Our meal came to under     ! Suzi will be back because Suzi m curious to try more of the menu !
reviews.name: Suzi

reviews.text: Wong's  is hubby and Colanie's new go to Hakka place ! Went to Spicy Dragon for lunch but Spicy Dragon were packed  so turned to trusty Yelp for some help. Looking for some affordable lunch specials and Wong's  came up with a  . Yes it is  in a small divey strip mall but the minute you walk in the door you will  be glad you braved the panhandlers  there was only one actually but it did not  sound as good without the  s  . Nice clean restaurant with lots of available tables  a strong aircon and free WiFi. Colanie was enamored by their delicate cork art  see pics ; the detail was so beautiful. The bubbly hostess was also our server. The bubbly hostess was the sweetest thing :  always smiling and helpful. With The bubbly hostess's detailed descriptions Colanie decided on.... -  Hot   sour soup with shrimp -  should have gotten chicken because the shrimp were tiny and Colanie did not  like the taste of the shrimp; however Hot   sour soup with shrimp was spicy and flavourful and left a strong afterburn. -  Lung Fung soup  -  if you like egg drop soup you will  like this. Chock - full of veggies  tofu and chicken. -  Chicken Pakora  -  crispy and flavorful on the outside  tender and juicy on the inside. -  Chili Fish  dry  lunch special which comes with a tiny egg roll  bleh rice and soup pop. It was flavorful and the fish was moist. Did not  see any dessert on the menu so Colanie asked The bubbly hostess about any dessert; The bubbly hostess must have notice Colanie's sad face and went to talk to the chef  who happens to be The bubbly hostess's hubby . The bubbly hostess came back and said that the chef  who happens to be her hubby could make us a deep fried pineapple dessert with vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup OH YEAH ! Tried vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup and Colanie did not  like the taste of vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup;  but when Colanie paired vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup with the warm deep fried pineapple and vanilla ice cream drizzled with maple syrup it was delish ! With lunch menu prices at   . nice ambiance  inside   and exemplary service ; Wong's  blew Spicy Dragon out of the water ! It was nice knowing Colanie SD.
reviews.name: Colanie

reviews.text: Bro and Neil had vegetables fried rice manchurian mix chow mein  chilli chicken with extra gravy and all extra spicy .. food was so good .. gotta comeback soon
reviews.name: Neil

reviews.text: first time at Wong's  Wong's Asian Cuisine  Wong's Asian Cuisine is Hakka - Chinese cuisine. Good prices for lunch specials. Marc ordered Shrimp and Lobster sauce  +  rice w soup lunch special and Chicken with Black Bean sauce  +  rice w pop. Condiments were simple  was hoping for chinese vinegar  but not available. Wife had hot and sour soup with Wife's lunch combo  only   type of soup offered the soup was too spicy for Wife and for me as well  Marc ended up not finishing the soup. Shrimp and Lobster sauce  +  rice w soup lunch special was a bit more salty than Marc normally like. Marc just barely finished our respective lunch dishes  was almost too much for us. At the time of our visit only   staff member was managing the dining room  service was kinda average. There are more dishes Marc are curious on tasting so likely will return again. They do accept cash debit  not certain on Credit cards.
reviews.name: Marc

reviews.text: Man o man Wong's is a winner across the board. The owners are absolutely fantastic and so is The owners's cooking. Kris had the chili beef  gravy and Kris's date had the chili paneer as my date is a vegetarian. Each dish cost under     and the portions were very large and delicious. Added a couple of veggie spring rolls and the wonton chicken soup also huge  cheap  and delicious . Kris honestly liked the wonton chicken soup so much Kris ordered a plate of curry beef to go curry beef also is amazing . Just really flavourful without the typical greasy feel. What a winner. The owners were super friendly and engaging and Kris will definitely be back here as this is the best Hakka Kris have  personally had in Toronto so far.
reviews.name: Kris

reviews.text: First time at Wong's  and Chryssy was not disappointed ! The exterior scared Chryssy a little with some guy outside selling Chryssy a video camera but it did not  stop Chryssy from checking out Wong's. Upon entering  Chryssy was welcomed with a nice smile from the waitress. Chryssy got the following :    . Chicken pakora  -        spicier the better    . Chilli paneer  -   . should get Chilli paneer with gravy   . Manchuria Beef fried rice  -   . Overall experience  = The chefs children were around doing The chefs children's homework so you can tell Wong's is  a family run business. Chryssy love Hakka food and Chryssy told the waitress if the waitress can make Chryssy's chicken pakora  less  spicy. Low and behold  the waitress did ! my chicken pakora was the perfect spice for Chryssy. People know Chryssy love Chryssy's vinegar so when Chryssy asked the waitress for  regular vinegar the waitress did not  even hesitate and gave Chryssy one. That  good service right there !
reviews.name: Chryssy

reviews.text: Sharlene's favourite place for super spicy Hakka food. Dishes are not  normally made to be very spicy  but they will make Dishes exactly how you want Dishes. The owners and staff here do a great job. The owners and staff here are  all very kind and make sure The owners and staff here feed you like you are  family.
reviews.name: Sharlene

reviews.text: First time having Hakka Chinese food. The flavors were good. Had chili chicken and Manchurian noodles. Would recommend chili chicken and Manchurian noodles.
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Karen ordered take out based on the   star reviews Karen have  read. Karen think it was good  not necessarily the best Karen have  ever had though. Fried mixed Hakka noodles with chicken and shrimp was slightly burnt. That was unfortunate. The portion was quite hefty. What else did Karen try   Paneer pakoras. Small but pretty tasty. Maybe a bit on the dry side. Much better with the green dipping sauce. A saucy beef good   a sweet and spicy shrimp Karen liked a sweet and spicy shrimp a lot   and Chili chicken  nice and spicy !  . The prices were very reasonable. Karen thought rice was usually included at Hakka restaurants but Karen was asked if Karen wanted some. Maybe it is  a way to save the resto some money The rice was slightly undercooked to be honest. Karen were happy with our meal but Karen will continue to search for the best Hakka food in Scarborough !
reviews.name: Karen

reviews.text: Glad to have found Wong's Asian Cuisine ! Kira ordered lots of delicious food :  hits included the Manchurian Veggie Fried Rice Singapore Style Vermicelli Chow Mein  Bombay Chicken  and Spicy Garlic Chicken. The Tom Yum Shrimp Soup Kira ordered was somewhat underwhelming so Kira will probably try a different soup next time. Kira think things could have been a little spicier as well  but condiments at the table helped with that. Wong's Asian Cuisine is small and not super fancy  but clean and well - kept. The service is excellent  -  -  the waitstaff helped us prevent over - ordering and frequently checked in. Ca not  wait to try Wong's Asian Cuisine again !
reviews.name: Kira

reviews.text: Paul went there the other day and order their lunch special     : am -   : pm . Paul had the Mixed Vegetables Chicken. the Mixed Vegetables Chicken was so good that Paul went back the day after for dinner and order Beef Cantonese Fried Noodles. Both were very flavourable  tasty and delicious. Paul strongly recommend Wong's Asian Cuisine. Friendly staff and accommodating to your taste. Paul will definitely go back.
reviews.name: Paul

reviews.text: Good Hakka food great lunch prices  excellent service in a small restaurant. What Sam Got :  Chicken Pakora Fish Pakora  Bombay Chicken Chili Fish What Sam Liked :  Bombay Chicken is definitely worth trying. Pakora was delicious What Sam Did not  :  Chicken Pakora was only alright What Sam will  Get Next :  Bombay Chicken and crispy beef a small restaurant is a highlight in an otherwise drabby - looking plaza. The interior looks great and the service is simply outstanding by any standards. On a weekend evening  there was a steady flow of people for takeout and dine in  which made the service even more impressive ! Sam ordered two pakora dishes  chicken and veggie  and two meat dishes  Chili Fish and Bombay Chicken . Pakora came first. Sam will  be honest : chicken was good but not great. chicken missing some kick and Sam think the crunch factor could be higher. HOWEVER... Pakora made up for it :  very tasty and one of the few dishes where Sam would  opt for the non - meat item ! Chili Fish was good  with a very optimal amount of spice for someone who can handle moderate amounts. But the star of the show is Bombay Chicken. Sam think Bombay Chicken is  the preeminent dish to figure out if you like subtle tastes. Bombay Chicken  different from Federick  and Hakka Legend with some savoury flavours that just bring out a special something. Worth trying. Sam got to pretend to be a serious food connoisseur by trying to figure out all the spices and seasonings they used here ! The only downside of a small restaurant is a bit beyond their control. Lots of places have downstairs basement washrooms... But this one was particularly ragged. Clean  for sure  -  but a little old looking. Empty your bladder before you come !
reviews.name: Sam

reviews.text: Phillip did not  know there was a Hakka restaurant in this part of town  especially in this plaza. Thanks to Phillip's dad who seems to know almost every Hakka place in the city and somehow knows the chief Phillip decided to try Wong's  Asian Cuisine. The interior of this place is spacious though from the outside this place seems small. What makes this place good is the quality of the food  price and portion. As a first - timer here  this place's customer service was superb and even the owners were quite interactive with the regulars and new customers. For food below are the recommendation if coming here. Fish pakora Chicken pakora Crispy beef Chili chicken Manchurian eggplant Green beans Beef with red wine sauce Sweet chicken haka noodles
reviews.name: Phillip

reviews.text: This has been my go to Hakka joint lately. Grill have not  had a dish Grill did not  like. The service has always been top notch and the chef and owner adds a personal touch with the chef and owner's approach to customer service. The prices are super legit too.
reviews.name: Grill

reviews.text: Second time Deb have  been here. Deb learned from our last visit. Ask them to keep the flavors vibrant if you can handle chili and spicy. this gem is Indian Hakka - Chinese food. Sister and brother run this gem. Deb had :   Hot and sour soup very spicy  upon request ; Coriander and manchurian chicken  with dry masalas not fried upon request; Szechuan mixed vegetables very spicy upon request. THIS WAS EXCEPTIONAL. India meets China in a dish and each mouthful is paradise. Kind and gentle people who own this business. Warm environment. Love.
reviews.name: Deb

reviews.text: Extremely reasonable price - point. Nice owners staff. Welcoming staff  and chef  who interact with Welcoming staff  and chef  who interact with their customers's customers. Friendly vibe. The food : Bombay Chicken  -  very tasty  but could have been spicier. Having said that  the flavours were beautiful. Manchurian Vegetable Spicy Soup  -  LOVELY. Light fresh  lots of coriander and a good punch of flavour. Hakka mixed noodles  -  nice  decent amount of seafood and chicken but again  could have been spicier.   . Singapore noodles : spicy and delectable  -  special Hakka - style Singapore noodles were amazing. Overall this is a good place. If they just raised the notch a level or two up for us re :  spiciness it would get five stars. Again  very pleasant dining atmosphere  overall good vibe.
reviews.name: Deb

reviews.text: Chris took Chris's dad here for my dad's birthday last night and Chris will definitely be coming back. The food was great and the service was amazing !
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Went there Saturday night after seeing the super high yelp and Google rating for dinner and ordered the thai soup  fish pakora  chilli beef and sechuwan fried rice. Pros : .Food ordered was sufficient for   people and maybe then some so the quantity provided was quite generous.  . Even with two servers on the floor and being busy during the night  the food came relatively quickly. Cons :   . Food was flavorless. One person in Assif's party barely touched One person in my party's food after trying one bite. Assif tried to power through a little bit but gave up and left super bummed out. Assif think the problem is none of the dishes were salted properly so while the ingredients were there  nothing gelled together to make anything that was tasty. Closest Assif can think of was if you had the flu and you tried to eat something but could not  taste anything. The fish pakora was also under - cooked. There are better Hakka chinese options available around the Danforth area and this was seriously underwhelming.
reviews.name: Assif

reviews.text: Ok so James returned  a bit worried that maybe James got lucky the first time and or that James's first ever visit caused James to be a little more enthusiastic than Wong's really deserved at   stars. But NOPE ! This time was even BETTER ! The first time James visited the chicken pakoras were very good  but did not  quite Blow James Away  when compared to James's favorite chicken pakoras  the huge portion of big fiery ones from Federick so This time James went for the shrimp pakora instead and Holy Crustacean Batman the shrimp pakora are delicious ! Great big bouncy shrimp inside  crispy on the outside  super silky and tender inside  and a killer cilantro nuoc cham type of dipping sauce  and the shrimp pakora just put the shrimp pakora over the top. Plus hard as it was to believe  James enjoyed the Bombay chicken even MORE This time than James did last time  with the Bombay chicken's super tender juicy hunks of chicken with a delicious and flavorful  bright red tandoori tikka type of marinade  but dry style  sauceless and absolutely freaking delicious ! James m hoping to try some other menu items  but James quite honestly can not  imagine going there and not having the Bombay chicken and the shrimp pakora  obviously James m going to have to bring some friends so James get to try some other dishes  LOL  James do not  give up   Stars very often but Wong's  the Bombay chicken Chicken and shrimp pakora do not  leave a lot of room for improvement  -  really good food  and the woman working the bar takeout counter was super friendly  quick  and very nice. Stars ! Keep up the good work !
reviews.name: James

reviews.text: Wong's  is a hidden gem in Scarborough. Kristian was one that never really liked spicy food but Wong's  opened up Kristian's taste buds to the world of spice ! If you like getting spicy grub then you should definitely try out Wong's's Manchurian rice noodles and Wong's's Chili Fish. When Wong's ask if you want it dry or with gravy Kristian suggest getting dry. Gravy  means saucy and Kristian got the full extent of the flavour when Kristian got Gravy dry anyway. The Crispy Sesame Beef that Wong's serve is to die for ! PS. Wong's do delivery if you live close to the restaurant. Service by the family that owns the restaurant is stellar !
reviews.name: Kristian

restaurants.name: New India Gate
restaurants.category: Restaurants, Nightlife, Vegan, Beer Bar, Halal, Buffets, Indian, Bars

reviews.text: Better meat than most buffets Steven have  had in the valley. New India Gate  but the owners were previously owners of a different restaurant that was sold so seem to have the mixture and admin down right. Very nice people and good service. Steven's favorite on the buffet was the goat -  -  - which is usually difficult to find. the owners did a good job and did not  skimp on the meat.

reviews.text: Yelp once again lead us to this great Indian food restaurant. The people who served us worked as a team; The people who served us were very welcoming and friendly. Our Food was delicious  chicken tiki masala and shrimp korma which can both be made with coconut milk to avoid the dairy. Our waiters kept bringing water and it did not   take long at all for any of the food. It was a great dining experience and the food could not  have been better. Try this great Indian food restaurant once and like us you are  going to want to go back.

reviews.text: First time eating here with a girlfriend and Puppy are  both hooked ! Came for dinner and since there is no dinner buffet Puppy tried a couple things off the menu. Puppy will say everything was awesome  and their tandoori chicken was especially amazing. Super sweet and attentive service. Awesome experience  and Puppy honestly might do a takeout order asap because Puppy m craving it already.

reviews.text: A nice little place run by two brothers with hospitality unlike any other Indian place  : Restaurant is very clean  lighting is just perfect and food is delicious. A very welcome addition to the Chandler food scene.

reviews.text: New India Gate  buffet offers a variety of dishes for a very reasonable price -  - perfect for anyone who wants to sample a bit of everything. Yvonne have little authority on Indian food  but in my opinion all the dishes were fantastic. My only complaint  is that Yvonne wish it was slightly spicier. Very friendly service and complimentary Chai tea.

reviews.text: Today my wife and Ravi visited New India Gate to try the food as Ravi have an upcoming party. Ravi were looking for a new Indian place to serve yummy food for our guests  expecting about     -     people . my wife and Ravi's experience Today was awful !  !  !  ! The food was terrible. The chicken tandoori was raw  the chicken dum biryani the chicken dum biryani is not even called a biryani curries had no flavor the desserts were not good the fruits in the mango custard were not fresh  the carrot halwa Ravi do not  want to call the carrot halwa a Halwa. Very bad !  !  !   . It  good that Ravi have tried the food before ordering for our party. Ravi have ordered at  Kabab palace    Pastries N chaat  and  Chennai Fusion Grill  for our previous parties and the food was never a fail. Ravi love those places. This time Ravi just thought Ravi will try something new but Ravi absolutely regret going to New India Gate. Ravi will never recommend New India Gate to anyone  friends  family and colleagues . Finally  decided to go back to our old favorite spots.

reviews.text: Awesome place ! Very authentic ! If you like it spicy ask for Fire    . Family owned  service is outstanding

reviews.text: Melanie have been to New India Gate multiple times and each experience was wonderful. The food is delicious and the staff is friendly. The chicken tikka masala is easily the best Melanie have ever had  and it is  great to see goat and lamb options. Melanie will be back over and over again !

reviews.text: Went back today for another excellent lunch ! The staff could not be any friendlier  and its such   a bargain for great food that T wish The staff would move to Maricopa ! Outstanding dishes today were :  Keema Matter Ground Beef w Green Peas   Chicken Tikka Masala Tandoori Chicken  Veg. Biryani  and Garlic Naan

reviews.text: The food and service here is excellent. Ted have eaten here   times and not disappointed. Love the chicken Tika masala and korma. Restaurant itself is   star food and service has been  . .

reviews.text: This by far is the best Indian food Jessica have had here in the valley !  !  ! Even better the service was amazing. My fianc  and Jessica came to try the service but did not  feel up to a sit down meal. Jessica sat at the car for a glass of wine while they prepared the food. The bartender was super friendly and engaged in great conversation. They brought us samples of custard and fruit dishes while Jessica waited. Jessica will definitely be back for the food and for Gopi. It was great talking with the staff there !

reviews.text: Amazing indian food. Kristen originally came in for the lunch buffet  and after that  decided Kristen wanted to have dinner there the very same night ! All of the food was very fresh extremely tasty  and well prepared. The staff was super friendly and even let us try a sample of a delicious drink ! All around excelent place to eat in the area.

reviews.text: Service was amazing !  ! Maren came shortly before time for the buffet to close and they invited Maren in anyway. Everyone was nice and attentive. Maren was trying to rush  Maren came about   min before the buffet was set to close and they told Maren to take Maren's time and enjoy. The food was very authentic ! The best Indian buffet and top   restaurant Maren have  been to in the valley. The food was delicious ! Maren will  be a regular here going forward ! Maren recommend The best Indian buffet and top   restaurant Maren have  been to in the valley. to anyone looking for Delish and authentic food and impressive service !

reviews.text: First off  the food was amazing ! Secondly  the family that owns New India Gate is so kind and open. Alison felt at home the second Alison sat down.

reviews.text: Great price for the variety of buffet selection ! Customer service was excellent. One of the brothers took One of the brothers's time to explain what is  in the dish and how to eat the dish ! Food selection was wonderful with an equal mix of vegetarian and meat selections ! The food was perfect for the price ! Enjoyed both the food and the service ! Definitely coming back again !
reviews.name: Milly

reviews.text: Chris just tried New India Gate. The staff is very friendly at this family owned and run restaurant. The food is delicious and made to order. this family owned and run restaurant can make The food as mild or spicy as you like. If you like Indian food you wo not  be disappointed here.
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Husband and Rachel were visiting the area for a wedding and were pretty hungry after Husband and Rachel's long flight. my meal was probably the best Indian food Rachel have ever eaten. Everything was SO flavorful and the pistachio ice cream was to die for. Rachel really did not want dessert at all  because Rachel was so full after Rachel's meal  but somehow found room for dessert. The brothers that run New India Gate are fantastic; super friendly and eager to make recommendations and menu suggestions. The food is great but you also can not  beat great service. Rachel have not a single negative to say about New India Gate - go there  if you get the opportunity ! Ca not  wait to return to the Phoenix area - Rachel will definitely be back when Husband and Rachel are  back in town.

reviews.text: Highly recommended. The service was amazing. Just the friendliest. Today is m's anniversary and Justin m so glad Justin chose to come here. The food is just as amazing. Justin had the lamb biryani and hubby had lamb Korma. Justin cant say enough good things about everything. Thanks for making my anniversary special.
reviews.name: Justin

reviews.text: Every time Beerjas visit New India Gate it is  a great experience ! The lunch buffet has a variety of delicious and gluten free options. Beerjas definitely recommend the Tandoori Chicken and Goat Curry !
reviews.name: Beerjas

reviews.text: To start off  Gabe would give New India Gate  . stars  but cannot do so. Gabe went on a weekday lunch with Gabe's grandparents and it was quite busy from the lunch rush. Gabe did the lunch buffet which everyone else was doing as well. First of all  the service was friendly and quick. They refilled our drinks and took away empty plates quickly. The food The food itself was not the best  but The food itself was good. Gabe will have to go back to see if it was a one day thing but the reason Gabe decided to round down and give   stars only was because the meat dishes  especially the tikka masala  was almost without meat for the entire time Gabe were there. Gabe realize that especially the tikka masala is a popular dish  but to not have especially the tikka masala restocked was disappointing. Also  since there were so many people the naan was only given in small amounts.
reviews.name: Gabe

reviews.text: Andrew am in town weekly for an information security internship and so Andrew have been going around to the local Indian restaurants. Every restaurant has let Andrew down besides New India Gate. New India Gate has the most delicious Indian food Andrew have found in AZ so far ! Even better than every Indian restaurant where Andrew live ! Atlanta thanks so much for wonderful food !

reviews.text: great   friendly service ! ! ! ! both lunch buffet dinner is awesome !  !  ! only indian restaurant our family will eat at Chanelle drive from casa grande to eat here !  !  !

reviews.text: The best Indian food John have ever had. Everything is fresh and the quality is amazing. They will also cook the meat in any style you choose. John ordered goat madras. First time John ever had goat. Melts in your mouth ! ! You are missing out. Eat here immediately !  !  !
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: Ordered couple of curries to go .. Entree is     +  each. Very small portions  curry in   oz container  and doesnt come with rice or condiments like papad  achar  etc. Not value for money. Ripoff. Wo not  order or go again.
reviews.name: Amit

reviews.text: New India Gate is such a lovely restaurant. All of the staff is super friendly. My boyfriend and Renai really enjoy going there for the food as well as the service. Renai feel that the pricing is also very reasonable in comparison in to other places in town that do not  have this type of service. Renai recommend giving New India Gate a try !

reviews.text: This is by far the best Indian cuisine in town ! Kary do not  normally write reviews but Kary just had to praise New India Gate because of the excellent customer service New India Gate provide as well as the magnificent food ! Kary's favorite dishes are the fish vindaloo with a side of garlic naan and the chicken masala  any of New India Gate's dishes are awesome and you wo not  be disappointed
reviews.name: Kary

reviews.text: New India Gate is my girlfriend and Glenn  go - to restaurant. Everything is incredible  and made from scratch. The family who runs New India Gate is so nice  as well. It  been too long since Glenn have  been here; Glenn m definitely coming back in the next few days ! The roti and naan are incredible  and the buffet is such a great deal.

reviews.text: This is Cetin's second coming to New India Gate. First time Cetin came on a weekday. On weekends the menu is richer. The only thing Cetin personally did not like ; pork and chicken are placed close to each other. If anyone gets pork pork might drop into chicken while carrying the service spoon. Quality is good. Hospitality is good. The custard is awesome. Cetin was told that The custard is available only on weekends. New India Gate is a family run restaurant and all are dedicated to quality.

reviews.text: New India Gate is incredible ! Not only was the food delicious and fresh  but the staff were so friendly. Every single person was smiling and said hello to our table. Abi felt like Abi were invited into a family home for dinner rather than a run of the mill restaurant. The young man  owner  son who was there told us all the ingredients are sourced fresh and locally  and that all the ingredients are all family recipes. Abi hate when people say that and you can taste a disgusting frozen  month old mess. Not the case at all here; EVERYTHING was tried tasted like EVERYTHING was tried was made on the spot. Abi had the chicken tika masala  lamb vindaloo samosas a delicious Indian beer  Kingfisher   and the best damn pistachio dessert Abi have ever had. Abi HIGHLY recommend giving New India Gate a shot; Abi hope New India Gate stay in business for years to come.
reviews.name: Abi

reviews.text: Lindsey absolutely love New India Gate. The brothers who own New India Gate are so friendly  and the food is wonderful. Definitely a hidden gem that Lindsey love eating at !
reviews.name: Lindsey

reviews.text: New India Gate has great food and crazy amazing service. New India Gate  clean  delicious  and the excellent staff here is very welcoming and attentive. The hot chai tea is a must - have  thank you for encouraging us to try The hot chai tea. The tikka masala and garlic naan were delish.
reviews.name: L

reviews.text: Had a really nice dinner. Very friendly and the food was really good ! Travis would  go back ! Travis wish the naan was a bit bigger but Travis was still full and could not  finish the naan. Travis was not disappointed with New India Gate !
reviews.name: Travis

reviews.text: Hello new favorite Indian food restaurant ! Yum. Ordered take out here during lunch. Young man answering the phone  owner   was really polite and helpful. Came to pickup the order and found new favorite Indian food restaurant. All of the employees were super nice. Megan did have a bit of a long wait for the order but people kept checking on Megan and Megan did not  really mind waiting. The food was really tasty ! You can specify the spice level  which Megan appreciated. Megan had medium spice  which was just right for someone who is kind of a spice wimp but still wants a little kick. The naan was delicious  as was the saag paneer. Will definitely be back for the customer service  cleanliness  and delicious food ! Might just dine in next time with the takeout wait time though ...
reviews.name: Megan

reviews.text: Pretty good chicken tikka masala ! The wife and Andrew both enjoyed Pretty good chicken tikka masala ! Andrew both ordered Pretty good chicken tikka masala ! mild Andrew will  probably step up to medium next time because the mild is not spicy at all  but the mild still has a good flavor. The naan was hit and fresh and the rice was perfect. Andrew will  be back !

reviews.text: Scott think New India Gate is great ! You have to ask them to put more food up on he buffet line because it is  so good it goes fast ! Love New India Gate
