reviews.text: Really  really  really cannot say enough about how much Sarah love Samosa Factory ! The best Indian food Sarah have had in Las Vegas by FAR ! If you are new to indian food and want something different but tasty Sarah can always recommend the lamb korma the lamb korma is  perfect ! With a side of garlic nan some samosas  of course   and mango lassi this is Sarah's favorite dinner. If Sarah was on death row  Sarah may very well pick Samosa Factory for Sarah's last meal. Samosa Factory's restaurant is tiny  but Sarah like Samosa Factory ! Samosa Factory does not  feel overly crowded but actually cozy. Sarah really can not  say enough good things about Samosa Factory.
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Wait  am Misti in New York City Seriously  something about Samosa Factory reminds Misti of a little Indian spot you might find in Manhattan. Samosa Factory is small  dark and moody with a Portishead soundtrack and a waiter who so professional you assume he must be going to graduate school for philosophy or something. Add to the mix the trippy Ganesha cartoon being projected on the window  and you are  definitely half way to Manhattan. It  a cool sensation  and perhaps one that can only be experienced at a later evening hour. The best part :  unlike Manhattan it is  easy to park ! Go Vegas. As for the food  Misti rarely go out for Indian dinner because Misti find it hard to go without the cornucopia offered by a lunch buffet  which they do not offer . Last night  though  Misti decided on Indian for dinner and this was close. Misti ended up spending      which seemed expensive  but Misti got three entrees when Misti would have been okay with two. The average entree is    . Misti had Baigan Bartha  Paneer Makhani and Dal Makhani. Misti requested a medium spice  and a medium spice was on the lower edge of spicy. Of the three dishes  Paneer Makhani was the absolute best  the perfect balance of tomato and cream and without a trace of grease. They definitely pride themselves on cooking fresh and healthy. Misti would not order Dal Makhani again. Dal Makhani is usually Misti's favorite Indian dish but this is the second time Misti have had Dal Makhani here. Both times Misti have walked away thinking Dal Makhani tasted like a not so great chili. However  Baigan was solid. Misti Misti went with roti instead of naan  and Misti really enjoyed roti. The menu has plenty for meat eaters vegetarians and vegans  and Misti am pretty sure they can help gluten - free eaters as well. The combination of experience and food quality adds up to an Indian spot worth trying.
reviews.name: Misti

reviews.text: One of the best Indian restaurants in town ! One of the best Indian restaurants in town ! do serve the best rice pudding. Reasonable prices. Chrisene-Faye usually order the chicken tikka masala or the lamb korma. Great quality food. One of the best Indian restaurants in town ! 's sauces are rich and creamy. Chrisene-Faye think each entree is good for   people  depending on how hungry you are  but Chrisene-Faye have  always been stuffed sharing an entree . Small restaurant  but great service.

reviews.text: Paolo found Samosa Factory by accident but im really glad Paolo did. great lunches specials and spicyness of food is just right

reviews.text: Kirk love Samosa Factory ! Kirk eat there every other weekend. Garlic naan is to die for. The food is excellent and so is the service.

reviews.text: Went here yesterday for lunch. It was ok. If you like samosas samosas were good here. Other than samosas Molly have  had better Indian food. Samosa Factory have plenty of vegetarian and vegan entrees though  so if you are  vegan or have a friend who is then Molly would reccomend Samosa Factory  but Tamba and Ghandi are better. Samosa Factory is pretty small too so dont go with a big group. Also Samosa Factory was full of white people I m white too but thats kind of a giveaway that Samosa Factory's not as authentic as other places because Molly did not see one Indian eating there...

reviews.text: Michele love Samosa Factory. While the service is sometimes a little on the slow side when they are busy  the food is always hot and fresh and delicious. The lunch specials are a real deal  but the other regular menu offerings are also great  and Michele encourage you to venture off the lunch menu and try something different. The saag paneer is always delicious  the curries are great  and the naan -  -  the perfect accompaniment to sop up the juice from whatever you have chosen to order. Michele also love how the owner always welcomes Michele back  and if the owner has not seen Michele in a while gently chides Michele for it and encourages Michele back. Try Samosa Factory for wonderful Indian food and you wo not  be disappointed !
reviews.name: Michele

reviews.text: Love Samosa Factory. The staff are delightful  food delicious such a pleasant atmosphere. SL have  taken family   friends here everyone loved Samosa Factory. SL would  recommend this to anyone looking for some delicious Indian food !

reviews.text: A true gem ! Small and quaint but the BEST chicken vindaloo Leyla have  ever had !  !  ! The owner  Rick  is a delight ! GREAT food and nice little diamond in the rough...Highly recommended !  !  !

reviews.text: Ok place for groups  not that super for couples or singles. Why would not  Samosa Factory offer a samosa with the thali platter  check Samosa Factory's name Why not offer a better thali combo option Papadum   Dessert samosa in the thali   Found the thali to be a bit pricey for what the thali offers.

reviews.text: EXCELLENT -  the Absolute BEST Garlic Naan  Raita Samosas Jack have  had  -  light  great seasoning and right on  target   - Jack had the vegetable korma and the mattar paneer  -  perfect and just the right level of spices. Our favorite Indian is Ajanta in Berkeley and the Red Fort in London  -  but Samosa Factory can give Ajanta in Berkeley and the Red Fort in London a run for Ajanta in Berkeley and the Red Fort in London's money. Jack are  looking forward to Jack's next trip to Las Vegas so Jack can go back twice or three times during Jack's stay  -  Jack's only regret is that Jack found it on Jack's last night in town.

reviews.text: Frank have brought Frank's friends and family here and my friends and family absolutely agree with Frank  food is amazing and so is the service. Samosa Factory  a perfect place to come if you are  a vegan vegetarian. Frank will  be coming back whenever Frank get a chance.

reviews.text: Such a great hardworking guy. Do not miss the dried fruit stuffed naan Such a great hardworking guy.'s apple chutney  or Such a great hardworking guy. 's samosas -  -  lots of terrific vegan dishes too. Gluten free You have  found a great place to enjoy delicious food safely.

reviews.text: Best Indian food EVER ! Best Indian food EVER ! clean fresh  and so flavorful ! ! In a little out of the way spot  -  totally unassuming. Had chicken tikka masala  lamb vindaloo  chicken korma  roti samosas  and chai. All was unbelievable : Jane are  so happy

reviews.text: Samosa Factory is where Linda go to read a book eat something delicious and feel taken care of after Linda have  had a crap day. If you are  a spice fiend  be clear and firm about your desired spice level. Otherwise  it is  pretty tame. Linda would not  say bland but if you enjoy crying while you eat  you will be disappointed. Linda especially love : their Veggie Samosa Chaat their samosas duh the Hot   Sour Chicken  their naan and oh my god  Linda love their khir. No matter how full  Linda always cram in an order of khir.

reviews.text: Really great service  Food very flavorful and fresh. Made to order. Owner is very nice and accommodating. Bernie Hanna

reviews.text: Samosa Factory is called Samosa Factory for a reason. The samosas are AMAZING ! The samosas come with a tasty cilantro chutney and a tamarind chutney. per order and The samosas are a very good size. Really worth the   . -   . price. Samosa Factory also have some unique items  such as masala fries covered in cilantro  onions  and come with a BBQ - cilantro - ginger sauce. Very tasty. Holly have  never been impressed with Samosa Factory's curries. A little bland for Holly's taste. But Samosa Factory do have a lot of vegan options  which is nice. Staff has always been friendly. Great place !
reviews.name: Holly

reviews.text: When it comes to ethnic cuisine Samosa Factory is a real winner. Samosa Factory is a regular spot for my coworkers and Jesse to meet for lunch and go over territory info. The samosas are great and the entrees are authentic. Check Samosa Factory out.
reviews.name: Jesse

reviews.text: A hit and a miss. Mark went here looking at the reviews and were disappointed. Do not  get me wrong  if you are  new to Indian food  like many reviewers here seem to be  you will  probably like Indian food. Unfortunately for Samosa Fake - tory Mark have  had our share of good Indian food and Samosa Factory is not  it. First off  to the uninitiated  samosas look and taste nothing like the one you find here. Mark mean not even close ! Google samosas and you will see what samosas look like. After our samosas  Mark ordered the thalis sort of an Indian mixed plate  and the naan  fluffy  delicious Indian bread  was great. Mark did not  like the saag  mustard leaf but my SO did. Neither of us liked the chicken curry or the potatoes and cauliflower. Contrary to popular claim the rice was not  basmati. You can not  ever go wrong with mango lassi  mango flavored yogurt drink  and mango lassi mango flavored yogurt drink probably was the best part of our meal. In summary  our food was okay but the alien samosa was a massive FAIL. If you have  never had a samosa please do yourself a favor and grab one from an authentic Indian restaurant. You will not regret it. May Mark recommend Gandhi  on Paradise Road or Tamba on the strip for the most authentic and best Indian food in town Positives -  The service was good. Our server  who Mark think is also the owner  seemed like a genuinely nice guy.
reviews.name: Mark

reviews.text: Wow ! A local took me here last nite. My first time for Indian food. Believe me...... Eve will definitely come back. Great service and the chicken korma and garlic naan..... out of this world !
reviews.name: Eve

reviews.text: Wonderful spot ! Ariane suggest everyone try Wonderful spot !. The service is attentive and friendly  food is prepared fairly quick and includes a wide selection of great tasting vegetarian and vegan dishes. Wonderful spot ! a nice  cozy cute spot for   -   people .. has takeout available also.
reviews.name: Ariane

reviews.text: S compare all Indian restaurants with the ones S have been to in the bay area and hence the poor rating. It  not Indian cuisine but a a fusion. star for the service. Nice and polite owner.

reviews.text: Husband  and Kitty ordered beef samosas  chicken tikki marsala lamb curry  garlic naan  and dessert samosa. The food was delicious. Kitty enjoyed The food very much. The service was great and our server was very friendly and attentive. Kitty will definitely be back for more. The only negative Kitty have was that when Kitty asked for a straw Kitty was handed a cup full of unwrapped straws and asked to pick one. Kitty cringe at the thought of how many dirty  unwashed hands have touched unwrapped straws. Ew.
reviews.name: Kitty

reviews.text: Hands down the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Rick makes me feel like an old friend as soon as Nicole walk in the door so my dining experience is that much more enjoyable. Cozy and relaxing decor and a menu that features staples such as tikka masala and lamb curry... and of course plenty of vegetarian and vegan selections. My goal is to try everything on the menu  but lately Nicole have  just been having Rick create a dish for me and Nicole have yet to be disappointed. Love Samosa Factory !  !
reviews.name: Nicole

reviews.text: Tony bought groupons as Tony were sitting at Samosa Factory  excited for the deal. Then Tony loaded up on orders to our max. Unfortunately there is only one groupon allowed per table says the owner with a stick up the owner's butt. This was Tony's first time at Samosa Factory and the owner served Tony. the owner stuck to the owner's guns and would not budge on letting Tony use   groupons  even though the owner openly admitted to being able to make an exception. Tony will not go again and definitely not recommending to anyone. Food was not  even very good. No spices and pop that you grow accustomed to in a good Indian dish. the owner looks like he  from ohio not bombay. Revised Tony think it is  completely unprofessional that the owner complains about not getting a tip when the owner was a dick to Tony. How about learning some customer service before entering in the retail food industry. Much better Indian restaurants in Vegas by far !  ! Try Much better Indian restaurants in Vegas by far ! for tasty  authentic Indian food and unconditionally friendly service :    . The Mint  -  Flamingo and Maryland  . Mount Everest  -  Sahara and Arville  . India Masala  -  Flamingo and Swenson  . India Palace  -  Twain and Paradise Tony will never go back to Samosa Factory and urge you not to patron Samosa Factory. Some people are not suited to be in front of customers. Rick  the owner here  believes the customer is always WRONG. Not the way to win repeat or new business.
reviews.name: Tony

reviews.text: Leza love Samosa Factory. The food is fantastic. The owner Rick is very personable and makes it pleasant to eat here. Leza wish Leza could eat here   days per week.
reviews.name: Leza

reviews.text: The food was not  disgusting or  bad  per se but its a crime to call The food Indian food. Samosa Factory feels like a white guys poor attempt at Indian food and  can best be described as food made by hipsters for hipsters. Joe's first clue should have  been the name  Samosa Factory but Joe do not  judge on initial appearances. The second clue was the balding white guy wearing clam diggers  a red flannel shirt and a wool cap in August...but alas it was too late... Joe had already called in Joe's order. Joe ordered the fairly basic dish of Chicken Tikka Masala  as Joe always do at these types of restaurants  because if you can not  even do THAT right there is  no sense in venturing onto the  real  Indian cuisine. Everyone does Chicken Tikka Masala their own way but what Joe received was more like an insultingly bland almost flavorless Butter Chicken. The garlic naan tasted like a thick  rubbery  cilantro covered tortilla. Joe do not  mean to talk sh t but Joe have  honestly had better Indian food at Mall food courts. For the EXACT same price you can receive twice the portions of the fairly basic dish of Chicken Tikka Masala  and Joe m assuming most  if not all  other menu items  made PROPERLY at Shalimar on S. Decatur in the Food Less parking lot.
reviews.name: Joe

reviews.text: My husband and T went to Samosa Factory for lunch T went there right when Samosa Factory opened. T am a big fan of butter chicken  and butter chickens what T wanted but they said they are out of butter chicken how can they be out of butter chicken when they just opened for lunch  . Of course  this got me very irritated. Anyway  T ended up ordering chicken curry  chicken curry was not  that satisfying  T have  had better . The service was good. Samosa Factory is very small. Overall  T would give Samosa Factory a another shot.
reviews.name: T

reviews.text: mark have  never been let down at Samosa Factory  in fact mark now make Samosa Factory a weekly stop. As others have said  service is great and the owner is a great guy. My weekly meal is chicken samosas and lamb vindaloo hot the garlic naan is amazing also.
reviews.name: mark

reviews.text: Great tasting and healthy Indian ! Well  supposedly healthy because they said they do not  use Ghee. Ghee =  = gross pure fat. But the food was definitely delicious !  !  !  ! And reasonably priced  too ! Will definitely be going back when craving some hot n  spicy Indian food...
reviews.name: Wayne

reviews.text: Stumbled upon Chatpatay after driving around trying to figure out what Elaina wanted for lunch and figured Elaina would  just settle for a Jersey Mike  sub. Saw Chatpatay was new and figured Elaina would  give it a go. So glad Elaina did ! Service was friendly and food was delicious. Elaina ordered the Baingan Bharta. the Baingan Bharta is Elaina's favorite Indian dish and Elaina m picky about the Baingan Bharta Elaina feel like the Baingan Bharta is  a dish that when done right is amazing  but Elaina have  had some disappointing versions at other restaurants   the Baingan Bharta was perfect ! Elaina m happy to have a good Indian restaurant in town !
reviews.name: Elaina

reviews.text: Chatpatay is a terrific  casual Indian restaurant that is Rob's favorite place to go for Indian food in the Charlotte Metro  though Rob love what Copper and The Blue Taj do when it comes to upscale Indian Indian fusion Rob have  been to Chatpatay on about five different occasions now; the food is consistent in the food's quality Rob have  never once felt like anything has been phoned in. For people who do not  eat spicy food on a regular basis  there are definitely items that you can get that will be safe  but be aware that the biryanis  the bullet naan  such a great name  such a great bread  and other items will light.you.up. Service can be slightly standoffish depending on who  working the register  but the owner GM is invested in the success of the owner GM's restaurant s and you feel it when the owner GM rings up your order or when you talk to the owner GM. Plenty of items here are delicious  and the menu is pretty sizable   but Rob have a particular fondness right now for the dal makhani. Chatpatay offer thalis and lunch specials  but other than thalis it is all a la carte. When people ask Rob where to go for Indian food in the area Chatpatay is the place Rob point to every time; even though Chatpatay is     minutes down Rob -     from Rob's neck of the woods it is  always worth the drive.
reviews.name: Rob

reviews.text: The best Indian food Ary have  had in Charlotte ! And the service was very attentive despite the service being  fast casual . Loved the service !
reviews.name: Ary

reviews.text: From the moment Nisha walked in  Nisha was greeted with a warm and welcome smile. You sit down wherever you want and a gentleman brings you a menu. Then you go to the front counter and place your order. The lady taking your order is very sweet as well ! Nisha ordered a Samosa Chat  Mango Lassi  Paratha Pav Bhaji  and Chicken Korma. You can choose your spice level just like any other Indian place. The lady taking the order repeated your order and confirmed our spice level to make sure it was what Nisha wanted. While Nisha were eating the food The lady taking the order did check on us and asked if Nisha needed anything. The service is quick in comparison to a full fledged restaurant and the food is delicious !  ! The pav bhaji is decent but the chicken itself was fork tender and Chicken Korma was silky  buttery  and scrumptious !  ! NOTE : if you are a UNCC student you get     off if you bring your student ID and show your student ID to the kind lady at checkout. Definitely recommend Chatpatay !  !
reviews.name: Nisha

reviews.text: Definitely give this place a try if you are in the area. A have been looking for an go - to Indian restaurant in the area and this place is an go - to Indian restaurant in the area. Service was amazing. The most friendly service that A have received at an Indian restaurant. Food was delicious. Ordered this place's spiced naan and butter roti their spiced naan and butter roti  both were fresh and so reasonably priced with generous portions. Also got a chicken curry and potato kofta which were both flavorful and just spicy enough. this place is a casual eatery so this place is  kid friendly. You order at the counter and the food is brought out to you. Will be coming back for sure to try out the rest of this place's extensive menu. Do not  miss out !
reviews.name: A

reviews.text: Jasmine just moved into the state and wanted to find a good Indian place . Well let me tell you a good Indian place was delicious !  !  ! Our waiter was also the owner Our waiter was so polite and kind to us . Our waiter welcomed us and made sure the food was to our liking. Definitely coming back   everything was so good  !
reviews.name: Jasmine

reviews.text: To say Chatpatay was disappointing in an under statement. Swatee can not  believe Chatpatay serve the food Chatpatay serve and still stay open ! Swatee visited Chatpatay  while taking a break from our road trip and were famished when Swatee got here. It was thanksgiving day  so not much open and very few people inside. First of all  Swatee m confused about whether Chatpatay is self service or not. Someone greeted us at the door and seated us  gave us menus. To place an order  you have to walk up to the counter. Chatpatay bring the dishes to you. You need to grab your own utensils. Chatpatay expect you to place dirty dishes in a far corner yourself. Just extremely confusing and annoying. Swatee have nothing against self service  -  in fact self service is  awesome and efficient  but this weird process made no sense. Anyways -  the food. Swatee started wit the mango chat. the mango chat was made with old papris and was over over sauced. Swatee would be okay with that  -  if th sauce tasted good. th sauce did not  -  way too much heeng and terrible flavor. Lily wanted to paneer -  paneer tasted of nothing  had a weird red color and the texture of rubber. Swatee actually were not able to get through more than   pieces collectively. Swatee also had the garlic naan. Swatee think you should be punished for screwing up something as simple as garlic naan and they totally did not -  too much garlic and uncooked sides  ugh. Swatee had the gobhi parantha and again  -  how you screw up something so simple  Swatee do not  understand. the gobhi parantha was uncooked in placed and Swatee could taste the raw dough. The filling tasted of nothing and there was not   enough of The filling. the gobhi parantha was also slathered with way too much oil  butter Rags loves chicken  -  he did not  like Chatpatay's version of chicken tikka. Everything tasted stale and disgusting. As much as Swatee hate food waste  Swatee ended up trashing about     of the food Swatee ordered and left Chatpatay hungry still. Never coming back and never recommending Chatpatay again.
reviews.name: Swatee

reviews.text: Feleisha love Chatpatay. Great food but casual and fast. Chatpatay are very helpful with suggestions if you do not  know what to order. Everything Feleisha have tried has been enjoyable. This trip Feleisha had the Goan curry chicken with garlic naan and the Goan curry chicken with garlic naan was amazing.
reviews.name: Feleisha

reviews.text: Chatpatay    Food is good and staff super helpful. Full recommendations   Typical of Indian places Chatpatay is  not warm and fuzzy but you can always order Togo
reviews.name: Richard

reviews.text: Jan have been coming to Chatpatay and love the food. Chatpatay not only have a large menu on street snacks  indo - Chinese but also offer north - indian curries to finish up with indian desserts and various choices of tea coffee. The service is fast even in rush hours  and Chatpatay cater to the point at your requested spice level. Jan are very happy that Chatpatay opened up closer to home. Meet Ravi the owner will guide you through the menu if you are new to Indian cuisine.

reviews.text: Dangerously situated on Kevin's way home from work Chatpatay will likely become an at least weekly stop for dinner. Kevin m no expert on Indian food but Kevin feel this is a great selection of Indian food. Kevin wish Kevin had the stomach capacity and spice tolerance to try everything on the menu. Kevin tried some Paneer    to start and Kevin easily could have eaten some Paneer for a main course. some Paneer was delicious and Kevin m all about the spices used. Kevin got chicken biryani  Kevin's girlfriend got malai kofta  and Kevin split some garlic naan. Everything came out quick  in large portions  and beautifully presented. The staff was helpful with our clear lack of knowledge about Indian food and the owner even stopped by to make sure everything was good. Kevin highly recommend Chatpatay; Kevin know Kevin m looking forward to the mountain of leftovers in the refrigerator right now.
reviews.name: Kevin

reviews.text: Amazing food. Cynthia ordered Samosa  Chicken Vindaloo and Bullet Naan. The samosa was out of this world. Fresh and flavorful. The sauces were incredible. Ravi the owner  was helpful in picking out the dishes. Cynthia asked for Samosa  Chicken Vindaloo. Cynthia will  just say Samosa  Chicken Vindaloo was amazing. Samosa Chicken Vindaloo was so tender Samosa  Chicken Vindaloo fell apart. And Bullet Naan  Cynthia would  never had Bullet Naan before  Bullet Naan was buttery and bursting with flavor. Everything was outstanding. Cynthia would  love to see Chatpatay stick around for a long time so Cynthia can order and eat everything on the menu !

reviews.text: Ravi have a feeling that Chatpatay will become Ravi's favorite indian restaurant. The food was just incredible the ambience is nice  and staff was very friendly. The menu is huge. Ravi am so happy Chatpatay opened in north charlotte. Chatpatay was much needed. Ravi would highly recommend everyone try Chatpatay  !  !

reviews.text: Zarina really like Chatpatay. Food is amazing and flavor is exactly what Zarina want. Chatpatay will make thing actually spicy which Zarina love but Chatpatay can also make thing more mild if needed. Chicken    is Zarina's favorite.

reviews.text: Tried Chatpatay for the first time  !  ! Very disappointed must say !  ! Ordered chicken    and gobi manchurian  chicken    and gobi manchurian were terrible as chicken was over cooked and super chewy and gobi manchurian was under cooked and tasting like flour Will not be going back  !  !

reviews.text: EXCELLENT RESTAURANT ! Denise chose EXCELLENT RESTAURANT ! to celebrate our   year wedding anniversary. The service was more than excellent and the owner  Ravi prepares a special dish that was not  on the menu  Malai Paneer Tikka ! reviews.text: Great new restaurant. Henry enjoyed taking my family and having authentic Indian cuisine. The owner  Ravi  and The owner  Ravi's employees were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.text: Tarun m new to Charlotte and made Tarun's first friend here in Bharat at Chatpatay ! Every single person Tarun have  interacted with here  including Ravi  the owner  is super - friendly and go out of Every single person Tarun have  interacted with here  including Ravi  the owner's way to make sure you are  having a good time. Every single person Tarun have  interacted with here  including Ravi  the owner actively seek feedback as well  on any aspect of your experience  and do not get all defensive about the constructive pieces  which is refreshing to see. As for the food  every entree chaat that Tarun have  tried here takes Tarun's taste buds back home to Delhi  although Tarun did learn that the chef is from Mumbai ! the food every entree chaat that Tarun have  tried here is definitely rich  and very flavorful. While Tarun have had a couple of misses  Tarun would highly recommend the Samosa  Mango Papdi Chaat  Chhole Bhature Chicken Methi  and Saag Chicken yes these guys put it together for us once !  . Now it does feel somewhat pricey  but Tarun m not sure that is  unique to these guys. Tarun m starting to get used to shelling a little more for Tarun's meals here in Charlotte !

reviews.text: Phenomenal food ! Big fan of the other location on the south side of town  the other location on the south side of town  this new location definitely lives up to expectations. Staff are always super friendly and helpful with the large menu. Quality and variety makes the other location on the south side of town  this new location a family favorite for sure. There are even chicken fingers for the boring eaters !

reviews.text: Brian m no expert on Indian food so Brian can not  comment on how authentic Chatpatay is  but Brian also do not  really care. Chatpatay  absolutely delicious !  ! Brian tried the chicken     garlic naan  and samosas and all were the best versions Brian have tried of the chicken     garlic naan  and samosas

reviews.text: Chatpatay is one of the best Indian street food restaurant Tabrez have been. Chatpatay's chats  pani puris chicken tikka Biryani are amazing. Will keep going there more often and updating Tabrez's post with more photograph. Chatpatay's quality of  food and pricing is very good too. Tabrez recommend everyone to try Chatpatay out
reviews.name: Tabrez

reviews.text: The taste of this food is truly amazing !  ! The experience was awesome just from walking through the front door and being greeted by a very warm and  friendly staff. a very warm and  friendly staff were very helpful with choosing what you want to eat. The price is great and the portions are good. Catrice will come here every time for Indian Food.

reviews.text: So Chatpatay was a new place Denise had not tried and Denise love Indian food. The food was good quality the set up Denise did not like so much. Denise do not  want to wait on Denise when Denise go out. But Denise must say that the Gobi Manchurian and Bullet Naan would make Denise come back. The gobi was crisp fried and in a delicious sauce with green onions and red onions. A very nice size portion. Bullet Naan was one of the spiciest Denise have had in NC. Denise loved Bullet Naan. Denise did miss not getting a Chutney or Condiment tray. Denise did have a great waitress  Denise's sister who was right next to the plates and silver ware and water. Try it !
reviews.name: Denise

reviews.text: Aleeza's partner and Aleeza were craving some Indian food. Unfortunately  there were no good places near the Concord Mills area so Aleeza drove a little out of the way to make sure Aleeza filled My partner and Aleeza's fix. Chatpatay does not  look like much but the staff and owner were so nice ! the staff and owner told My partner and Aleeza the staff and owner's favorites and what the staff and owner's customers like. Aleeza took all of the staff and owner's advice with no regrets  except maybe on Aleeza's wallet . Aleeza got the mango papdi chaat plain   gobi paratha    Indian sodas lamb biryani  and chicken tikka masala. Chatpatay was reasonably priced  but Aleeza definitely was not  expecting to get so many things. Aleeza are  a sucker for trying new things. the mango papdi chaat was good  -  refreshing with a surprising amount of heat. Indian sodas were good too  -  very slightly spiced though Aleeza do not  know how to quite describe Indian sodas. plain   gobi paratha was A +  crispy and buttery. plain   gobi paratha went very well with Aleeza's partner  chicken tikka masala  which was SO RICH and tasty  with exceptionally moist chicken. lamb biryani was good as well. Good spices  big pieces of lamb  and just so so good with the raita. The only thing Aleeza would not  order again is the gobi paratha. the gobi paratha was a little dry  but Aleeza could tell Chatpatay's parathas are more authentic than other places -  Chatpatay definitely use whole wheat flour  not using enriched bleached flour for American tastes. The owner stopped by to talk with My partner and Aleeza a couple times and ensure the food was good. Aleeza was very happy with the food and service. Aleeza liked that Chatpatay was casual in that you get your own silverware and water. It  worth the detour to ensure you get solid Indian food.
reviews.name: Aleeza

reviews.text: Real visit Chatpatay. Chatpatay is clean  good food can not  ask for anything better for the price. Customer service is on point and the Ravi  manager  is the man ! Do not  pass on the Mango Chaat.

reviews.text: Best Indian food Amy have  had in a long time. Very casual with great service from friendly staff. Amy had lamb kebab  lamb saag and naan. nice touch -  lamb kebab lamb saag and naan are served with julienned veggies on a hot  fajita style  skillet. Basic spice level is medium and is definitely hot but so flavorful. Amy will  be back soon.
reviews.name: Amy

reviews.text: Looking for quick indian snacks and rightly found so... dahi sev puri is amazing... mango papri chat on recommendation by owner Ravi Gera was  very tasty as well. malai panner sizzler was well marinated and soft tender and cooked to perfection.. Pankaj will be back soon again to try out more stuff

reviews.text: The food is great. Ankush ordered the thali with chicken and goat curry. The pickles were tasty. The dessert was also tasty. They provided a great service.

reviews.text: Chatpatay have Old Monk ! Been wanting to try Chatpatay for a while now as Sam am a huge fan of the Pineville location. The interior is similar but the menu has some slight differences. You also do not order at the counter like you do in Pineville which Sam actually like better. What Sam did not like better was the food. Our Gobi Manchurian had not been fried long enough and Our Gobi Manchurian was a bit on the soggy side. Sam requested spicy and Our Gobi Manchurian was more like a medium. Sam's rogan josh was good but again  My rogan josh was just missing the spice kick that Sam get at Pineville. The staff was friendly and Sam hope The staff make it but for Sam  Sam will  stick with Ravi in Pineville. Hey at least Chatpatay have Old Monk !

The service was great and friendly  overall with food and service definitely a worth a place to repeat. The menu is so creative  if you are a Bollywood fan you will love the way menu is written.

reviews.text: Sophia recently had Chatpatay's Saag Shrimp and Naan. their Saag Shrimp and Naan was delicious. The staff was very friendly. Sophia definitely recommend trying the food there Sophia will be back soon.

reviews.text: Try the mango papdi chat. Amisha really loved the mango papdi chat. Rest of food was also good. Dabeli can be worked upon a little. People are friendly and welcoming and restaurant is clean

reviews.text: If you are  looking for some delicious Indian food at a really good price Chatpatay is the place for you to go. Rian were seated immediately and served very quickly. The waiter  which Rian later found out is the owner  was extremely courteous and patient. The waiter  which Rian later found out is the owner recommended everything that Rian had based off of what Rian liked. Rian had the got curry  bullet naan  and chicken kabab appetizer Rian believe  and everything that Rian had was DELICIOUS. There are beer selections that are actually imported from India. Rian m not much of a beer drinker but Rian decided to try. Wrong decision. It  not that the bottles were not  good the bottles were just bigger than Rian expected so Rian could not  finish it all on top of all the food Rian ate. Rian can honestly say that Rian have found Rian's go - to Indian spot. If Rian go  please talk with the owner. the owner  really nice !

reviews.text: Great service and even greater food ! I got the saag chicken and fell in love. I also got an order of samosas and samosas were also delicious !

reviews.text: What a great experience ! The food is excellent and freshly prepared. The restaurant is set up so that you place your order at the register and they give you a number and they bring your food out to you. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with any questions that you may have about the menu. Monica will certainly be back. The restaurant will be our go to for Indian cuisine. The restaurant have only been opened for months. Give The restaurant a try !  ! You wo not  be disappointed.

reviews.text: Very good Indian food ! Also great gluten - free menu. Perfect to grab food to go if you are  at the Armored Cow brewery.

reviews.text: Great first visit. Ample parking. Ordered panic purification and choke nature. Ate a whole one. So very good. Great service. Tim will come back with a crowd and family !

reviews.text: Chatpatay are super great ! Hanna have been looking for a good chicken korma all over Charlotte and this is the best ! Hanna love the casual atmosphere and Chatpatay are very helpful if you do not  know what you would want. Chatpatay have convinced me other dishes to try and Hanna have never been disappointed. The naan is amazing as well. Would recommend to anybody wanting to try indian food or for people already fans. reviews.text: Came by Chatpatay on our way home and stopped in. It was such a warm atmosphere from the time Halle walked into the door. Halle got our menus and sat down to figure out what Halle wanted. The cashier helped us determine good things to get based off what Halle knew Halle were comfortable with. After the food was brought to us... my goodness ! The colors are so rich and beautiful. Aroma is amazing. And your first bite is heaven. Get the samosa to start !  !  ! Only appetizer Halle have  had but Only appetizer Halle have  had is  amazing. Food was piping hot and tasted amazing. And Halle like that even when you order spicy there is  so much flavor versus it being so hot that you just cry Chatpatay will be our new evening spot for Indian and the price is well worth it. YUMM

reviews.text: The food is good. But there is no one to wait tables because it is a fast - food setting. reviews.text: Have not  tried much Indian food in the University area but Chatpatay was awesome ! Our waiter who is also the manager was very friendly and had some great suggestions. The food was fresh and very yummy. Kelsey recommend the Tikka masala  chicken biryani and garlic naan.

reviews.text: Really enjoyed the variety of food Chatpatay served. The food and service was great. Would come back and recommend others to try The food and service if you havent !  !

reviews.text: Patricia really enjoyed Royal Ganesha. The service was amazing and the food was some of the best Patricia have  had. Patricia also had my   year daughter and our server was super sweet with my   year daughter and gave my   year daughter's rice pudding and a little gift. reviews.text: Tammy love Royal Ganesha ! Royal Ganesha  in a unique space with good parking nearby  plus Royal Ganesha is  close to Kensington and the train so it is  vey easy to get to. reviews.text: Went here with friends in search of good Indian for dinner. It was so good and convenient to get to from the hotel. The Lamb Korma was delicious with enough spice to make The Lamb Korma interesting. Personally  Crystal could have had a bit more spice but when trying a new place  and not knowing the spice levels  Crystal tend to be a bit conservative. Next time  Crystal will  up the ante ! Definitely worth it  and Crystal would go back for more. If Crystal lived in Calgary  Crystal could see Crystal becoming a regular patron ! The service was great and menu suggestions were spot on !

reviews.text: Was here about two weeks ago  and in going back in an hour... the food was amazing ! The host owner manager was most accommodating and super friendly. The atmosphere is also very Indian and quite lovely. Roger highly recommend Royal Ganesha.

reviews.text: Yash would not recommend Royal Ganesha. Me and my buddy went on sunday evening. First of all the service is very poor no one was around to even ask for water after the food was served. The malai kofta was uncooked and garlic naan was burnt. Yash had to wait for    mins for someone to come and ask Me and my buddy if everything was ok. They killed my apatite and when Yash were finished Yash had to go downstairs to notify them ... Damm Yash ! ! oh Yash are done eating would Yash pack Me and my buddy the curry and give Me and my buddy the bill... No sorry no nothing...
reviews.name: Yash

reviews.text: Royal Ganesha is housed in the house that used to be Anju on St. S.W. Being part of the Calgary Opera Chorus for Lakme Eswina had a   hour dinner break between afternoon and evening rehearsals on a Saturday night. They do not  normally do dinner buffets but when Eswina explained Eswina had    people wanting East Indian food  Lakme  Lakme  is set in   th Century India under British rule they very obligingly agreed to have one just for us. Eswina took over the main floor of the restaurant. Service was excellent. The food was decent and Eswina highly recommend the onion bhajia onion fritters  and chicken pakora. Eswina had butter chicken  beef curry  vegetable korma  dal makhani and vegetable biriyani as well as salad  papadam and a chutney  butter naan and rice and rice pudding for    .  . The curry and butter chicken was a little on the watery side but the flavours were good the sauces could have been thicker. A selection of house wines could be had for   . per glass. Parking is on the street. the restaurant is a small place so definitely reservations are recommended on the weekend. a chutney  butter naan is scrumptious  crisply baked in the tandoori and still soft and pliable to dip in the sauces. the restaurant have one of the best rice puddings Eswina have  tasted  not too sweet or overly scented with cardamom.
reviews.name: Eswina

reviews.text: As a man working there said.. Ashley J cook for quality not quantity  and a man working there was right ! The best Indian food Ashley J have tried in Calgary.
reviews.name: Ashley J

reviews.text: Excellent lunch buffet. Everything fresh and delicious. Great place to come if you are  hungry.
reviews.name: Bernie

reviews.text: Ordered online. The prices were good  and it was classic Indian food. There were plenty of vegetarian options. Shauna would order from there again.
reviews.name: Shauna

reviews.text: So last night Raquel ordered    dollars worth of takeout and they did not  give me a receipt and forgot the cucumber salad. The butter chicken Raquel had was so watered down and runny like soup  the aloo gobi Raquel also ordered was covered in green mush and there was two califlower and potatoes were so mushy saffron rice was not  anything special it tasted like it is  been a couple days old not fresh  and the rice pudding was like soup  ! Barely any rice. Overall very disappointed. There are better Indian restaurants to order from
reviews.name: Raquel

reviews.text: Great portions for the price. Mango lassi was great. Service is friendly. Odd policy of paying before the meal. They have  probably had a bunch of people skip out on the bill  so understandable. Butter chicken was more like  delicious  tomato chicken. Beef samosa was really yummy. Emily got butter chicken  rice  naan and could have fed three. Will come back.
reviews.name: Emily

reviews.text: Are you ready Calgary    dinah live on the same block as the infamous Anju and much to dinah's disappointment dinah noticed that the infamous Anju were closing down. In the weeks to follow dinah started seeing movement in the infamous Anju only to see another restaurant was going to take the infamous Anju. Much to dinah's delight another restaurant was Indian food. The day that Royal Ganesha opened Royal Ganesha's doors to the public  some friends and dinah were there with huge bells on ! Royal Ganesha offers a very affordable lunch buffet at  . for meat and  . for vegetarian. But get there fast because only two weeks after opening Royal Ganesha's doors Royal Ganesha already has line ups !  !  ! dinah have been an avid foodie and have written many yelp restuarant reviews as you can see and dinah honestly can say that this is the BEST Indian food dinah have ever had in Calgary. The dishes change daily and The dishes use the most freshest ingrediants. The choices are vast  lamb  beef  spinach chicken lentil   chickpea and the mango lassos are to die for. The nicest thing is the family that own Royal Ganesha are very very nice and hardworking folks and go out of Thier way to make you feel very welcome. There are only    -    tables open for now but as soon as the upstairs opens up you can bet that Royal Ganesha will be packed to the rim. Thier curries have extra flavour and the rice pudding is superb.. not too sweet and sprinkled with chopped pistacios and nuts with a delicious hint of cardamon. dinah highly recommend Royal Ganesha ! You work during the day .. do not  despair Royal Ganesha are also open for dinner....
reviews.name: dinah

reviews.text: Impressed with their service. Had to book some out of province catering for a client in Calgary so they were prepared to do name labelling of the dishes companies like that. reviews.text: Food was excellent. Very fresh and the Naan bread was outstanding. Service was great  very friendly people. Just moved to the area and Chris know Chris will be regular customers.
